\is 3.3.1.7
\sd Stubborn
\sdn Berdegil
\oldis 3.3.5.2
\oldsd Stubborn
\oldsdn Berdegil
\oldis 4.4.2.1.7
\oldsd Obstinate
\oldsdn Keras hati (kepala)

\dd Use this domain for words related to being stubborn--to be unwilling to change a decision; to be unwilling to do something someone wants you to do; or to do what you want to do, even though other people do not want you to do it.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words describe someone who is stubborn?
\qun
\ex stubborn, adamant, bull-headed, conservative, dogged, enduring, hardened, hardheaded, headstrong, immovable, impenitent, incorrigible, indomitable, inflexible, intractable, mulish, obdurate, obstinate, persistent, pig-headed, recalcitrant, relentless, stiff-necked, strong-willed, stubborn, as stubborn as a mule, tenacious, unbending, uncompromising, ungovernable, unmanageable, unrepentant, unyielding, willful
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a stubborn person?
\qun
\ex stubborn fool, mule, bulldog
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to being stubborn?
\qun
\ex refuse to obey/listen, won't listen to reason, stick to your guns
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the quality of being stubborn?
\qun
\ex stubbornness, inflexibility, obstinacy, tenacity, stick-to-itiveness
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.5.2
\oldqu (1) What words refer to being unwilling to change a decision?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tiadanya kesanggupan untuk melepaskan sesuatu keputusan yang telah diambil?
\oldex Stubborn, obstinate

\oldexn Berkeras hati (kepala), berdegil, enggan menurut perintah

\oldqun (2) Bagaimana merujuk kepada seseorang yang keras hati (kepala)?
\oldex obstinate person, stubborn fool
\oldexn Seorang yang keras hati (keras kepala, seorang yang degil)

\is 3.3.2
\sd Request
\sdn Meminta, Memohon
\oldis 3.3.2
\oldsd Request
\oldsdn Meminta, Memohon
\oldis 3.3.2.2
\oldsd Implore, plead
\oldsdn Memohon Rayu
\dd Use this domain for words related to requesting something--to ask for something, or ask someone to do something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to saying something in order to acquire something from the other person?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tindakan (secara lisan atau bersurat) yang bertujuan untuk mendapatkan sesuatu daripada orang lain?
\ex request, make a request, ask for something, ask somebody to do something, appeal, make an appeal, petition, requisition, solicit, apply, consult
\exn Memohon, membuat permohonan, meminta sesuatu, minta seseorang untuk melakukan sesuatu, membuat tuntutan, mendesak
\qu (2) What words refer to what is said when someone makes a request?
\qun
\ex appeal (n), petition (n), request (n), solicitation, question
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a person who makes a request?
\qun
\ex petitioner, suppliant
\exn
\qu (4) What special words do people use when they want to make a polite request?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang khususnya digunakan semasa membuat permintaan dengan cara sopan? Dipersilakan sekiranya kamu bersetuju (tiada bantahan), sudikah kamu…? atau bolehkah kamu….?
\ex please, if you wouldn't mind, would you mind?
\exn ataupun sanggupkah kamu….?
\qu (5) What words refer to asking for something when you are desperate to get it?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal meminta sesuatu semasa kamu terdesak untuk mendapatkannya (kerana akibatnya adalah dibagaikan antara mati dan hidup)?
\ex implore, plead, beseech, entreat, importune
\exn Memohon-rayu - memohon izin (rayuan supaya pertimbangan baru/semula dibuat), merayu dengan bersungguh-sungguh
\qu (6) What words refer to what is said when a person pleads?
\qun
\ex plea, entreaty
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a person who pleads?
\qun
\ex importunate
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.2.2

\is 3.3.2.1
\sd Agree to do something
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to agreeing to do something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to agreeing to do something?
\qun
\ex agree to do something, accept, approve a plan, consent to, give your consent, grant someone's request, jump at the chance, jump at the opportunity, OK something, give your OK, say yes, give something the thumbs up, take on
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the act of agreeing to do something?
\qun
\ex agreement, consent
\exn
\qu (3) What do people say when they agree to do something?
\qun
\ex All right, Yes you can, Sure, Of course, Help yourself, Be my guest
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that you are doing something that someone has asked you to do?
\qun
\ex at someone's request, at the request of
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to agreeing to do something after first refusing?
\qun
\ex give in, bow to, accede to
\exn
\gd ID2E73238-FF99-4BA3-8CE6-D8AE98721710

\is 3.3.2.2
\sd Refuse to do something
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to refusing to do something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to refusing to do something?
\qun
\ex refuse, refusal, flatly refuse, refuse point-blank, not agree to, will not, say no, decline, shake your head, turn down, dig your heels in, slam the door in someone's face, draw the line at, have none of
\exn
\qu (2) What do people say when they refuse to do something?
\qun
\ex not likely, nothing doing, no way, and that's that
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to refusing to give something?
\qun
\ex refuse, deny, withhold
\exn

\dd Use this domain for words related to interceding for someone--to say something to someone because you want them to do something good for someone else.

\qun (1) Bagaimanakah menerangkan perihal membuat permohonan kepada seseorang untuk melakukan sesuatu untuk orang lain?
\ex intercede, intercession, intercessory, intervene on behalf of, interpose, mediate
\exn Memohon bagi kebaikan sesuatu pihak tertentu, bertindak bagi pihak (seseorang atau sekumpulan orang)
\qu (2) What words refer to a person who intercedes?
\qun
\ex intercessor, go-between, intermediary, mediator, peacemaker

\qun (1) Bagaimanakah adanya kesanggupan untuk melakukan sesuatu itu dinyatakan?

\exn Tidak sanggup

\is 3.3.3
\sd Influence
\sdn Mempengaruhi
\oldis 3.3.3
\oldsd Influence
\oldsdn Mempengaruhi
\dd Use this domain for words related to influencing someone--to do something because you want someone to change his thinking.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to influencing someone to change his thinking or decision?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengaruh yang boleh mengakibatkan seseorang itu untuk mengubah pendapat dan keputusannya?
\ex influence, sway, bias, pull strings, work on, affect, impact, make an impression on, prejudice, bribe, bring into line, lead by the nose
\exn Mempengaruhi, mengumbang-ambingkan (mengoncangkan), menimbulkan prasangka, merujuk kepada atau meminta sokongan daripada pihak yang lebih berkuasa, keazaman (tekad), menarik perhatian/ mengusik perasaan, menguasai fikiran dan/ perasaan, meninggalkan kesan mendalam ke atas fikiran dan/perasaan, menghasut, memberi rasuah, menjadi pemangkin sesuatu pengubahsuaian (seperti melalui program suai kenal dsn), memperhambakan
\qu (2) What words refer to your ability to change another's mind or decision?
\qun (2) Bagaimankah dinyatakan perihal sesuatu kemampuan yang dapat mengubah minda dan keputusan orang lain?
\ex have influence, be influential, carry weight, have a hold on
\exn Mempunyai pengaruh atau berkuasa atas sesuatu atau seseorang, bermandat (berpengaruh/ berkuasa), mampu mendatangkan kesan (contohnya orang yang berkedudukan dalam masyarakat), memiliki hak kuasa (mempunyai hak milik contohnya kuasa penjajah) atau kepakaran (berpengalaman/ berpengetahuan/ berkuasa dalam sesuatu bidang)
\qu (3) What words refer to the influence you have on another's mind or decision?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengaruh yang dimiliki ke atas minda atau keputusan orang lain?
\ex influence, impact, weight, pressure, power, sway, control, leverage, pull
\exn Pengaruh, kesan mendalam (besar), mandat, desakan (tekanan), kuasa, goncangan (pergolakan zaman), penjajahan, kekuatan (daya pengumpil), daya tarikan
\qu (4) What words describe a person who has influence?
\qun (4) Bagaimanakah seseorang yang mempunyai kuasa mempengaruhi dirujuk?
\ex influential
\exn Berpengaruh (berkuasa, berkedudukan, bermandat, pakar)

\cf Command

\is 3.3.3.1
\sd Suggest
\sdn Mencadangkan
\oldis 3.3.3.1
\oldsd Suggest
\oldsdn Mencadangkan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to suggesting something--saying that something might be good.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to suggesting something to someone?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi suatu cadangan kepada seseorang?
\ex suggest, make a suggestion, float, recommend, propose, propound, submit
\exn Mencadangkan, mengesyorkan, menyarankan
\qu (2) What words refer to formally suggesting something to a person in authority?
\qun
\ex propose, recommend, put forward, put something before someone, submit, present
\exn
\qu (3) What words do people use when suggesting something?
\qun
\ex I suggest, can I suggest, can I make a suggestion, let's, how about, what about, why don't you, you could always, we may as well, we might as well
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to suggesting someone for a job?
\qun
\ex suggest, recommend, nominate, propose, put someone's name forward
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something that someone suggests?
\qun
\ex suggestion, proposal, recommendation, proposition, submission
\exn

\is 3.3.3.2
\sd Advise
\sdn Menasihatkan
\oldis 3.3.3.3
\oldsd Advise
\oldsdn Menasihatkan
\dd Use this domain for words referring to giving someone advice or counsel, for instance recommending a wise course of action.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi seseorang buah nasihat - contohnya mengesyorkan suatu wawasan yang arif.
\qu (1) What words refer to giving someone advice?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi nasihat kepada seseorang?
\ex advise, say someone should do something, give advice, recommend, urge, offer advice, advocate, commend, counsel, present, promote, propose, recommend a course of action, guide, instruct, submit, make a motion, exhort
\exn Memberi nasihat (menasihatkan), memberi pedoman (tunjuk ajar, garis panduan dsn), memberi bimbingan (membimbing), memberi cadangan atau pendapat (mencadangkan), mengesyorkan
\qu (2) What words do people use when giving advice?
\qun
\ex if I were you, you should do something, you ought to, you'd be better off, take my advice, take it from me, you'd be well advised to do something, on no account, you'd better, I would
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to asking for advice?
\qun (3) Bagaimanakah sesuatu tindakan untuk meminta nasihat itu diterangkan?
\ex ask someone's advice, seek advice, consult, ask for advice, request advice, turn to for advice
\exn Meminta kata atau buah nasihat, membuat permohonan untuk dinasihatkan
\qu (4) What words refer to doing what someone advises?
\qun
\ex take someone's advice, follow someone's advice, listen to advice, act on someone's advice, accept advice, adopt
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the advice that a person gives?
\qun
\ex advice, tip, recommendation, guidance, counseling, counsel, instructions, idea, proposal, charge
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to someone who gives advice?
\qun (6) Bagaimanakah seseorang yang memberi buah nasihat dirujuk?
\ex advisor, counselor, consultant, guru, mentor, coach
\exn Penasihat, pembimbing
\qu (7) What words refer to a group of people who give advice?
\qun (7) Bagaimanakah sesuatu pihak (terdiri daripada beberapa orang) yang bermandat untuk memberi nasihat dirujuk?
\ex council, board, committee, advisory (board)
\exn Majlis, lembaga, jawatan kuasa
\qu (8) What words refer to needing advice?
\qun
\ex need advice, don't know what to do
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to not knowing what to advise?
\qun (9) Bagaimanakah perihal tiadanya kemampuan memberi sesuatu nasihat itu dinyatakan?
\ex don't know what to tell you
\exn Kurang pengalaman, pengetahuan atau kepakaran untuk memberi nasihat, tidak arif untuk memberi sebarang nasihat
\qu (10) What words refer to not accepting advice?
\qun
\ex refuse advice, ignore advice
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to giving advice when the person doesn't want it?
\qun
\ex meddle, kibitz, kibitzer
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe good or bad advice?
\qun
\ex good, wise, bad, bum steer, advisable, helpful, constructive, positive
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.3.3
\oldqu (2) What words refer to the advice which a person gives?
\oldqun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada nasihat yang diberikan oleh seseorang?
\oldex advice, counsel, suggestion, recommendation
\oldexn Kata atau buah nasihat, bimbingan, cadangan, syor-syor
\gd I6BFB7813-3A7D-47E2-88E1-D54034C07E5D

\is 3.3.3.3
\sd Persuade
\sdn
\oldis 3.3.3.2
\oldsd Advocate, promote, persuade
\oldsdn Menganjurkan, Memajukan, Menyakinkan
\dd Use this domain for words related to persuading someone--to try to get someone to do something or to change his thinking.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to trying to persuade someone to change his thinking or decision?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tindakan yang diambil untuk memujuk seseorang untuk mempertimbangkan semula (mengubah) pendapat atau keputusannya?
\ex advocate, promote, persuade, convince, encourage, encouragement, urge, sway
\exn Menganjurkan (mengemukan maklumat yang menyokong usul yang dianjurkan), memajukan (supaya keberkesanan usul menjadi nyata), memujuk, menyakinkan
\qu (2) What words describe a person who can persuade others?
\qun (2) Bagaimanakah menyatakan kemampuan seseorang untuk memujuk orang lain (supaya dipertimbangkan semula pendapat atau keputusannya)?
\ex convincing, persuasive
\exn Menyakinkan, merangsangkan (masuk hati, masuk akal)
\qu (3) What words refer to someone being persuaded to change his thinking or decision?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepda perihal seseorang yang sedang dipujuk untuk mempertimbangkan semula pendapat atau keputusannya?
\ex come around to (someone's) view, see it (someone's) way, be won over
\exn Mula memahami pandangan seseorang, mula berkenan (bersetuju) dengan tindakan, pendapat, pendirian dan/ kepercayaan seseorang, dimenangkan (menjadi yakin) kepada sesuatu pihak atau pendapat (pendirian dsn) -
\qu (4) What words refer to persuading someone not to do something?
\qun (4) Bagaimanakah tindakan memujuk seseorang supaya tidak melakukan sesuatu dinyatakan?
\ex dissuade
\exn Mengajukan fakta-fakta kontra (bantahan) untuk dipertimbangkan atau diambilkira

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.3.2
\cf Influence

\gd I9D428E57-E125-4575-B165-9BC6FD4EC507

\is 3.3.3.4
\sd Insist
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to insisting--to say strongly or repeatedly that someone must do something, because the other person does not want to do it.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to insisting that someone do something?
\qun
\ex insist, be insistent, at someone's insistence, put your foot down, demand, be adamant, won't take no for an answer, won't hear of, maintain, be resolute
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe a person who insists?
\qun
\ex insistent, importunate, resolute
\exn

\is 3.3.3.5
\sd Compel
\sdn Menggerakkan
\oldis 3.3.3.5
\oldsd Compel
\oldsdn Menggerakkan

\dd Use this domain for words related to compelling someone to do something--to cause or force someone to do something that they do not want to do.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to forcing someone to do something?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengaruh suatu kuasa yang menggerakkan seseorang untuk melakukan sesuatu?
\ex compel, blackmail, browbeat, bully (v), coerce, constrain, drive, force someone to do something, use force, force something on, insist, impel, impose your will on, make someone do something, oblige, press, pressure, put pressure on, push, use strong-arm tactics, use strong-arm methods, under duress, be breathing down someone's neck
\exn Menggerakkan (minda berfikir dan hati beriman sehingga berazam atau bermotivasi melakukan sesuatu) - masih melibatkan kehendak seseorang, mendesak (tidak atau kurang mengambil kira kehendak seseorang tetapi masih melibatkan kehendaknya sebagai contoh: anak-anak yang belum mampu mengenal bahaya masih perlu memilih untuk mematuhi nasihat, arahan atau amaran yang diberikan), memaksa (langsung tidak mengambil kira kehendak orang lain)
\qu (2) What words refer to a situation forcing someone to do something?
\qun
\ex force, make someone do something, drive, compel someone to do something, leave someone with no choice, leave someone with no option, be condemned to
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to forcing someone to accept something?
\qun
\ex force something on, impose, inflict something on
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the act of forcing someone to do something?
\qun
\ex compulsion
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that someone is forced to do?
\qun
\ex forcible (eviction), forcibly, compulsory (education)
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to something someone does in order to force someone to do something?
\qun
\ex coercion, pressure, high-pressure tactics, strong-arm tactics
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to someone who forces people to do things?
\qun
\ex bully
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe someone who forces people to do things?
\qun
\ex bossy, coercive, pushy
\exn

\is 3.3.3.6
\sd Control
\sdn Menguasai
\oldis 3.3.3.6
\oldsd Control
\oldsdn Menguasai

\dd Use this domain for words related to controlling someone--to force someone to do what you want them to do by ordering them to do it, or by doing something so that they have no choice. Also use this domain for words related to controlling something, for instance to control a machine, so that it does what you want it to do.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to controlling someone or something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menguasai seseorang atau sesuatu?
\ex control, be in control, manipulate, pull strings, call the shots, be in the driver's seat, steer, regulate, govern, dominate, monopolize, have a monopoly, have a stranglehold, have a hold over, wrap someone around your finger, hold sway, be the boss, be domineering, oppress, keep someone down, repress, walk all over
\exn Menguasai, menguruskan kehidupan seseorang atau sesuatu sepenuhnya sama ada dengan cekap (maksud baik) atau dengan licik (maksud jahat)
\qu (2) What words refer to being under someone's control?
\qun
\ex be under someone's control, be in someone's power, be under someone's spell, be at someone's mercy, be a doormat
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.3.6
\gd IE6EC43EF-0100-4CF4-A047-C575EE8613B4

\is 3.3.3.7
\sd Warn
\sdn Memberi Amaran
\oldis 3.3.3.7
\oldsd Warn
\oldsdn Memberi Amaran
\dd Use this domain for words related to warning someone--saying something to someone so that he will not do something bad.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan perihal memberi amaran kepada suatu pihak supaya mereka tidak akan melakukan sesuatu yang jahat.
\qu (1) What words refer to warning someone?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan yang merujuk kepada memberi amaran kepada seseorang?
\ex warn, forewarn, admonish, advise against, discourage someone from doing something, dissuade
\exn Amaran (peringatan), memberi amaran, menghalang (tindakan tidak menggalakkan sesuatu perbuatan maksiat), halangan (larangan yang bertujuan tidak menggalakkan sesiapa pun untuk melakukan kejahatan)
\qu (2) What words refer to what is said when someone is warning someone?
\qun
\ex warning, admonition, alarm, alert, caution, caveat, discouragement, forewarning
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that should not be done?
\qun
\ex inadvisable
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something that makes a sound to warn people?
\qun
\ex alarm, bell, buzzer
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.3.7
\gd I3445E61B-61A3-4EDE-93F5-402EBE9CA51C

\is 3.3.3.8
\sd Threaten
\sdn
\oldis 3.3.3.8
\oldsd Threat
\oldsdn Ancaman
\dd Use this domain for words related to threatening someone--to say that you will do something bad to someone if they don't do what you want them to do.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to threatening someone?
\qun
\ex threaten, menace, intimidate, terrorize, frighten, cow, bully, browbeat, blackmail, extort, warn
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the act of threatening or to what is said?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal sesuatu tindakan (perkataan atau perbuatan) yang mengancamkan?
\ex threat, menace, intimidation, terrorism, blackmail, extortion, warning
\exn Ancaman, ugutan, gertakan, pengganasan, peras-ugut, paksaan (kekerasan), amaran
\qu (3) What words describe a person who threatens?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perbuatan seseorang yang mengancam?
\ex threatening, menacing, intimidating, bullying
\exn Mengancam, mengugut, mengertak, menindak
\qu (4) What words refer to a person who threatens?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang mengancam orang lain?
\ex bully, terrorist, blackmailer, extortionist
\exn Penindas, pengganas, pemeras-ugut, ahli kongsi gelap (daripada gerombolan samseng, penjenayah, penjahat)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.3.8
\oldqu (1) What words refer to promising to harm someone?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tindakan yang diambil untuk mengancam seseorang?
\oldex threaten, menace, intimidate, terrorize, frighten, cow, bully, browbeat, blackmail, extort, warn
\oldexn Mengancam, mengugut, mengertak, mengganas, menakut-nakutkan, mengecutkan semangat, menindas, berjanji untuk membahayakan, memeras ugut, menggunakan kekerasan (memaksa), memberi amaran (untuk berlaku zalim)
\gd IC1C1DCB4-8FE5-43AC-9B91-B2B2BC33DE5B

\is 3.3.4
\sd Ask permission
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to asking permission to do something. This domain is part of a scenario: You have authority over me. I want to do something. I ask you for permission to do it. You give permission or refuse permission. I obey you or disobey you.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to asking permission to do something?
\qun
\ex ask, ask someone's permission
\exn
\qu (2) What words do people use when they are asking permission to do something?
\qun
\ex can I, may I, do you mind if, would you mind if, is it all right if
\exn
\gd I8383B4CB-E14A-4D04-A8C3-9C5276384953

\is 3.3.4.1
\sd Give permission
\sdn
\oldis 3.3.2.3
\oldsd Give consent
\oldsdn Memberi Izin
\oldis 4.6.5.1
\oldsd Permit
\oldsdn Memberi kebenaran
\dd Use this domain for words related to giving someone permission to do something. This domain is about a scenario: You have authority over me. I want to do something. I ask you for permission to do it. You give permission or refuse permission.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to giving someone permission to do something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi kebenaran kepada seseorang untuk melakukan sesuatu?
\ex give permission, agree to, allow, authorize, consent to, give your consent, grant permission, let, permit, say someone can do something, not stand in someone's way, sanction, suffer, give someone the go-ahead, okay something, give someone the green light, give leave
\exn Memberi kebenaran, membenarkan, mengizinkan, memberi kelulusan
\xe John <allowed> us to use his shovel.
\xen
\qu (2) What words do people use when they give someone permission?
\qun
\ex go ahead, be my guest, feel free, help yourself
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to being allowed to do something?
\qun
\ex get permission, can, be allowed, be free to do something, may
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to allowing something to happen by not making any effort to prevent it?
\qun
\ex let, allow, not stand in someone's way, unchecked
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to allowing someone to do whatever they want?
\qun
\ex give someone complete freedom, give someone a free hand, give someone carte blanche, give someone the run of
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to permission to do something?
\qun
\ex permission, authorization, consent, clearance, someone's say-so, license, green light, the okay, the go-ahead
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to an official document that gives someone permission to do something?
\qun
\ex permit, license, warrant
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to giving someone permission to do something that is not usually allowed?
\qun
\ex bend the rules, make an exception, concession, excuse, exempt, waive
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe something that people are allowed to do?
\qun
\ex be allowed, allowable, permissible, acceptable
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.2.3
\oldqu (1) What words refer to agreeing to a request?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal meluluskan sesuatu permohonan?
\oldex Give consent, agree
\oldexn Memberi izin, berkenan (untuk meluluskan)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.6.5.1

\is 3.3.4.5

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mempunyai kebebasan untuk melakukan sesuatu?
\ex free, freely, be at liberty to do something
\exn Bebas, mempunyai hak kebebasan untuk melakukan sesuatu, tidak terbatas (tanpa halangan), tiada sekatan untuk melakukan sesuatu, tiada bantahan untuk melaksanakan sesuatu

\exn

\exn

\exn

\qun
\ex gain your freedom, gain your liberty, win your freedom
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to freeing someone?

\exn

\is 3.4
\sd Emotion
\sdn Pengalaman Batin
\oldis 3.4
\oldsd Emotion
\oldsdn Pengalaman Batin
\dd Use this domain for general words related to feelings and emotions.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan dan pengalaman batin yang di alami oleh seseorang.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling something?
\qun
\ex feel, experience
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the part of a person that enables him to feel emotions?
\qun
\ex feelings, emotions, heart
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a feeling?
\qun
\ex feeling, emotion, sentiment
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe a feeling?
\qun
\ex heart-felt, strong, powerful, deep, shallow, passing
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to feeling something very strongly?
\qun
\ex be gripped by
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a strong feeling?
\qun
\ex strong feeling, strong emotion, passion
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe someone who has strong emotions?
\qun (7) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang menunjukkan pengalaman batin (emosi) yang sangat nyata?
\ex emotional, sensitive, sentimental, passionate, intense, intensity
\exn Penuh perasaan (sikap yang sihat pada masa yang sesuai) / terlalu mengikut perasaan (sikap yang tidak baik), peka, perasaan jiwa yang kuat atau beremosi yang kuat
\qu (8) What words refer to feeling something for a long time?
\qun
\ex attitude, mood, state of mind, frame of mind, spirits, morale
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to causing someone to feel something?
\qun
\ex make you feel, stimulate, stir, arouse, raise, touch
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel something?
\qun
\ex stimulation
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something that causes someone to feel something?
\qun
\ex stimulating, rousing, touching, emotional
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to doing something to show a feeling?
\qun
\ex emote, express, show, act out, display
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe someone who does not show many emotions?
\qun (13) Bagaimanakan menjelaskan seseorang yang jarang menunjukkan perasaannya?
\ex unemotional, dispassionate, unfeeling, insensitive, unsentimental
\exn Tidak mudah dipengaruhi atau tidak mengikut perasaan, tidak berperasaan - tiada belas kasihan, tidak peka
\qu (14) What words refer to controlling your feelings?
\qun
\ex control yourself, self-control, restrain yourself, restraint, contain yourself, keep your temper
\exn
\qu (15) What words describe a person whose emotions are so strong that they lose control?
\qun
\ex hysterical, have hysterics, go to pieces, fall apart, break down, have an emotional breakdown, go berserk, snap, crack, crack up, give in to, get carried away, have a fit
\exn
\qu (16) What words refer to controlling your feelings again after losing control?
\qun
\ex snap out of it, get a grip on yourself, pull yourself together
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4
\oldqu (1) What words refer to feeling emotions?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan dan pengalaman batin yang dialami?
\oldex Feel, emote, sentiment
\oldexn Berasa (rasa, merasakan), tunjuk perasaan (menunjukkan emosi secara keterlaluan -contohnya waktu mogok atau lakonan), perasaan jiwa (sentimen) - perasaan dan pendapat (kedua-duanya dialami terhadap sesuatu perkara)
\oldqu (2) What words refer to the part of a person which enables him to feel emotions?
\oldqun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang berkaitan dengan sumber pengalaman batin seseorang?
\oldex feelings, emotion, heart
\oldexn Perasaan, pengalaman batin, hati
\oldqu (3) What words refer to ongoing emotions?

\oldex attitude, mood
\oldexn Sikap, perasaan hati

\is 3.4.1.1

\sdn Suka
\oldis 3.4.1.1
\oldsd Like, love
\oldsdn Suka

\dd Use this domain for words related to liking something or someone, or liking to do something.

\qu (1) What words refer to liking something?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal adanya rasa suka terhadap sesuatu atau seseorang?
\ex like, have a liking for, adore, enjoy, be fond of, proud of someone, fancy something, have a fancy for, take a fancy to, care for, have affection for, admire, look up to, think highly of, approve, pleased, admire, appeals to you, be to your liking, go down well, savor (v), luxuriate, be happy with, feel good toward, feel good about
\exn Suka - kesukaan, dibenarkan - memberi kebenaran, gembira - dengan sukacita (kegembiraan), kagum - kekaguman, menikmati - nikmat, kenikmatan
\qu (2) What words refer to liking someone?
\qun
\ex like, be fond of, be attached to, have a soft spot for, see something in someone, a man/woman after your own heart
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the feeling of liking something?
\qun
\ex liking, admiration, adoration, affection, approval, enjoyment, fondness for, pleasure, pride, affinity
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to liking something very much?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal adanya perasaan sangat suka terhadap sesuatu atau seseorang?
\ex love, adore, delight, enthusiastic about, enthusiasm for, be mad about, be crazy about, be attached to, have a passion for
\exn Amat menyukai - mengasihi, sangat mengembirakan
\qu (5) What words describe something that is liked?
\qun
\ex likable, lovable, lovely, tasteful, admirable, delightful, charming, endearing, engaging, pleasing, pleasurable, enjoyable, nice, likes and dislikes, love of your life, passion
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a person who likes something?
\qun
\ex admirer, fan, (art)-lover, lover of, enthusiast, devotee
\exn

\qun
\ex adoring, affectionate
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to liking something and wanting to have it?

\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to something causing someone to like a person or thing?
\qun
\ex beguile, bewitch, charm, dazzle, delight, enchant, enthrall, fascinate, gladden, gratify, impress, please, thrill, tickle, wow
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to something that causes someone to like a person or thing?
\qun
\ex charm, enchantress
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something that causes someone to like a person or thing?
\qun
\ex beguiling, bewitching, charming, dazzling, delightful, enchanting, enthralling, fascinating, gratifying, impressive, pleasing, thrilling
\exn

\is 3.4.1.1.1
\sd Enjoy doing something
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to enjoying doing something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to enjoying something?
\qun
\ex like, enjoy, love, be fond of, get a lot of pleasure out of, savor, with relish, exhilarate
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to feeling happy when you are doing something?
\qun
\ex enjoy yourself, have a good time, have fun, have the time of your life, have a whale of a time, have a blast, be in your element, live it up, let your hair down
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the feeling you get when you enjoy doing something?
\qun
\ex enjoyment, pleasure, ecstasy, exhilaration, satisfaction
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe someone who enjoys doing something?
\qun
\ex keen, avid, great
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to causing someone to enjoy himself?
\qun
\ex amuse, entertain
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to something that causes someone to enjoys something?
\qun
\ex amusement, entertainment
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that people enjoy doing?

\ex enjoyable, fun, good fun, great fun, pleasurable, pleasure, be a delight, the joys of, the delights of, be a blast, be a good laugh, satisfying, amusing, entertaining, treat
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe someone that other people enjoy being with?
\qun
\ex be good company, fun, be a good laugh
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to enjoying something bad?
\qun
\ex revel in, get a kick out of, take delight in, relish, gloat, take pleasure in, delight in, wallow in
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to doing something just because you enjoy it?
\qun
\ex for fun, for a laugh, for the hell of it
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to enjoying being praised?
\qun
\ex bask in, lap something up
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe someone who is only interested in enjoying themselves?
\qun
\ex self-indulgent, hedonist
\exn

\qun
\ex recreation, leisure
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to someone who does not want other people to enjoy themselves?
\qun
\ex spoilsport
\exn

\is 3.4.1.2
\sd Happy
\sdn
\oldis 3.4.1.2
\oldsd Joyful, happy
\oldsdn Penuh Sukacita, Bersukacita
\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling happy--to feel good when something good happens (such as receiving a gift, hearing good news, or watching something good happening).
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal bagaimana perasaan seseorang dipengaruhi semasa sesuatu yang baik dialami (contohnya semasa menerima suatu pemberian atau khabar baik ataupun semasa menyaksikan sesuatu yang baik berlaku)
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling happy?
\qun
\ex rejoice, feel good, be in a good mood
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of happiness?
\qun
\ex happiness, bliss, cheerfulness, contentment, delight, elation, euphoria, gladness, good feelings, joy, mirth, pleasure, satisfaction
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels happy?
\qun
\ex happy, happily, cheerful, cheerfully, chipper, content, contented, contentedly, glad, gladly, jaunty, merry, mirthful, pleased, satisfied
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very happy?
\qun
\ex exult, delight in, ecstasy, be on top of the world, be over the moon, rapture
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe a person who is very happy?
\qun
\ex blissfully happy, overjoyed, delighted, ecstatic, elated, exultant, joyful, jubilant, radiant, thrilled
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe a person who usually feels happy?
\qun
\ex happy, cheerful, contented, jolly, jovial, have a happy/cheerful/sunny disposition
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a person who feels good while doing something?
\qun (7) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal seseorang yang mengalami suatu perasaan yang baik semasa dia melakukan sesuatu?
\ex enjoy, take pleasure in, be fond of doing
\exn Menerima nikmat (menikmati), berkenan atau senang hati terhadap, menjadi kegemaran (gemar melakukan)
\qu (8) What words refer to feeling good about someone's behavior?
\qun
\ex be pleased with
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe how a person feels when something good happens to someone else?
\qun (9) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang digunakan untuk menjelaskan perihal perasaan yang mungkin dialami oleh seseorang apabila orang lain diberkati?
\ex feel happy for, rejoice with
\exn Turut bergembira dengan dia, bersukacita kerana dia (telah lulus)
\qu (10) What words refer to feeling good when something bad happens to someone?
\qun (10) Bagaimanakah menyatakan perihal berasa sukacita semasa sesuatu yang tidak baik menimpa orang lain?
\ex exultant, glee, gleeful, gloat
\exn Megahkan diri dalam kesusahan atau kegagalan yang menimpa orang lain
\qu (11) What words refer to causing someone to feel happy?
\qun
\ex make someone happy, cheer someone up, comfort, console, delight, gladden, please, satisfy, put someone in a good mood, make someone's day, raise someone's spirits, lift someone's spirits
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to feeling happy again after feeling sad?
\qun
\ex brighten up, cheer up, perk up, be cheered, be heartened, take heart
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel happy?
\qun
\ex delight, joy, happy ending
\exn
\qu (14) What words describe something that causes someone to feel happy?
\qun
\ex happy, cheering, cheerful (thought), heartening, heartwarming, pleasing, satisfying
\exn
\qu (15) What words describe a time period when you feel happy?
\qun
\ex happy, blissful, delightful (time), idyllic, joyous (occasion), pleasant
\exn

\sdn Tenang

\oldsdn Tenang

\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling calm.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling calm?
\qun
\ex feel calm, be at peace
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of calm?
\qun
\ex calm (n), composure, presence of mind, equanimity, peace, placidity, poise, repose, serenity, tranquility
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels calm?
\qun
\ex calm (adj), calmly, collected, composed, cool, dispassionate, peaceful, phlegmatic, quiescent, sedate, serene, staid, steady, tranquil, unruffled, not fazed
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to causing someone to feel calm?
\qun
\ex calm someone, calm someone down, soothe
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel calm?
\qun
\ex calming influence, tranquilizer
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that causes someone to feel calm?
\qun
\ex calming
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to remaining calm in a difficult situation?
\qun (7) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman seseorang yang bertenang semasa menghadapi suatu kesusahan?
\ex keep your cool, keep your head, keep a stiff upper lip, maintain your composure, imperturbable, untroubled
\exn Bertenang (di hati dan fikiran), kelihatan tenang (waktu bertindak), tenteram (sikap), perasaan terkawal (hidup aman damai)
\qu (8) What words describe a person who is usually calm?
\qun
\ex placid, even-tempered, laid-back
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe a calm place?
\qun
\ex calm, quiet, peaceful
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to becoming calm?
\qun
\ex calm down, cool down, cool off, compose yourself, steady your nerves, relax, quiet down
\exn
\qu (11) What do you say to someone when you want them to be calm?
\qun
\ex Cool it. Take it easy. Calm down.
\exn

\oldsdn Hairan, Kagum

\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang dialami oleh seseorang apabila terjadinya sesuatu yang di luar jangkaan atau tanggapannya.

\qun

\exn

\qun
\ex surprise (n), amazement, astonishment, awe (n), incredulity
\exn

\qun
\ex surprised, amazed, astonished, incredulous, startled, flabbergasted
\exn

\ex surprise (n)
\exn

\exn

\exn Wah!

\oldexn Membangkitkan rasa kagum, menakjubkan, memberi rangsangan yang membuahkan rasa junjung dan sanjung

\oldexn Menarik (ada daya tarikan)
\oldqu (2) What words describe something that people are not interested in?
\oldqun (2) Bagaimanakah dijelaskan perihal sesuatu yang tidak mendapat perhatian orang ramai?
\oldex uninteresting
\oldexn Tidak menarik (tiada daya tarikan)
\gd IF9D020D6-B129-4BB8-9509-3B4A6C27482E

\is 3.4.1.4.1
\sd Excited
\sdn
\oldis 3.4.1.4.1
\oldsd Excited, enthusiastic
\oldsdn Hati Berkobar-kobar

\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling excited--to feel good when something good has happening or is about to happen.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang dialami oleh seseorang semasa sesuatu yang baik sedang berlaku atau akan berlaku.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling excited?
\qun
\ex be on the edge of your seat, be on tenterhooks, be all agog
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of excitement?
\qun
\ex excitement, thrill, exhilaration, hysteria, suspense
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels excited?
\qun
\ex excited, eager, thrilled, animated, exuberant
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe a group of people who are excited?
\qun
\ex frenzy, fever pitch, hysterical, high spirits
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to feeling very excited?
\qun
\ex exhilarated, overexcited, mad, wild, crazy
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to causing someone to feel excited?
\qun
\ex excite, get someone excited, thrill, give someone a thrill, animate, stir up, exhilarate
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel excited?
\qun
\ex sensation
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that causes someone to feel excited?
\qun
\ex exciting, thrilling, sensational, sensation, exhilarating, heady, dramatic, nail biting, action-packed
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to doing something in order to feel excited?
\qun
\ex do something for kicks, do something for the thrill of it
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe an exciting experience?
\qun
\ex thrill, adventure, excitement
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to the most exciting part of something?
\qun
\ex climax, high point, high spot, highlight
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe a person who becomes excited easily?
\qun
\ex excitable
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to becoming more excited?
\qun
\ex get excited, excitement rose, go mad, go wild, go crazy, reach a climax, reach a fever pitch
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to becoming less excited?
\qun
\ex calm down
\exn
\qu (15) What words describe a person who does not feel excited?
\qun
\ex calm, unexcited
\exn

\is 3.4.1.4.4
\sd Attract
\sdn Mempesona
\oldis 3.4.1.4.3
\oldsd Attract
\oldsdn Mempesona

\dd Use this domain for words related to attracting someone's attention to something. In a typical situation, a person sees something with an interesting quality. The person moves closer, pays close attention to the thing, and possibly does something to it.

\exn

\exn Mempesona, menawan hati

\exn

\exn

\is 3.4.1.4.5
\sd Indifferent
\sdn Tidak Peduli
\oldis 3.4.1.4.4

\oldsdn Tidak Peduli

\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling indifferent about something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling indifferent?
\qun
\ex not care, shrug it off, be on the fence, middle-of-the-road
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of indifference?
\qun
\ex indifference, neutrality, apathy, unconcern, lack of concern
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels indifferent?
\qun
\ex indifferent, neutral, apathetic, unconcerned, unmoved, blasé, careless, lackadaisical, half-hearted, casual, offhand, nonchalant, gaily
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very indifferent?
\qun
\ex not give a damn, couldn't care less, be past caring, for all I care
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that you don't care, because you will be happy no matter what happens?
\qun
\ex don't mind, not be fussy, it doesn't bother me
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that you used to care, but don't anymore because you are hurt or angry?
\qun
\ex be past caring, for all I care, not give a damn, couldn't care less
\exn
\qu (7) What words indicate that you don't care about someone else's problem?
\qun
\ex not my problem, not my concern, that's your problem, (that's just) tough
\exn
\qu (8) What expressions do people use when they don't care?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe What the hell! So what? Who cares? I don't care. I could care less. See if I care. I don't give a care. I don't give a damn. I'm indifferent. What difference does it make? What's the difference? It makes no difference to me. It's all the same to me. Never mind! It doesn't matter (to me). Close enough.
\xen
\qu (9) What words refer to not being aware of other people's feelings?
\qun
\ex insensitive
\exn

\oldis 3.4.1.4.5

\oldsdn Membosankan

\qun

\exn

\exn

\exn

\qun

\exn

\qun

\exn

\exn

\exn Membosankan, tidak menarik, tidak memeriahkan
\qu (10) What words describe a place that is uninteresting
\qun
\ex dead, one-horse town, nothing ever happens, drab, featureless, dreary
\exn

\qun

\exn

\is 3.4.1.5
\sd Confident
\sdn Yakin, Berkeyakinan
\oldis 3.4.1.5
\oldsd Confident
\oldsdn Yakin, Berkeyakinan

\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling confident--to feel sure that you can do something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang digunakan untuk menjelaskan seseorang yang berkeyakinan dia mampu melakukan sesuatu.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling confident?
\qun
\ex feel confident, sure of yourself, think positively, secure in yourself
\exn

\qun
\ex confidence, morale, positive thinking
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels confident?
\qun
\ex confident, assured, self-assured, assertive
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe someone who is too confident?
\qun
\ex overconfident
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to causing someone to feel confident?
\qun
\ex encourage, boost someone's morale, raise someone's confidence
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel confident?
\qun
\ex encouragement, boost, morale raiser
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that causes someone to feel confident?
\qun
\ex encouraging
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to feeling more confident?
\qun
\ex your morale rises
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to feeling less confident?
\qun
\ex demoralize, shake someone's confidence, lose confidence
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe someone who is not confident?
\qun (10) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang tidak berkeyakinan?
\ex insecure, unsure of yourself
\exn Rasa tidak terjamin (rasa tidak selamat tetapi terancam), tidak yakin atau tiada keyakinan terhadap diri sendiri

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.1.5
\oldqu (1) What words describe a confident person?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang berkeyakinan?
\oldex confident, confidence, sure of yourself, assured, assertive, morale
\oldexn Yakin (berkeyakinan), keyakinan, mempunyai keyakinan dalam diri sendiri, rasa pasti - kerana adanya pendirianatau kedudukan yang terjamin (teguh), menunjukkan ketegasan, bersemangat
\oldqu (2) What words describe a person who is too confident?
\oldqun (2) Bagaimanakah dijelaskan perihal seseorang yang terlalu yakin kepada diri sendiri?
\oldex overconfident
\oldexn Terlalu atau terlampau yakin (terhadap sendiri, orang lain atau sesuatu)
\oldqu (3) What words refer to making a person feel more confident?
\oldqun (3) Bagaimanakah menjelaskan perihal tindakan yang diambil untuk mengukuhkan keyakinan diri seseorang?
\oldex boost morale
\oldexn Membangkitkan lagi rasa bersemangat (menjaga maruahnya dengan menyedarkan betapa pentingnya untuk mengenal dan memelihara harga diri)
\oldqu (4) What words refer to making a person feel less confident?
\oldqun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal suatu tindakan yang diambil untuk melemahkan rasa yakin seseoran?
\oldex demoralize, shake someone's confidence
\oldexn Melemahkan atau mematahkan semangat (dengan ancaman dan penindasan terhadap maruah dan harga diri), mengoncangkan keyakinan seseorang

\is 3.4.2.1
\sd Sad
\sdn Sedih
\oldis 3.4.2.1
\oldsd Sad
\oldsdn Sedih
\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling sad--to feel bad because something bad has happened (such as losing something, hearing bad news, or watching something bad happening).
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang dialami oleh seseorang apabila berlakunya suatu kejadian yang tidak baik (contohnya bila kehilangan sesuatu, menerima khabar buruk atau menyaksikan suatu kejadian malapetaka).
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling sad?
\qun
\ex be sad, feel sad, feel down, grieve, mourn, feel sorry for yourself, sulk, wallow in, feel hurt
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of sadness?
\qun
\ex sadness, dejection, depression, despondency, dismal feeling, gloom, gloominess, grief, heartache, self-pity, misery, pain, sorrow, unhappiness, woe
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels sad?
\qun
\ex sad, crestfallen, dejected, disappointed, discouraged, doleful, down, downcast, downhearted, fed up, forlorn, gloomy, glum, grouchy, grumpy, with a heavy heart, homesick, low, melancholy, morose, mournful, pensive, sober (adj), solemn, sorry, sorrowful, sullen, unhappy, wistful, woeful
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling sad because someone died?
\qun
\ex grief, grieve, mourn, be in mourning
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to feeling very sad?
\qun
\ex agony, anguish, desolate, despair, be in despair, disconsolate, grief stricken, heartbroken, inconsolable, miserable, misery, suicidal, woe
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to feeling sad for a long time?
\qun
\ex depressed, despondent, down, be down in the dumps, feel blue, low, mope
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a time when a person feels sad?
\qun
\ex sad, unhappy, miserable
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe a person who usually feels sad?
\qun (8) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang selalu besedih hati?
\ex discouraged, discouragement, depressed, depression, feel down, grouch, unhappy, unhappiness
\exn Rasa tidak gembira atau berdukacita (kedukaan), tawar hati (lemah/ patah semangat), hati dan jiwa rasa tertekan (tekanan batin), masyghul
\qu (9) What words refer to causing someone to feel sad?
\qun
\ex sadden, aggrieve, disappoint, depress, discourage, distress, grieve, hurt, sober (v), sting, torment, make someone sad, make someone unhappy, get someone down, break someone's heart, drive someone to despair
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel sad?
\qun
\ex heartbreak, heartache, discouragement, grief, downer, tragedy, bitter pill to swallow, woe
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something that causes someone to feel sad?
\qun
\ex sad, depressing, grievous, heartbreaking, plaintive, mournful, tragic
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe a place that causes someone to feel sad?
\qun
\ex dismal, depressing, dreary, bleak, cheerless
\exn
\qu (13) What do people do when they are sad?
\qun (13) Apakah yang dilakukan oleh seseorang yang bersedih hati?
\ex hang your head, cry, frown, bewail, groan, lament, lamentation, sigh, wail
\exn Kepalanya tertunduk dan mukanya menghadap ke bawah bagaikan orang yang segan hidup
\qu (14) What sounds does a person make when he is sad?
\qun (14) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal cara seseorang menyatakan rasa sedih hatinya?
\ex groan, moan, sigh
\exn Mengerang, mengeluh, berkeluh-kesah (menarik nafas panjang)
\qu (15) What do people say when something bad happens and they want to say they are sad about it?
\qun
\ex it's a pity, it's a shame, too bad, unfortunately, sadly, regrettably, it's unfortunate, it's sad, more's the pity, unhappily, I'm sorry, sorry to hear, sorry (that), wish that ... not (something hadn't happened), tragically, feel sorry for someone
\exn
\qu (16) What words describe something that you wish had not happened?
\qun
\ex unfortunate, regrettable
\exn
\qu (17) What do people say when they don't want someone to feel sad?
\qun
\ex cheer up
\exn
\qu (18) What words refer to helping someone who feels sad to feel good?
\qun
\ex comfort, console, reassure, solace
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.2.1
\oldqu (1) What words describe a person who is sad?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal seseorang yang sedang bersedih?
\oldex sad, sadness, discouraged, grieve, grief, sorry, sorrow, dismal feeling, down, forlorn, upset, mournful, grouchy, grumpy
\oldexn Bersedih (rasa sedih), kepiluan, tawar hati, berdukacita (hati yang penuh duka lara), rasa kasihan sehingga turut merasa sedih) atau menyesal (dalam sikap yang penuh penyesalan), berasa muram, masyghul, putus asa, bersusah hati, kelihatan hiba, merungut-rungut sahaja, bersungut-sungut sahaja
\oldqu (2) What words describe a person who is very sad?
\oldqun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal sumber kepada pengalaman seseorang yang berasa amat sedih hati?
\oldex grief stricken, despair, misery
\oldexn Kesedihan (duka lara, masyghul), kebatinan yang terluka cedera, perasaan putus asa, kesengsaraan
\oldqu (3) What words refer to causing a person to be sad?
\oldqun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal suatu tindakan yang menjadi sumber sebabnya seseorang itu bersedih hati?
\oldex sadden, discourage, discouragement, grieve, depress
\oldexn Menyedihkan, tidak beri galakkan - melemahkan semangat (sehingga seseorang itu lemah/patah semangat), mendukacitakan, memberi tekanan atau menekan kebatinan seseorang (sehingga dia berasa kecil hati)
\oldqu (5) What words describe how a person feels when his hopes are not fulfilled?
\oldqun (5) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang dialami oleh seseorang kerana harapannya tidak menjadi kenyataan?
\oldex disappointed, frustrated
\oldexn Rasa kecewa, rasa hampa
\oldqu (6) What words refer to feeling bad when something good happens to someone?
\oldqun (6) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman berasa kecil hati apabila sesuatu yang baik terjadi dalam kehidupan orang lain?
\oldex envious, jealous
\oldexn Dengki, iri hati (cemburu)
\oldqu (9) What words refer to frowning?
\oldqun (9) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mengerut dahi?
\oldex frown (in disapproval or worry), grimace (in pain), sneer (in derision)
\oldexn Mengerut dahi (sebagai tanda tidak setuju atau kekhuartiran), menyeringai (wajah yang berkerut kerana rasa susah hati), mengerenyot (mengerut kerana mengejek)
\cf Mourn
\gd I6142C173-161A-47D5-BDEC-C827518FD67C

\is 3.4.2.1.1
\sd Dislike
\sdn
\oldis 3.4.2.3
\oldsd Dislike, abhor
\oldsdn Tidak Suka, Benci
\oldis 4.4.2.2.3
\oldsd Displeased with
\oldsdn Tidak berkenan terhadap

\dd Use this domain for words related to not liking someone or something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang dialami seseorang terhadap sesuatu atau seseorang yang tidak disukai.
\qu (1) What words refer to disliking something?
\qun
\ex don't like, dislike (v), take a disliking to, take an instant dislike to, have a healthy dislike for, not be fond of, not keen on, not be crazy about, not think much of, not be someone's cup of tea, not be to your taste, not be to your liking, not be your thing, not be your type, have no time for, not take kindly to, don't care for, look down on, turn up your nose at, be unhappy with, hold in disfavor, feel unfavorable toward, be displeased with
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of dislike?
\qun
\ex dislike (n), disliking, antipathy, aversion, displeasure, distaste, prejudice
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who dislikes something?
\qun
\ex displeased, offended, prejudiced
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to causing someone to dislike something?
\qun
\ex displease, offend, repel, trouble, upset, put someone off, turn someone against
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something that causes someone to dislike something?
\qun
\ex offense
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that people dislike?
\qun
\ex contemptible, deplorable, despicable, displeasing, distasteful, obnoxious, odious, offensive, unpleasant, not very nice, leave a bad taste in the mouth, morbid
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe someone that people dislike?
\qun
\ex disliked, bastard, disagreeable, horrible, mean, nasty, nasty piece of work, not very nice, objectionable, obnoxious, odious, off-putting, unpleasant
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe a taste or smell that people dislike?
\qun
\ex unpleasant, not very nice, nasty, unappetizing, unpalatable
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe a sound that people dislike?
\qun
\ex harsh, grating, rasping
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to stopping liking something?
\qun
\ex go off
\exn
\qu (11) What do people do to show they dislike something?
\qun
\ex sneer, boo
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.2.3
\oldqu (1) What words describe a person who doesn't like something?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang mungkin dialami terhadap seseorang atau sesuatu yang tidak disukai?
\oldex dislike, disapprove, disgust, distaste, aversion, abominate, detest, nausea, shudder at
\oldexn Tidak suka, tidak berkenan, meluat, tidak gemar, tidak disenangi, jijik, benci, mual, dikuasai rasa permusuhan sehingga mengigil atau gementar
\oldqu (2) What words describe a person who really doesn't like something?
\oldqun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman seseorang yang berasa tidak suka terhadap sesuatu atau orang lain?
\oldex abhor, hate, loathe, (feel horror), feel awful, feel revolted, revulsion, shudder to think, turn away in disgust, feel disgusted, feel grossed out
\oldexn Rasa benci, rasa dendam, rasa jijik, rasa ngeri, rasa amat tidak disenangi (rasa dahsyat), meluat sehingga adanya rasa ingin memberontak, rasa tindakbalas (reaksi) yang mendadak untuk menolak, rasa permusuhan dibangkitkan sehingga mengigil atau gementar semasa sesuatu atau seseorang itu terlintas dalam fikiran, berpaling ke arah lain (enggan menerima sesuatu atau seseorang) kerana rasa meluat, rasa amat tidak gemar (meluat), rasa tidak hormat sehingga timbul sikap menghina dan kelakuan kasar
\oldqu (3) What words describe something which is disliked?
\oldqun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal sifat sesuatu atau seseorang yang tidak disukai?
\oldex repugnant, offensive, disgusting, distasteful, abhorrent, hateful, horrible, horrifying, abomination, loathsome, detestable, repulsive, sickening, revolting
\oldexn Menjijikkan, menyinggungkan (menyakitkan hati), memualkan, tidak menyenangkan, sesuatu atau seseorang yang dibenci, sesuatu atau seseorang yang mudah membangkitkan rasa dendam, mengerikan, menggerunkan, menghinakan (contohnya kehormatan diri, nama baik keluarga dan maruah bangsa), memuakkan, sesuatu atau seseorang yang sangat dibenci, sesuatu dan seseorang yang ditentang, menyusahkan dan menjemukan (memenatkan sehingga sakit kepala,sakit hati dsn), yang memberontak (pemberontak, penjenayah) atau sumber pemberontakan (pengganas, puak pelampau, penghasut, pengkhianat dan ajaran mereka)

\oldsdn Kecewa

\qu (1) What words refer to feeling disappointed?
\qun

\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of disappointment?
\qun
\ex disappointment, frustration, letdown, bitter pill to swallow, forlorn hope, unfulfilled hopes
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels disappointed?
\qun
\ex disappointed, crushed, disconcerted, discouraged, deflated, disillusioned, disenchanted, dispirited, frustrated
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very disappointed?
\qun
\ex crushed, bitterly disappointed
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to causing someone to feel disappointed?
\qun

\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel disappointed?
\qun
\ex disappointment, anticlimax, bitter pill to swallow, blow, letdown, discouragement, frustration
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that causes someone to feel disappointed?
\qun
\ex disappointing, be a disappointment, be an anticlimax, be a letdown, not live up to expectations, not all it's cracked up to be, discouraging, disheartening, frustrating, not up to par
\exn

\ex agitation, distress, uproar
\exn

\qun
\ex upset, agitated
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very upset?
\qun
\ex deeply hurt, deeply distressed, distraught, be in a state, be in an uproar, emotions in an uproar, torment, tormented
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to becoming upset?
\qun
\ex get upset, get worked up, take something to heart
\exn

\qun

\exn

\exn

\qun
\ex upsetting, distressing, harrowing, painful, traumatic
\exn

\qun
\ex sensitive
\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\qun

\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that causes someone to feel shocked?
\qun
\ex shocking, horrible, horrifying, shattering
\exn

\is 3.4.2.1.8
\sd Jealous
\sdn Cemburu
\oldis 3.4.2.9
\oldsd Jealous
\oldsdn Cemburu
\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling jealous--to feel bad when someone does well, has something good, receives something good, or something good happens to them, because you want what they have. Also use this domain for words for when a husband (or wife) is jealous because he thinks his wife loves someone else.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman rasa cemburu yang dialami oleh seseorang semasa didapati orang lain sudah berjaya, memiliki atau menerima sesuatu yang baik kerana dia ada rasa ingin memiliki berkat serupa.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling envious?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman rasa cemburu seseorang?
\ex be jealous, feel jealous, jealously, envy (v), begrudge, turn green, covet
\exn Rasa cemburu (kecemburuan), rasa iri hati (hasad), rasa dengki, menjadi seseorang yang berhasad dengki, mengidamkan hakmilik orang lain
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of jealousy?
\qun
\ex jealousy, envy (n), covetousness, resentment, sour grapes
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels jealous?
\qun
\ex jealous, possessive, envious, green with envy, covetous, jaundiced, resentful, bitter
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very jealous?
\qun
\ex bitterly jealous
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to causing someone to feel jealous?
\qun
\ex make someone jealous, arouse jealousy
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to not feeling jealous?
\qun
\ex not begrudge
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.2.2.5

\is 3.4.2.2
\sd Sorry
\sdn
\oldis 4.8.3.6.1
\oldsd Sorrow for wrong
\oldsdn Bersusah hati kerana kesalahan yang dilakukan
\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling sorry--to feel bad about something bad that you did.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling sorry?
\qun
\ex feel sorry, be sorry, regret, feel remorse, feel convicted, conscience stricken, feel guilty, lament, rue, rue the day, ruefully, wish you hadn't done something, kick yourself, repent, be ashamed, feel ashamed, have a bad conscience, have a guilty conscience, be on your conscience, feel bad about
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of sorrow?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berasa susah hati?
\ex sorrow, regret, remorse, guilt, conviction, contrition, penitence, repentance, shame, conscience
\exn Bersusah hati, menyesal, berasa berat hati atau berasa kesal
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels sorry?
\qun
\ex sorry, penitent, regretful, remorseful, rueful, convicted, guilty, contrite, repentant
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very ashamed?
\qun
\ex guilt-ridden
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to feeling sorry for a long time?
\qun
\ex gnaw at you
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to causing someone to feeling sorry?
\qun
\ex convict
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel sorry?
\qun
\ex conscience, conviction
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that causes someone to feel sorry?
\qun
\ex convicting
\exn
\qu (9) What do people say when they feel sorry?
\qun
\ex why did I, why didn't I, I could have kicked myself
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to not feeling sorry?
\qun
\ex impenitent, not regret, not be sorry, have no regrets, would do the same thing again, remorseless, unrepentant, not feel guilty, a clear conscience, have no qualms about, have no compunction, feel no compunction
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to trying to stop yourself from feeling sorry?
\qun
\ex salve your conscience, clear your conscience
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.8.3.6.1
\oldqu (1) What words refer to feeling sorry for doing wrong?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal bersusah hati kerana kesalahan yang dilakukan?
\oldex feel sorry, be sorry, regret, feel remorse, feel convicted, conscience stricken, feel guilty
\oldexn Berasa sedih, bersusah hati, menyesal, berasa kesal - berasa berat hati, menginsafi, ada suara hati yang menimbulkan kesedaran, rasa bersalah
\oldqu (3) What causes a person to feel guilty?
\oldqun (3) Apakah yang menyebabkan seseorang rasa bersalah?
\oldex conscience, conviction
\oldexn Suara hati, keinsafan
\gd IDA39C0D9-A5C1-4F10-BD3B-4E988ABCAB5A

\exn

\is 3.4.2.3
\sd Angry
\sdn Marah
\oldis 3.4.2.5
\oldsd Angry
\oldsdn Marah
\oldis 4.4.2.2.7
\oldsd Resent, bear a grudge
\oldsdn Sakit hati, rasa dendam
\oldis 4.4.2.4.5
\oldsd Provoke
\oldsdn Menghasut
\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling angry--to feel bad when someone does something wrong and to want to do something bad to them.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan yang dialami oleh seseorang apabila orang lain melakukan kesalahan.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling angry?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berasa panas hati?
\ex be angry, feel angry, bristle, miffed, take offense, resent, be in a temper, pissed off, pissed, be worked up, be up in arms, in a huff, be disgusted, take something personally, take exception to, be put out, feel put out
\exn Rasa marah (panas hati), tunjuk rasa (di air muka, dengan suara atau tindakan tertentu)
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of anger?
\qun
\ex anger, annoyance, bitterness, dander, fury, grudge, indignation, ire, outrage, rage, rancor, resentment, temper, wrath
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels angry?
\qun
\ex angry, aggravated, bitter, embittered, cross, exasperated, incensed, indignant, irate, irked, irritated, mad, nettled, offended, peeved, perturbed, piqued, rancorous, resentful, riled, sore, upset, vexed, wroth
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very angry?
\qun
\ex enraged, furious, furiously, incensed, infuriated, irate, livid, full of resentment, seething, be on the warpath, wrathful, have a tantrum, have a temper tantrum, boiling mad
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe a person who gets angry often or easily?
\qun
\ex have a temper, irascible, bilious, cantankerous, choleric, cranky, grouch, hot tempered, hot headed, ill-tempered, irascible, irritable, easily offended, quick-tempered, prim, prude, sensitive, thin-skinned, touchy
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to feeling angry for a long time?
\qun
\ex boil, burn, chafe, fume, fuss, mope, seethe, simmer, smolder, stew, sulk, sullen, bear a grudge, hold a grudge against, have something against, have it in for, hold something against someone, there is no love lost between
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to becoming angry?
\qun
\ex get angry, get mad, lose your temper, fly off the handle, blow your top, hit the roof, go crazy, go nuts, have a fit, go berserk, erupt, get your dander up
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to causing someone to feel angry?
\qun
\ex anger (v), make someone angry, make someone mad, aggravate, antagonize, chafe, cross someone, disturb, embitter, enrage, exasperate, gall, incense, infuriate, insult (v), irk, madden, needle, nettle, offend, cause offense, peeve, perturb, pique, provoke, rankle, rile, vex, make your blood boil, make you sick, get someone going, get someone's back up, wind someone up, be like a red flag to a bull
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel angry?
\qun
\ex affront, aggravation, bitter pill to swallow, insult (n), offense, outrage, provocation, vexation
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe something that causes someone to feel angry?
\qun
\ex aggravating, exasperating, galling, infuriating, insulting, irksome, maddening, objectionable, offending, offensive, vexing
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to acting in an angry manner?
\qun
\ex make a scene, huff, have a tantrum, throw a tantrum, outburst, shake your fist, stamp your foot, let off steam, rant, rave, scowl, pout
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe something said or done in an angry manner?
\qun
\ex angry, furious, stormy, heated, furor, uproar, feelings run high
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to trying to stop someone from feeling angry?
\qun
\ex conciliate, mollify, pacify, placate, soothe
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to becoming less angry?
\qun
\ex cool off, cool down, settle down, count to ten
\exn
\qu (15) What words describe something that is unlikely to cause someone to feel angry?
\qun
\ex inoffensive, harmless, innocuous
\exn

\oldex (to) anger (someone), aggravate, offend, irritate, enrage, enfuriate
\oldexn Membangkitkan kemarahan, menjengkelkan, menyinggung perasaan, mengacau orang atau kerjanya (termasuk menindas kebatinannya dan mengganggu jiwanya), menjadi batu api supaya orang rasa panas hati (menghasut mengkhanati), memarahi sehingga meradangkan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.2.4.5

\oldex provocation, aggravation, irritation, vexation, affront
\oldexn Penghasutan, tindakan menambah-burukkan, kejengkelan, gangguan - sakat (terhadap rasa senang hati, kesabaran dsn), penghinaan
\oldqu (4) What words describe a person who provokes another?
\oldqun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang menjelaskan perihal seseorang yang menghilangkan perasaan baik (percaya, sabar, tenang dsn) orang lain?
\oldex annoying, irritating, exasperating, nettlesome, vexing, aggravating, bothersome
\oldexn Selalu melakukan kesalahan - selalu membangkitkan amarah, suka menjengkel, sengaja memanaskan hati, sengaja menyakitkan hati, suka mengganggu - menyakat, bertabiat menambah-burukkan, sengaja menyusahkan

\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\is 3.4.2.4
\sd Afraid
\sdn
\oldis 3.4.2.7
\oldsd Fear
\oldsdn Ketakutan
\dd Use this domain for words related to fear--to feel bad because you think something bad might happen to you.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman rasa takut.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling afraid?
\qun
\ex feel afraid, be afraid, fear (v), for fear of, have a horror of
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of fear?
\qun
\ex fear (n), fright, alarm, foreboding, horror, panic (n), terror, trepidation
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels afraid?
\qun
\ex afraid, fearful, frightened, alarmed, panicky, quaking, scared, skittish, weak-kneed
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very afraid?
\qun
\ex terrified, terror, panic, panic-stricken, petrified, scared stiff, scared out of your wits, scared to death
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to feeling suddenly afraid because of something that happens?
\qun
\ex get a fright, panic (v), go white as a sheet, nearly jump out of your skin
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to feeling afraid for a long time?
\qun
\ex phobia, have a phobia about, live in fear, dread (n), dread (v)
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to causing someone to feel afraid?
\qun
\ex frighten, give someone a fright, frighten the life out of someone, alarm (v), cow (v), give someone the creeps, daunt, intimidate, petrify, rattle (v), scare, spook, startle, terrify, terrorize, unnerve, make your hair stand on end, make your blood run cold
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel afraid?
\qun
\ex scare (n), terror, horror, alarmist
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe something that causes someone to feel afraid?
\qun
\ex frightening, frightful, alarming, blood-curdling, chilling, creepy, dreadful, eerie, fearsome, forbidding, hair-raising, scary, spine-chilling, spooky, terrifying
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe someone who is easily frightened?
\qun
\ex scare easily, timid, be of a nervous disposition
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe someone who is not afraid?
\qun
\ex brave, bravely, bravery, courage, courageous, courageously, fearless, fearlessly, unafraid
\exn
\qu (12) What are the signs that someone is afraid?
\qun
\ex tremble, quail, quake, shake, shiver, shudder, heart pounds, teeth chatter, be paralyzed with fear, freeze, cower, crouch, cringe, jump, flinch, wince, shrink, slink, stampede, turn tail, turn white, blanch, cry out, goose-flesh, goose-pimples, goose-bumps
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.2.7

\oldex afraid, fear, frightened, fright, scared, quaking
\oldexn Takut, ketakutan, gentar [sehingga menjadi pengecut (penakut) - terkecut hati kerana (ketakuan) ancaman yang menakutkan], terkejut sehingga menjadi kaku kerana ketakutan, menggeletar kerana ketakutan

\oldqun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman seseorang yang berasa sangat takut?

\oldex frighten, scare, terrify
\oldexn Menakutkan, mengejutkan, mengerunkan
