\is 3.4.2.4.1
\sd Worried
\sdn
\oldis 3.4.2.7.1
\oldsd Worry
\oldsdn Khuatir
\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling worried--to feel bad because you think something bad might happen.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling worried?
\qun
\ex worry (v), feel worried, be worried, feel anxious, be anxious, be afraid, feel afraid, feel scared, feel unsure, agonize over, wonder what is going to happen, uneasy, fret, brood, lose sleep, not like the look of, not like the sound of
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of worry?
\qun
\ex worry, anxiety, concern, stress, strain, anguish, uncertainty, lack of confidence, apprehension, dismay
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels worried?
\qun
\ex worried, anxious, anxiously, apprehensive, bothered, concerned, dismayed, disturbed, strained, troubled, uneasy, unsettled
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to being a little worried?
\qun
\ex feel a little worried, slightly worried, a bit anxious, not so sure
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to being very worried?
\qun
\ex anxiety attack, really worried, really scared, really wondering, despair, despairing, desperate, desperation, be worried sick, be at your wits' end, frantic, frantically
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to being worried all the time?
\qun
\ex have a lot on your mind, be under a strain, preoccupied, stressed out
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to being worried when there is nothing to worry about?
\qun
\ex paranoid, paranoia
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to causing someone to feel worried?
\qun
\ex worry someone, alarm (v), bother, concern (v), cause someone concern, disturb, trouble (v), bother, prey on your mind, cause concern, be a cause for concern, weigh on your mind, disquiet
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel worried?
\qun
\ex worry (n), alarm (n), burden, concern (n), trouble (n), care, stresses and strains, hang-up, complex, weight
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe something that causes someone to feel worried?
\qun
\ex worrying, worrisome, alarming, anxious, bothersome, disturbing, nerve-racking, stressful, tense, niggling, alarmist
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to someone who worries a lot?
\qun
\ex be a worrier, worrywart, neurotic, hypochondriac
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to not being worried?
\qun
\ex not worried, unworried, not concerned, unconcerned, unperturbed, not lose sleep over, don't care, without a care in the world, carefree, philosophical
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to not being worried about something that you were worried about before?
\qun
\ex relief, relieved, be a weight off your mind, relax
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to helping someone stop worrying?
\qun
\ex reassure, reassuring, reassurance, put your mind at rest, put someone at their ease, put someone out of their misery
\exn
\qu (15) What do people say when they don't want someone to worry?
\qun
\ex Don't worry. There's nothing to worry about. Rest assured. Never mind.
\exn
\qu (16) What do people say when they don't need to worry anymore?
\qun
\ex Thank God! Thank goodness! What a relief!
\exn
\qu (17) What do people do when they are worried?
\qun
\ex wring your hands, bite your lip
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.2.7.1
\oldqu (1) What words are used for the emotion of worry?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang berkaitan dengan perihal pengalaman rasa khuatir seseorang?
\oldex be worried, feel anxious, be anxious, be afraid, feel afraid, feel scared, feel unsure, agonize over, wonder what is going to happen, I'm not feeling very confident, feel nervous, concern
\oldexn Khuatir, rasa bimbang (bimbang), rasa takut (takut, terkejut), rasa tidak pasti, berdukacita (dalam pergelutan jasmani & batin), tertanya dalam hati dan cuba memikirkan apakah yang akan berlaku, berasa kurang yakin, rasa gelisah, risau
\oldqu (2) What words refer to the emotion of worry?
\oldqun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perasaan khuatir seseorang?
\oldex worry, anxiety, fear, uncertainty, lack of confidence
\oldexn Kekhuatiran, kebimbangan, ketakutan, ketidakpastian, kurang keyakinan
\oldqu (3) What words describe a slight case of worry?
\oldqun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman rasa khuatir sedikit sahaja?
\oldex feel a little worried, slightly worried, a bit anxious, not so sure
\oldexn Rasa khuatir sedikit, tidak berapa khuatir, rasa bimbang sedikit, tidak berapa pasti
\oldqu (4) What words describe a serious case of worry?
\oldqun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman rasa amat khuatir yang dialami seseorang?
\oldex anxiety attack, really worried, really scared, really wondering
\oldexn Serangan kebimbangan (diserang keraguan sehingga banyak kebimbangan untuk di atasi), rasa amat khuatir, ngeri betul, selalu sahaja tertanya-tanya pada diri sendiri
\oldqu (5) What do people typically worry about?
\oldqun (5) Apakah yang biasanya dikhuatirkan oleh seseorang?
\oldex the future, what will happen, the outcome of a decision
\oldexn Masa depan, kejadian yang akan menjadi nyata, keberkesanan sesuatu keputusan
\oldqu (6) What causes worry?
\oldqun (6) Apakah sebab berlakunya rasa khuatir?
\oldex uncertainty, threat, strange or bizarre behavior, doubt about someone's character, fate
\oldexn Ketidakpastian, ancaman, kelakuan yang luarbiasa atau yang keterlaluan, keraguan terhadap keperibadian seseorang, takdir
\oldqu (7) What is the opposite of worry?
\oldqun (7) Apakah yang berlawanan dengan rasa khuatir?
\oldex resigned to one's fate, serene, calm, confident
\oldexn Sabar menghadapi takdir masing-masing, hidup aman sentosa, perasaan jiwa dan batin yang tenang, ada keyakinan
\gd IBA1E8D2B-7D3E-4B65-A9BE-EE1A4063C796

\is 3.4.2.4.2
\sd Nervous
\sdn Gelisah
\oldis 3.4.2.7.2
\oldsd Nervous
\oldsdn Gelisah

\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling nervous--to be worried and frightened that something bad may happen, so that you are unable to relax.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling nervous?
\qun
\ex be nervous, be on edge, have butterflies (in your stomach), be on pins and needles
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of being nervous?
\qun
\ex nerves, nervousness, tension, unease, stage fright
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels nervous?
\qun
\ex nervous, apprehensive, edgy, fidgety, flustered, ill at ease, jittery, restless, tense, uneasy, uneasily, uptight
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling very nervous?
\qun
\ex agitated, be a bundle of nerves, excited, have the jitters, be jittery, jumpy, nervous wreck, panicky, be in a state
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe someone who is often nervous?
\qun
\ex nervous, high-strung, of a nervous disposition
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to causing someone to feel nervous?
\qun
\ex make someone nervous, fluster, unsettle, unnerve, psych out, put someone on edge
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel nervous?
\qun
\ex strain
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that causes someone to feel nervous?
\qun
\ex tense, strained, uneasy, nail biting, charged, nerve-racking
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to causing someone to not feel nervous?
\qun
\ex reassure, reassuring, reassurance, reassuringly
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.2.7.2

\oldex nervous, tense, uneasy
\oldexn Gelisah, tegang, resah

\is 3.4.2.4.3
\sd Shy, timid
\sdn Segan, Takut
\oldis 3.4.2.4
\oldsd Shy, timid
\oldsdn Segan, Takut

\dd Use this domain for words related to feeling shy--to feel bad (afraid) when you are with people because you think they might think something bad about you if you say or do something (for instance, being afraid to talk, feeling inadequate to do what is required in a social situation, or not feeling as good as other people).
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman rasa segan, takut atau tidak selesa yang dialami oleh seseorang waktu berada di antara orang ramai atau waktu bersama-sama orang lain (kerana rasa kurang mampu untuk menyesuaikan diri dengan suatu golongan atau kerana dikuasai rasa rendah diri)
\qu (1) What words refer to feeling shy?
\qun
\ex be shy, feel shy
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the feeling of shyness?
\qun
\ex shyness, inhibition
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who feels shy?
\qun
\ex shy, timid, uncomfortable, bashful, coy, diffident, reserved, withdrawn, introverted, inhibited
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to causing someone to feel shy?
\qun
\ex inhibit, intimidate, make you feel uncomfortable
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something that causes someone to feel shy?
\qun
\ex intimidation
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that causes someone to feel shy?
\qun
\ex inhibiting, intimidating, uncomfortable
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to not being shy?
\qun
\ex come out of your shell, come out of yourself, open up
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to helping someone to not be shy?
\qun
\ex bring someone out of their shell, bring someone out, put someone at ease
\exn

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal seseorang yang pandai berbicara?
\ex speak well, be eloquent, be a good speaker, be an excellent speaker, be fluent, speak clearly, articulate

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.1.1.7
\gd IE96F6860-0914-4324-9C49-48F24A0FF7F1

\is 3.5.1.1.8
\sd Speak poorly
\sdn Tidak Pandai Berbicara
\oldis 3.5.1.1.8
\oldsd Speak poorly
\oldsdn Tidak Pandai Berbicara
\dd Use this domain for words related to speaking poorly.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan kepada soalan-soalan berikut
\qu (1) What words refer to not being able to speak correctly?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal seseorang yang tidak pandai berbicara?
\ex slow of speech, not fluent, poor speaker, stutter, stammer, have a speech impediment
\exn Tidak fasih lidah, tidak lancar, penceramah yang lemah (yang tidak pandai berbicara), gagap, gugup, kecacatan daya pembicaraan (selalu gugup/ gagap)
\qu (2) What words refer to speaking so that people can't understand you?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal suatu pembicaraan yang tidak mudah difahami?
\ex speak incoherently, speak irrational, say nonsense, speak gibberish, No one could understand him. I can't understand you. I can't understand a word you are saying.
\exn Berbicara tanpa kesinambungan, bercakap tanpa budi bicara, mengatakan yang bukan-bukan, pandai/ selalu merepek sahaja, ‘Tiada seorang pun yang boleh faham (kata-kata) dia', ‘Saya tidak faham kamu', ‘ Saya tidak boleh faham sepatah perkataanpun yang kamu katakan'.
\qu (3) What words refer to making a mistake when speaking?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tersalah sebut atau kata semasa menyatakan sesuatu?
\ex stumble, misspeak, gaff, speak ungrammatically
\exn Membuat kesilapan waktu bercakap, tersalah sebut atau kata, terbongkar rahsia atau terlanjur kata kerana kurang berhati-hati, kesilapan tatabahasa
\qu (4) What words are used for speaking inappropriately?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal bicara yang tidak sopan?
\ex speak inappropriately, be rude, crude, socially unacceptable, filthy speech, out of place, not fit for mixed company, shocking speech
\exn Bicara yang kurang atau tidak sopan, berbahasa kasar, berbahasa kesat, kata-kata biadab (orang-orang yang berbahasa sedemikian dianggap bersifat kurang ajar oleh masyarakat), membuahkan kata-kata lucah, kata-bicara yang tidak sesuai (contohnya: ucapan rasmi berbanding dengan perbualan biasa), kata-bicara yang menimbulkan rasa malu di kalangan pendengar yang terdiri daripada golongan lelaki dan perempuan, kata-kata sumpahan, ancaman atau sindiran yang terlampau sehingga mengejutkan
\qu (5) What words refer to not knowing what to say?
\qun (5) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tidak mengetahui apa yang harus diperkatakan?
\ex not know what to say, be speechless, tongue-tied, cat's got your tongue
\exn Tidak mengetahui apa yang harus diperkatakan, terkelu, terdiam tidak dapat mengatakan apa-apa, bersenyap kerana perasaan cemas (terutamanya di kalangan kanak-kanak)
\qu (6) What words refer to speaking too long?
\qun (6) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berbicara untuk masa yang terlampau lama?
\ex speak for too long, go over the time allotted, be long winded, speak forever
\exn Berbicara terlampau lama, melampai masa yang diperuntukan, berbicara dengan panjang lebar, tidak pandai berhenti berbicara
\qu (7) What words refer to when a person wants to speak but hesitates?
\qun (7) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal seseorang yang berasa teragak-agak untuk menyatakan sesuatu?
\ex hesitate, pause, false start
\exn Teragak-agak, terdiam (berhenti bicara) sejenak, sedar kemungkinan terlanjur kata maka berhati-hati berfikir dahulu sebelum mula berbicara semula atau meneruskan bicara.
\qu (8) What words describe something that has been said so often that people think it is stupid?
\qun
\ex trite, over-used, stale, banal, be wearing thin, threadbare, clichéd, corny, hackneyed, shopworn, stereotyped, commonplace
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.1.1.8
\gd I8F779877-7D86-4683-8A8B-298C7FC62815

\is 3.5.1.2
\sd Talk about a subject
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to talking about a subject.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to talking about a subject?
\qun
\ex talk about, dwell on, discuss, address, treat, cover
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the thing being talked about?
\qun
\ex subject, topic, theme, issue, question, matter, business, thing
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a part of a subject?
\qun
\ex point, aspect
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to starting to talk about something?
\qun
\ex bring up, raise, broach, introduce, launch into
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to starting to talk about a different subject?
\qun
\ex change topics, switch topics, turn to, get onto
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to talking about the subject you are supposed to be talking about?
\qun
\ex get to the point, stick to the point, to the point
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to starting to talk about something else instead of what you are supposed to be talking about?
\qun
\ex get off the subject, digress, get sidetracked, stray from, ramble, lose the thread, where was I?
\exn
\cf Be about, subject

\sd Explain
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to explaining something--to help someone to understand something.

\qun
\ex explain, throw light on, shed light on, enlighten, elucidate, by way of explanation
\exn

\qun
\ex in other words, let me explain, that is, to put it another way, put it like this, put it this way, let me rephrase that
\exn

\qun
\ex tell, explain, demonstrate, give instructions
\exn

\qun
\ex simplify, demystify
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to explaining something completely?
\qun
\ex set out
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to what you say when you explain something?
\qun

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menyatakan sesuatu pada kali keduanya?
\ex repeat, repeat yourself, say again, iterate, recapitulate, reiterate, reaffirm
\exn Mengulangi, menyatakan sekali lagi

\exn Berulang-ulang menyatakan sesuatu

\exn

\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to what is said a second time?
\qun
\ex repetition, recapitulation
\exn
\qu (6) What do you say when you want someone to repeat something?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe Sorry? Pardon? Excuse me? What? What did you say? Would you mind repeating that? Could you say that again? Repeat after me.

\is 3.5.1.2.9
\sd Be about, subject
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words that express the idea that something (said, written, thought, or made) depicts or is about a subject, or that something is logically related to some topic. Also use this domain for words that mark the topic or subject of what is being thought about, talked about, or written about. Verbs of thinking, knowing, or speaking (including other types of expression) can take a 'topic' role. We can think of a 'topic' as the main idea. Use this domain also for the important thing in a picture.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to being about something or someone?
\qun
\ex be about something, concern, deal with, be concerned with, center on, focus on, address, cover, depict, discuss, dwell on, present, portray, treat
\exn
\xe The story <presents> a view of the President.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate what something is about?
\qun
\ex about, on, concerning, on the subject of, regarding, re, with regard to, in, of
\exn
\xe a course <in> history
\xen
\qu (3) What words refer to the thing something is about?
\qun
\ex subject, topic, theme, issue, question, matter, business, thing
\exn
\xe The <topic> of the discussion is efficiency.
\xen
\cf Talk about a subject


\gd I06B23BCD-69DF-471A-B5A5-4CA8CAB7F0D9

\is 3.5.1.3
\sd True
\sdn Benar
\oldis 3.2.8
\oldsd True
\oldsdn Benar

\dd Use this domain for words that indicate if something is true, if it agrees with reality, or if it is not true.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal sesuatu yang besar kemungkinan adalah benar ataupun yang mempunyai unsur kebenaran dan perihal sesuatu yang tiada unsur kebenaran.
\qu (1) What words indicate that a statement agrees with reality?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang menunjukkan bahawa sesuatu pernyataan itu adalah berunsur kebenaran?
\ex true, truth, accurate, in fact, right, correct
\exn Benar, kebenaran, nyata, sebetulnya, sejati, tepat, pada kenyataan, wajar, betul
\qu (2) What words indicate that something is not true?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkaran perkataan yang merujuk kepada sesuatu yang tiada unsur kebenaran?
\ex untrue, false, falsehood, wrong, error, inaccurate, incorrect, mistake
\exn Tidak benar, palsu, bohong, salah, kesalahan, tidak ternyata, tiruan, khayalan, tidak tepat, lancung, tipu-helah, tidak betul, kesilapan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.2.8
\gd IAC2E424B-6AEE-4031-8864-7B3F4A6FB5A3

\is 3.5.1.3.1
\sd Tell the truth
\sdn
\oldis 4.4.1.5
\oldsd Speak truth
\oldsdn Bercakap benar
\dd Use this domain for words related to telling the truth.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to telling the truth?
\qun
\ex tell the truth, speak the truth, be honest, be open, be up front, play fair, level with, lay/put your cards on the table, testify, witness, reveal
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe a person who tells the truth?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menjelaskan perihal seseorang yang bercakap benar?
\ex honest, truthful, sincere, straight, open, scrupulous, upright
\exn Jujur, benar, tulus hati
\qu (3) What words refer to telling the truth without hiding anything?
\qun
\ex honest, to be honest, in all honesty, frank, candid, direct, straightforward, tell someone straight
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to telling the truth without caring how other people feel?
\qun
\ex forthright, blunt, outspoken, bald, speak your mind, not beat about the bush, make no bones about, not mince your words, call a spade a spade, pull no punches
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the quality of telling the truth?
\qun
\ex honesty, integrity, truthfulness, scruples
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.1.5
\oldqu (1) What words refer to speaking the truth?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan berkaitan yang merujuk kepada perihal bercakap benar?
\oldex speak truth, tell the truth, be honest, upright, be forthright, scrupulous, scruples, truth, honesty, trust, be open, truthful, accurate, testify, witness, reveal, integrity
\oldexn Bercakap benar, memberi pernyataan benar, jujur, tulus hati, berterus-terang, bertanggunjawab dan teliti - berhati-hati membuat pernyataan waktu rasa keberatan, kebenaran, kejujuran, kepercayaan, keterbukaan, benar, tepat, memberi kesaksian, bersaksi, memberitahu (bukan membongkar rahsia orang lain tetapi memberitahu rahsia sendiri supaya ada pengertian terhadap tindakan-tndakan dan diri sendiri), keikhlasan
\gd I3BC961D1-9F4F-4F1B-ADA7-B1E9A2928EA4

\is 3.5.1.3.6
\sd Exaggerate
\sdn Tokok Tambah
\oldis 3.5.2.3
\oldsd Exaggerate
\oldsdn Tokok Tambah

\dd Use this domain for words referring to exaggerating--reporting information but saying something untrue that makes the information seem bigger or more important than it really is.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tindakan tokok tambah yang berlaku semasa melaporkan sesuatu maklumat sehingga menjejaskan kebenaran maklumat itu kerana kini gambarannya adalah lebih besar atau lebih penting daripada isi kandungan asalnya.
\qu (1) What words refer to exaggerating?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berlakunya suatu tindakan tokok tambah?
\ex exaggerate, stretch the truth, inflate your story, distort, overemphasize, overstate, overemphasize, overrate, overdo, make too much of, blow something out of proportion, lay it on thick, dramatize, be melodramatic, be overly dramatic
\exn Tokok tambah, menipis kan kebenaran, menyebarkan keterangan palsu, spekulasi, khabar angin atau prasangka sehingga mencemarkan suatu kebenaran, memutarbelitkan sehingga berubah isi kandungan atau erti suatu maklumat kebenaran, terlalu mementingkan sebahagian maklumat sehingga terjejas maksud keseluruhannya, terlanjur atau terlebih kata
\qu (2) What words refer to what is said when you exaggerate?
\qun
\ex exaggeration, overstatement
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe an exaggerated statement?
\qun
\ex exaggerated, extravagant, melodramatic
\exn

\is 3.5.1.4
\sd Speak with others
\sdn Berbual Dengan Orang Lain
\oldis 3.5.1.4
\oldsd Speak with others
\oldsdn Berbual Dengan Orang Lain
\dd Use this domain for words referring to carrying on a conversation with other people.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berbual dengan orang lain.

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berbual dengan orang lain?
\ex speak with, converse, carry on a conversation, talk with, talk to, chat, discuss
\exn Berbicara dengan, berbual dengan orang lain, bercakap dengan, menyatakan atau berkata sesuatu kepada, bertukar-tukar pendapat (baik) atau berceloteh (kurang berfaedah), berbincang
\qu (2) What words refer to an event or time period when people talk to each other?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal pengalaman yang dialami semasa orang berbual antara satu sama lain?
\ex conversation, discussion
\exn Perbualan, perbincangan
\qu (3) What words refer to what is talked about?
\qun (3) A;pakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal perkara yang diperkatakan?
\ex topic (of conversation)
\exn Topik (hal, perkara, tajuk) perbualan atau perbincangan
\qu (4) What words modify the length of time?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal jangkamasa suatu perbualan?
\ex long (conversation/talk), brief (conversation)
\exn Perbualan (perbincangan) terperinci atau yang lama, perbualan (perbincangan) singkat

\is 3.5.1.4.2
\sd Contact
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to contacting someone--to communicate with someone who is far away from you using some communication device such as a telephone.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to contacting someone?
\qun
\ex get in touch with, contact, make contact with, approach, get onto
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to regularly contacting someone?
\qun
\ex be in contact, keep in touch, stay in touch, keep in contact, communicate
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to succeeding in contacting someone?
\qun
\ex get hold of, get through, reach
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the process by which people contact each other?
\qun
\ex communication, contact
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to no longer communicating with someone?
\qun
\ex lose touch, lose contact
\exn
\gd IE033CA92-EE8C-4ab9-9368-5F6F4E942987

\is 3.5.1.4.3
\sd Greet
\sdn Menyambut
\oldis 3.5.1.4.2
\oldsd Greet
\oldsdn Menyambut
\dd Use this domain for words related to greeting someone.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan kepada soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to greeting someone?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menyambut seseorang?, Menyambut dengan kata-kata aluan, memberi sambutan dengan kata salam ‘hello'
\ex greet, say hello
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe a greeting?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal sambutan yang diberikan?
\ex greet warmly, warm greeting, cool reception, enthusiastic greeting
\exn Mengalu-alukan kedatangan, memberikan sambutan yang mesra, memberikan sambutan yang dingin, menyambut dengan meriah
\qu (3) What gestures typically accompany a greeting?
\qun (3) Apakah gerak-geri yang biasanya mengiringi suatu sambutan yang diberikan?
\ex shake hands, bow, salute, give a hug, give a kiss, wave hello
\exn Berjabat-tangan, menundukkan badan atau kepala, bertabik, memberi pelukan, mencium (muka, tangan), melambaikan tangan
\qu (4) What words refer to a refusal to greet someone?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal keengganan untuk menyambut kedatangan seseorang?
\ex refuse to greet, snub, ignore
\exn Enggan menyambut, memberi sambutan dingin kepada golongan yang lebih muda, tidak mengendahkan
\qu (5) What words and expressions are used when greeting someone?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan atau ungkapan-ungkapan yang digunakan semasa menyambut atau memberi salam kepada seseorang?
\ex
\exn ‘Hello', ‘Apa khabar?', ‘Sihat-sihat sahaja?', ‘Selamat pagi', ‘Selamat petang', ‘Selamat malam', ‘Saya gembira jumpa kamu', ‘Aku senang hati mengenali kamu'
\xe Hello. Howdy. How are you? How ya doin'? Good morning. Good afternoon. Good evening. Good to see you. Pleased to meet you.
\xen

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.1.4.2
\gd I52B04E15-7062-4FB2-9EAA-4FE8726F302A

\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi salam antara satu dengan yang lain sebelum berpisah?
\ex say farewell, say goodbye
\exn Mengucapkan selamat tinggal kepada yang ditinggalkan, mengucapkan selamat jalan.kepada yang meneruskan perjalanan
\qu (2) What words and expressions are used when saying farewell?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan dan ungkapan-ungkapan yang digunakan semasa memberi salam antara satu dengan yang lain sebelum berpisah?
\ex Goodbye. See you later. Have a good day.
\exn ‘Selamat tinggal atau selamat jalan', ‘Jumpa lagi', ‘Semoga kamu berbahagia hari ini'

\is 3.5.1.4.5
\sd Speak in unison
\sdn Serentak Bersuara
\oldis 3.5.1.4.4
\oldsd Speak in unison
\oldsdn Serentak Bersuara
\dd Use this domain for words related to speaking in unison--to say something at the same time as someone else.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan kepada soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to someone talking at the same time as someone else?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang digunakan untuk menjelaskan perihal seseorang bercakap semasa orang lain masih lagi bercakap?
\ex interrupt, talk at the same time
\exn Menyampuk, serentak berbicara
\qu (2) What words refer to many people speaking in unison?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal orang ramai yang serentak menyuarakan sesuatu?
\ex speak in unison, speak at once, congregational reading
\exn Serentak bersuara, masing-masing berbicara pada masa yang sama (doa serentak), pembacaan serentak atau serentak membaca sesuatu

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menyatakan sesuatu untuk tujuan memperolehi maklumat tertentu?
\ex ask, question, inquire, interrogate, interview
\exn Meminta, menyoal (berkaitan suatu hal), bertanya, menjalankan soal siasat, bertemu-bual

\qun
\ex question, inquiry, interrogation, interview
\exn

\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.1.5
\cf Request

\gd I77B4D6C1-87BF-4839-B4BE-6A45119B700A

\is 3.5.1.5.1
\sd Answer
\sdn Menjawab
\oldis 3.5.1.5.1
\oldsd Answer
\oldsdn Menjawab
\dd Use this domain for words related to answering a question.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan kepada soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to answering a question?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menjawab suatu pertanyaan?
\ex answer, give an answer, reply, get back to, respond, acknowledge
\exn Menjawab, memberi jawapan, menyahut panggilan pelanggan, menyusuli soalan yang dikemukakan, membalas pertanyaan atau memberi maklum balas, mengesahkan sesuatu
\qu (2) What words refer to what is said in answer?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal maklumat yang disampaikan semasa menjawap?
\ex answer, response, reply, acknowledgment, rebuttal, rejoinder, return, echo, feedback, immediate response, answer by return mail
\exn Jawapan, balasan (tindakan sewajarnya), sahutan, pengesahan, tangkisan, penolakan dakwaan disertakan penjelasan, surat susulan, menyuarakan masalah yang sama, maklum balas, makluman serta-merta, jawapan dalam bentuk surat kiriman
\qu (3) What words refer to a humorous answer?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal suatu jawapan yang lucu?
\ex snappy comeback, retort, repartee
\exn Maklum balas atau maklumat susulan yang sungguh menarik hati kerana penuh kelucuan, membalas dengan gaya yang melucukan, bijak membalas sehingga orang geli hati
\qu (4) What words describe an answer?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal jenis jawapan yang diberikan?
\ex carefully worded, careful, well thought through, off the cuff, off hand, wise, stupid, thoughtless, foolish
\exn Bernas, wajar, munasabah, (menjawap dengan) pintar, spontan (serta-merta tanpa persediaan), arif, tidak arif, (menjawap dengan) terburu-buru - tidak bernas, tidak munasabah
\qu (5) What words refer to the time it takes to answer?
\qun (5) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada masa yang terlibat sebelum jawapan diberikan atau diterima?
\ex take a long time to answer, take your time to answer, quick reply, response time
\exn Mengambil masa yang lama untuk menjawap, menjawap menurut kemampuan atau sewaktu ada masa lapang, memberi jawapan serta-merta atau cepat membalas, menjawap dalam masa yang ditetapkan
\qu (6) What words refer to not having an answer or not knowing what to answer?
\qun (6) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal ketidakmampuan untuk memberi suatu jawapan?
\ex have no answer, lack answer, not know what to answer, don't know how to answer, don't know what to say, don't have an answer, can't answer
\exn Tidak mampu menjawab - tiada jawapan, kurang maklumat untuk memberi jawapan yang lengkap - tiada jawapan lengkap, tidak berpengetahuan untuk menjawab - tidak boleh jawab, tidak tahu bagaimana menjawab, tidak tahu apa yang harus dijawab, belum atau tidak ada jawapan, masih belum atau tidak dapat menjawab

\is 3.5.1.5.2
\sd Disclose
\sdn Memberi Keterangan
\oldis 3.5.1.5.2
\oldsd Disclose
\oldsdn Memberi Keterangan

\dd Use this domain for words that refer to discovering and revealing unknown information.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal penemuan dan pemberitahuan suatu maklumat yang tidak diketahui sebelum itu.
\qu (1) What words refer to discovering information?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tindakan yang terlibat dalam usaha mencari suatu maklumat?
\ex discover, uncover, detect, find out
\exn Menemui (sumber), memberitahu (pihak berkenaan), mengesan (dengan siasatan lanjut), memperolehi (bukti atau maklumat lain)
\qu (2) What words refer to disclosing information?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi keterangan mengenai suatu maklumat?
\ex disclose, unmask, expose, reveal, unveil, bring to light
\exn Memberi keterangan (maklumat), memperlihatkan (tujuan) yang sebenarnya, mendedahkan (prasangka), memberitahu (maksud sebenarnya), menjelaskan (perkara-perkara atau hal yang benar), menerangkan atau mencelikkan mata hati (supaya kenal dan faham isi dan dasar kandungan yang sebenarnya)
\qu (3) What words describe something that is not hidden?
\qun
\ex open, openly, in the open, for all to see
\exn

\sdn Perbahasan
\oldis 3.5.1.6
\oldsd Debate
\oldsdn Perbahasan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to debating--for two or more people to discuss some issue and try to persuade the other person to accept one's view.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal dua atau lebih daripada satu pihak yang berbahas dalam suatu perbincangan berkenaan beberapa perkara dengan tujuan mempengaruhi pihak lain untuk menerima pendapat masing-masing.
\qu (1) What words refer to debating with someone?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berbahas dengan seseorang?
\ex debate, argue, dispute, discuss, contend, negotiate
\exn Berbahas, bertikai (giat bertukar-tukar pendapat dengan memberikan pandangan masing-masing secara terbuka - tidak semestinya bertikam lidah), berbincang
\qu (2) What words refer to saying something in reply to something someone said?
\qun
\ex reply, contradict, say in rebuttal, rebuttal, refute, rejoinder
\exn

\qu (1) What words refer to demonstrating something?

\qun

\exn

\is 3.5.1.6.2
\sd Quarrel
\sdn Pertengkaran, pergaduhan
\oldis 4.4.2.4.4
\oldsd Quarrel
\oldsdn Pertengkaran, pergaduhan
\dd Use this domain for words related to quarreling--to fight with words.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to quarreling?
\qun
\ex quarrel (v), altercate, argue, bicker, clash, contend with, differ, disagree, dispute (v), dissent, feud (v), fight (v), quibble, row (v), scrap, squabble (v), wrangle (v), find fault with
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a quarrel between people?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan berkaitan yang merujuk kepada perihal berlakunya suatu pertengkaran (pergaduhan) di antara dua pihak tertentu?
\ex quarrel (n), altercation, arguing, argument, bickering, contention, controversy, disagreement, dispute (n), feud (n), fight (n), fracas, row (n), ruckus, rumpus, spat, squabble (n), tiff, wrangle (n), wrangling, friendly argument, heated debate
\exn Bertengkar, pertengkaran, bertikam lidah, perdebatan, berselisih-faham, pertikaian, bercanggah, percanggahan, bergaduh, pergaduhan, bercecok, percecokan, bersengketa (bermusuh), persengketaan (permusuhan), berlawan, perlawanan, cari gaduh (dengan mencari kesalahan seseorang atau suatu pihak yang ditentang), perselisihan, meludah, berdebat sambil belajar dengan tujuan bertukar-tukar fikiran
\qu (3) What words refer to something someone says in an quarrel?
\qun
\ex argument, argumentation, angry words, disputation
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something people quarrel about?
\qun
\ex bone of contention
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe someone who quarrels often?
\qun (5) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang menjelaskan perihal seseorang yang sering kali bergaduh?
\ex quarrelsome, contentious, argumentative, combative, pugnacious, faultfinding
\exn Suka bergaduh, suka berbalah, suka berdebat, suka berlawan (berbeza dengan seseorang yang suka berjuang kerana tujuan seseorang pejuang bukan untuk cari lawan), suka berkelahi, suka mencari kesalahan orang (pihak) lain

\is 3.5.1.7.1
\sd Thank
\sdn Berterima kasih
\oldis 4.4.1.2.4
\oldsd Thank
\oldsdn Berterima kasih
\oldis 4.4.2.2.4
\oldsd Ungrateful
\oldsdn Tidak mengenal budi
\dd Use this domain for words related to thanking someone--to tell someone that you feel good about something they did for you.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to thanking someone?
\qun
\ex thank, say thank you, express your thanks, acknowledge (a gift), appreciate, show your appreciation, express your gratitude, show gratitude, recognize, in recognition of
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the act of expressing thanks?
\qun
\ex thanks, thank you, thankfulness, thanksgiving, acknowledgement
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe a person who feels thankful?
\qun
\ex thankful, grateful, gratefully, appreciate, appreciative, be indebted to, owe
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the feeling of wanting to thank someone?
\qun
\ex appreciation, gratitude
\exn
\qu (5) What do people say when they thank someone?
\qun (5) Apakah yang dikatakan semasa berterima kasih dengan seseorang?
\ex
\exn Terima kasih
\xe Thank you. Thanks. That's very kind of you. That's very good of you. I appreciate it. You shouldn't have, You've saved my life. I'd like to thank. Many thanks. Bless you. Blessings on you. Much obliged. I'm indebted to you. I'm in your debt. I'm beholden to you.
\xen
\qu (6) What do people say when someone thanks them?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe Don't mention it. That's all right. That's OK. You're welcome. My pleasure. Not at all. Think nothing of it. It was nothing. No problem.
\xen
\qu (7) What words refer to not thanking someone?
\qun
\ex ingratitude
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe a person who does not thank someone?
\qun
\ex unthankful, unappreciative, ungrateful
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to a person who does not thank someone?
\qun
\ex ingrate, ungrateful wretch
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe someone that no one thanks?
\qun
\ex unappreciated
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something someone does that no one thanks him for?
\qun
\ex thankless (task), unacknowledged, unappreciated
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.1.2.4
\oldqu (1) What words describe a person who is thankful?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang digunakan untuk menjelaskan perihal seseorang yang penuh kesyukuran (rasa syukur)?
\oldex thankful, grateful
\oldexn Sungguh berasa syukur, penuh kesyukuran - penuh rasa berterima kasih (kerana berasa terhutang budi)
\oldqu (2) What words refer to expressing your thanks?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menyatakan rasa berterima kasih?
\oldex thank, show gratitude
\oldexn Berterima kasih, menunjukkan (menyatakan) kesyukuran, rasa berterima kasih atau rasa terhutang budi
\oldqu (3) What words refer to not expressing your thanks?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tiada rasa berterima kasih langsung (bukan tidak berani buka mulut atau menunjukkan rasa berterima kasih)?
\oldex unthankful, ungrateful, ingratitude
\oldexn Tiada rasa atau tindakan berterima kasih, tiada keinginan atau tindakan bersyukur, tiada rasa terhutang budi atau tindakan menyatakannya

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.2.2.4
\oldqu (1) What words refer to the state of being ungrateful?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal bersikap tidak mengenal budi?
\oldex be ungrateful
\oldexn Tidak mengenal budi, tidak mengenang budi, lupa jasa atau budi baik orang lain, tidak berterima kasih, tidak berucap syukur
\oldqu (2) What words refer to the character trait of being ungrateful?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada ciri-ciri atau sifat nyata seseorang yang tidak mengenal budi?
\oldex ingratitude
\oldexn Tidak berterima kasih (tidak bersyukur) kerana lupa atau tidak mengenal (mengenang) budi orang lain
\oldqu (3) What words describe a person who is ungrateful?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menjelaskan perihal seseorang yang tidak mengenal budi?
\oldex ungrateful, unthankful, thankless, ingrate
\oldexn Tidak mengenal budi, tidak berterima kasih, tidak bersyukur, tidak mengenang budi
\oldqu (4) What words refer to a person who is ungrateful?
\oldqun (4) Bagaimana merujuk kepada seseorang yang tidak mengenal budi?
\oldex ingrate
\oldexn Seseorang yang tidak mengenal (mengenang) budi orang lain - oleh itu dia tidak berterima kasih atau bersyukur

\is 3.5.1.7.2
\sd Flatter
\sdn Mengampu
\oldis 4.4.2.4.8
\oldsd Flatter
\oldsdn Mengampu
\dd Use this domain for words referring to flattering someone--saying something nice to someone but not meaning it.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mengampu seseorang: - mengatakan sesuatu yang baik mengenai dri seseorang tanpa kebenaran.
\qu (1) What words refer to flattering someone?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mengatakan sesuatu yang baik mengenai dri seseorang tanpa kebenaran (cuma bermuka-muka sahaja)?
\ex flatter, ingratiate, adulate, blandish, cajole
\exn Angkat bakul, mengampu

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.2.4.8
\gd I53D34F16-2F94-4AFA-9530-7AC75E05B8D4

\is 3.5.1.7.3

\sdn Memborakkan

\oldsdn Memborakkan

\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the act of boasting?
\qun
\ex boasting, bragging, name-dropping
\exn

\qun

\exn

\exn

\qun

\is 3.5.1.8
\sd Criticize
\sdn Mengkritik
\oldis 4.4.2.4
\oldsd Speak evil of
\oldsdn Menghujah
\oldis 4.4.2.4.1
\oldsd Criticize
\oldsdn Mengkritik
\dd Use this domain for words related to criticizing someone or something--to say that something is bad, especially something that someone did.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to criticizing someone or something?
\qun
\ex criticize, be critical, be a critic of, critique, accuse, attack, launch into an attack on, badmouth, belittle, blame, carp, cavil, censure, cite, charge, decry, denounce, deprecate, deride, disparage, gibe, harangue, judge, lay into, mock, rake someone over the coals, recriminate, reprehend, reproach, ridicule, scoff, speak evil of, tear down (someone), voice your disapproval
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to strongly criticizing someone or something?
\qun
\ex slam, pan, tear to shreds, pillory, do a hatchet job on, blast, castigate, condemn, damn, excoriate, execrate
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to criticizing someone in an unfair way?
\qun
\ex find fault with, pick holes in, knock, run down, denigrate, put down, get at
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something someone says when criticizing?
\qun
\ex criticism, critique (n), accusation, attack (n), belittlement, castigation, censure, charge, condemnation, denigration, denouncement, denunciation, deprecation, derision, disapproval, disparagement, excoriation, execration, faultfinding, gibe (n), harangue (n), judgment, malediction, put-down, recrimination, reprehension, ridicule (n), slur
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something someone says when criticizing?
\qun
\ex critical (remark/essay), belittling, deprecatory, disparaging, scathing
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a person who often criticizes other people?
\qun
\ex critic
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe someone who often criticizes other people?
\qun
\ex critical, captious, censorious, hypercritical, judgmental
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to being criticized by someone else?
\qun
\ex receive criticism, come in for criticism, be under attack, come under attack, get a lot of flak, take a lot of flak, be open to criticism
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to someone who is criticized?
\qun
\ex target
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to not criticizing someone?
\qun
\ex don't blame, can't blame
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.2.4
\oldqu (1) What words refer to speaking evil of someone?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menghujah (memberi pandangan buruk terhadap) seseorang?
\oldex speak evil of, complain, complaint
\oldexn Menghujah - memberi pandangan buruk sehingga tercemar nama baiknya), bersungut (mengadu, merungut, memberi lapuran yang buruk atau palsu), sungutan (aduan, rungutan, laporan buruk atau palsu)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.4.2.4.1

\oldex criticize, criticism, blame, critique, find fault with, tear down (someone), censure, disparage, badmouth
\oldexn Mengkritik, kritikan, menyalahkan, kritikan yang dibentangkan dalam bentuk karangan atau rencana, cari gaduh (mencari silap-salah dan cacat-cela bukan untuk tujuan membetulkan tetapi untuk mempersalahkan pihak yang ditentang atau dilawan), meruntuhkan (semangat seseorang), mencela, merendah-rendahkan atau memperkecilkan, mulut jahat - menghujah, mengutuk, mencaci-maki, mulut jahat atau lidah ular - yang begitu tajam dan bisa celaannya sehingga mencederakan (mencelakakan) seseorang (suatu pihak) dan nama baik (masa depan) mereka

\is 3.5.1.8.1
\sd Blame
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to blaming someone for something--to say that someone did something, and because of this something bad happened.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to blaming someone for something?
\qun
\ex blame someone for something, blame something on someone, say something is somebody's fault, put the blame on, lay the blame on, apportion blame, hold someone responsible
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to blaming yourself for something?
\qun
\ex blame yourself, reproach yourself
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to being blamed for something?
\qun
\ex get the blame, get blamed for, take the blame, take the rap, carry the can, take the fall
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to someone who is unfairly blamed for something?
\qun
\ex scapegoat, fall guy
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to blaming someone else for something that is your fault?
\qun
\ex shift the blame, pass the buck
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to saying that someone is not to blame for something?
\qun
\ex exonerate, give someone the benefit of the doubt
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to people blaming each other for something?
\qun
\ex recriminations
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to feeling bad about someone because you think they are to blame for something?
\qun
\ex reproach (n)
\exn

\is 3.5.1.8.4
\sd Gossip
\sdn Mengumpat
\oldis 4.4.2.4.3
\oldsd Gossip
\oldsdn Mengumpat
\dd Use this domain for words related to gossip--to say something bad about a person who is not with you.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to gossiping?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan berkaitan yang merujuk kepada perihal mengumpat (bercerita-cerita mengenai hal orang lain dengan maksud jahat biasanya kerana ditokok-tambah hal-hal yang bukan-bukan dan diubah hal yang benar semasa menceritakan kepada orang lain)?
\ex gossip, talk about someone behind their back, bitch about, slag off, bad-mouth, start a whispering campaign, tattle, stab in the back, tell tales, start a rumor, spread rumors, spread an evil report, slander
\exn Mengumpat, bercerita di luar pengetahuan orang atau pihak yang berkenaan, memulakan kempen (komplot) desas-desus (menyebarkan hal-hal untuk tujuan mencemarkan nama baik seseorang), berceloteh, menfitnah, mengkhianati (membuka rahsia), perintis khabar angin, menyebarkan (pembawa) khabar angin, menyebarkan lapuran jahat (palsu), memburukkan nama seseorang atau suatu pihak
\qu (2) What words refer to what is said in gossip?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal bahan cakapan waktu mengumpat?
\ex gossip, rumor, tale, report, juicy detail, hearsay, scandal, slander, second hand story
\exn Umpatan, desas-desus, cerita (rekaan, di tokok tambah atau diubah berbanding dengan hal benar), lapuran (palsu, ditokok-tambah atau diubah berbanding dengan hal benar), butir-butir khusus (lanjut) yang menarik & mengoda, khabar angin, skandal, fitnah, cerita pihak kedua (bukan hasil daripada apa yang telah disaksikan sendiri)
\qu (3) What words refer to someone who gossips?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang mengumpat?
\ex gossip, busybody, talebearer, tattler, tattletale, chatterer, slanderer
\exn Pengumpat, penyibuk, penipu, pembelot, penghasut, mulut-murai, pemfitnah
\qu (4) What do rumors do?
\qun (4) Bagaimana mennjelaskan perihal apa yang mungkin berlaku kepada suatu desas desus yang dimulakan?
\ex circulate, float, go around, be all over town, get spread
\exn Diedarkan, dikhabarkan, disiarkan ke merata-rata tempat menjadi bahan cakapan, cerita, atau perbincangan di seluruh bandar, disebarkan

\ex promise, agree, commit, guarantee, assure, swear
\exn Berjanji, bersetuju (untuk melaksanakan sesuatu), menerima amanah, memberi jaminan

\qun
\ex keep, fulfill, make good
\exn

\exn

\qun
\ex hold you to your promise
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to allowing someone to not do what he promised?
\qun

\exn

\is 3.5.2.3
\sd Figurative
\sdn Bersifat Kiasan
\oldis 3.5.2.4
\oldsd Figurative
\oldsdn Bersifat Kiasan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to figurative speech--saying something that is not meant to be understood literally (according to the normal meaning of each word), or saying something that compares one thing to another.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bahasa kiasan iaitu penggunaan perkataan-perkataan (contohnya: pokok-pokok bertepuk tangan) yang tidak boleh diterjemahkan secara harfiah (iaitu bukan pokok yang bertepuk tangan) kerana sebagai bahasa kiasan ertinya (pokok-pokok bertepuk tangan) kini disamakan dengan fungsi atau suatu kebolehan yang diibaratkan kepada yang dibandingkan. (pokok-pokok yang diibaratkan seperti manusia berkebolehan bertepuk tangan)
\qu (1) What words refer to figurative speech?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada bahasa kiasan?
\ex figurative, not literal, metaphorical, figure of speech, colorful language
\exn Bersifat kiasan, tiada erti harfiah, bersifat metafora, kiasan, bahasa yang indah
\qu (2) What words refer to particular types of figures of speech?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal jenis-jenis kiasan yang ada?
\ex metaphor, simile, comparison
\exn Metafora, banding sama, banding beza

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.2.4

\qu (1) What words refer to admitting something?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal tindakan yang diambil untuk mengaku sesuatu kesalahan?
\ex admit, confess, acknowledge
\exn Mengaku, memberi pengakuan, mengakui

\ex deny, disavow, disclaim

\is 3.5.3
\sd Language
\sdn Bahasa
\oldis 3.5.3
\oldsd Language
\oldsdn Bahasa
\dd Use this domain for words referring to a language.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to a language?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu bahasa pada umumnya?
\ex language, tongue, speech, lingo
\exn Bahasa, lidah, pertuturan
\qu (2) What words refer to the type of language a person speaks?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada jenis bahasa pertuturan seseorang?
\ex dialect, foreign language, accent, pidgin, slang, colloquial
\exn Loghat tempatan, (daerah, negeri dsn), bahasa asing, bahasa ibunda (bahasa Inggeris Britain, bahasa Inggeris Amerika, bahasa Inggeris Australia), bahasa pasar atau bahasa basahan (kasar)
\qu (3) What words refer to the first language you learned as a child?
\qun
\ex first language, mother-tongue, native speaker
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the language used to talk about a particular subject?
\qun
\ex terminology, jargon, specialized vocabulary, technical terms
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a special or secret language?
\qun (5) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu bahasa khas atau rahsia?
\ex code, sign language, computer language
\exn Kod (braille), bahasa isyarat, bahasa komputer
\qu (6) What words are used to talk about language?
\qun (6) Apakah lingkungan perkataan berkaitan yang digunakan waktu merujuk kepada penggunaan bahasa?
\ex linguistics, linguistic, metalanguage, vocabulary, dictionary, grammar, syntax, morphology, phonology, phonetics, sounds, semantics, meaning, pragmatics, rhetoric, pronunciation
\exn Kiasan, perbendaharaan kata yang umum, perbendaharaan kata yang khusus (menurut bidang), kamus, tatabahasa, pembentukan ayat (sintaksis), pembentukan kata-kata (morfologi), bunyi bahasa (fonologi), bunyi-bunyi pertuturan (fonetik), bunyi (nada suara dsn), erti kata (semantik), erti (lebih luas daripada erti kata), penggunaan bahasa yang sesuai, menggunakan kata-kata yang indah dan berkesan (retorik), sebutan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.3

\is 3.5.3.1
\sd Word
\sdn Perkataan
\oldis 3.5.3.1
\oldsd Word
\oldsdn Perkataan
\dd Use this domain for words that refer to words and groups of words.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to a word?
\qun
\ex word, term, verbal
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to words that are similar in meaning?
\qun
\ex synonym, synonymous, derivative, antonym, opposite of
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to words that are similar in sound?
\qun
\ex homograph, homonym, homophone, homophonous, rhyme
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the way a word should be said?
\qun
\ex pronunciation, pronounce, stress, tone, vocalization
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the way a word should be written?
\qun
\ex spelling, spell, misspell
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a new word?
\qun
\ex coin a term, coinage, neologism
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to an old word?
\qun
\ex archaic, archaism
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to the history of a word?
\qun
\ex etymology, derivation, etymon
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to special words?
\qun
\ex acronym, anagram
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to special words that are used to talk about a particular area of life?
\qun
\ex terminology, jargon, technical term, specialized vocabulary
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to all the words of a language?
\qun
\ex vocabulary, lexicon, dictionary, glossary
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to a short form of a word?
\qun
\ex abbreviation, abbreviate, be short for, for short, stand for, contraction
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to a section of speech?
\qun
\ex phrase, clause, sentence, utterance, discourse, formation, locution
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to a section of writing?
\qun
\ex paragraph, text, section, chapter, point, construction, document, passage, portion
\exn
\qu (15) What words refer to a group of words that express a particular meaning?
\qun
\ex adage, aphorism, byword, cliché, dictum, epigram, expression, idiom, motto, phrase, proverb, saying, slogan, watchword
\exn
\qu (16) What words refer to two words that are often used together?
\qun
\ex collocate, collocate (v)
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.2.7
\gd IF4B77866-C607-43F0-B816-95459C269525

\is 3.5.5.1
\sd Obscenity
\sdn Kelucahan
\oldis 3.5.2.8
\oldsd Obscenity
\oldsdn Kelucahan
\dd Use this domain for obscene words related to sex, defecation, death, damnation, and other taboo or offensive subjects. It is important to check the appropriateness of including obscene words in the dictionary. It should be the choice of the speakers of the language whether a word should be included or excluded. Obscene words included in the dictionary should be clearly marked as such. Obscenity is often used to heighten the emotion of an expression, and is often used when someone is angry. Obscenity is often associated with sex or defecation. Cursing is often associated with God, religion, or the afterlife. Insults often involve equating a person with an animal that is associated with an undesirable characteristic, questioning someone's parentage/legitimacy, questioning someone's character, or questioning someone's intelligence/sanity.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kata-kata lucah yang berkaitan dengan seks, najis, kematian, kutukan, pantang larang atau perkara-perkara yang sumbang. Adalah penting untuk mengenalpasti sama ada sesuatu perkataan lucah patut didedahkan dalam kamus yang akan dihasilkan.. Golongan pengguna bahasa itu sendiri yang harus memutuskan. Dalam kamus yang sedang disediakan, para pengguna akan dimaklumkan secara khusus mengenai perkataan-perkataan sedemikian. Waktu membuat keputusan, patutlah diambil kira bahwa kelucahan biasanya mengkhayalkan seseorang.
\qu (1) What words refer to speech that is considered offensive or improper?
\qun
\ex bad language, strong language, swear word, four letter word, curse, obscenities, profanity, swearing, unprintable
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to using obscenity?
\qun
\ex swear, curse, cuss
\exn
\qu (3) What words are used in an obscene way?
\qun (3) Apakah antara kata-kata sumbang yang pernah atau masih digunakan? Sial (anak sial, kucing sial dsn), sial betul (sebagai kutukan), setan, hantu, tahi, mau makan? (memperkosa), sudah atau mau kena makan?
\ex damn, damn it, God damn, Hell, shit, screw, fuck, bastard, son of a bitch, bitch
\exn (diperkosa), celaka
\qu (4) What words describe speech or actions that are obscene?
\qun
\ex obscene, coarse, crude, dirty, filthy, improper, indecent, lewd, naughty, profane, risqué, rude, saucy, suggestive, vulgar
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe someone who uses obscenities a lot?
\qun
\ex foul-mouthed
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.5.2.8
\oldqu (1) What general words refer to speech which is considered offensive or improper?
\oldqun (1) Bagaimanakah dijelaskan perihal penggunaan bahasa yang terdiri daripada kata-kata yang sumbang?
\oldex obscenity, obscene, four letter words
\oldexn Kelucahan, lucah (bahasa yang penuh kelucahan atau kata-kata lucah), perkataan 4-huruf (contohnya: damn-sial, shit - tahi) yang sumbang
\gd I59A95939-44D7-4396-9EF7-3A80C17E9FB1

\exn Mengisyaratkan supaya datang (menggamitkan - dengan tangan), percakapan seseorang yang disertai gerakan tangan, lengan dan kepala, (menggunakan bahasa) isyarat, memberi isyarat

\ex gesture (n), sign (n), signal

\is 3.5.6.3
\sd Facial expression
\sdn Air Muka
\oldis 3.5.6.3
\oldsd Facial expression
\oldsdn Air Muka

\dd Use this domain for facial expressions--ways in which people move the parts of their faces to show feeling or communicate something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to a facial expression?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal wajah seseorang yang menyatakan sesuatu?
\ex expression, look, face, countenance, facial expression, the look on someone's face
\exn Air muka, wajah yang kelihatan (wajah muram kelihatan sedih, wajah ria kelihatan gembira)
\qu (2) What words refer to an expression using the eyes?
\qun
\ex stare, glare, roll your eyes, wink, blink, lift your eyes, raise your eyebrows, narrow your eyebrows, wrinkle your brow
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to an expression using the mouth?
\qun
\ex lick your lips, smack your lips, kiss, purse your lips
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to making an expression on your face?
\qun
\ex make a face, get an expression on your face, have an expression on your face, give someone (an expression)
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to making a particular expression?
\qun
\ex frown (in disapproval or worry), gape, grimace (in pain), pout, scowl, snarl, start
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to smiling?
\qun
\ex smile, grin, beam, be all smiles, force a smile, smirk, leer, sneer, wide grin, big smile, half smile, slight smile
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to starting to smile?
\qun
\ex break into a smile, someone's face lights up
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe a face that shows a lot of feeling?
\qun
\ex expressive, animated
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe a face that shows no feeling?
\qun
\ex expressionless, impassive, blank, deadpan, inscrutable, poker-faced
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe an expression that shows a particular feeling?
\qun
\ex cheerful, solemn, horrified, pained, wry
\exn

\is 3.5.6.4
\sd Laugh
\sdn Ketawa
\oldis 3.4.1.2.1
\oldsd Laugh
\oldsdn Ketawa
\dd Use this domain for words related to the expression of good feelings, including laughing--the sounds a person makes when he is enjoying himself or thinks something is funny.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu perasaan baik yang ditunjukkan khususnya melalui gelak ketawa iaitu bunyi yang kedengaran semasa seseorang itu berasa seronok atau geli hati.
\qu (1) What general words refer to laughing?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berketawa?
\ex laugh, laughter, laugh at (something), have a laugh
\exn Ketawa, gelak-ketawa, ketawa terhadap
\qu (2) What words describe the way a person laughs?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang digunakan untuk menjelaskan bagaimana seseorang itu ketawa?
\ex laugh aloud, laugh out loud, chortle, heehaw, guffaw, cackle, yuck it up, squeal with laughter, canned laughter
\exn Ketawa terbahak-bahak, ketawa di hati (secara diam-diam), ketawa kecil tanpa membuka mulut, ketawa besar atau terkekeh-kekeh dalam keriangan, ketawa meringkik (seperti bunyi kuda), ketawa berdekah-dekah, ketawa berdekit-dekit (geli-hati), terkekek-keket (seperti bunyi ayam), ketawa kuat-kuat - bergemuruh dengan gelak-ketawa
\qu (3) What words refer to laughing a little or quietly?
\qun
\ex laugh silently, chuckle, giggle, ripple of laughter, titter, twitter
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to laughing a lot or loudly?
\qun
\ex roar with laughter, laugh uproariously, howl with laughter, shriek with laughter, hearty laugh, peals of laughter, laugh helplessly, laugh your head off, laugh hysterically, have hysterics, roll in the aisle, almost die laughing, double up, convulsed with laughter, split your sides
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to laughing for a long time?
\qun (5) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal lamanya seseorang itu berketawa?
\ex can't stop laughing, have the giggles, fall over/about laughing, have a good laugh, laugh till the tears roll down your cheeks
\exn Ketawa berterusan - tidak terhenti-henti berketawa, asyik bergeli hati sahaja
\qu (6) What words refer to laughing at someone because they did something wrong?
\qun (6) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal ketawa terhadap kesilapan orang lain?
\ex laugh at, mock, titter, snicker, snigger
\exn Ketawa terhadap, memperolok-olokkan dengan gelak-ketawa, ketawa kecil yang tertahan-tahan kerana geli hati melihat kebodohan orang lain, ketawa dengan tujuan mengejek orang yang rasa malu
\qu (7) What words refer to beginning to laugh?
\qun (7) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal terdorongnya seseorang untuk mula ketawa?
\ex start laughing, burst out laughing, burst of laughter, dissolve into laughter
\exn Mula ketawa kerana terasa ingin ketawa, tercetusnya gelak-katawa, terasa geli hati sehingga mula berketawa
\qu (8) What words refer to causing someone to laugh?
\qun
\ex make someone laugh, amuse, crack someone up, have someone in hysterics, have someone in stitches, tickle, ticklish
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe someone or something that causes people to laugh?
\qun
\ex laughable, amusing, comic, comical, absurd, facetious, humor, humorous, sense of humor
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to the sound of a person makes when he is laughing?
\qun
\ex ho ho ho, ha ha ha
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to trying not to laugh?
\qun (11) Bagaimanakah menjelaskan perihal tindakan cuba menahan diri daripada tertawa?
\ex (try to/can't) keep a straight face, stifle a laugh
\exn Cuba menahan diri dari tertawa, menahan tercetusnya gelak ketawa - bertenang supaya tidak tertawa
\qu (12) What words refer to smiling?
\qun (12) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal bersenyum?
\ex smile, smile at, grin, wide grin, big smile, half smile, slight smile, smirk, crack a smile, beam
\exn Senyum (bersenyum), tersengih, tersenyum lebar (kernyih)
\qu (13) What other ways do people show they feel good?
\qun (13) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal cara menunjukkan suatu perasaan baik yang dialami selain daripada berketawa?
\ex clap, applaud, applause, cheer, jump up and down, jump for joy, dance for joy, shout for joy, make merry, revel, weep for joy, ululate
\exn Bertepuk, bertepuk tangan, tepukan tangan, bersorak-sorai, melompat-lompat, berlompat dengan keriangan, menari dengan meriah
\qu (14) What do people say when they are happy?
\qun
\ex Hurrah! Hooray! Yeah! Three cheers! Hallelujah! Yippee! Yahoo!
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.4.1.2.1
\oldqu (3) What words refer to laughing loudly?
\oldqun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perhal ketawa yang kuat?
\oldex roar with laughter, laugh uproarously, howl with laughter, hearty laugh
\oldexn Riuh dengan gelak-ketawa, ketawa kuat sehingga bergemuruh jadinya, melolong dengan gelak-ketawa, ketawa sekuat-kuat hati - ketawa terbahak-bahak
\oldqu (4) What words refer to laughing a lot?
\oldqun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal banyak berketawa?
\oldex laugh helplessly, laugh your head off, have hysterics, roll in the aisle, almost die laughing, double up
\oldexn Terlalu melucukan sehingga tidak mampu berhenti ketawa, ketawa terbahak-bahak sehingga lupa (tidak memikirkan lagi keadaan sekeliling), meracau dengan ketawa kerana kerasukan atau selap - ketawa semasa seseorang hilang kesiumannya, tertawa sehingga bergolek di lantai, terlampau kuat berketawa sehingga setengah mati rasanya, terlalu berketawa sehingga tidak dapat menegakkan badan kerana terasa kesakitan diafragma
\oldqu (8) What words refer to making someone laugh?
\oldqun (8) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mendorong seseorang untuk ketawa?
\oldex amuse, crack someone up, have someone in hysterics
\oldexn Berkelakar untuk menghiburkan, bergurau senda dengan seseorang, terlampau melucukan sehingga hilang kesedaran (masalah atau penderitaan ataupun kesiuman) dan asyik tertawa sahaja
\oldqu (9) What words describe someone or something which causes people to laugh?
\oldqun (9) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal sesuatu atau seseorang yang dapat mempengaruhi orang lain untuk ketawa?
\oldex laughable, amusing, comic, comical, absurd, facetious, humor, humorous, sense of humor
\oldexn Menggelikan, menghiburkan, lucu - melucukan, penuh dengan lawak jenaka (contohnya lakonan atau cerita yang tidak masuk akal tetapi menyeronokan} - berlawak atau berjenaka, kelakar - mampu mengusik hati dan jiwa - pandai bergurau senda
\oldqu (10) What words refer to the sounds a person makes when he is laughing?
\oldqun (10) Apakah yang kedengaran semasa seseorang itu ketawa?
\oldex ho ho ho, ha ha ha
\oldexn Hee! Hee! Hee!, Ha! Ha! Ha!
\cf Humor; Mock
\gd ICBC0A8F5-9CBA-41D2-A7E5-565FBF09C8C4

\is 3.5.6.5
\sd Cry, tear
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to crying--when water forms in the eyes because of sadness or pain.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to crying?
\qun
\ex cry, weep, be in tears, tearful, have tears in your eyes, weeping, weepy, squall
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to crying a lot?
\qun
\ex cry your eyes out, tears roll down your cheeks, eyes full of tears, eyes are brimming with tears, cry your heart out, cry yourself to sleep
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to crying in a noisy way?
\qun
\ex sob, bawl, howl, wail
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to crying in an annoying way?
\qun
\ex snivel, sniffle, whimper, blubber, blub, crybaby
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to starting to cry?
\qun
\ex start to cry, start crying, burst into tears, break down, turn on the waterworks, get teary
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to almost crying?
\qun
\ex be close to tears, have a lump in your throat, fight back tears, choke back the tears
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to crying because something gets in your eyes?
\qun
\ex cry, your eyes water
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to making someone cry?
\qun
\ex make someone cry, reduce someone to tears, bring tears to someone's eyes, tearful, tearjerker
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to a tear?
\qun
\ex tear, teardrop
\exn
\qu (10) What do tears do?
\qun
\ex fall, run (down the face), streak
\exn
\qu (11) What do people do to tears?
\qun
\ex wipe away, dry
\exn
\qu (12) What do people say to stop someone from crying?
\qun
\ex don't cry, there there
\exn
\gd IB4FE4698-54A2-4BCD-9490-E07EE1EE97AF

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal kegiatan membaca dan menulis?
\ex reading and writing, literacy
\exn Membaca dan menulis, kenal huruf (mampu membaca dan menulis)

\exn Tulis (menulis), mencatit, menyalin sebagaimana diberitahu secara lisan (diimlakkan)
\qu (2) What words refer to the letters and symbols we use to write?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada hurufiah dan lambang-lambang yang digunakan semasa menulis?

\exn Ortografi (sistem ejaan yag teratur dan baik), abjad, huruf, tanda bacaan, bunyi sebutan, tanda nada

\ex writing materials, paper, pen, ink, pencil
\exn Bahan-bahan tulisan seperti buku-buku latihan, kertas tulis, pena tulis, dakwat, pensel

\qun (1) Bagaimanakah makna sesuatu dinyatakan?
\ex meaning, definition, semantics, sense, interpretation
\exn Makna (maksud, tujuan), erti
\qu (2) How do you say that something means something?
\qun (2) Bagaimana menyatakan sesuatu yang mempunyai makna tertentu?
\ex mean (something), have the meaning
\exn Bermakna, mempunyai makna tertentu,
\qu (3) What words describe something that has two meanings?
\qun
\ex ambiguous, double meaning, doubletalk
\exn

\oldex meaningless, nonsense, absurd, ridiculous, lack meaning

\is 3.5.8.4
\sd Show, indicate
\sdn Membuktikan, Menandakan
\oldis 3.5.7.4
\oldsd Show, indicate
\oldsdn Membuktikan, Menandakan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to showing or indicating something--if something (such as an object, something said, or something that happens) shows something, it makes people think of something or understand something (e.g. When his face turns red, it indicates he is angry.)
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to something showing that something is true?
\qun
\ex show, be a sign, mean, indicate, reveal, make it clear, demonstrate, betray, be evidence, reflect, illustrate, bear witness to, tell
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to something showing that something might be true?
\qun
\ex suggest, point to, imply, give the impression
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to something showing that something has a good quality?
\qun
\ex be a tribute to, say a lot for, reflect well on, be a testimony to
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something showing that something has a bad quality?
\qun
\ex be a reflection on, be a comment on, be a symptom of, be symptomatic of, be an indictment of, not say much for, reflect badly on, make a mockery of, sign of the times
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something showing that something is going to happen?
\qun
\ex mean, herald, bode well, bode ill, spell
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a sign that shows that something is true?
\qun
\ex sign, indication, indicator, evidence, mark, trace, manifestation, symptom, omen, telltale, be a giveaway
\exn

\oldexn Membuktikan, menandakan, bermaksud, menunjukkan

\oldsdn Media Massa

\dd Use this domain for words related to radio, television, newspapers, magazines and other forms of mass communication.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan radio, televisyen, surat khabar, majalah khususnya dan kemudahan media massa yang lain (jika ada).

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada pelbagai kemudahan media massa?
\ex radio, television, newspaper, magazine
\exn Radio, televisyen, surat khabar, majalah
\qu (2) What words refer to programs and messages?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu susunan acara dan maklumat?
\ex program, article
\exn Rancangan (susunan acara), rencana (susunan maklumat)
\qu (3) What words refer to making programs?
\qun (3) Bagaimanakah menyatakan perihal pengurusan suatu susunan acara atau maklumat?
\ex broadcast
\exn Menyiarkan (rancangan-rancangan radio & televisyen), menerbitkan (rencana-rencana surat khabar & majalah)

\is 3.5.9.1

\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada kemudahan media massa yang disiarkan?
\ex radio, television
\exn Radio, televisyen
\qu (2) What words refer to programs?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada susunan acara untuk disiarkan?
\ex program, ad
\exn Pelbagai siaran (pelbagai rancangan untuk disiarkan), siaran iklan
\qu (3) What words refer to making programs?
\qun (3) Bagaimanakah menyatakan perihal pengurusan rancangan-rancangan untuk disiarkan?
\ex broadcast
\exn Menyiarkan (contohnya rancangan-rancangan TV3)
\qu (4) What words refer to a person who talks on the radio or television?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang pengacara yang kedengaran melalui siaran radio dan televisyen?
\ex reporter, anchorman, disk jockey
\exn Pemberita, juruacara, juruhebah
\qu (5) What words refer to radio and television stations?
\qun
\ex station, band, frequency, reception
\exn

\is 3.5.9.2
\sd Telephone
\sdn Telefon
\oldis 3.5.8.2
\oldsd Telephone
\oldsdn Telefon

\dd Use this domain for words related to the telephone.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan kemudahan perkhidmatan telefon.
\qu (1) What words refer to telephones?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada kemudahan perkhidmatan telefon?
\ex telephone, phone, cell phone
\exn Telefon awam, telefon rumah atau pejabat, telefon bimbit
\qu (2) What words refer to talking to someone on the telephone?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal berbual dengan seseorang melalui telefon?
\ex speak/talk on the phone, be on the phone
\exn Berbual melalui telefon, sedang menggunakan telefon (menelefon)
\qu (3) What words refer to beginning a telephone call?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal membuat suatu panggilan telefon?
\ex call (up), ring, phone (v), dial
\exn Dail nombor telefon (A), membuat panggilan kepada (A), mendengar bunyi telefon, minta bercakap dengan (A)
\qu (4) What words refer to ending a telephone call?
\qun (4) Bagaimanakah dijelaskan mengenai tindakan mengakhiri suatu panggilan telefon?
\ex hang up
\exn Letakkan gagang telefon
\qu (5) What words refer to a person who works for the telephone company?
\qun (5) Siapakah dalam perkhidmatan syarikat telefon yang mengendalikan setiap panggilan telefon?
\ex operator
\exn Telefon operator
\qu (6) What words refer to problems with making a telephone call?
\qun (6) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada masalah yang dihadapi semasa membuat panggilan telefon?
\ex busy signal, go dead, wrong number
\exn Panggilan tidak dapat disambungkan kerana talian yang sedang digunakan, tiba-tiba terputus sambungan talian, terdial salah nombor atau diberi nombor yang salah

\oldsdn Mengajar
\dd Use this domain for words related to teaching.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to teaching?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mengajar?
\ex teach, educate, instruct, lecture, edify, tutor, coach, inform, indoctrinate, infuse, instill
\exn Mengajar (mendidik), bersyarah, memberi tunjuk ajar, membina keyakinan (beri teladan akhlak dan pemikiran yang baik), membimbing, melatih, memaklumkan, memuridkan (mempengaruhi), memperdalamkan kemahiran (ulang kaji intensif), menyemai (contohnya sikap tekun berusaha)
\qu (2) What words refer to a person who teaches?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang mengajar?
\ex teacher, tutor, lecturer, professor, coach, trainer, faculty, educator
\exn Guru (pendidik), pembimbing, pensyarah, pakar (ilmu tertentu), pemimpin, pelatih, facilitator- pemudahcara
\qu (3) What words refer to a person who is taught?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang atau sekumpulan orang yang menerima tunjuk ajar?
\ex pupil, student
\exn Anak murid, pelajar, para penuntut, kelas (bukan sahaja ke suatu bilik tetapi golongan untuk dididik)
\qu (4) What words refer to what is taught?
\qun
\ex teaching, subject, education
\exn

\oldis 3.6.1

\oldsdn Memberi Tunjuk Ajar, Menerangkan
\dd Use this domain for words related to showing someone how something works, or explaining something to someone.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to showing how something works or how something is done?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menunjukkan bagaimana sesuatu itu boleh digunakan atau bagaimana menggunakan sesuatu itu?
\ex show, demonstrate
\exn Menunjukkan (beri contoh bagaimana sesuatu boleh digunakan), memberi tunjuk ajar (bagaimana menggunakan sesuatu)
\qu (2) What words refer to explaining something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal memberi keterangan mengenai sesuatu?
\ex explain, explanation, elaborate, elucidate
\exn Menerangkan, menjelaskan (dengan memberi keterangan atau keterangan yang lebih lanjut)
\qu (3) What words refer to something that is said about something?
\qun
\ex comment, remark, observation
\exn

\is 3.6.2
\sd School
\sdn Institusi Pendidikan
\oldis 3.6.2
\oldsd School
\oldsdn Institusi Pendidikan
\dd Use this domain for words related to school.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan-soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words refer to a school?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada sesebuah institusi pendidikan?
\ex school
\exn Institusi pendidikan, sekolah (institusi pendidikan peringkat) rendah, sekolah (institusi pendidikan peringkat) menengah, institusi pendidikan peringkat menegah atas (pra -universiti), kolej, universiti (institusi pngajian tinggi), seminari (institusi pengajian teologi), akademi (institusi pendidikan kemahiran khusus)
\qu (2) What words refer to a school for different ages?
\qun
\ex nursery school, kindergarten, grammar school, elementary school, secondary school, high school, university, college
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a special kind of school?
\qun
\ex public school, state school, private school, boarding school, co-educational, comprehensive school, religious school, seminary, academy
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a place in a school?
\qun
\ex classroom, lecture hall, playground, sports field, gymnasium, auditorium, staffroom
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a group of students in a school?
\qun
\ex class, grade, form, year, set, student body
\exn
\qu (6) What equipment is used in a school?
\qun (6) Apakah alat kemudahan pendidikan yang disediakan oleh pihak institusi pendidikan?
\ex textbook, desk, chair, blackboard, chalk, eraser, rubber, uniform, school-bag, exercise book
\exn Meja, kerusi, papan tulis (dulu) kain layar, skrin, kertas lut sinar (kini) kapur (dulu) pena tanda,alat projektor, mikro komputer riba (kini), pemadam, (dului) pemadam elektronik (kini)
\qu (7) What words refer to attending school?
\qun (7) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menghadiri kelas di sesebuah institusi pendidikan pada musim belajar?
\ex attend, go to school, enter school
\exn Hadir di sekolah (menghadiri kelas atau kursus tertentu), pergi ke sekolah, masuk sekolah, kelas atau jurusan tertentu)
\qu (8) What words refer to leaving school?
\qun (8) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal meninggalkan sesebuah institusi pendidikan?
\ex leave, graduate, drop out, dropout
\exn Pindah sekolah, tamat sekolah, kursus atau pengajian, gagal peperiksaan (tidak layak meneruskan pelajaran), dibuang sekolah (tidak dibenarkan hadir di sekolah atau kelas)
\qu (9) What words refer to making someone leave school because of bad behavior?
\qun
\ex expel, kick out, suspend
\exn
