\gd I24361BE2-49BE-4860-BB56-4E46DD1E8B0C

\is 4.9.5.7
\sd Salvation
\sdn Keselamatan
\oldis 4.9.5.7
\oldsd Salvation
\oldsdn Keselamatan
\dd Use this domain for the primary goal or goals of a religion, for instance in Christianity salvation from sin, death and Hell. Each religion has different beliefs about salvation. Our purpose here is not to preach or argue, but to list those words that people use to talk about this topic.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk lingkungan perkataan yang berkaitan dengan perihal matlamat asas atau tujuan muktamad mengamalkan agama atau kepercayaan tertentu. Contohnya keselamatan dari kuasa dosa & maut serta dari hukuman kematian kekal di neraka adalah matlamat asas atau tujuan muktamad bagi umat Kristian.menurut rencana Tuhan. Pendekatan terhadap keselamatan adalah berlainan berdasarkan agama dan kepercayaan masing-masing. Tujuan kami bukan untuk berkotbah atau berdebat tetapi untuk menyenaraikan lingkungan perkataan yang biasa digunakan orang waktu berbicara mengenai keselamatan.
\qu (1) What words refer to what God does to save a person?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan Tuhan untuk menyelamatkan seseorang?
\ex save, salvation, sanctify, redeem, justify, regenerate
\exn Menyelamatkan, memberi jaminan keselamatan, menguduskan, menebus, menjadikan sebagai orang benar (kerana sudah bertaubat, diampuni dan bebas untuk hidup dalam kebenaran), mencipta baru melalui pengalanan lahir baru - menjadikan orang yang percayai sebagai ciptaan (generasi) baru yang rohani dan benar
\qu (2) What words refer to a person who saves another?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada pihak yang menyelamatkan orang lain?
\ex savior
\exn Penyelamat - juruselamat - Yesus - Kristus - Yesus Kristus, penebus,
\qu (3) What words refer to what a person does to be saved?
\qun (3) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan yang diambil oleh seseorang untuk memperolehi keselamatan?
\ex believe, repent, return (to God), receive, work, earn
\exn Percaya, bertaubat, kembali hidup menurut rencana (kehendak) Tuhan, menerima janji-janji keselamatan dari Tunan, mengerjakan (iman & keselamatan) - bekerjasama dengan Tuhan (mentaati firman Tuhan) untuk membina hidup baru atau hidup beriman, menuai hasil hidup beriman iaitu keselamatan atau hidup kekal yang akan menjadi nyata sepenuhnya di akhirat

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.5.7
\gd I6105A207-4311-4920-8C19-63259424BFAF

\is 4.9.5.8
\sd Dedicate to religious use
\sdn Mentahbiskan untuk pelayanan Tuhan
\oldis 4.9.5.8
\oldsd Dedicate to religious use
\oldsdn Mentahbiskan untuk pelayanan Tuhan

\dd Use this domain for words related to dedicating someone or something to religious use.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to dedicating something to religious use?
\qun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mentahbiskan bagi pelayanan Tuhan?
\ex dedicate, consecrate, anoint, sanctify, devote, hallow, baptize, circumcise
\exn Mentahbiskan (seseorang & sesuatu), menyucikan (seseorang & sesuatu) mengurapi (untuk manusia sahaja), menguduskan (untuk smanusia sahaja)
\qu (2) What words describe something that has been dedicated?
\qun
\ex holy, consecrated, sanctified, sacred, devoted, baptized
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that has not been dedicated?
\qun
\ex unholy, common
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to improperly using something that has been dedicated?
\qun
\ex desecrate
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.5.8
\oldqu (2) What words refer to improperly using something which has been dedicated?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada penyalahgunaan sesuatu yang telah ditahbiskan?
\oldex desecrate
\oldexn Menyahgunakan (penyalahgunaan) tempat atau benda yang suci - mencemarkan tempat yang suci - mengotorkan tempat atau benda yang suci - merosakkan tempat atau benda yang suci
\gd I62ED8254-E53A-4781-935E-79869619E40A

\is 4.9.5.9
\sd Fasting
\sdn Berpuasa
\oldis 4.9.5.9
\oldsd Fasting
\oldsdn Berpuasa

\dd Use this domain for words related to fasting--to not eat for a period of time.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to not eating for a period of time?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menahan diri daripada mengambil makanan untuk tempoh tertentu?
\ex fast, deny (oneself)
\exn Berpuasa, menahan diri daripada menjamu makanan untuk tempoh tertentu
\qu (2) What words refer to a person who denies himself for religious purposes?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang menahan diri daripada sesuatu untuk tujuan rohani?
\ex ascetic
\exn Pertapa, orang yang bertapa, orang yang mengamalkan pertapaan, orang yang mempertapakan diri (mempertapakan keinginan jasmani untuk mendapat berkat rohani)
\qu (3) What words refer to the general practice of denying oneself something?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada amalan yang lazimnya dikaitkan dengan menahan diri daripada sesuatu?
\ex asceticism
\exn Pertapaan, pengawalan diri (yoga), kebiaraan, berpuasa
\qu (4) What words refer to a time when a person fasts or denies himself in some other way?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu masa apabila seseorang itu akan berpuasa atau menahan diri daripada sesuatu?
\ex fast, Lent, Ramadan
\exn Waktu berpuasa, ‘Lent' - tempoh berpuasa bagi umat Kristan (amalan sukarela dalam jangkamasa 40 hari sebelum menyambut perayaan hari kebangkitan Yesus), Ramadan - bulan puasa bagi umat Islam (amalan tetap sebelum berhari raya)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.5.9
\gd I79F3B53A-EB56-4188-87F8-48317F76E7CE

\is 4.9.6
\sd Heaven, hell
\sdn Syurga, Neraka
\oldis 4.9.6
\oldsd Heaven, hell
\oldsdn Syurga, Neraka
\dd Use this domain for words related to heaven and hell--the place where people go after they die.
\ddn
\qu (1) What is the place or home of God called?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tempat Tuhan bersemayam?
\ex Heaven, the highest heaven, the abode of God, the throne of God
\exn Syurga, syurga yang tertinggi, tempat Tuhan bersemayam, takhta Tuhan
\qu (2) What is the place called where dead people are?
\qun (2) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada tempat yang dikaitkan bagi orang-orang yang telah meninggal dunia secara amnya?
\ex Hades, Sheol, the place of the dead, the grave, the other side, the beyond, underworld, nether world
\exn Nota: Hades & Sheol - rujuk perkara (4)  Tempat menyimpan mayat - rumah (bilik) mayat, keranda, kubur - pusara - makam, alam roh orang mati yang beriman - alam roh orang mati yang tidak bertaubat, di luar dunia nyata - alam roh-roh baik (orang beriman) - alam roh-roh jahat (orang kafir)
\qu (3) What is the place called where believers (good people) go when they die?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang dikaitkan dengan tempat perginya roh-roh semua orang baik (yang percaya kepada Tuhan) apabila mereka meniggal dunia?
\ex heaven, paradise, your reward
\exn Sebelum hari kiamat: Syurga, firdaus.  Selepas hari kiamat: tempat hidup kekal yang disediakan oleh Tuhan bagi orang-orang beriman yang telah meninggal dunia, Jerusalem baru, Kota Suci
\qu (4) What is the place called where unbelievers (bad people) go when they die?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang dikaitkan dengan tempat perginya roh-roh semua orang jahat (kafir) apabila mereka meniggal dunia?
\ex hell, the pit, fire and brimstone, eternal damnation
\exn Sebelum hari kiamat: Hades (bahasa Yunani) - tempat khusus arwah jahat menurut Perjanjian Baru - kerajaan maut, Sheol (bahasa Yahudi) - tempat khusus arwah jahat menurut Perjanjian Lama, lubang maut, tempat api belerang - neraka fana - Gehena (bahasa Yunani). Selepas hari kiamat: tempat kematian kedua - tempat kematian kekal - neraka (lautan api yang) kekal
\qu (5) What words refer to going to heaven or hell?
\qun
\ex pass on, go to heaven, go to hell
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something belonging to heaven or hell?
\qun
\ex celestial, heavenly, hellish
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.6
\oldqu (5) What words refer to going to the non-earthly realm?
\oldqun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menjelaskan perihal meneruskan hidup selepas meninggal dunia dalam alam di luar dunia nyata?
\oldex pass on, go to heaven, go to hell
\oldexn Meneruskan perjalanan hidup di alam baru, masuk syurga fana menunggu hari kiatmat, masuk neraka fana menunggu penghakiman Anak Tuhan
\gd I1C3F8996-362E-4EE0-AF02-0DD02887F6AA

\is 4.9.6.1
\sd Resurrection
\sdn Kebangkitan
\oldis 4.9.6.1
\oldsd Resurrection
\oldsdn Kebangkitan
\dd Use this domain for words related to resurrection--life after death, or living again after dying.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to coming back to life?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal kembali hidup semula?
\ex come back to life, come back from the grave, come to life, resurrection
\exn Hidup kembali, bangkit dari kubur, hidup semula, terjadinya kebangkitan dari maut
\qu (2) What words refer to causing someone to come back to life?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan yang menyebabkan seseorang itu hidup kembali?
\ex resurrect, raise from the dead, bring back to life, bring back from the dead
\exn Membangkitkan, membangunkan jasad yang mati dari kubur, menghidupkan semula, memberi nyawa untuk hidup kembali dari maut
\qu (3) What words refer to the condition or state of living forever?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada keadaan hidup yang berkekalan?
\ex live forever, (have) eternal life, life everlasting, immortality, life after death
\exn Hidup untuk selama-lamanya, mempunyai hidup kekal, menerimai kehidupan yang berkekalan, diberi hidup yang kekal abadi
\qu (4) What words refer to reincarnation?
\qun
\ex reincarnation, reincarnated
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.6.1
\gd IFF505092-6D88-4B5E-8095-04E471D7AD4C

\is 4.9.7
\sd Religious organization
\sdn Organisasi keagamaan
\oldis 4.9.7
\oldsd Religious organization
\oldsdn Organisasi keagamaan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to official religions, groups within a religion, and religious meetings. Each religion will have different names for its groups. Answer each question for each religion.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada oraganisasi agama, kumpulan agama dan pertemuan agama yang dikendalikan secara rasmi. Setiap organisasi agama rasmi akan memberi nama yang berlainan kepada kumpulan-kumpulan rasmi yang di bawah naungannya. Gunakan panduan soal jawap berikut untuk setiap oraganisasai agama yang rasmi.
\qu (1) What general words refer to an official religion?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang biasanya digunakan untuk merujuk kepada suatu organisasi agama yang rasmi?
\ex religion, faith
\exn Agama rasmi, kepercayaan rami, agama atau kepercayaan yang diiktirafkan oleh pihak kerajaan
\qu (2) What are the names of the official religions?
\qun (2) Apakah nama-nama organisasi agama yang rasmi?
\ex Christianity, Islam, Hinduism, Judaism, animism, paganism
\exn Agama Kristian - kepercayaan umat Kristian, agama Islam - kepercayaan umat Islam, agama Hindu - kepercayaan umat Hindu, agama Yahudi - kepercayaan umat Yahudi, agama Buddha - kepercayaan pengikut-pengikut Buddha. Nota: Animisme adalah diiktirafkan kerajaan sebagai sebahagian daripada budaya orang tempatan kafir bukannya sebagai suatu agama rami; kepercayaan bahawa semua benda adalah bernyawa - penyembahan alam semulajadi seperti gunung kinabalu terutamanya pada masa-masa lampau
\qu (3) What words refer to a group within a religion?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kumpulan-kumpulan tertentu dalan suatu organisasi agama yang rasmi itu?
\ex sect, denomination, party
\exn Denominasi, gerakan misi, evangelikal, karismatik, apostolik, profetik dsn, mazhab-golongan ortodoks, tidak ortodoks, Roman Katolik, Katolik, Protestan dsn
\qu (4) What are the names of the sects?
\qun
\ex Catholic, Protestant, Baptist, Presbyterian, Methodist
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a group of believers in a particular place?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada sekumpulan orang Kristian yang temu berbakti di suatu tempat?
\ex church, congregation, diocese, parish
\exn Jemaah gereja setempat, jemaah Kristian di bandar atau kota, jemaah Kristian di suatu dearah atau kawasan jagaan uskup atau bishop, jemaah suatu perkampungan - jemaah gereja kariah
\qu (6) What words refer to beginning to believe in a religion or changing from one religion to another?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan perihal bermulanya seseorang itu menganuti suatu kepercayaan atau agama tertentu ataupun seseorang yang meninggalkan kepercayaan atau agama asalnya untuk yang lain?
\ex convert, conversion
\exn Tukar agama - ubah pegangan - memeluk ugama - menganuti agama - menjadi pengikut kepercayaan tertentu (pengikut Kristus) - menjadi kawan baru (agama Islam) - mualaf (agama Islam), pertaubatan (umat Kristian - contoh: tukar atau ubah pendirian rohani iaitu dari orang kafir yang berdosa kepada orang yang beriman yang telah menerima pengampunan dosa-dosanya) - pemelukan - penganutan - permualafan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.7
\oldqu (4) What are the names of the (Christian) denominations?
\oldqun (4) Apakah antara nama-nama denominasi Kristian?
\oldex Catholic, Protestant, Baptist, Presbyterian, Methodist
\oldexn Katolik, Protestan, Baptis, Presbyterian, Methodis, Basel, Anglikan, Kalvari, Khabar Baik, Evangelikal dsn
\gd I2470AD05-636E-4C85-96AB-CD880DA58741

\is 4.9.7.1
\sd Religious person
\sdn
\oldis 4.9.7.1
\oldsd Religious practitioner
\oldsdn Orang yang mengerjakan amal ibadah agama atau kepercayaannya
\dd Use this domain for words referring to religious practitioners--people who practice a religion, who are members of the religion, believe in the religion, leaders of the religion, and followers of the religion. Each religion has its own terms for religious practitioners. List these terms separately for each religion. The examples given below are for the Christian religion.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada orang-orang yang mengerjakan amal ibadah agama atau kepercayaan mereka - mereka yang taat kepada ajaran-ajaran agama atau kepercayaan mereka, mereka yang telah menjadi anggota, yang mengerjakan iman mereka, para pemimpin dan para pengikut agama atau kepercayaan itu. (Kepercayaan Umat Kristian: Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada para pekerja atau pelayan Tuhan dan kerajaannNya - para jemaah yang taat kepada firman Tuhan, jemaah yang telah menjadi aggota tubuh Kristus dan gereja setempat, umat yang mengerjakan iman mereka, para pemimpin dan para pengikut ajaran Tuhan Kristus Yesus.) Setiap agama atau kepercayaan mempunyai istilah khusus bagi yang setia mengerjakan amal ibadah mereka. Senaraikan secara berasingan istilah-istilah untuk agama atau kepercayaan yang berlainan. Istilah-istilah yang digunakan dalam domain ini adalah berdasarkan kepercayaan umat Kristian.
\qu (1) What is a person called who believes in a religion?
\qun (1) Bagaimana merujuk kepada seseorang yang percaya kepada ajaran-ajaran dalam agama atau kepercayaan tertentu pada umumnya?
\ex believer, member (of the faith), adherent, follower, practitioner
\exn Orang beriman, aggota umat yang percaya, penyokong- kawan baru, pengikut
\qu (2) What is a person called who believes in the (Christian) religion?
\qun (2) Bagaimana merujuk kepada seseorang yang percaya kepada ajaran-ajaran dalam agama atau kepercayaan umat Kristian?
\ex Christian, brother, fellow believer, saint
\exn Kristian - - pengikut Yesus Kristus, orang yang beriman kepada Yesus Kristus, saudara atau saudari dalam Yesus Kristus - anggota tubuh Kristus - anggota jemaah setempat, anggota seiman - saksi Yesus Kristus, orang kudus (suci, salih)
\qu (3) What is a leader of the (Christian-Protestant) religion called?
\qun (3) Bagaimana merujuk kepada seseorang pemimpin agama atau kepercayaan umat Kristian Protestan?
\ex pastor, minister, parson
\exn Gembala (pastor) - pengajar - penginjil - nabi - rasul, pelayan (pelapis) - penatua - bishop, paderi - uskup - ketua uskup atau uskup agung
\qu (4) What is a leader of the (Christian-Catholic) religion called?
\qun (4) Bagaimana merujuk kepada seseorang pemimpin agama atau kepercayaan umat Kristian Katolik?
\ex priest, father, bishop, archbishop, Cardinal, pope, man of the cloth
\exn Rahib (lelaki, perempuan), paderi (pendeta), bishop, ketua uskup (uskup agung), kardinal, paus, dari golongan (jabatan) paderi
\qu (5) What words refer to the profession of being a religious leader?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada jawatan kepimpinan dalam hal keagamaan dan kerohanian?
\ex pastorate, priesthood, ministry
\exn Bagi umat Kristian: jabatan paderi - jabatan atau pelayanan para gembala, jabatan pendeta - jabatan atau pelayanan para pengajar, jabatan atau pelayanan para penginjil, jabatan atau pelayanan profetik, jabatan atau pelayanan apostolik, jawatan imamat rajani - pendoa syafaat
\qu (6) What words refers to all religious leaders?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada semua pemimpin hal keagamaan dan kerohanian?
\ex clergy
\exn Khususnya: yang berjawatan rasmi dalam gereja. Jabatan paderi- jawatan kepimpinan: para rasul, para nabi, para peninjil, para pengajar para gembala - uskup agung, bishop, dekan dan pelayan-pelayan penuh masa (memimpin orang mengenal Tuhan, beriman seperti Yesus Kristus dan bertumbuh dalam Roh Kudus). Umumnya: yang biasanya melayani secara sukarela dan tidak berjawatan rasmi dalam gereja. Pendoa syafaat - imamat rajani - pelayan kerajaan Tuhan - pekerja di ladang Tuhan - saksi Tuhan Yesus - pemimpin kebaktian di gereja atau rumah
\qu (7) What words refer to followers of a religion who are not leaders?
\qun
\ex laity, layperson, flock
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.7.1
\oldqu (5) What special clothes does a religious person wear?
\oldqun (5) Apakah pakaian khusus seseorang pemimpin rohani atau agama pada umumnya?
\oldex (priest's) robes, habit, cloth
\oldexn Jubah paderi, bishop, uskup agung, kardinal & paus, jubah rahib lelaki & perempuan menurut mazhab, kain jubah yang tidak bercorak dan berwarna-warni - kain jubah yang sejenis warnanya sahaja kecuali untuk pakaian lengkap rasmi uskup agung
\oldqu (8) What word refers to followers of a religion who are not leaders?
\oldqun (8) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada para pengikut yang tidak terlibat dalam kepimpinan suatu agama atau kepercayaan?
\oldex laity, lay person, flock
\oldexn Pengikut yang tidak berjawatan (rasmi) untuk melayai jemaah setempat atau jemaah Kristian (tetapi boleh diberi tanggungjawab mewakili kepimpinan rasmi), pengikut yang belum matang atau mahir dalam hal-hal rohani untuk menyandang tugas rasmi kepimpinan sepenuh masa, para jemaah atau para anggota umum yang masih perlu dipimpin
\gd IEF860EE3-A4A5-4A42-B810-FDF41E35D151

\oldexn Berhala, bentuk yang melambang kuasa luar biasa yang dipuja - lambang setan - patung dewa atau dewi, gambar dewa-dewi dsn yang dipuja seperti Tuhan, patung atau lukisan orang-orang salih

\is 4.9.8.2
\sd Place of worship
\sdn Tempat penyembahan
\oldis 4.9.8.2
\oldsd Place of worship
\oldsdn Tempat penyembahan
\dd Use this domain for words related to places of worship. Each religion has different types of places of worship. These questions must be answered according to the practices of each religion and for each separate type of place.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tempat-tempat penyembahan. Setiap agama atau kepercayaan mempunyai tempat pemyembahan yang berlainan. Gunakan soalan-soalan domain ini untuk menjawap dengan lingkungan perkataan yang berkaitan dengan tempat-tempat untuk mengerjakan amal ibadah suatu agama atau kepercayaan yang khusus (disenaraikan dalam soalan (1)) dan hal-hal yang berkaitan dengan tempat-tempat itu secara khususnya (contoh: soalan (2) & (3))
\qu (1) What words refer to a place that is dedicated to God?
\qun
\ex house of God, church, temple, synagogue, mosque, shrine, god house, sanctuary, tabernacle
\exn
\qu (2) What are the parts of a church?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang dikaitkan dengan bahagian-bahagian suatu gereja?
\ex pew, altar, pulpit, choir loft, baptismal font, stained glass window, steeple
\exn Kerusi panjang di gereja, mazbah, mimbar, tempat kumpulan koir gereja, bekar air untuk membaptiskan, kaca tingkap di gereja yang bercorak (berlukisan) warna warni lut cahaya, menara gereja yang berceracak di atasnya
\qu (3) What are the parts of a temple?
\qun (3) Apakah bahagian-bahagian yang dikaikan dengan bangunan tempat kehadiran Tuhan dinyatakan (atau tempat Tuhan bersemayam di antara manusia)?
\ex courtyard, holy place, holy of holies, altar, laver, lamp stand
\exn Halaman perkehemahan atau bangunan, tempat suci perkhemahan atau bangunan, tempat Maha Kudus- tempat yang hanya dibenarkan kepada imam besar masuk beribadah kepada Tuhan Maha Kudus bagi pihak umat Israel
\qu (4) Where are idols placed?
\qun (4) Di manakah berhala ditempatkan?
\ex god shelf, shrine
\exn Ruang (rak, peti atau bangunan kecil), tempat keramat
\qu (5) Where do religious leaders live?
\qun (5) Di manakah para pemimpin kerohanian dan hal-hal beramal ibadah tinggal?
\ex monastery, convent, parsonage
\exn (Nota: Golongan kepimpinan ini adalah yang telah mentahbiskan diri mereka untuk melayani Tuhan sepenuh masa atau seumur) Kota Vatican - para kardinal & paus Katolik, biara (untuk lelaki) rumah pertapaan lelaki: para paderi & rahib Katolik, biara (untuk perempuan) - rumah pertapaan perempuan: para paderi (ibu) dan rahib perempuan Katolik, rumah gembala untuk uskup agung, bishop (uskup), paderi atau pendeta Kristian dan dekan - rumah gereja untuk penginjil atau pelayan Tuhan penuh masa, rumah pelayanan - pemimpin pelayanan (doa syafaat, profetikk, apostolik) penuh masa

\oldqu (1) What words refer to a place which is dedicated to God?
\oldqun (1) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu tempat yang dikhusukan (ditahbiskan) untuk mengerjakan amal ibadah kepada Tuhan?
\oldex house of God, church, temple, synagogue, mosque, shrine, god house, religious sanctuary
\oldexn Rumah Tuhan - tempat menyembah Tuhan, gereja - tempat amal ibadah orang Kristian, bangunan tempat kehadiran Tuhan dinyatakan atau tempat Tuhan bersemayan di antara manusia (orang Yahudi, orang Kristian) - kuil (orang Hindu) - tokong (orang Cina), biah - tempat orang Yahudi beramal-ibadah, masjid (orang Islam), tempat keramat (orang Jepun dsn), peti atau bangunan kecil yang dikhususkan untuk menyimpan patung atau benda-benda yang dipuja (kepercayaan Shinto dsn), tempat suci untuk bersembayang & menyembah Tuhan
\gd I9B476AFD-58C2-46A2-8294-449AC4AAD3A9

\is 4.9.9
\sd Irreligion
\sdn Anti-Tuhan, ketidakagamaan
\oldis 4.9.9
\oldsd Irreligion
\oldsdn Anti-Tuhan, ketidakagamaan

\dd Use this domain for words related to thinking and acting against God or religion.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan berfikiran dan berkelakuan mengingkari Tuhan atau kepercayaan terhadapNya (agama)
\qu (1) What is a person called who does not believe in a religion?
\qun (1) Bagaimanakah seseorang yang tidak berkepercayaan dalam Tuhan atau tidak beragama dirujuk?
\ex unbeliever, pagan, gentile, heathen, atheist, agnostic, irreligious, godless
\exn Orang yang tidak berkepercayaan dalam Tuhan, orang kafir, orang yang tidak berketurunan Yahudi dan dianggap tidak berkepercayaan kepada Tuhan Maha Esa umat Yahudi, orang yang tidak beradab kerana kejahilan perihal Tuhan dan cara beramal ibadah terhadapNya, ateis - orang yang tidak percaya akan kewujudan Tuhan, agnostik - orang yang mengingkari sebarang bukti kewujudan Tuhan, orang yang tidak beragama, orang yang tidak alim atau mangingkari Tuhan dalam kehidupan mereka
\qu (2) What words refer to a religious group, which the official religion considers to be false?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada segolongan orang yang amalan agamanya dianggap oleh pihak agama rasmi sebagai tidak benar?
\ex false religion, sect
\exn Agama palsu - kepercayaan palsu, mazhab ajaran sesat
\qu (3) What words refer to a belief, which the official religion considers to be false?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu kepercayaan (fahaman dogma) yang dianggap oleh pihak agama rasmi sebagai bercanggah dengan kebenaran?
\ex heresy, heretical, heretic, false doctrine/teaching
\exn Bidaah, yang menyimpang daripada dogma yang dianggap benar (rasmi), pembidaah, ajaran atau fahaman sesat - di luar dogma gereja
\qu (4) What words refer to thinking against God?
\qun (4) Apakah lingkungan perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mempunyai fikiran yang menentang (anti) Tuhan?
\ex disbelieve, unbelief, lack of faith, doubt, skepticism, agnosticism, atheism, paganism
\exn Enggan mempercayai, ketidakpercayaan, tidak beriman atau mempercayai sepenuhnya, meragui - waham, mempunyai kecurigaan, agnostisisme - fahaman yang mengingkari sebarang bukti kewujudan Tuhan, ateisme - ketidakpercayaan perihal kewujudan Tuhan, kekafiran
\qu (5) What words refer to speaking against God?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal mengeluarkan kata-kata yang menentang Tuhan?
\ex blaspheme, scoff, profane, irreverent
\exn Mencaci, mencemuh, mencerca kesucian - memburukkan nama Tuhan yang suci, menunjukkan sikap atau berkelakuan tidak menghormati - mengutuk
\qu (6) What words refer to acting against God?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal melakukan perkara-perkara yang bertentangan dengan kehendak Tuhan?
\ex sin, impiety, ungodly, godlessness, desecrate, sacrilege
\exn Berdosa, tidak memuliakan Tuhan, kehidupan yang mengingkari Tuhan, hidup di luar (dalam kejahilan perihal) kehendak Tuhan - hidup dalam dosa (kegelapan, kejahatan), menyalahgunakan tempat atau benda yang suci, pencemaran (pelanggaran, pencabulan) kehidupan seseorang atau sesuatu (benda, tempat dsn) yang dianggap suci atau yang telah dikuduskan
\qu (7) What words describe someone who is against God?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menjelaskan perihal seseorang yang menentang Tuhan?
\ex impious, irreligious, profane
\exn Tidak alim - tidak salih, tidak beragama- tidak berkepercayaan kepada Tuhan - t idak beramal ibadah kepada Tuhan- tiada berpegangan rohani - tidak beriman - agnostik -ateistik - murtad - anti -Tuhan Maha Esa yang benar, memburukkan (tidak memuliakan) nama Tuhan dan memfitnah umat Tuhan yang percaya dalan nama kudusNya
\qu (8) What words refer to turning away from God?
\qun (8) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal membelakangkan Tuhan atau tidak lagi mempercayai dan mentaatiNya?
\ex apostasy, backsliding, reprobate
\exn Murtad - meninggalkan kepercayaan dan hidup beramal ibadah kepada Tuhan, kembali hidup seperti orang kafir - hilang kepercayaan terhadap Tuhan - mundur beramal ibadah dalam kebenaran - hidup dalam keruntuhan moral, menyangkal Tuhan - mengutuk Tuhan - hidup dalam kejahatan atau dosa
\qu (9) What words refer to pretending to be religious?
\qun
\ex hypocrisy, hypocrite
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to extreme beliefs that are evil?
\qun
\ex fanatic, fanaticism, bigot, bigotry
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to religious practices that are done in ignorance?
\qun
\ex superstition
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to allowing other people to practice their religion?
\qun
\ex tolerance, intolerance
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.9.9
\oldqu (9) What word refer to pretending to be religious?
\oldqun (9) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal beramal ibadah dalam kepura-puraan?
\oldex hypocrisy, hypocrite
\oldexn Kemunafikan - kepura-puraan, munafik - berpura-pura
\oldqu (10) What words refer to extreme beliefs which are evil?
\oldqun (10) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada fahaman yang melampau sehigga membangkitkan kejahatan?
\oldex fanatic, fanaticism, bigot, bigotry, intolerance
\oldexn Fanatik (ajaran: sehigga menyesatkan orang) - melampau (amalan: sehingga membahayakan orang) - pelampau (sikap & kelakuan: sehigga memudaratkan kehidupan orang), kefanatikan (mengakibatkan penindasan), keterlampaua (mengakibatkan kekejaman) - keterlaluan (mengakibatkan penyeksaan, penaniayaan), tidak bertolak ansur (mengakibatkan pertelingkahan, peperangan yang berterusan dsn)
\gd I725D78EB-8CAC-4B2F-B5A4-F0A9ADB80F5D

\is 5.2.1
\sd Food preparation
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to food preparation.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to preparing food?
\qun
\ex food preparation, cook, prepare food, fix (a meal, dish), make a dish
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the person who prepares food and cooks?
\qun
\ex the cook, chef, short order cook, cookie
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a person who prepares special types of food?
\qun
\ex baker (bread), butcher (meat), confectioner (candy), brewer (alcohol)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the thing that is cooked?
\qun
\ex food, meal, dish
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the place where food is prepared and cooked?
\qun
\ex kitchen, cookhouse, bakery, butchery, food processing plant, restaurant
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe how well a person cooks?
\qun
\ex good cook, bad cook, tremendous cook, fantastic cook
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe how thoroughly something has been cooked?
\qun
\ex raw, rare, medium, well done, under done, under cooked, over cooked, burnt, burned to a crisp, crispy, charred, just right
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to a set of instructions for cooking something?
\qun
\ex recipe, ingredients, instructions, measurements
\exn
\gd I1FDA68D4-5941-4695-B656-090D603A3344

\is 5.2.1.1
\sd Cooking methods
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words referring to various ways of cooking food. It is necessary to think through different kinds of food and how they are cooked. An example is given below for cooking eggs.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to various ways of cooking food?
\qun
\ex cook, bake, baste, boil, boil over, braise, brew, broil, brown (v), fry, deep fat fry, grill, marinate, pan-fry, parboil, pickle, poach, roast, sauté, season, sift, simmer, steam, stew, stir fry
\exn
\qu (2) What ways can you cook an egg?
\qun
\ex boil, fry, scramble, poach, bake
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that has been cooked?
\qun
\ex cooked, boiled, braised, broiled, fried, grilled, marinated, parboiled, pickled, poached, sautéed, stewed
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe something that is being cooked?
\qun
\ex sizzle
\exn
\gd IFC0AFB69-A4D4-439A-91CD-ED0CE67677B5

\is 5.2.1.2
\sd Steps in food preparation
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to the steps in food preparation. One way to find the words in this domain is to describe how each type of food is prepared.
\ddn
\qu (1) What are the steps in preparing food?
\qun
\ex gather ingredients, add ingredients, pour into dish, dilute, thicken, concentrated, dissolve, sweeten
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to cutting up ingredients?
\qun
\ex shred, grate, slice, cut up, chop, dice, cube, quarter, halve, mince, grind
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to mixing ingredients?
\qun
\ex mix, stir, knead, toss, tossed, whisk, beat
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to allowing food to ripen?
\qun
\ex ripen, age (cheese), allow cream to rise, allow bread to rise
\exn
\gd I726923D4-B25C-46EB-8AB0-427207177AE3

\is 5.2.1.3

\qun

\exn

\qun
\ex refrigerator, freezer, icebox, cupboard, pantry
\exn

\qun

\is 5.2.2.2
\sd Meal
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to a meal.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to a time when people eat?
\qun
\ex meal, mealtime
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a meal eaten at a particular time of day?
\qun
\ex breakfast, lunch, supper, brunch, mid afternoon snack, midnight snack, tea, luncheon
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the main meal of the day?
\qun
\ex dinner
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a small meal?
\qun
\ex snack, light breakfast, light meal
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a meal eaten outside?
\qun
\ex picnic
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to eating a meal?
\qun
\ex dine, breakfast (v), lunch (v), snack (v)
\exn
\qu (7) What do people say at the beginning of a meal?
\qun
\ex Let's say grace. Let's thank the Lord for the food. Let's eat. Dig in.
\exn
\qu (8) What do people say when they want something?
\qun
\ex (Please) pass (the salt). May I have (the salt please).
\exn
\qu (9) What do people say when they are done eating?
\qun
\ex Thank you. May I be excused.
\exn

\is 5.2.2.4

\ddn

\qun
\ex eat before others, eat early
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to tasting a little food to see if it tastes good?
\qun
\ex taste, test, sample
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to eating a little?
\qun
\ex eat a little, nibble, snack, go on a diet, to diet, diet (n)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to eating a lot?
\qun
\ex eat a lot, eat too much, be a glutton, gluttony, eat like a pig, pig out
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to eating fast?
\qun
\ex gobble, inhale, wolf down, devour, eat fast
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to eating more than your share?
\qun
\ex eat more than your share, be greedy
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to eating two things together?
\qun
\ex (no words in English but some in North American Indian languages)
\exn

\is 5.2.3.1.1

\ddn

\ex seed, grain, cereal, bean, legume, nut
\exn
\qu (2) What types of grain are eaten?
\qun
\ex rice, wheat, corn, maize, barley, sesame, millet, sorghum, oat
\exn
\qu (3) What types of nuts are eaten?
\qun
\ex peanut, groundnut, cashew, walnut, almond, cola nut, palm nut, coconut, cocoa nut
\exn
\qu (4) What types of beans are eaten?
\qun
\ex green bean, lima bean, kidney bean, pea, cowpea, soybean
\exn
\qu (5) What other types of seeds are eaten?
\qun
\ex cottonseed, pumpkin seeds, sunflower seeds
\exn
\gd I1447278F-EFFF-4807-B9EA-C487DEA1BA5E

\is 5.2.3.2
\sd Food from animals
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words referring to eating meat and to types of animals that are eaten. Only include those animals that are commonly eaten, especially those that are domesticated.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a person (or animal) who only eats meat?
\qun
\ex carnivore, carnivorous, meat eating
\exn
\qu (2) What types of animals are eaten?
\qun
\ex beef (cow), mutton (sheep), venison (deer)
\exn
\qu (3) What types of birds are eaten?
\qun
\ex chicken, turkey
\exn
\qu (4) What types of fish are eaten?
\qun
\ex tuna, trout, sardines
\exn
\qu (5) What types of reptiles are eaten?
\qun
\ex frog legs
\exn
\qu (6) What types of insects can be eaten?
\qun
\ex edible insects, white ant, termite, grub, locust
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to honey and other insect products that can be eaten?
\qun
\ex honey
\exn
\qu (8) What types of small animals are eaten?
\qun
\ex shrimp, lobster
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to eating human flesh?
\qun
\ex cannibal
\exn
\cf Animal

\gd I1F608E18-958E-4BB3-A977-04879FB5ACD5

\is 5.2.3.4
\sd Prepared food
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words referring to prepared food. Cultures vary widely in the number and types of foods they prepare, and in how they classify them. For instance the English distinction between main dish and side dish is not found in the classification system of other languages. If your language has well-recognized subcategories, you can set up a separate subdomain for each. The questions below are based on the main ingredient in the dish.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to prepared food?
\qun
\ex cooked food, prepared food, dish, course
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a major class of prepared food?
\qun
\ex main dish, side dish, meat dish, casserole, vegetable, staple, bread, soup, salad, fruit, condiment, dessert, candy, cookie, sweets, savories, snack
\exn
\qu (3) What general words refer to a food made primarily from meat?
\qun
\ex meat dish, main dish, main course
\exn
\qu (4) What types of foods are made primarily from meat?
\qun
\ex roast beef, steak, fried chicken, fish and chips, hamburger, hotdog, pizza, spaghetti, casserole, lasagna, stew
\exn
\qu (5) What foods are made primarily from staple foods?
\qun
\ex mashed potatoes and gravy, pasta, cooked rice, stuffing, oatmeal, porridge, cereal, mush
\exn
\qu (6) What types of bread are there?
\qun
\ex bread, pastry, brown bread, white bread, biscuit, muffin, roll, sweetbread, sandwich, tortilla, toast, loaf
\exn
\qu (7) What foods are made primarily from fruit?
\qun
\ex cranberry sauce, applesauce, fruit salad
\exn
\qu (8) What foods are made primarily from vegetables?
\qun
\ex side dish, vegetable, carrot sticks, onion rings
\exn
\qu (9) What foods are made primarily from leaves and stems?
\qun
\ex salad, tossed salad, green salad, coleslaw
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to foods that contain a lot of water and are boiled?
\qun
\ex soup, tomato soup, split green pea soup, clam chowder, broth, stew, gravy
\exn
\qu (11) What types of condiments are there (foods that people only eat a little of, because they are expensive, strong tasting, or are added to other foods to flavor them)?
\qun
\ex condiment, garnish, pickle, olive, black olive, green olive, tomato sauce, catsup, mustard, mayonnaise, peanut butter, jam, jelly, preserves
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to sweet foods?
\qun
\ex dessert, sweet (n), cake, ice cream, pie, cobbler, cookie, cinnamon roll, candy, chocolate, chocolate bar, pudding, lollipop, syrup, treacle
\exn
\qu (13) What foods are eaten away from home (for instance on a journey or at work)?
\qun
\ex sack lunch, picnic lunch, dried food, C-rations, fast food
\exn
\gd IEFFC49DD-6322-4302-899C-4CF540F0E2E4

\is 5.2.3.5
\sd Prohibited food
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words that describe food that is prohibited by the culture or religion. Do not list the foods that are prohibited.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe food that is prohibited?
\qun
\ex prohibited food, taboo food, unclean
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe food that is not prohibited?
\qun
\ex kosher
\exn
\gd I2EBA12C6-7817-4DFD-9E7C-94C8B8B389EF

\qun
\ex beverage, drink
\exn
\qu (2) What types of drinks are there?
\qun
\ex water, milk, juice, tea, coffee, soda, soda pop, coke, milkshake, malt, chocolate
\exn

\is 5.2.3.7

\qun

\exn
\qu (2) What types of alcoholic drinks are there?
\qun
\ex beer, wine, rice wine, sake, mead, whiskey, vodka, millet beer, banana beer

\exn
\gd I2D894ECA-8F6C-4B63-B265-0914A65D9BE9

\is 5.2.3.7.1
\sd Alcohol preparation
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to making alcoholic beverages.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to making alcoholic beverages?
\qun
\ex brew
\exn
\qu (2) What are the steps in brewing?
\qun
\ex ferment, distill, mellow, age, ripen
\exn
\qu (3) What foodstuffs are used to make alcohol?
\qun
\ex hops, yeast, millet, corn (maize), rice
\exn
\qu (4) What equipment and materials are used to brew alcohol?
\qun
\ex distillery, brewery, still, filter
\exn
\gd IEE8A20B7-4202-489A-B8CD-BDEBAF770313

\is 5.2.3.7.2
\sd Drunk
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to drinking alcohol and the effect it has on a person.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to drinking alcohol?
\qun
\ex drink, imbibe
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to someone who drinks a lot of alcohol?
\qun
\ex drunkard, drunk, wino, alcoholic
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the effect alcohol has on a person?
\qun
\ex be drunk, be intoxicated, soused, had too many, under the influence, drink under the table
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the aftereffects of being drunk?
\qun
\ex hangover
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a drinking establishment?
\qun
\ex bar, saloon, bartender
\exn
\gd ID067B555-E53C-4C16-BB09-5314862D8BAE

\is 5.2.4
\sd Tobacco
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to using tobacco.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to tobacco?
\qun
\ex tobacco, cigarette, pack of cigarettes, cigar, pipe, chewing tobacco
\exn
\qu (2) What methods of using tobacco are there?
\qun
\ex smoke, light up, light (a cigarette), chew
\exn
\qu (3) What tools are used to smoke or chew tobacco?
\qun
\ex filter, pipe cleaner, ashtray, spittoon
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a person who smokes tobacco?
\qun
\ex smoker
\exn
\qu (5) What affect does tobacco have on a person?
\qun
\ex smokers cough, smokers hack, habit, addiction, lung cancer
\exn
\qu (6) What is produced by smoking tobacco?
\qun
\ex cigarette ash, cigarette smoke, cigarette butt
\exn
\qu (7) What does tobacco contain?
\qun
\ex nicotine, tar
\exn
\gd IC6688928-6694-4264-8048-A60B665B5793

\is 5.2.5
\sd Narcotic
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to narcotics and drugs that are not used as medicine but as stimulants. Narcotics are often addicting and harmful to a person's health.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to narcotics?
\qun
\ex narcotic, drug
\exn
\qu (2) What types of narcotics are there?
\qun
\ex marijuana, bhang, LSD, heroin, opium
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to taking drugs?
\qun
\ex take drugs, be on drugs
\exn
\qu (4) What tools are used to take drugs?
\qun
\ex drug paraphernalia
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a person who takes drugs?
\qun
\ex addict, user, junkie
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a dosage of drugs?
\qun
\ex joint
\exn
\qu (7) What affect do drugs have on people?
\qun
\ex addiction, dependence, be high
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to being addicted to drugs?
\qun
\ex be addicted, dependent, be hooked
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to the need for drugs?
\qun
\ex addiction, habit, dependence
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe a drug that makes people addicted?
\qun
\ex addictive
\exn
\gd I3710E019-46C9-44DB-A0AA-9054D3126161

\is 5.2.6

\ddn

\qun
\ex stimulant
\exn
\qu (2) What types of stimulants are there?

\ex coffee, tea, mate, hookah, chewing gum, beetle nut
\exn

\is 5.3.4
\sd Clothes for special occasions
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words referring to special clothes worn on special occasions. It is necessary to think through all the various special occasions in the culture and think of any special clothes worn on those occasions. Two examples are given below for work and graduation, but there are many others.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to clothes worn on a special occasion?
\qun
\ex sports clothes, work clothes, formal clothes, informal, office wear
\exn
\qu (2) What special clothes are worn for work?
\qun
\ex work clothes, overalls, coveralls, apron, work gloves, hardhat, steel-toed shoes, boots, goggles
\exn
\qu (3) What special clothes are worn for graduation?
\qun
\ex cap and gown
\exn
\gd IC3B808D4-D94E-4C8E-B7B2-87B4F4A83198

\is 5.3.5
\sd Clothes for special people
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for special clothes worn by special people. It is necessary to think through all the various special types of people in the culture and think of any special clothes worn by them. Several examples are given below, but there are many others.
\ddn
\qu (1) What special clothes are worn by police or soldiers?
\qun
\ex uniform, dress uniform, fatigues, camouflage, helmet, beret, cap, gasmask, braid
\exn
\qu (2) What kinds of uniforms are there?
\qun
\ex police uniform, military uniform, nurse's uniform, band uniform
\exn
\qu (3) What special clothes are worn by religious people?
\qun
\ex habit (nun), cowl (monk), robe
\exn
\qu (4) What special clothes are worn by the king?
\qun
\ex purple cloth, crown, royal robes
\exn
\qu (5) What special clothes are worn by doctors?
\qun
\ex greens, surgical suit, white coat, nurses cap
\exn
\gd IC817AF65-7CC8-4105-A8ED-47067D97B73B

\is 5.3.6
\sd Parts of clothing
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to parts of clothing.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to parts of clothing?
\qun
\ex belt loop, bodice, collar, cowl, crease, cuff, fringe, hem, hood, lapel, leg, neck, neckband, neckline, placket, pocket, sash, seam, seat, shirttail, skirt, sleeve, slit, tassel, waist, waistband, waistline
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to parts of shoes?
\qun
\ex sole, shoelace, bootlace, eye, tongue, toe, heel, insole, strap, buckle, thong
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to parts of hats?
\qun
\ex brim, peak, ribbon
\exn
\qu (4) What things are used to hold parts of clothes together?
\qun
\ex belt buckle, button, buttonhole, clasp, cuff-link, lace, snap, zip, zipper
\exn
\gd I40516AF2-D413-418E-8B68-8443847EE169

\is 5.3.7
\sd Wear clothing
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to wearing clothing.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to wearing clothing?
\qun
\ex wear, have on, be clothed, clad, shod
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to putting clothing on?
\qun
\ex to dress, get dressed, put on, clothe, get into, throw on, jump into, don, tuck in, button, zip, tie
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to taking clothing off?
\qun
\ex to undress, get undressed, take off, strip, rip off, get out of
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to not wearing a piece of clothing?
\qun
\ex barefoot, shoeless, shirtless, hatless, unshod, topless
\exn
\gd I4445CCCD-E9B9-4F25-9E8C-2EF58408297D

\is 5.3.8
\sd Naked
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to being naked--not wearing any clothes, and for words referring to how a person feels about being naked. It is a part of universal human experience that people do not want to be naked. So there are words that refer to feeling bad if one does not have enough clothes on (shame). Other words refer to wanting to have enough clothes (modest). Other words refer to how people feel about other people who do not wear enough clothes (indecent).
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to being naked?
\qun
\ex be naked, nakedness, nude, nudity, unclothed, nothing on, not have anything on, stripped, bare, expose (oneself)
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to not wearing enough clothes?
\qun
\ex dress immodestly, immodest, impropriety, indecent
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to not wanting to be naked?
\qun
\ex modest, propriety, decent
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling bad if you are naked?
\qun
\ex shame, embarrassed, blush
\exn
\gd I5450043D-907B-4884-A9E5-35CFD5935947

\is 5.3.9
\sd Style of clothing
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to clothing styles.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe the style of your clothing?
\qun
\ex style, stylish, in style, fashion, out of fashion, modern, traditional, old-fashioned
\exn
\gd I72D9B7CD-AA06-4F7B-A66B-B992171D2CD4

\is 5.4
\sd Adornment
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to adornment.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to making yourself look better?
\qun
\ex adorn, beautify, make oneself attractive, personal care, hygiene, toilet, look your best
\exn
\qu (2) What general words refer to things people put on themselves in addition to clothes?
\qun
\ex adornment, accessories, decoration
\exn
\gd I15947464-997A-4F44-9A4B-AC4916E7E19B

\is 5.4.1
\sd Jewelry
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for objects such as jewelry that are put on or attached to the body or to the clothes as decoration.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to jewelry?
\qun
\ex jewelry, accessory, ornament
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to types of jewelry?
\qun
\ex earring, necklace, brooch, hairclip, comb, belt, hat, glasses, sunglasses, handkerchief
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to jewelry worn on the hands and arms?
\qun
\ex ring, bracelet, watch, armband, cuff link, bangle
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to jewelry worn on the legs?
\qun
\ex anklet
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to putting on or having on jewelry?
\qun
\ex bedeck, adorn
\exn
\gd I844F922B-6FB6-49AA-864B-B1C49EDAA1AE

\is 5.5
\sd Fire
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for general words that refer to fire and for words referring to types of fire. These words may be specific for what is being burned (forest fire 'a fire burning a forest'), the size of the fire (inferno 'a very large hot fire'), or the place where the fire burns (hellfire 'the fire in hell').
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to a fire?
\qun
\ex fire, combustion
\exn
\qu (2) What types of fire are there?
\qun
\ex fireball, torch, firebrand, fireworks, firecracker, burn a field before planting
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to what is being burned?
\qun
\ex house fire, forest fire, grass fire, wood fire, oil fire
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the size of the fire?
\qun
\ex spark, flame, flicker, finger, tongue, flare, blaze, conflagration, inferno, raging inferno
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to where the fire is?
\qun
\ex campfire, hellfire
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a fire started by accident?
\qun
\ex blaze, the flames
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a fire started on purpose?
\qun
\ex cook fire, bonfire, controlled fire
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to deliberately burning something?
\qun
\ex burn something, set something on fire, set fire to, torch (v)
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to the crime of burning someone's house or field?
\qun
\ex arson, arsonist
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe something that burns easily?
\qun
\ex flammable, inflammable, combustible
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something that will not burn?
\qun
\ex fireproof, unburnable, fire-resistant, unquenchable
\exn
\gd IFF7E3ABD-6810-4128-83C9-701B4925C2FE

\is 5.5.1
\sd Light a fire
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to lighting a fire.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words are used of a person starting a fire?
\qun
\ex light a fire, build a fire, make a fire, start a fire, ignite, light a match, set on fire, set fire to something, blow into flames, kindle
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to something beginning to burn?
\qun
\ex catch fire, start burning, burst into flames, spark, smolder
\exn
\qu (3) What things are used to start fires?
\qun
\ex match, matchstick, matchbox, flint and steel, cigarette lighter, lighter fluid, tinderbox
\exn
\qu (4) What materials are used as kindling?
\qun
\ex kindling, tinder, punk
\exn
\gd I1438C623-C4CE-4559-B71B-CFB86A71E6D7

\is 5.5.2
\sd Tend a fire
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words that refer to tending a fire--to keep a fire burning so that it burns well and does not go out.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to keeping a fire burning?
\qun
\ex tend a fire
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to adding fuel to a fire?
\qun
\ex feed a fire, stoke a fire, throw another log on the fire
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to blowing on a fire to make it bigger?
\qun
\ex fan a fire, fan into flames, blow on a fire, bellows, pump bellows
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to making a fire bigger?
\qun
\ex build up a fire
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to restarting a fire that has died down?
\qun
\ex rekindle
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to keeping a fire from going out, such as covering a fire with ashes to keep it from going out during the night?
\qun
\ex bank a fire
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to taking something out of a fire?
\qun
\ex pull out of the fire, snatch from the flames
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to something taken out of a fire?
\qun
\ex firebrand
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to a person who is responsible to make sure the fire does not go out?
\qun
\ex preserver of the fire
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to sharing fire with a neighbor whose fire has gone out?
\qun
\ex (no words in English)
\exn
\qu (11) What things are used to carry fire?
\qun
\ex fire pan, brazier
\exn
\qu (12) What tools are used to tend a fire?
\qun
\ex poker, tongs, wick trimmer, snuffer
\exn
\gd I9A456463-3C71-4F9A-8117-DC2FCB087BD3

\is 5.5.3
\sd Extinguish a fire
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for all the ways a person can stop a fire.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a fire stopping?
\qun
\ex die down, go out, burn itself out
\exn
\qu (2) What general words are used of a person stopping a fire?
\qun
\ex extinguish, put out (a fire), fight (a fire), stub out (a cigarette)
\exn
\qu (3) What words are used of stopping a fire with water?
\qun
\ex douse (a fire), quench (a fire)
\exn
\qu (4) What words are used of stopping a fire by blowing on it?
\qun
\ex blow out (a candle)
\exn
\qu (5) What words are used of stopping a fire by covering it?
\qun
\ex smother (a fire), snuff out (a flame)
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a person whose job is to stop fires?
\qun
\ex fireman, firefighter
\exn
\qu (7) What equipment is used to stop a fire?
\qun
\ex fire engine, fire truck, fire extinguisher
\exn
\gd I514974A2-C2FD-4B25-A24D-2FF52FA3D798

\is 5.5.4
\sd Burn
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for verbs that are used of fire: "The fire is ____." In some languages there are verbs for what is happening to the thing that is burning: "The house is ____."
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a fire burning?
\qun
\ex burn
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe a fire that is burning well?
\qun
\ex blaze, ablaze, burn fiercely, burn brightly, burn hot
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe a fire that is not burning well?
\qun
\ex die down, smolder
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe a fire that starts to burn again after having died down?
\qun
\ex flare up, flame up
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe the appearance of fire?
\qun
\ex flicker, dance, glow
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a fire burning something?
\qun
\ex burn something
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to something burning partly?
\qun
\ex blacken, scorch, singe
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to something burning completely?
\qun
\ex burn up, burn down, burn to the ground, consume, incinerate, destroy by fire, reduce to ashes
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to a fire making something hot?
\qun
\ex to heat something, to warm something
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to something burning?
\qun
\ex be burning, go up in flames, go up in smoke, be in flames
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something that has been burned?
\qun
\ex burnt
\exn
\gd I2933A9C1-AA62-46FB-A03C-68AED7FAE9B7

\is 5.5.5
\sd What fires produce
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to the things that fires produce.
\ddn
\qu (1) What do fires produce?
\qun
\ex flames, heat, light, smoke, fumes, exhaust, sparks, ash, soot
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a fire giving off something?
\qun
\ex to smoke, give off sparks, send up sparks, give off heat, glow
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to smoke?
\qun
\ex smoke, smoky, blue with smoke, haze, smog
\exn
\qu (4) What do sparks do?
\qun
\ex shoot up, fly out, land on things
\exn
\qu (5) What sounds do fires make?
\qun
\ex crackle, pop, hiss, roar of the flames
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to wood after it has been burning?
\qun
\ex embers, coals, live coals
\exn
\qu (7) What is left behind by a fire?
\qun
\ex ash, blackened wood, charred remains
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to the material that is left on things near a fire?
\qun
\ex soot
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to an area of ground that has been burned?
\qun
\ex burn (n), burned off area
\exn
\gd IB93BDFA4-486C-44A0-8266-557CCDC78B31

\is 5.5.6
\sd Fuel
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for types of fuel and for words used in making, collecting, storing, or using fuel. This domain includes the scenario of collecting firewood.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the thing that is burned by a fire?
\qun
\ex fuel
\exn
\qu (2) What types of things are normally used as fuel?
\qun
\ex wood, coal, charcoal, oil, gas, candle wax, kindling
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to firewood?
\qun
\ex firewood, bundle of firewood, piece of firewood, stack of firewood
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to collecting fuel?
\qun
\ex collect, gather, pick up, chop firewood, split firewood
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to charcoal?
\qun
\ex charcoal
\exn
\qu (6) What words are used for making charcoal?
\qun
\ex cook
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to liquid fuel?
\qun
\ex liquid fuel, gasoline (petrol), gas, kerosene (paraffin), diesel, candle wax, oil (lamp)
\exn
\qu (8) What containers are used to hold liquid fuels?
\qun
\ex gas can, jerry can
\exn
\gd I9FC25175-3B4A-4248-BC7F-B86012EC584F

\is 5.5.7
\sd Fireplace
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for any place where fires are normally burned.
\ddn
\qu (1) Where do people light fires?
\qun
\ex fireplace, stove, lamp, lantern, candle, trash heap, firepot, incinerator, furnace, heater, kiln, barbeque, forge, blast furnace, crematorium, brazier, range, cooker, gas ring, burner
\exn
\qu (2) What are the parts of a fireplace?
\qun
\ex hearth, flue, grate, fireguard, screen, chimney, mantle, fender, hob, trivet
\exn
\qu (3) What are the parts of a stove?
\qun
\ex oven, burner, grill
\exn
\qu (4) What are the parts of a candle?
\qun
\ex candlestick, wax, wick
\exn
\qu (5) What are the parts of a lamp?
\qun
\ex lamp stand, oil, wick
\exn
\gd I70164474-A65B-4506-9953-F26AFB6B497A

\is 5.6.4

\qun
\ex soak, scrub, rinse, wring, hang up (to dry), dry, take down, iron, fold, put away, hang up

\qun

\ex dust cloth, rag, eraser, rubber
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the dirt that is removed?
\qun
\ex dust
\exn
\gd IC09EEDD3-C4E1-4CF9-B6D1-A01624C6426A

\is 5.7
\sd Sleep
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to sleeping.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words are used of being asleep?
\qun
\ex be asleep, sleep
\exn
\qu (2) What words are used of a good sleep?
\qun
\ex sleep well, sleep peacefully
\exn
\qu (3) What words are used of a bad sleep?
\qun
\ex sleep poorly, sleep badly, sleep fitfully
\exn
\qu (4) What words are used of a light sleep?
\qun
\ex light sleep, doze, half asleep
\exn
\qu (5) What words are used of a deep sleep?
\qun
\ex be in a deep sleep, be really out, sleep deeply, sleep soundly, sound asleep
\exn
\qu (6) What words are used of sleeping during the day?
\qun
\ex nap, take a nap, rest, take a rest
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to sleeping someplace unusual, for instance in someone else's house, or outside?
\qun
\ex sleepover, sleep outside, sleep under the stars, camp, campout, bivouac
\exn
\qu (8) What words are used of urinating while asleep?
\qun
\ex wet the bed
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to talking in your sleep?
\qun
\ex talk in your sleep
\exn
\cf Rest

\gd ID502512C-966B-4752-8636-716FB29FACFE

\is 5.7.1
\sd Go to sleep
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to going to bed and going to sleep.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to getting ready for bed?
\qun
\ex get ready for bed, go to bed, turn in
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to getting into bed?
\qun
\ex get into bed, crawl into bed, curl up in bed, get under the covers, crawl under the covers, fall into bed (exhausted), jump in bed
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to going to sleep?
\qun
\ex go to sleep, fall asleep, drop off, sink into a deep sleep
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to feeling like you want to sleep?
\qun
\ex drowsiness, drowsy, sleepiness, sleepy, somnolence, somnolent, soporific
\exn
\qu (5) What are the symptoms of beginning to go to sleep?
\qun
\ex nod, yawn, stretch, eyelids droop
\exn
\qu (6) What do you say when you are beginning to go to sleep?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe (I'm) fading fast. (I'm really) tired. (I think I'll) go to bed. (I'm not going to) last much longer. (I can't) stay awake.
\xen
\qu (7) What words are used of someone causing someone to go to sleep?
\qun
\ex put to sleep, put to bed
\exn
\qu (8) What words are used of the time when you go to sleep?
\qun
\ex bedtime, nighttime, time to go to sleep
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to going to bed early or late?
\qun
\ex early night, late night, stay up
\exn
\qu (10) What does someone say to someone else who is going to sleep?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe goodnight, sleep tight, pleasant dreams, sweet dreams
\xen
\qu (11) What special clothes are used when sleeping?
\qun
\ex pajamas, pj's, jammies, nightgown, nightie, nightclothes
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to staying awake and not going to sleep?
\qun
\ex stay up (late), stay awake
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to preventing someone from going to sleep?
\qun
\ex keep (someone) awake
\exn

\is 6.1.1
\sd Worker
\sdn Pekerja
\oldis 6.1.1
\oldsd Worker
\oldsdn Pekerja
\dd Use this domain for words related to a worker.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to a person who works?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata am yang merujuk kepada orang yang bekerja?
\ex worker, laborer
\exn pekerja, buruh
\qu (2) What words refer to a person who works in a particular place?
\qun (2) Apakah kata-kata am yang merujuk kepada seorang yang bekerja di dalam tempat tertentu?
\ex butler (house), field hand, farm hand (fields), ranch hand (ranch)
\exn Ketua pesuruh lelaki (rumah), buruh di ladang, buruh di ladang ternak
\qu (3) What words refer to a person who works for someone else?
\qun (3) Apakah kata-kata am yang merujuk kepada seorang yang bekerja untuk orang lain?
\ex hired hand, employee, servant, hireling, slave
\exn pekerja upahan, pekerja, orang gaji, pembantu rumah, orang upahan
\qu (4) What words refer to a person who works for a day or a few days?
\qun (4) Apakah kata-kata am yang merujuk kepada seorang yang bekerja untuk sehari atau beberapa hari?
\ex day laborer, temporary help, casual worker
\exn pekerja harian, pembantu sementara, pekerja sambilan
\qu (5) What words refer to a person who works for only part of a day, or for the whole day?
\qun (5) Apakah kata-kata am yang merujuk kepada seorang yang hanya bekerja setengah hari atau sepanjang hari?
\ex part-time worker, full-time worker
\exn pekerja sambilan, pekerja penuh masa
\qu (6) What words refer to a person who works with a particular material or animal?
\qun (6) Apakah kata-kata am yang merujuk kepada seorang yang bekerja dengan bahan tertentu atau binatang?
\ex carpenter (wood), blacksmith (iron/metal), cowboy (cattle), shepherd (sheep)
\exn tukang kayu, tukang besi, gembala lembu (lelaki), gembala (domba)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.1.1

\is 6.1.1.1
\sd Expert
\sdn Pakar
\oldis 6.1.1.2
\oldsd Expert
\oldsdn Pakar
\dd Use this domain for words related to being an expert--someone who can do something well.
\ddn Gunakan bidang fikiran ini untuk kata-kata yang berkaitan dengan menjadi pakar -seorang yang dapat melakukan sesuatu itu dengan baik.
\qu (1) What words refer to an expert?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada seorang pakar?
\ex expert, professional, master, craftsman, specialist, old hand, old-timer, the best we have, leader in his field, on the cutting edge, senior, graduate, doctor, consultant, trainer, teacher, is degreed, has a degree
\exn pakar, profesional, tukang, pekerja mahir, tangan lama, orang lama, yang terbaik kita ada, pemimpin dalam bidangnya, lebih tua, graduan, doktor, konsultan, jurulatih, guru, berijazah.
\qu (2) What words are used to refer to the knowledge or ability of an expert?
\qun (2) Apakah kata-kata yang digunakan untuk merujuk kepada pengetahuan atau kebolehan seorang pakar?
\ex expertise, knowledge, expert knowledge, experience, ability, craftsmanship, training, understanding, proficiency
\exn kepakaran, pengetahuan, kepakaran pengetahuan, pengalaman, kemampuan, kemahiran, latihan, pengertian, kecekapan
\qu (3) What words describe an expert?
\qun (3) Apakah kata-kata yang menggambarkan seorang pakar?
\ex the best we have, leader in his field, on the cutting edge, master (craftsman), expert (machinist), leading (scholar), degreed (scholar), foremost (expert), knowledgeable, experienced, able (seaman), well-trained, proficient, capable, clever, skilled, skillful
\exn yang terbaik kita ada, pemimpin di dalam bidangnya, tukang, pakar (mesin), pemimpin (sarjana), berijazah (sarjana), terutama (pakar), berpengetahuan, berpengalaman, mampu (kelasi kapal), terlatih baik, cekap, berkemampuan, pandai
\qu (4) What words are used to refer to someone who is not an expert?
\qun (4) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada seorang yang bukan pakar?
\ex student, apprentice, trainee, novice, jack-of-all-trades, greenhorn, beginner, new recruit, plebe, freshman
\exn pelajar, pekerja baru, pelatih, orang baru, budak mentah, baru mula, rekrut baru, orang bawahan, penuntut tahun pertama di pengajian tinggi
\qu (5) What words describe someone who is not an expert?
\qun (5) Apakah kata-kata yang menggambarkan seorang yang bukan pakar?
\ex green, beginning (student), new, uninitiated, ignorant, untrained, inexperienced, unknowledgeable
\exn hijau, bermula (pelajar), baru, belum disahkan, tidak tahu, tidak terlatih, tidak berpengalaman, tidak berpengetahuan

\is 6.1.2.1
\sd Try, attempt
\sdn
\oldis 6.1.2.1
\oldsd Try
\oldsdn Cuba
\dd Use this domain for words indicating that someone is trying to do something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to trying to do something?
\qun
\ex try, attempt, make an attempt, experiment, test, make a stab at it, give it a go, try it out, see if it works, make an effort, aim to do something, assay, endeavor, essay, seek to do something, strain, struggle, undertake, venture, give it a whirl, have a try, try and do something, see if you can do something
\exn
\xe John <tried> to bake bread.
\xen
\qu (2) What words refer to trying hard to do something?
\qun
\ex do your best, try your best, put your mind to it, make an effort, be at pains to do something, strive, to the best of your ability, do the best you can, as best you can, give something your best
\exn
\xe John is <striving> to earn enough money to buy a bicycle.
\xen
\qu (3) What words refer to doing all you can when you are trying to do something?
\qun
\ex try for all your worth, do your utmost, do everything you can, do all you can, give your all, pull out all the stops, struggle to do something, go to great lengths to do something
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to trying to do something, even though you are unlikely to succeed?
\qun
\ex have a go, have a stab at, give it a go, put up a good show
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to trying hard to get something that you really want?
\qun
\ex try for, go for, try out for, shoot for, make a bid for, struggle for, go all out, go after
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to trying hard to do something for someone?
\qun
\ex bend over backwards to do something, go out of your way to do something, take the trouble to do something
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to doing something in order to try to do something else?
\qun
\ex try and do something, in an effort to do something, in an attempt to do something
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to an attempt to do something?
\qun
\ex attempt (n), endeavor (n), try (n), campaign, drive
\exn
\xe The <attempt> was unsuccessful.
\xen

\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who works too hard?

\ex overburdened, worn
\exn

\is 6.1.3.4
\sd Advantage
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to having an advantage--something that helps you succeed that other people don't have.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to an advantage?
\qun
\ex advantage, asset, privilege
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to having an advantage over other people?
\qun
\ex have an advantage, be at an advantage, have something on your side, the odds are stacked in your favor, have a head start, have everything going for you, hold all the cards, have the upper hand, be in a strong position, be in a position of strength
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that something gives one person an advantage over others?
\qun
\ex give someone an advantage, give someone the edge, be to someone's advantage, be in someone's favor, favor (v)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a disadvantage?
\qun
\ex disadvantage, handicap, drawback, liability, limitations
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to having a disadvantage compared with other people?
\qun
\ex have a disadvantage, be at a disadvantage, be handicapped, the odds are stacked against you, disadvantaged
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something gives someone a disadvantage?
\qun
\ex be to someone's disadvantage, be against
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the advantages and disadvantages of something?
\qun
\ex advantages and disadvantages, pros and cons, pluses and minuses
\exn
\gd I7C6BA6E5-D81E-4a50-A111-C946A0793378

\is 6.2.1
\sd Growing crops
\sdn Penanaman tanam-tanaman
\oldis 6.2.1
\oldsd Growing crops
\oldsdn Penanaman tanam-tanaman
\dd Use this domain for general words related to growing crops. If one crop is cultivated extensively and there are many words related to it, set up a separate domain for it.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk kata-kata yang berkaitan dengan penanaman tanam-tanaman. Jika satu tanaman itu ditanam secara besar-besaran dan banyak lagi kata-kata yang berkaitan dengannya, buatlah satu bidang lingkungan yang lain untuknya.
\qu (1) What words refer to growing crops?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada penanaman?
\ex grow, cultivate, raise, farm (v), garden (v), produce
\exn menanam, memelihara, berladang, berkebun
\qu (2) What words refer to something that is grown?
\qun
\ex crop, produce (n)
\exn

\is 6.2.1.1
\sd Growing grain
\sdn Penanaman bijirin
\oldis 6.2.1.1
\oldsd Growing grain
\oldsdn Penanaman bijirin
\dd Use this domain for general words related to growing grain crops such as barley, maize (corn), millet, oats, rice, rye, sesame, sorghum, and wheat. If one crop is cultivated extensively and there are many words related to it, set up a separate domain for it. This has already been done for rice, wheat, and maize, since they are so common around the world.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to growing grain?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada penanaman bijirin?
\ex grow grain, sheaf, winnow
\exn menanam bijirin/biji-bijian

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.2.4.5
\gd I0698B0F4-0A31-4A70-9262-8D36677D8FAA

\is 6.2.5
\sd Harvest
\sdn Tuai
\oldis 6.2.5
\oldsd Harvest
\oldsdn Tuai
\dd Use this domain for words related to harvesting crops. If there is an important crop and there are a lot of words that refer to harvesting it, set up a special domain for it, such as 'Harvest rice' or 'Harvest coconuts'. If there is more than one such crop, set up a separate domain for each of them.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk kata-kata yang berkaitan dengan menuai tanam-tanaman. Jika ada satu tanaman yang penting dan ada banyak kata-kata yang merujuk kepada cara menuainya, buatlah satu bidang lingkungan untuknya, seperti "Menuai Padi"atau "Menuai kelapa". Jika ada lebih daripada satu tanaman seperti itu, buatlah satu bidang lingkungan untuk setiapnya.
\qu (1) What words refer to harvesting?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada menuai?
\ex harvest, reap, gather in the harvest
\exn menuai, memetik, mengumpulkan tuaian
\qu (2) What special words are used for harvesting each crop?
\qun (2) Apakah kata-kata istimewa yang digunakan untuk menuai setiap tanaman itu?
\ex harvest maize, harvest rice, harvest yams, harvest beans, pick fruit, pluck an apple, dig potatoes, pull carrots, cut vegetables
\exn menuai jagung, menuai padi, mencabut keladi, memetik kacang, memetik buah, memetik apel, menggali kentang, mencabut lobak merah, memotong sayur
\qu (3) What words refer to what is harvested?
\qun (3) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada apa yang dituai?
\ex crop, harvest, yield
\exn tuaian, hasil
\qu (4) What tools and machines are used to harvest crops?
\qun (4) Apakah alat-alat dan mesin yang digunakan untuk menuai tanam-tanaman?
\ex harvester
\exn mesin penuai, sabit
\qu (5) What is done to a field after the crops are harvested?
\qun (5) Apakah yang dibuat untuk ladang yang sudah dituai?
\ex lie fallow, animals graze, plow under plants
\exn dibiarkan, tempat haiwan meragut rumput
\qu (6) What words describe a crop that is ready to harvest?
\qun
\ex ripe
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the time of harvest?
\qun
\ex harvest, harvest time
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.2.5
\gd IC2630384-2F72-4A96-BAED-3FFF03383362

\is 6.2.5.1
\sd First fruits
\sdn Buah pertama
\oldis 6.2.5.1
\oldsd First fruits
\oldsdn Buah pertama
\dd Use this domain for words referring to the first fruits or crops to be harvested.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk merujuk kepada kata-kata tentang buah pertama atau tanam-tanaman yang akan dituai.
\qu (1) What words refer to the first fruits to be harvested?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada buah pertama yang akan dituai?
\ex first fruits, eat first of new crops
\exn buah pertama, makan buah yang baru

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.2.5.1

\is 6.2.5.2
\sd Crop failure
\sdn Kegagalan tanam-tanaman
\oldis 6.2.5.3
\oldsd Crop failure
\oldsdn Kegagalan tanam-tanaman
\dd Use this domain for words related to crop failure.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to crop failure?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada kegagalan hasil?
\ex crop failure, poor harvest
\exn kegagalan tanam-tanaman, tuaian yang tidak memuaskan atau baik
\qu (2) What causes crop failure?
\qun (2) Apakah penyebab kegagalan tanaman?
\ex drought, blight, disease, locusts, insect plague, storm, exhausted soil, bad seed
\exn kemarau, penyakit, belalang, serangan serangga, ribut, tanah tidak subur, benih tidak baik
\qu (3) What results from crop failure?
\qun (3) Apakah akibat dari kegagalan tanaman?
\ex famine, lean times
\exn kebuluran, masa kekurangan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.2.5.3

\is 6.2.5.3
\sd Gather wild plants
\sdn Mengumpulkan tanaman liar
\oldis 6.2.5.4
\oldsd Gather wild plants
\oldsdn Mengumpulkan tanaman liar
\dd Use this domain for words related to gathering wild plants. In a hunter-gatherer culture this domain might need to be extensively developed.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk kata-kata yang berkaitan dengan mengumpulkan tanaman liar. Dalam kebudayaan memburu dan mengumpulkan hasil hutan bidang lingkungan ini mungkin perlu dikembangkan lebih luas
\qu (1) What words refer to gathering wild plants?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada mengumpulkan tanaman liar?
\ex gather, collect, pick (berries)
\exn mengumpulkan, mengutip, memetik (buah)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.2.5.4
\gd IA8BFD196-8B54-4084-B11A-FE6E8BC5DA4C

\is 6.2.5.4
\sd Plant product
\sdn Hasil tanaman
\oldis 6.2.5.5
\oldsd Plant product
\oldsdn Hasil tanaman
\dd Use this domain for words referring to materials and substances that are taken from plants and used for various purposes. It is necessary to think through various types of plants to think of what materials are taken from each.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk kata-kata yang merujuk kepada bahan-bahan dan apa yang diambil dari tanaman untuk kegunaan yang berbeza-beza. Ianya penting untuk memikirkan jenis-jenis tanaman dan apakah yang diambil daripada setiap satu.
\qu (1) What plant products are used for building?
\qun (1) Apakah hasil tanaman yang digunakan untuk bangunan?
\ex wood
\exn kayu, kulit kayu
\qu (2) What plant products are used for the roof of a building?
\qun (2) Apakah hasil tanaman yang digunakan untuk atap bangunan?
\ex thatch, shingle
\exn jerami, genting
\qu (3) What plant products are used for fibers, thread, and rope?
\qun (3) Apakah hasil tanaman yang digunakan untuk gentian, benang dan tali?gentian, kapas
\ex hemp, cotton
\exn
\qu (4) What plant products are used for chemicals?
\qun (4) Apakah hasil tanaman yang digunakan untuk bahan kimia?
\ex sap, rubber
\exn getah
\qu (5) What plant products are used for burning?
\qun (5) Apakah hasil tanaman yang digunakan untuk dibakar?
\ex firewood
\exn kayu api

\exn baja

\qun (6) Apakah bahagian setiap alat itu?
\ex tip, edge, handle, blade
\exn hujung, mata, pemegang

\is 6.3.1
\sd Domesticated animal
\sdn Binatang pelihara
\oldis 6.3.1
\oldsd Domesticated animal
\oldsdn Binatang pelihara
\dd Use this domain for words related to domesticated animals. Add extra domains for specific domesticated animals in your culture such as elephants in east Asia, camels in the Middle East, and llamas in South America.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a domesticated animal?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada binatang peliharaan?
\ex domesticated animal, livestock, pet
\exn binatang pelihara, binatang ternakan
\qu (2) What words refer to domesticating an animal?
\qun (2) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada menjinakkan binatang?
\ex domesticate, tame, break (horse)
\exn menjinakkan, memelihara
\qu (3) What words describe an animal that has been domesticated?
\qun
\ex domesticated, tamed, broken in
\exn
\qu (4) What animals are commonly domesticated?
\qun (4) Apakah binatang-binatang yang biasanya dipelihara?lembu, kambing, kambing biri-biri, keledai, anjing, kucing, ayam, itik, angsa, ayam belanda
\ex cow, goat, sheep, horse, donkey, dog, cat, chicken, duck, goose, turkey
\exn

\oldexn dijinakkan, dipelihara

\is 6.3.1.1
\sd Cattle
\sdn Lembu
\oldis 6.3.1.1
\oldsd Cattle
\oldsdn Lembu
\dd Use this domain for words related to cattle and the care of cattle.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk kata-kata yang berkaitan dengan lembu dan penjagaan lembu.
\qu (1) What words refer to cattle?
\qun (1) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada lembu?
\ex cattle, bovine
\exn lembu
\qu (2) What words refer to male or female cattle?
\qun (2) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada lembu jantan dan lembu betina?lembu jantan, lembu betina
\ex bull, cow
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to young cattle?
\qun (3) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada anak lembu?
\ex calf, bullock, heifer
\exn anak lembu
\qu (4) What words refer to a castrated bull?
\qun (4) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada lembu janta yang dikembirikan?
\ex ox, steer
\exn lembu jantan
\qu (5) What types of cows are there?
\qun
\ex Angus, aurochs, Brahma, Guernsey, Holstein, Jersey, longhorn, shorthorn
\exn
\qu (6) What are the parts of a cow?
\qun (6) Apakah bahagian seekor lembu betina?
\ex udder
\exn tetek, yang menghasilkan susu
\qu (7) How do cattle eat?
\qun (7) Bagaimanakah lembu makan?meragut, mengunyah
\ex graze, chew the cud
\exn
\qu (8) What sounds do cows make?
\qun (8) Apakah bunyi yang lembu buat?
\ex moo, low, bellow, snort
\exn moo, lenguh, mendengus, melaung, menguak
\qu (9) Where are cows kept?
\qun (9) Di manakah lembu betina disimpan?
\ex cow pasture, cattle range, cow barn, cowshed, stall
\exn ladang lembu, bangsal lembu, kandang lembu,padang ragut
\qu (10) What do cows produce?
\qun (10) Apakah yang dihasilkan oleh lembu betina?
\ex milk, blood, meat
\exn susu, darah, daging,
\qu (11) What is the meat of a cow called?
\qun (11) Apakah nama daging lembu itu?
\ex beef, steak, hamburger, minced meat, rump roast, fillet
\exn daging, stik, hamburger, daging kisar

\is 6.3.1.7
\sd Beast of burden
\sdn Binatang mengangkat beban
\oldis 6.3.1.7
\oldsd Beast of burden
\oldsdn Binatang mengangkat beban
\dd Use this domain for words related to animals that are used as a beast of burden--either to ride, to carry loads, or to pull vehicles. The questions refer to horses, but can be applied to any animal.
\ddn Gunakan bidang lingkungan ini untuk kata-kata yang berkaitan dengan binatang yang mengangkat beban - sama ada ditunggang, mengangkat muatan atau menarik kenderaan. Soalan-soalan yang merujuk kepada kuda, tetapi juga boleh juga dikaitkan dengan binatang apa sahaja
\qu (1) What types of beasts of burden are there?
\qun (1) Apakah jenis binatang yang mengangkat beban?
\ex beast of burden, horse, equine, donkey, burro, ass, mule, camel, llama, elephant
\exn kuda, keledai, baghal, unta
\qu (2) What words refer to male or female horses?
\qun (2) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada kuda betina atau jantan?
\ex stallion, mare
\exn kuda jantan, kuda betina
\qu (3) What words refer to young horses?
\qun (3) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada anak kuda?
\ex colt, foal, filly
\exn anak kuda
\qu (4) What words refer to a castrated male horse?
\qun (4) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada kuda jantan yang dikembiri?
\ex gelding
\exn kuda jantan yang dikembiri
\qu (5) What types of horses are there?
\qun
\ex Arabian, pinto, pony, thoroughbred, racehorse
\exn
\qu (6) Where are horses kept?
\qun (6) Di manakah kuda disimpan?
\ex stable, pasture, range, barn, shed, stall
\exn kandang kuda, padang ragut
\qu (7) What equipment is used to ride or harness a horse?
\qun (7) Apakah alat yang digunakan untuk menunggang kuda?
\ex saddle, bit, bridle, reins, harness, yoke
\exn pelana, tali kekang kekang, kok, abah

\ddn

\exn menjaga, meragut, gembala, kawanan, padang ragut, menjaga binatang

\exn penjaga binatang, gembala, koboi
