\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.4
\gd I3A28AB73-2847-44A4-97ED-7129269F1366

\is 7.1.5
\sd Bow
\sdn Tunduk
\oldis 7.1.5
\oldsd Bow
\oldsdn Tunduk
\dd Use this domain for words referring to bowing to someone--to face someone and lower your head or bend at the waist so that your upper body is lowered. The words in this domain should all be symbolic acts, that is, the culture assigns a meaning and significance to the physical action. Some cultures define it as a greeting, as an act of respect, or as an act of submission. For instance in ancient middle eastern culture bowing was an act of submission done in the presence of the king. Failure to bow was an act of rebellion punishable by death. In far eastern culture it is a greeting. In African culture it is an act of respect or done to welcome a visitor. Cultures define how a person is to bow, for instance how they are to hold their hands. A person may bow while standing, or may kneel, or even prostrate himself flat on his face. Whether both people bow is also significant. The depth of the bow can have significance. In Japan the person of lower social rank must bow deeper. In European culture a performer bows to acknowledge applause.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menundukkan diri atau badan kepada seseorang - menghadap seseorang dengan menundukkan kepala atau membongkokkan badan supaya bahagian atas tubuh seseorang direndahkan. Perkataan-perkataan di dalam domain ini kesemuanya haruslah di dalam bentuk tindakan-tindakan simbolik, iaitu budaya berkenaan menerima ataupun memberi suatu makna dan kepentingan kepada tindakan fizikal itu. Beberapa budaya mendefinisikannya sebagai sapaan, suatu tindakan penghormatan atau penyerahan. Contohnya: Pada zaman kuno di timur tengah,menunduk merupakan suatu tindakan menyerah yang dilakukan di hadapan raja. Kegagalan berbuat demikian menandakan ia adalah suatu tindakan memberontak dan boleh dikenakan hukuman mati. Bagi kebudayaan di timur jauh pula, ia merupakan sapaan. Dalam kebudayaan di Afrika, ia menunjukkan penghormatan atau dilakukan semasa mengalu-alukan kedatangan pengunjung. Budaya-budaya tertentu menentukan bagaimana seseorang menunduk, misalnya cara meletak tangan mereka. Tindakan menunduk ini mungkin dilakukan semasa berdiri, berlutut atau sujud sehingga muka/dahi menyentuh lantai. Sama ada kedua-dua orang yang berhadapan muka saling menundukkan diri atau salah seorang sahaja pun adalah penting. Rendahnya seseorang menunduk itu mungkin juga mempunyai kepentingannya. Di Jepun, orang dari taraf sosial rendah harus menunduk dengan lebih rendah. Dalam kebudayaan di Eropah, penghibur tunduk selepas mempersembahkan persembahan sebagai tanda penghargaan bagi tepukan yang diberikan oleh para penonton.
\qu (1) What words refer to bowing?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tunduk?
\ex bow, bow down, bow to/before someone
\exn tunduk, sujud, melutut/bersujud di hadapan seseorang
\qu (2) What words describe how a person bows?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan cara seseorang tunduk?
\ex sweeping bow, bow low, deep bow, slight bow, bow your head, his head fell, incline your head, nod, curtsy, genuflect, kowtow, prostrate, grovel
\exn tunduk serendah-rendahnya, tunduk dalam-dalam, tunduk kepala, angguk kepala, angguk ringkas, berlutut, melutut, bertelut, menelut, sujud, menyembah sujud, sujud hingga tertiarap, tersungkur, menyungkur, tunduk dengan membongkok sedikit, membongkokkan badan sebagai tanda tunduk
\qu (3) What words indicate the significance of the bow?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menjelaskan makna ketundukan itu?
\ex obeisance, worship, bow in submission/reverence/greeting
\exn sembah sujud, sembah, tunduk dalam penyerahan/penghormatan/sapaan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.5
\gd IC3F20CE7-D30E-40FD-AF8A-713A65C46CD0

\is 7.1.6
\sd Lean
\sdn Bersandar
\oldis 7.1.6
\oldsd Lean
\oldsdn Bersandar
\dd Use this domain for words describing a person who is leaning.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan seseorang yang sedang menyandar.
\qu (1) What words refer to leaning against something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada posisi bersandar pada sesuatu?
\ex lean, lean on, lean against, lean back, rest against, recline
\exn bersandar, bersandar pada/menyandarkan (sesuatu) pada, berpaut pada, melayah ke belakang, menyandar pada sesuatu untuk berehat,
\qu (2) What words describe something that is leaning?
\qun
\ex leaning, lean forward, lean towards, lean over
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.6
\oldqu (2) What words describe something which is leaning?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan sesuatu yang sedang menyandar?
\oldex Leaning, lean forward, lean towards, lean over
\oldexn menyandar, ditopangi
\cf Leaning, sloping
\gd I566BE8C1-3E42-4F8B-87EB-E70E8C13C6F8

\is 7.1.7
\sd Straight posture
\sdn Postur tegak
\oldis 7.1.7
\oldsd Straight posture
\oldsdn Postur tegak
\dd Use this domain for words referring to straight posture--holding your body straight, stiff, or erect, rather than relaxed.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada postur tegak--- menegakkan badan seseorang, kaku,
\qu (1) What words describe someone who is in a straight posture?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan seseorang yang berpostur tegak?
\ex straight posture, stand at attention, stand/sit stiffly, erect
\exn tegak, berdiri lurus-lurus, berdiri tegak penuh perhatian, tercegat, tercancang, tertegak
\qu (2) What words refer to changing your posture so that it is straight?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan mengubah postur anda supaya tegak?
\ex straighten up, sit up straight, stand up straight
\exn meluruskan/menegakkan badan, duduk tegak, berdiri tegak
\xe The soldier stood at attention with his shoulders back, his chest out, his chin up, and his arms held stiffly at his sides.
\xen Askar itu berdiri tegak penuh perhatian dengan kedua-dua bahunya ke belakang, dagu terjulur ke depan dan kedua-dua tangannya lurus di bahagian sisi badannya.

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.7
\gd I85B9908F-4F57-4BAA-9ED2-BC4705B12E72

\is 7.1.7.1
\sd Relaxed posture
\sdn Postur santai
\oldis 7.1.7.1
\oldsd Relaxed posture
\oldsdn Postur santai
\dd Use this domain for words describing a relaxed posture.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan postur santai.
\qu (1) What words refer to a relaxed posture?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada postur santai?
\ex relaxed (posture), (stand/be) at ease, be a slouch, slouch around, lounge, sprawl, droop, sag, loll
\exn santai, rileks (bebas dari tekanan dan desakan), rehatkan diri (dalam perbarisan), duduk-duduk, baring-baring, tergelempang (terlentang membujur), bermalas-malas, bersandar malas, terlentok (kepala)
\qu (2) What words refer to changing your posture so that it is relaxed?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan mengubah postur anda supaya ianya santai?
\ex relax (your posture), slouch, lean back, slump
\exn rileks, tenang (postur seseorang), mengendurkan, bersandar, merebahkan diri (ke atas sesuatu)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.7.1
\cf Relaxed
\gd I8E65904C-F9E9-4E12-B430-C1DDC540F1AE

\is 7.1.8
\sd Bend down
\sdn Membongkok
\oldis 7.1.8
\oldsd Bend down
\oldsdn Membongkok

\dd Use this domain for words referring to bending down--to bend your body so that it is closer to the ground (in order to see something, pick up something, or hide).
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada membongkok--- membongkokkan badan supaya menghampiri lantai (untuk melihat atau mengambil sesuatu ataupun bersembunyi
\qu (1) What words refer to bending down?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan membongkok?
\ex bend, bend down, bend over, bob, bow, cower, crouch, double up, duck, get down, hunch, hunker down, lean over, scrunch, stoop
\exn membongkok, menunduk, merendahkan badan, terbongkok-bongkok, membengkokkan jari/tangan kaki, melentur, membongkokkan badan sececah, bercangkung
\qu (2) What words describe someone who is bent over?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan seseorang yang bongkok?
\ex bent, stooped, hunched over, humpback, crooked
\exn bongkok, si bongkok
\qu (3) What words refer to straightening up?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menegakkan badan?
\ex straighten up, rear up
\exn tegakkan badan, luruskan belakang

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.8
\gd I85DFC6A3-6C70-41F2-A869-32E2FB3C40EE

\is 7.1.9
\sd Move a part of the body
\sdn Menggerakkan sebahagian daripada anggota tubuh badan.
\oldis 7.1.9
\oldsd Move a part of the body
\oldsdn Menggerakkan sebahagian daripada anggota tubuh badan.

\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving various parts of the body.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to moving a part of your body forward or out?
\qun
\ex extend, hold out, put out, stick out, stretch
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to moving the head?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menggerakkan kepala?
\ex shake, nod, throw (head) back, bow, hang, hold high, crane (neck)
\exn mengangguk-angguk, memaling, menoleh, menggeleng, memanjangkan leher, melentok-lentokkan kepala
\qu (3) What words refer to moving parts of the face (other than eyes, ears, nose, and mouth)?
\qun
\ex raise (eyebrows), jut (chin)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to moving your arms and shoulders?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menggerakkan lengan dan bahu anda?
\ex shrug (shoulders), raise (arm), salute, shake (fist), clench (fist), fold (arms), cross (arms), crook (arm/finger), crack (knuckles), spread (arms/fingers), hold up your hands, fold your arms, cross your arms
\exn mengangkat bahu, tabik, menggeletar (tangan), menepuk, mengibas, menggenggam (buku lima), melipat tangan, memeluk tubuh, membengkokkan (jari/lengan), mematah-matahkan/meletup-letupkan (jari), mendepangkan tangan
\qu (5) What words refer to moving your legs?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menggerakkan kaki anda?
\ex kick, stamp, bend, shake, twist (ankle), cross (your legs), wiggle (toes)
\exn tendang, hentak, bengkokkan kaki, goyang-goyangkan kaki, memusingkan (buku lali), menyilangkan (kaki seseorang)
\qu (6) What words refer to moving your torso?
\qun
\ex sway (hips), rotate (hips), suck in (stomach), stick out (chest), straighten (back), bend (back), bow (at the waist), double up, twist, curl up
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to moving your muscles?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menggerakkan otot-otot anda?
\ex flex (muscles), ripple, contract, tighten, tense, relax, bunch up, cramp, twitch, stretch, tear, pull, bulge, spasm, convulsion
\exn membengkok luruskan otot, melentur tegangkan otot, mengendur otot, meregang otot, rileks, kejang, bonjol, koyak, tegang, mengeras
\qu (8) What words refer to when your body shakes?
\qun
\ex shake, quiver, tremble, have the chills, quake, shiver
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to moving suddenly?
\qun
\ex jerk, twitch
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.1.9
\oldqu (2) What words refer to moving parts of the face (other than eyes, ears, nose and mouth)?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tindakan menggerakkan bahagian muka (selain daripada mata, telinga, hidung dan mulut?
\oldex Raise (eyebrows), jut (chin)
\oldexn mengangkat kening, menjulur dagu, mencemik, mencebikkan bibir
\cf Eye; Ear; Nose; Mouth

\gd I86E5C062-D90F-476C-A363-264ADFAFEDFA

\is 7.2
\sd Move
\sdn Gerak
\oldis 7.2
\oldsd Move
\oldsdn Gerak
\dd Use this domain for intransitive verbs of movement referring to moving your whole body to a different location. There are many components of meaning involved in verbs of movement. They can include a source location (from), a goal location (to), a path (along), manner (walk, run), speed (race, crawl), direction (forward, back, side, up, down, toward, away from), shape of the path (straight, curve, circle, angle), relationship to some object or objects (on, hang, against, between, across, through, into, out of, onto, off of, around), proximity (near, far), multiple movements (back and forth, return, bounce), inclusion with other objects or parts of objects (join, leave, collect, disperse, unite, separate), volition (go versus drift), intransitive versus transitive (move versus move something). Some verbs of movement do not involve moving from one place to another, but express bodily movement.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi pergerakan kata-kata kerja tak transitif yang merujuk kepada tindakan menggerakkan seluruh tubuh seseorang kepada lokasi yang berlainan. Terdapat banyak makna komponen yang terlibat dalam kata-kata kerja pergerakan. Ianya boleh merangkumi lokasi sumber (daripada), lokasi tujuan (ke), sebuah laluan (sepanjang), cara (berjalan, berlari), kelajuan (berlumba, merangkak), arah (depan, belakang, tepi, atas, bawah, menghadap, jauh daripada), bentuk laluan (lurus, bengkok, bulat, selekoh, berliku-liku), hubungan kepada beberapa objek atau objek-objek (di atas, digantung, pada, di antara, melalui, ke dalam, keluar dari... ke atas, dari atas, sekeliling), hampir/dekat (dekat, jauh) pergerakan berganda (undur maju, pergi balik, lantun), ketermasukan dalam objek-objek atau bahagian-bahagian objek lain (bercantum, tinggalkan, takung, kumpul, serak, bersatu, berpadu, bercerai, berpisah), gerakan secara sengaja ataupun tidak sengaja, tidak transitif lawan transitif (bergerak lawan dengan menggerakkan sesuatu), sesetengah kata kerja pergerakan tidak melibatkan pergerakan dari suatu tempat ke tempat lain, tetapi menunjukkan pergerakan badan.
\qu (1) What general words refer to moving your body to a different location?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada menggerakkan tubuh anda ke tempat yang berlainan?
\ex move, movement, change position, maneuver, jockey for position, budge
\exn gerak, pergerakan, memindahkan kedudukan, menukar kedudukan, berasak-asak, berebut-rebut untuk mendapat tempat, berganjak, berundur, maju, maju selangkah
\qu (2) What words refer to beginning to move?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada mula bergerak?
\ex stir, make a move
\exn bertolak, berangkat, menggeliat
\qu (3) What words describe something that is moving?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan sesuatu yang bergerak?
\ex moving, be in motion
\exn bergerak-gerak, sentiasa bergerak, dalam keadaan bergerak

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2
\oldqu (4) What words describe something that can move or can be moved?
\oldqun (4)) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan sesuatu yang boleh bergerak atau boleh digerakkan?
\oldex mobile, mobility, moveable
\oldexn bergerak, pergerakan, boleh bergerak, boleh digerak-gerakkan
\oldqu (5) What words describe something that cannot move?
\oldqun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan sesuatu yang tidak dapat bergerak?
\oldex can't move, stuck, immobile, paralyzed, stranded, entangled, caught
\oldexn tidak boleh bergerak, tidak dapat bergerak, tersekat, lumpuh, kandas, tersangkut, tertangkap,
\gd IC7C85346-158D-4881-839D-9A6A8E47209B

\is 7.2.1
\sd Manner of movement
\sdn Cara pergerakan
\oldis 7.2.1
\oldsd Manner of movement
\oldsdn Cara pergerakan
\dd Use this domain for general words referring to the way in which a person moves.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada cara bagaimana seseorang bergerak.
\qu (1) What general words refer to the way in which a person moves?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada bagaimana seseorang bergerak?
\ex gait
\exn gaya jalan, gaya lari, lagak, gelagat, rupa, stail, teknik, cara, aksi

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1
\gd I5CC64831-C14A-4DBE-BEBA-214E725AD041

\is 7.2.1.1
\sd Walk
\sdn Berjalan
\oldis 6.7.5
\oldsd Walking stick
\oldsdn Tongkat
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis 7.2.1.1
\oldsd Walk
\oldsdn Berjalan
\dd Use this domain for words related to walking--moving slowly using your legs.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan berjalan—bergerak perlahan dengan menggunakan kaki seseorang.
\qu (1) What general words refer to walking?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada berjalan?
\ex walk
\exn jalan, berjalan
\qu (2) What words refer to traveling someplace on foot?
\qun
\ex travel by foot, foot it, hoof it, leg it, tramp, strike off on foot
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to walking quickly?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan dengan cepat?
\ex speed walk, step out, stride, pace, rush
\exn melangkah cepat, bergegas, terburu-buru, tergesa-gesa, terkejar-kejar, lekas-lekas, cepat-cepat, berlari anak
\qu (4) What words refer to walking slowly?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan perlahan?
\ex walk slowly, stroll, amble, ramble, take a Sunday stroll, meander along, saunter, inch, lumber, plod, poke, slog, toddle, traipse, trudge
\exn berjalan perlahan-lahan, melangkah perlahan, merayau-rayau, bersiar-siar, berjalan-jalan pada hujung minggu, gontai, mara sedikit demi sedikit, bertatih-tatih, berjalan-jalan, menapak, membetis,
\qu (5) What words refer to walking carefully?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan dengan berhati-hati?
\ex walk carefully, watch your step, tread, pick your way, edge
\exn Berpijak dengan berhati-hati,
\qu (6) What words refer to walking quietly or secretly?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan senyap-senyap?
\ex steal along, walk stealthily, sneak, pad, stalk, creep
\exn berjalan senyap-senyap, menyelinap, merayau-rayau (hantu), merayap, merangkak
\qu (7) What words refer to walking on your toes?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan di atas jari-jari kaki?
\ex tiptoe, walk on tiptoes
\exn berjengket, berjengket-jengket, bersijengket, terjengket-jengket
\qu (8) What words refer to walking loudly?
\qun (8) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan dengan bunyi yang kuat?
\ex stomp, clump
\exn berjalan menghentakkan kaki, bunyi berderap (kasut but), berjalan berdepak-depak (kasut)
\qu (9) What words refer to walking like a soldier?
\qun (9) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan seperti askar?
\ex march, parade, goose-step, in step
\exn berjalan seperti orang berkawat, berkawat, berarak
\qu (10) What words refer to walking in various manners?
\qun (10) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan di dalam pelbagai cara?
\ex walk with a spring in your step, walk jauntily, swagger, flounce, mince, prance, saunter, strut
\exn berjalan terenjut-enjut, berjalan lincah, lenggok jalan, berjalan dengan sombong/angkuh, berjalan mengada-ngada, berjalan dengan perasan, berjalan perlahan-lahan, gaya berjalan mendada, berlenggang kangkung, berlenggang-lenggok, terhuyung-hayang, mundar-mandir
\qu (11) What words refer to stepping on something?
\qun (11) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada memijak pada sesuatu?
\ex step on, put foot on/in, tread on, stamp on, underfoot
\exn memijak, meletakkan tapak kaki pada/di atas, melangkah, menghentak kaki ke atas
\qu (12) What words refer to a single step?
\qun (12) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada langkah tunggal?
\ex step, footstep, pace
\exn langkah, selangkah
\qu (13) What words refer to the length of your step?
\qun (13) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada jarak antara dua kaki anda ketika berjalan?
\ex stride
\exn langkah
\qu (14) What words refer to the way in which a person walks?
\qun (14) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada cara di mana seseorang berjalan?
\ex gait, funny gait
\exn gaya berjalan, gaya jalan yang lucu atau menggelikan
\qu (15) What words refer to measuring the length of something by counting your steps?
\qun (15) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada mengukur kepanjangan sesuatu dengan menggunakan langkah anda untuk membilangnya?
\ex pace off
\exn mengukur dengan langkah
\qu (16) What words refer to someone who walks?
\qun (16) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada seseorang yang berjalan?
\ex walker, hiker, tramp, pedestrian, passer-by
\exn pejalan kaki, pendaki
\qu (17) What words refer to a place where a person walks?
\qun (17) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tempat di mana seseorang berjalan?
\ex sidewalk, walkway, promenade, path, footpath, stepping-stone
\exn kaki lima, laluan, jalan, persiaran, lorong, laluan kaki, lorong jalan kaki
\qu (18) What words refer to a mark on the ground left by a person's foot?
\qun (18) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bekas yang ditinggalkan kaki seseorang pada permukaan tanah?
\ex footprint
\exn tapak, jejak
\qu (19) What words refer to the effect of walking on something?
\qun (19) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kesan/pengaruh/akibat daripada berjalan di atas sesuatu?
\ex trample, wear a path
\exn hentak-hentakkan kaki, memijak-mijak, menginjak-injak
\qu (20) What words refer to the sound of someone walking?
\qun (20) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bunyi seseorang berjalan?
\ex footsteps
\exn bunyi tapak kaki, derapan (bunyi tapak kaki orang berkawat)
\qu (21) What words refer to walking through water?
\qun (21) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan melalui air?
\ex wade, paddle, slosh
\exn meranduk, merandai, mengharungi, mendayung
\qu (22) What words refer to a time when people walk for fun?
\qun (22) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada masa apabila orang berjalan untuk bersuka-suka?
\ex go for a walk, take a walk, go for a stroll, parade, procession, stretch your legs, hike, go hiking, trek, walk around
\exn berjalan-jalan, bersiar-siar, makan angin, berarak, mendaki, berbaris, perbarisan, perarakan, meregangkan kaki atau badan
\qu (23) What words refer to causing someone to walk?
\qun (23) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada menyebabkan seseorang berjalan?
\ex take someone for a walk, walk the dog
\exn membawa seseorang pergi berjalan-jalan/bersiar-siar
\qu (24) What words refer to a walking stick?
\qun (24) Apakah kata-kata yang merujuk kepada tongkat?
\ex walking stick, cane, crutch
\exn tongkat, rotan, tongkat ketiak

\nt Old questions for \oldis 6.7.5
\oldqu (2) What words are used to describe the actions done with these tools?
\oldqun 2) Apakah kata-kata yang menggambarkan perbuatan dengan menggunakan alat-alat ini?
\oldex
\oldexn bertongkat

\oldqu (2) What words refer to traveling some place on foot?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan-jalan di sesebuah tempat dengan berjalan kaki?

\is 7.2.1.1.1
\sd Run
\sdn Lari
\oldis 7.2.1.2
\oldsd Run
\oldsdn Lari
\dd Use this domain for words referring to running--moving fast on your legs.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berlari—bergerak pantas dengan menggunakan kaki
\qu (1) What general words refer to running?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada berlari?
\ex run
\exn lari
\qu (2) What words refer to running slowly?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-berlari yang merujuk kepada berlari perlahan?
\ex trot, canter, jog, lope
\exn lari-lari anak, joging, meligas (kuda), berlari dengan langkah panjang
\qu (3) What words refer to running quickly?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berlari pantas?
\ex race, gallop, dash, make a dash, tear (along), streak, double time, sprint, charge, dart, scurry, scuttle, scamper, scoot, stampede, bound, bolt
\exn lumba, perlumbaan, menderap/mencongklang (kuda), meluru, bergegas, bergerak pantas, memecut, bergegas lari, lari tergesa-gesa, berlari dengan pantas/cepat, mencalai (binatang), pergi cepat-cepat, lari bertempiaran, lari berempuh-rempuhan (binatang), melonjak-lonjak, lintang-pukang, tunggang-langgang
\qu (4) What words refer to how fast you are running?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada cepatnya anda berlari?
\ex pace
\exn kelajuan
\qu (5) What words refer to beginning to run?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada permulaan larian?
\ex break into a run, set off on a run
\exn mula berlari, membuka langkah untuk lari
\qu (6) What words refer to running faster?
\qun
\ex speed up, put on a spurt, kick
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a race?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada sesebuah perlumbaan?
\ex race, dash, marathon, long/short distance race, racecourse
\exn lumba lari, maraton, jogaton, pecut 100 meter, lumba lari jarak dekat/jauh, litar/tapak perlumbaan
\qu (8) What words refer to being in pain because of running?
\qun (8) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kesakitan yang disebabkan berlari?
\ex be out of breath, be winded, have a stitch (in your side)
\exn Termengah-mengah, tercungap-cungap, terengah-engah, semput, sesak nafas, rasa mencucuk-cucuk di badan, (terkapus-kapus-Melayu Sabah)

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.2
\gd IB16DE6A0-71DD-448C-9FFA-49F6646A5219

\is 7.2.1.1.2
\sd Crawl
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words referring to crawling--moving on your hands and knees or on your stomach.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to crawling?
\qun
\ex crawl, walk on your hand and knees, on all fours, scoot, drag, creep
\exn
\gd IA2BBF179-8D38-4D2E-84CD-0E00BB6C74F3

\is 7.2.1.1.3
\sd Jump
\sdn Lompat
\oldis 7.2.1.4
\oldsd Jump
\oldsdn Lompat
\dd Use this domain for words referring to jumping--moving your body off the ground by pushing hard with your legs.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melompat—mengalihkan tubuh anda dari tempat anda berdiri dengan menolak ke atas dengan sekuat tenaga menggunakan kedua-dua kaki anda.
\qu (1) What words refer to jumping up and down in one place?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melompat ke atas dan ke bawah pada satu tempat?
\ex jump, jump up and down, bounce, leap, buck, bob, jump for joy
\exn lompat, melompat-lompat, meloncat-loncat, melantun-lantun, melonjak-lonjak, melambung-lambung
\qu (2) What words refer to jumping from one place to another place?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melompat daripada sebuat tempat ke tempat lain?
\ex jump up/down/off of/onto/out of the way, bound, spring, pounce, dive, jump overboard, somersault
\exn melompat ke atas/luar/bawah, lompat katak
\qu (3) What words refer to jumping over something?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melompat melalui sesuatu benda atau sebagainya?
\ex jump over, leap over, vault over, hurdle, clear, leapfrog
\exn melompat melalui, melompat masuk, melombol, melombol melepasi
\qu (4) What words refer to jumping on one leg?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melompat dengan menggunakan sebelah kaki?
\ex hop, hop on one leg, hop around, skip
\exn lompat dengan sebelah kaki
\qu (5) What games involve jumping?
\qun (5) Apakah permainan-permainan yang melibatkan tindakan melompat?
\ex hopscotch, leap frog, gymnastics, high jump, broad jump, pole vault, bungee jumping, sky diving, parachuting
\exn Permainan tingting, lompat kaki, gimnastik, lompat tinggi, lompat kijang, lompat jauh, lompat galah, payung terjun
\qu (6) What things are used to help people jump?
\qun (6) Apakah nama alat yang digunakan untuk membantu seseorang melompat?
\ex skipping rope, trampoline, pogo stick, springboard, parachute
\exn tali skip, trampolin, tongkat pogo, payung terjun, papan anjal, batu loncatan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.4
\gd I5ABD1270-261A-4980-93E5-E10EACEA99AD

\is 7.2.1.2
\sd Move quickly
\sdn Bergerak cepat
\oldis 7.2.1.5
\oldsd Move quickly
\oldsdn Bergerak cepat
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving quickly or slowly.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak cepat atau lambat.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving quickly?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak cepat?
\ex move quickly, hurry, haste, hasten, rush, forge ahead, charge, barrel along, move like a bat out of hell, make a beeline for, boil, bolt, bustle, move along at a good clip, dart, double-time, fast, fire, flash, flat-out, fling, flit, fly, gallop, move like greased lightning, be really hopping, kick, lickety-split, plunge in, quick, race, rapid, rapidly, rapidity, run, rush, sail, scour, scud, shoot, move like sixty, skim, snappily, speed, stampede, streak, sweep, swift, swiftly, swing, tear, apace, tilt, vroom, whiz, wildfire, zip, zoom, at full speed, at top speed, express, make tracks, burn up the track
\exn jalan cepat, bergerak cepat, lekas-lekas, cepat-cepat, buru-buru, bergesa-gesa, bergegas, memecut ke depan, meluru, terjun, menjunam, deras, melayang, kelajuan yang agak cepat, (double time=untuk tentera yang berjalan dua kali lebih cepat daripada biasa), lari berhabis-habisan, menyental, meluncur, memancut, mencampak-campakkan, terbang, terkilat, terlintas, berarak cepat, bergerak pantas, bergerak seperti kilat, mencongklang, tendang, sepak, terjun, terjun menjunam, lari, pecut (memecut), pesat, dengan cepat, laju, pantas, berempuh-rempuh, lari berempuh-rempuhan, mengalir deras, laju sekali, amat cepat, ayun, berayun-ayun, rancak, jongkang-jongket/jungkang-jungkit, bersiung (sesuatu yang lalu dengan cepat dengan bunyi bersiung), tersebar dengan cepat, berdesing (bunyi kecepatan pergerakan peluru), deruman, menderum (motosikal dsbg.), kepantasan/kecepatan yang penuh, kepantasan/kecepatan yang teratas sekali, ekpres, macam kera kena belacan
\qu (2) What words refer to moving more quickly?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak lebih cepat lagi?
\ex hurry up, speed up, pick up speed, increase your speed, accelerate, acceleration, (its) speed rose, step on it, step it up, snap it up, pick up the pace, give it some gas, look lively, quicken
\exn cepat!, cepat lagi, cepat-cepat, lekas-lekas, laju-laju, tambahkan kelajuan/kecepatan, kecepatannya naik, bawa laju-laju, tekan minyak
\qu (3) What words refer to continuing to move without trying to speed up or slow down?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak berterusan tanpa berusaha menambah kelajuan atau mengurangkan kelajuan?
\ex coast, glide, float
\exn meluncur, mengalir, terapung-apung
\qu (4) What words refer to how fast something is moving?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada kecepatan sesuatu (orang, benda atau haiwan) itu bergerak?
\ex speed, pace, rate
\exn kelajuan, kecepatan, kadar kelajuan
\qu (5) What words refer to moving quickly for a short time?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak cepat dalam jangka masa yang singkat?
\ex jerk, twitch, start, spasm, jump, snap, nip in, shoot, spurt, dash
\exn menyentak, menyentap, merentap-rentap, gerenyet
\qu (6) What idiophones are used of moving quickly?
\qun
\ex zip, zoom, whiz, vroom, chop chop
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.5
\oldqu (6) What ideophones are used of moving quickly?
\oldqun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang meniru bunyi pergerakan yang cepat (onomatopia)?
\oldex zip, zoom, whiz, vroom, chop chop
\oldexn zip, vroom, bersiung, berdesing
\cf Speed; Quick

\gd I1017CBC3-0DFB-4930-9881-28F96784035C

\is 7.2.1.2.1
\sd Move slowly
\sdn Bergerak lambat
\oldis 7.2.1.5.1
\oldsd Move slowly
\oldsdn Bergerak lambat

\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving slowly.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak lambat.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving slowly?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak lambat?
\ex crawl, move at a snail's pace, creep along, inch forward, poke along, slowpoke, drag, mosey along, slow motion, plod, dawdle
\exn merangkak, mengengsot, berjalan perlahan-lahan
\qu (2) What words refer to moving more slowly?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak lebih lambat?
\ex slow down, slow up, decelerate, coast to a stop, (its) speed fell, ease off, reduce your speed, decrease your speed, come to a stop
\exn perlahankan, perlahan-lahan, kurangkan kelajuan/kecepatan, kelajuan/kecepatannya jatuh, dalam proses berhenti
\qu (3) What do you say to someone when you want him to slow down?
\qun
\ex Slow down! Whoa! (horse) Wait, wait! Wait for me! Wait a minute! Can we slow down?
\exn
\qu (4) What idiophones are used of moving slowly?
\qun
\ex chug
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.5.1
\oldqu (3) What do you say to someone when you want him to slow down? Slow down! Whoa! (horse) Wait, wait! Wait for me! Wait a minute! Can we slow down?
\oldqun (3) Apakah yang anda katakan kepada seseorang apabila anda hendak orang itu memperlahankan langkahnya? perlahan sedikit!, hwo!/wo! (kuda), tunggu dulu!, nanti!, boleh perlahan sedikit?
\oldex
\oldexn
\oldqu (4) What ideophones are used of moving slowly?
\oldqun (4) Ideofon apakah yang digunakan sebagai tanda bergerak perlahan?
\oldex chug
\oldexn bunyi cag-cag (keretapi)
\cf Slow

\gd IE442AFE1-E7CD-4AB2-B456-963E2E041A1E

\is 7.2.1.3
\sd Wander
\sdn Mengembara/berjalan tanpa destinasi tertentu
\oldis 7.2.1.6.1
\oldsd Wander
\oldsdn Mengembara/berjalan tanpa destinasi tertentu
\dd Use this domain for words referring to wandering--to move slowly without any purpose or goal.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain-domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada mengembara-berjalan perlahan-lahan tanpa destinasi tertentu
\qu (1) What words refer to wandering?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan tanpa destinasi tertentu?
\ex wander, meander, ramble, roam, prowl, walk around
\exn bersiar-siar, merayau-rayau, berlegar-legar, berjalan-jalan tanpa tujuan, bergelandangan, bertualang, mengembara
\qu (2) What words refer to a person who wanders?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada orang yang mengembara itu?
\ex wanderer, vagabond, tramp, hobo
\exn perayau, kutu rayau, petualang, gelandang, pengembara

\exn
\qu (2) What words describe graceful movements?
\qun
\ex graceful, elegant, smooth, flowing, effortless, easy, with ease
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer graceful movement?
\qun
\ex grace, gracefulness, poise, elegance, coordination
\exn

\is 7.2.1.4.1
\sd Clumsy
\sdn Kekok
\oldis 7.2.1.7.1
\oldsd Clumsy
\oldsdn Kekok

\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving in a clumsy manner.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dalam keadaan yang kekok.
\qu (1) What words describe someone who moves in a clumsy way?
\qun
\ex uncoordinated, awkward, ungainly, clumsy, gawky, inelegant, klutz, ungraceful, lumbering, have two left feet, gangling
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe someone who is clumsy and often has accidents?
\qun
\ex clumsy, klutz, be all thumbs, accident-prone, ham-fisted, bungling, bumbling, bull in a china shop, butterfingers
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.7.1

\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dalam kekekokan?
\oldex clumsy, klutz, uncoordinated, awkward
\oldexn kekok, canggung, janggal, tidak ada kordinasi, cemerkap, tidak cermat, gabah/gegabah, gabir, kaku

\is 7.2.1.5
\sd Walk with difficulty
\sdn Berjalan dengan susah payah
\oldis 7.2.1.8
\oldsd Walk with difficulty
\oldsdn Berjalan dengan susah payah
\dd Use this domain for words referring to walking with some difficulty such as stumbling--to miss your step because of hitting an object such as a stone, hole, or mud; staggering--to walk unsteadily because of weakness, illness, or drunkenness; or limping--to walk unevenly or with difficulty because of injury to a foot.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini dengan menggunakan perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan kaki dengan sedikit kesukaran misalnya tersandung-kurang selangkah kerana terlanggar sesuatu benda seperti lubang batu, atau lumpur; terhuyung-hayang-berjalan dalam keadaan yang tidak betul disebabkan oleh kelemahan pada tubuh, penyakit, mabuk: atau longlai/tidak bermaya-berjalan dengan tidak seimbang atau dengan sukar disebabkan kecederaan pada kaki.
\qu (1) What words refer to stumbling?
\qun
\ex stumble, trip, trip and fall, slip
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to causing someone to stumble?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada menyebabkan seseorang tersandung?
\ex trip someone
\exn tersandung, tersandung sesuatu dan jatuh, tergelincir
\qu (3) What words refer to staggering?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada terhuyung-hayang?
\ex stagger, weave back and forth, reel, lurch
\exn terhuyung-hayang, terhuyung-huyung, tersengguk-sengguk, tersenggut-senggut
\qu (4) What words refer to limping?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada pincang?
\ex limp, hobble, shamble, shuffle, walk haltingly, walk with a cane, use crutches, get around
\exn pincang, tempang, kaki rengkat, capik, berjalan menyeret, pincang-pincung, berjalan berdengkot-dengkot
\qu (5) What words describe someone who cannot walk well?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan seseorang yang tidak dapat berjalan dengan elok?
\ex lame, disabled
\exn lumpuh, kurang berupaya
\qu (6) What things do people use to help them walk?
\qun (6) Apakah alat-alat yang digunakan orang untuk membantu mereka berjalan?
\ex walker, cane, crutch, walking stick, wheelchair
\exn walker bayi, topang ketiak, tongkat, kerusi roda

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.8
\gd I879E66BC-AF29-4FE4-86E0-0047973A57D6

\is 7.2.1.5.1
\sd Slip, slide
\sdn Menggelincir, menggelongsor
\oldis 7.2.1.8.1
\oldsd Slip, slide
\oldsdn Menggelincir, menggelongsor

\dd Use this domain for moving across a smooth or lubricated surface.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi pergerakan melintasi permukaan yang licin.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving across a smooth or lubricated surface?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melintasi permukaan yang licin?
\ex slip, slide, glide, coast, skim, skate
\exn menggelincir, meluncur, menggelongsor, melayap, menyusur, tergelincir
\qu (2) What words describe a surface that something can easily slip on?
\qun
\ex slippery
\exn

\is 7.2.1.6
\sd Steady, unsteady
\sdn Mantap, ketidakmantapan
\oldis 7.2.1.9
\oldsd Steady, unsteady
\oldsdn Mantap, ketidakmantapan
\dd Use this domain for words describing how easy it is for someone or something to move or be moved.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan betapa mudahnya seseorang atau sesuatu benda bergerak atau digerakkan.
\qu (1) What words describe something that can move?
\qun
\ex movable, mobile, mobility, portable, loose, fluid, free
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that cannot move?
\qun
\ex fixed, immovable, stuck, jammed, stiff, won't budge, can't budge something, can't move, immobile, paralyzed, stranded, entangled, caught, bound, permanent, rooted, entrenched, established, settled, set
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that is easy to move?
\qun
\ex unsteady, shaky, easily moved, unstable, unsettled, rickety, tottering, wobbly
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe something that is difficult to move?
\qun
\ex steady, firm, stable
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.9
\oldqu (1) What words refer to being steady?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada mantap?
\oldex steady, firm, immovable, stable, permanent, fixed, stuck, rooted, entrenched, established, settled, set
\oldexn tegap, mantap, stabil, kukuh, teguh, tidak goyah, berakar, tetap, malar, tegar, tidak berubah
\oldqu (2) What words refer to being unsteady?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada ketidakmantapan?
\oldex unsteady, shaky, moveable, easily moved, unstable, unsettled, loose, free
\oldexn ketidakmantapan, tidak mantap, tidak teguh, goyah, bergoyang, dapat digerak-gerakkan, dapat digoyang-goyangkan, mudah bergoyang, terombang-ambing, tidak stabil
\cf Stay, remain

\gd I985F099D-F38C-4957-907A-769D1A45CA10

\is 7.2.1.6.1
\sd Balance
\sdn Imbangan
\oldis 7.2.1.9.1
\oldsd Balance
\oldsdn Imbangan
\dd Use this domain for words that refer to balancing yourself or something--when someone or something is able stand or move without falling.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada orang atau sesuatu yang dapat berdiri atau berjalan tanpa jatuh.
\qu (1) What words refer to balancing yourself?
\qun
\ex balance, keep your balance
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to balancing something?
\qun
\ex balance something, steady something
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the ability to balance yourself?
\qun
\ex balance (n)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to losing your balance?
\qun
\ex lose your balance, totter
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that is balanced?
\qun
\ex steady, poised
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that is not balanced?
\qun
\ex unsteady, unstable, precarious
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to feeling like you are going to fall?
\qun
\ex dizzy, giddy, vertigo, dizziness, someone's head is swimming
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.1.9.1

\is 7.2.2
\sd Move in a direction
\sdn Bergerak ke arah tujuan
\oldis 7.2.2
\oldsd Move in a direction
\oldsdn Bergerak ke arah tujuan
\dd Use the domains in this section for words referring to moving in a direction related to the orientation of the person's body (not in relation to the position of the destination).
\ddn Sila gunakan domain pada bahagian ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke arah tujuan yang berkenaan dengan kedudukan tubuh orang itu (bukan berkenaan dengan arahnya destinasi).
\qu (1) What general words refer to moving in a direction?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke arah tujuan?
\ex head (in a direction), go (in a direction)
\exn maju, mara, menghala, mengarah, menuju ke satu arah
\qu (2) What words refer to the direction in which a person is moving?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada haluan di mana seseorang itu pergi?
\ex direction, heading, way, course
\exn mengarah, menuju, arah, haluan, hala

\oldis 7.2.2.1

\oldsdn Maju/Bergerak ke depan

\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke hala depan—pada arah sama yang dipandang

\ex move forward, advance, move ahead, go ahead
\exn maju, mara, melangkah ke depan, berjalan ke depan

\sd Move back
\sdn Berundur
\oldis 7.2.2.2
\oldsd Move back
\oldsdn Berundur
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving in a backward direction--the person is facing one direction, but moving toward their back--to move in the opposite direction from the direction the person is facing.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak berundur—iaitu bergerak bertentangan dengan arah orang itu menghadap.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving backwards while still facing forward?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke belakang sementara masih menghadap ke depan?
\ex move back, back up, move backwards, move in reverse
\exn Undur

\oldis 7.2.2.3
\oldsd Move sideways

\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving in a sideways direction--the person is facing one direction, but moving toward their side.

\qun

\is 7.2.2.4
\sd Move up
\sdn Bergerak ke atas
\oldis 7.2.2.4
\oldsd Move up
\oldsdn Bergerak ke atas
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving in an upward direction or to moving to a higher place.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke arah atas atau ke tempat yang lebih tinggi.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving up?
\qun
\ex move up, go up, arise, hop up, lift yourself up, pull yourself up, jump, surge, go higher, get higher, levitate
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to moving up through the air?
\qun
\ex rise, ascend, gain height
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to moving up into the air quickly?
\qun
\ex fly up, soar, shoot up
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to climbing?
\qun
\ex climb, scale, clamber, shin up, shinny up
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to moving onto something?
\qun
\ex climb onto, get on, mount, embark, hop onto, jump onto
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to climbing over something?
\qun
\ex climb over
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the sun or moon moving up in the sky?
\qun
\ex come up, rise
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to an airplane moving up?
\qun
\ex leave the ground, take off, lift off, blast-off, launch
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to the act of moving up?
\qun
\ex rise (n), ascension, ascent
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to someone who moves up?
\qun
\ex climber, mountaineer, mountain climber, rock-climber
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to the sport of climbing?
\qun
\ex climbing, mountaineering, go climbing, rock-climbing
\exn

\is 7.2.2.5
\sd Move down
\sdn Bergerak ke bawah/Turun
\oldis 7.2.2.5
\oldsd Move down
\oldsdn Bergerak ke bawah/Turun
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving in a downward direction or to moving to a lower place.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke arah bawah ke tempat yang lebih rendah.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving down slowly or purposefully?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke bawah dengan perlahan atau dengan tujuan?
\ex move down, go down, lower oneself, climb down, jump down, descend, descent
\exn turun, lompat, terjun

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.2.5
\oldqu (2) What words refer to falling under the influence of gravity?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada sesuatu yang dipengaruhi oleh graviti?
\oldex fall, fall into, fall down, fall over, collapse, tumble, trip, lose your balance
\oldexn jatuh, pengsan, tumbang, rebah, hilang imbangan, jatuh bergolek, jatuh tersungkur, jatuh tersembam, jatuh tertiarap, jatuh tergelincir

\gd I16081DD6-72E5-4826-B86D-958DD82A01C0

\is 7.2.2.5.1
\sd Fall
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words referring to something falling--for something to move down under the influence of gravity.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to falling?
\qun
\ex fall, drop, fall on
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to accidentally falling from a high position?
\qun
\ex fall off, take a fall, tumble, be thrown
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to falling from a very high position?
\qun
\ex plunge, plummet
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to falling from a standing position?
\qun
\ex fall down, fall over, have a fall, fall flat on your face, collapse, topple over, keel over, go head over heels, fall headlong
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to almost falling?
\qun
\ex trip, slip, stumble, lose your balance, lose your footing, keep your balance, stay up
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to falling off of something?
\qun
\ex fall from, fall out, come off
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the act of falling?
\qun
\ex fall (n), avalanche
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to slowly falling?
\qun
\ex sink slowly, float down, drift down, settle
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to something like rain or leaves falling through the air?
\qun
\ex fall, drop, come down, parachute
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to letting something fall?
\qun
\ex drop
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to something falling onto its side?
\qun
\ex fall over, topple over, tip over
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to a building falling?
\qun
\ex fall down, collapse, fall in, cave in
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to causing someone to fall?
\qun
\ex knock down, push over, trip, knock someone to the ground, bring down
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to causing something to fall?
\qun
\ex knock over, upset, tip over, overturn
\exn
\qu (15) What words refer to water falling?
\qun
\ex cascade, cataract, pour, precipitate, shower
\exn
\qu (16) What words refer to falling into water?
\qun
\ex sink, fall overboard, plunge into, fall into, plop, plunk
\exn
\qu (17) What words refer to the force that causes things to fall?
\qun
\ex gravity
\exn
\qu (18) What words refer to keeping something from falling?
\qun
\ex hold up, prop up, brace
\exn
\gd IB14DB9F4-5E1D-4a2b-BEC0-0D6BCB5B1A31

\is 7.2.2.6
\sd Turn
\sdn Pusing
\oldis 7.2.2.6
\oldsd Turn
\oldsdn Pusing
\dd Use this domain for words referring to turning and changing the direction in which one is moving.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berpusing dan menukar arah dimana seseorang sedang bergerak.
\qu (1) What words refer to turning?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berpusing?
\ex turn, change direction/course, deviate, go off at an angle, swerve
\exn pusing, putar, tukar/ubah arah, beralih hala, bertukar haluan, menyelekoh, membelok
\qu (2) What words refer to turning around and moving in the opposite direction?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berpusing dan bergerak bertentangan arah?
\ex turn around, reverse direction, retreat, go back, retire to the rear
\exn pusing balik, berundur balik, pengunduran, berpatah balik

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.2.6

\is 7.2.2.7
\sd Move in a circle
\sdn Bergerak di dalam bulatan
\oldis 7.2.2.7
\oldsd Move in a circle
\oldsdn Bergerak di dalam bulatan
\dd Use this domain for words referring to continually changing the direction you are facing in until you are once again facing in the same direction, e.g. moving in a circle, moving around something, or rotating.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berpusing-pusing sehingga anda menghadap arah yang sama semula, misalnya; bergerak di dalam bulatan, bergerak mengelilingi sesuatu, atau berputar
\qu (1) What words refer to moving around in a circle?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dalam satu bulatan?
\ex move in a circle, curve, circulate, turn around, swing, cycle
\exn bergerak dalam bulatan, berpusing, berputar
\qu (2) What words refer to moving around something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak mengelilingi sesuatu?
\ex move around, surround, encircle, revolve, swivel, pivot
\exn mengelilingi, beredar, berpusing, pangsi, berlegar
\qu (3) What words refer to rotating?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berputar?
\ex rotate, spin, wheel, twirl, whirl, gyrate, roll, gyrate, revolve, swivel
\exn berputar, berpusing, putaran, pusingan
\qu (4) What words refer to rolling something?
\qun
\ex roll, turn, rotate, spin
\exn

\gd I36176D59-171B-4A0A-A0F7-A8F9857536A1

\is 7.2.3
\sd Move toward something
\sdn Bergerak ke arah sesuatu
\oldis 7.2.3
\oldsd Move toward something
\oldsdn Bergerak ke arah sesuatu
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving toward, in the direction of, or near something or some place. The words in this domain should refer to moving in the direction of a place, but should not require that the person actually arrived. Some languages (such as German and Polish) distinguish 'go on foot' from 'go in a vehicle'.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak menuju, ke arah atau berhampiran sesuatu atau suatu tempat. Perkataan-perkataan di dalam domain ini hendaklah merujuk kepada bergerak menuju ke arah sesuatu tempat tetapi tidak semestinya orang itu tiba. Sesetengah bahasa (seperti bahasa Jerman dan bahasa Poland) membezakan ‘berjalan kaki' daripada ‘menaiki kenderaan'.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving toward a place?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak ke arah sesuatu tempat?
\ex move toward, go toward, head toward, go in the (general) direction of
\exn berjalan menuju ke arah, menghala
\qu (2) What words refer to moving near something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak menghampiri sesuatu? mendekati, menghampiri, datang menghampiri/mendekati, menyergap, menyoroti (kamera)?
\ex approach, move near, come near, move in on
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to two things moving toward each other?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada dua benda menuju ke arah satu sama lain?
\ex converge, be on a collision course
\exn bertemu, berjumpa, berlanggar, berlaga, berhantuk, beradu
\xe The two ships were on a collision course.
\xen Kedua-dua kapal laut tersebut akan berlanggar.
\qu (4) What words refer to the place toward which a person is moving?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tempat yang ditujui oleh seseorang?
\ex destination, goal
\exn destinasi, tujuan, arah, haluan, tempat tujuan

\oldsdn Pergi
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving away from the speaker. In Australian languages many movement words are marked for direction toward or away from the speaker.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada meninggalkan pembicara. Dalam bahasa-bahasa Australia, banyak kata-kata pergerakan yang ditandai dengan arah menuju atau sebaliknya daripada pembicara.

\exn pergi, tinggalkan tempat ini, beredar/pergi dari tempat ini atau sini
\qu (2) What do people say when they want someone to go away?
\qun (2) Bagaimanakah seseorang itu menyampaikan permintaannya jika dia menghendaki seseorang pergi?
\ex
\exn
\xe Get out of my sight!
\xen Pergi, saya tidak mahu tengok muka kau!

\gd I88269184-D033-454E-B750-559D5F53287C

\is 7.2.3.4.1
\sd Move out
\sdn Keluar
\oldis 7.2.3.4.1
\oldsd Move out
\oldsdn Keluar
\dd Use this domain for words related to moving out of something, such as a house or area.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to moving out of an area or space?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada keluar dari sesebuah kawasan atau ruang?
\ex move out, go out, come out, get out, emerge, exit, exodus, issue, leave
\exn keluar, keluaran, dikeluarkan, muncul, berhijrah
\qu (2) What words refer to an opening where something can move out?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tempat sesuatu keluar?
\ex exit, outlet, vent, mouth, opening, way out
\exn pintu keluar, saluran keluar, bolong, lubang, mulut, jalan keluar, lohong

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.3.4.1
\gd ID95ED463-AC64-4004-9C3B-0FCE2F7639BE

\is 7.2.3.5
\sd Move past, over, through
\sdn Melewati, melombol, melalui
\oldis 7.2.3.5
\oldsd Move past, over, through
\oldsdn Melewati, melombol, melalui
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving past, over, or through something.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melewati, beranjak, atau melalui sesuatu.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving past something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melewati sesuatu?
\ex move past, move by, bypass, go around, go by, stop by, zoom by, zip by
\exn lalu, memirau, melangkau, mengelilingi sesuatu, berlalu, singgah
\qu (2) What words refer to passing someone or something, which is moving in the same direction?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada melalui seseorang atau sesuatu yang bergerak dalam arah yang sama?
\ex pass
\exn melalui, melewati, melangkaui, memotong
\qu (3) What words refer to overtaking someone of something, which is moving in the same direction?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada memotong seseorang yang bergerak dalam arah yang sama?
\ex come up with, catch up with, overtake
\exn memotong, melangkaui, mengatasi
\qu (4) What words refer to moving over something?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak di atas sesuatu?
\ex move over, walk over, run over, overrun
\exn melombol, menggelek, digelek, dipenuhi, meremuti, diremuti, diselimuti, dikerumuni
\qu (5) What words refer to moving through something?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak melalui sesuatu?
\ex pass through
\exn melalui, bergerak menerusi, menembusi
\qu (6) What words refer to moving across something, such as a river, road, mountain range, or some other dividing line?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak melintasi sesuatu, seperti sungai, jalan, banjaran atau apa-apa pemisah?
\ex move across, go across, cross, go to the other side
\exn menyeberangi, melintasi, pergi ke seberang sana

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.3.5
\gd IEA2D0DC5-2CDB-4686-9F48-ABE65ED295A4

\is 7.2.3.6
\sd Return
\sdn Kembali
\oldis 7.2.3.6
\oldsd Return
\oldsdn Kembali
\dd Use this domain for words referring to returning to a place--to go back to a place you earlier left.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kembali ke sesebuah tempat—balik ke tempat di mana anda tinggalkan sebelumnya.
\qu (1) What words refer to returning to a place?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kembali ke sesebuah tempat?
\ex return, come back, move back
\exn kembali, balik, berpindah balik, balik semula, pulang

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.3.6
\gd I5A021F98-2EFB-4BAF-9384-A553DC3DF86C

\is 7.2.4
\sd Travel
\sdn Perjalanan
\oldis 7.2.6
\oldsd Travel
\oldsdn Perjalanan
\dd Use this domain for words referring to traveling--to move a long distance. The words in this domain may imply that the person has to sleep somewhere other than his home.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perjalanan---berjalan jauh. Perkataan-perkataan di dalam domain ini mungkin juga menyiratkan orang yang terlibat dalam perjalanan itu terpaksa menginap di tempat lain.
\qu (1) What words refer to going on a journey?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada pergi berjalanan?
\ex go on a journey, journey, trip, passage, tour
\exn pergi makan angin, perjalanan
\qu (2) What words refer to moving from place to place?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dari sebuah tempat ke tempat lain?
\ex travel, move from place to place, move around, voyage
\exn Pergi berjalan, perjalanan, berjalan dari tempat ke tempat, pelayaran, belayar, pergi menjelajah, pindah-randah
\qu (3) What words refer to moving from place to place and then returning to the first place?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dari sebuah tempat ke tempat lain kemudian kembali semula ke tempat yang mula-mula?
\ex circulate, go on a circuit, circumnavigate
\exn berpusing, beredar, peredaran, perlitaran, belayar mengelilingi
\qu (4) What words refer to going to an unknown place in order to discover what is there?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada pergi ke tempat asing untuk mendapat tahu apakah yang ada di situ?
\ex explore
\exn Menerokai, menjelajah
\qu (5) What words refer to going somewhere without intending to return?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada pergi ke sesuatu tempat tanpa niat hendak kembali lagi?
\ex move away, leave forever, emigrate, immigrate
\exn pindah, meninggalkan (sesuatu tempat) selama-lamanya, pergi selama-lamanya, berimigrasi, berhijrah
\qu (6) What words refer to traveling to another country?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada pergi ke negeri lain?
\ex go abroad, go overseas
\exn pergi ke luar negeri
\qu (7) What words refer to a person who is traveling?
\qun
\ex traveler, passenger, tourist
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe someone who has traveled a lot?
\qun
\ex well traveled, cosmopolitan
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to a place where a traveler can stay or eat?
\qun
\ex hotel, motel, inn, campground, restaurant
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.6
\gd I6F01B67C-33A0-4ED3-8205-F868E97A1A3A

\is 7.2.4.1
\sd Travel by land
\sdn Perjalanan melalui darat
\oldis 7.2.6.1
\oldsd Travel by land
\oldsdn Perjalanan melalui darat
\dd Use this domain for words related to traveling by land.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan perjalanan di darat.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving by land?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan di darat?
\ex travel overland, overland
\exn perjalanan melalui darat
\qu (2) What words refer to starting a vehicle?
\qun
\ex start, accelerate, pull out
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to stopping a vehicle?
\qun
\ex stop, brake, park
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.6.1

\is 7.2.4.1.1
\sd Vehicle
\sdn Kenderaan
\oldis 7.2.6.1.1
\oldsd Vehicle
\oldsdn Kenderaan
\dd Use this domain for things used to move.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi benda-benda yang digunakan untuk bergerak.
\qu (1) What kinds of vehicles are there?
\qun (1) Apakah jenis-jenis kenderaan yang yang boleh didapati?
\ex vehicle, car, auto, truck, motorcycle, bicycle, cycle, bus, taxi
\exn kereta, motosikal, basikal, bas, lori, beca, kereta lembu, keretapi
\qu (2) What kinds of vehicles are used by children or for play?
\qun (2) Apakah jenis-jenis kenderaan yang biasa digunakan oleh kanak-kanak atau sebagai alat mainan?
\ex tricycle, scooter, skateboard, roller-skates, roller blades, ice-skates
\exn basikal tiga roda, skuter, papan roda, kasut roda, papan luncur ais
\qu (3) What kinds of vehicles are pulled by animals?
\qun (3) Apakah jenis-jenis kenderaan yang ditarik oleh haiwan?
\ex wagon, cart, chariot, carriage
\exn kereta lembu, pedati, rata (kereta kuda kuno yang digunakan di dalam peperangan, perlumbaan dan perarakan), kereta kuda
\qu (4) What words refer to moving in a vehicle?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dengan menaiki sesebuah kenderaan?
\ex drive, cycle, pedal, ride
\exn memandu, menunggang, mengayuh, mendayung, menaiki
\qu (5) What are the parts of a vehicle?
\qun
\ex chassis, body, engine, brake, gas pedal, brakes, gear, steering wheel, windshield, windshield wiper, horn
\exn
\qu (6) What are the parts of a bicycle?
\qun
\ex handle bars, kick stand, bike bell, tire pump
\exn
\qu (7) What are the parts of a wheel?
\qun
\ex wheel, tire, rim, spokes, hub, axle
\exn

\is 7.2.4.1.2
\sd Railroad
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to railroads.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a railroad?
\qun
\ex railroad, railway, station
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a train?
\qun
\ex train, railroad car, engine, caboose, freight train, passenger train, locomotive, freight car, trolley, streetcar
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the tracks?
\qun
\ex tracks, railroad tracks, rail, tie, bed
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to moving in a train?
\qun
\ex ride, ride the rails, go on the train
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a person who operates a train?
\qun
\ex engineer, conductor, station master
\exn

\is 7.2.4.2
\sd Travel by water
\sdn Perjalanan melalui air
\oldis 7.2.6.2
\oldsd Travel by water
\oldsdn Perjalanan melalui air
\dd Use this domain for words related to traveling by water.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan perjalanan melalui air.
\qu (1) What words refer to traveling on water?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan melalui air?
\ex sail, ship (v), cross (the river/lake)
\exn belayar, menaiki kapal laut/sampan/bot dsbg., menyeberangi (sungai, tasik dsbg.)
\qu (2) What words refer to getting into a boat?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada menaiki kapal?
\ex embark
\exn naik kapal
\qu (3) What words refer to leaving in a boat?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada bertolak dengan menaiki kapal?
\ex set sail, sail off
\exn mula belayar
\qu (4) What words refer to arriving in a boat?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tiba dengan menaiki kapal?
\ex land, make land, landfall
\exn tiba, sampai ke darat, tiba di darat, bertemu daratan, mendarat
\qu (5) What words refer to getting out of a boat?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada keluar dari kapal?
\ex disembark
\exn penumpang-penumpang turun, penurunan para penumpang
\qu (6) What words refer to a ship hitting the land?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada kapal terdampar?
\ex run aground, shipwreck, maroon
\exn dampar, kandas, terdampar, terkandas, karam
\qu (7) What words refer to the places a ship can go?
\qun
\ex waterway, sea-lane
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to a place where a ship comes to land?
\qun
\ex harbor, port, landing, dock, wharf, water break
\exn

\is 7.2.4.2.1
\sd Boat
\sdn Kapal
\oldis 7.2.6.2.1
\oldsd Boat
\oldsdn Kapal
\dd Use this domain for words related to a boat.
\ddn
\qu (1) What types of boats are there?
\qun (1) Apakah jenis-jenis kapal yang ada?
\ex ship, boat, canoe, raft, life raft, lifeboat, ship's boat, surfboard, submarine
\exn kapal, bot, kanu, raf, perahu, sampan, rakit, ancu, telatak, jeriau, telatap, kayak, bot penyelamat, perahu keselamatan, jong, tongkang
\qu (2) What are the parts of a boat?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bahagian-bahagian pada kapal?
\ex bow, stern, starboard, port, deck, gunwale, below decks, mast, spar, crow's nest, figurehead, rudder, helm, superstructure
\exn buritan kapal, buntut kapal, kanan kapal, dek
\qu (3) What equipment is used in a boat?
\qun (3) Peralatan apakah yang digunakan di dalam kapal?
\ex oar, paddle, sail, rigging, plank, compass, signal flag
\exn dayung, layar, kompas, bendera isyarat
\qu (4) What words are used of operating a boat?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang digunakan untuk mengemudi kapal?
\ex row, paddle, sail, push a boat with a pole, pole a boat, bale out water
\exn mendayung, melayar, menurunkan layar supaya kapal boleh bergerak, menggalah rakit,
\qu (5) What words refer to a person who uses a boat?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada orang yang mengemudikan kapal?
\ex sailor, captain
\exn pelayar, kapten, pendayung sampan, pengemudi kapal, juru mudi

\is 7.2.4.2.3
\sd Dive
\sdn Selam
\oldis 7.2.6.2.3
\oldsd Dive
\oldsdn Selam
\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving under the water.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak di dalam air.
\qu (1) What words refer to diving into water?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada menyelam?
\ex dive, plunge, belly flop, jump in
\exn selam, menjunam ke dalam air, terjun ke dalam air
\qu (2) What words refer to sinking under the water?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada tenggelam di dalam air?
\ex sink, go down, go under, submerge
\exn tenggelam, masuk ke dalam air, masuk ke bawah air, karam
\qu (3) What words refer to moving while underwater?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak semasa berada di dalam air?
\ex run submerged, swim underwater
\exn tenggelam, karam, kelebu, berenang di bawah permukaan air
\qu (4) What words refer to coming to the surface of the water?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada timbul di atas permukaan air?
\ex rise to the surface, surface (v), float to the surface
\exn timbul, terapung-apung, merapung, membuntang
\qu (5) What words refer to drowning?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada sedang lemas?
\ex drown
\exn Lemas

\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perjalanan melalui udara?
\ex travel by air, fly, aviation
\exn perjalanan melalui udara, terbang, penerbangan, dengan kapal terbang

\exn kapal terbang, peluncur, belon (yang boleh dinaiki), layang-layang besar (yang boleh dinaiki oleh satu orang)

\is 7.2.4.5
\sd Move to a new house
\sdn Berpindah ke rumah baru
\oldis 7.2.6.5
\oldsd Move to a new house
\oldsdn Berpindah ke rumah baru
\dd Use this domain for words related to permanently leaving your home or country, and for words related to migrating--moving every year to the same places because of the weather and food supplies.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan meninggalkan rumah atau negara anda buat selama-lamanya dan bagi perkataan-perkataan yang berkaitan dengan berhijrah—setiap tahun berpindah ke tempat yang sama atas sebab cuaca dan bekalan makanan.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving to a new house?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berpindah ke rumah baru?
\ex move, move in
\exn pindah, pindah ke rumah baru
\qu (2) What words refer to a celebration when moving into a new house?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada merayakan kemasukan ke rumah baru?
\ex housewarming
\exn doa selamat, doa kesyukuran
\qu (3) What words refer to leaving home?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada meninggalkan rumah?
\ex leave, move out, leave home, run away, vacate
\exn pergi, pindah, lari, keluar dari, meninggalkan rumah, melarikan diri, menghilangkan diri
\qu (4) What words refer to moving to a new country?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berpindah ke negara baru?
\ex emigrate, immigrate
\exn berhijrah, berimigrasi
\qu (5) What words refer to migrating?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada penghijrahan?
\ex migrate
\exn hijrah, berpindah

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.6.5

\is 7.2.4.6
\sd Way, route
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to the way or route that you take to go somewhere.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the way to go from one place to another?
\qun
\ex way, how to get, route, directions
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a short way of getting somewhere?
\qun
\ex shortcut
\exn
\qu (3) What refer to telling someone the way?
\qun
\ex tell someone the way, give someone directions, show someone the way, direct
\exn
\qu (4) What refer to asking someone the way?
\qun
\ex ask someone the way, ask for directions
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to finding the way?
\qun
\ex find your way, navigate
\exn
\qu (6) What do you say to someone when you want them to tell you the way?
\qun
\ex can you tell me the way to, do you know the way to, how do I get to, can you direct me to, is this the way to
\exn
\gd I70953222-5BC5-4fa2-A85A-01827F7BC537

\oldsdn Sesat

\dd Use this domain for words related to losing your way.

\qu (1) What words refer to losing your way?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada sesat?
\ex be lost, not know where you are, get lost, lose your way

\is 7.2.4.8
\sd Map
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to a map--a drawing of the world or part of the world.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a map?
\qun
\ex map, chart, atlas
\exn
\qu (2) What types of maps are there?
\qun
\ex road map, street map, contour map, geographical map, political map
\exn
\qu (3) What is a model of the earth called?
\qun
\ex globe
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to making a map?
\qun
\ex draw
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to using a map?
\qun
\ex read a map, look for something on the map, find something on the map, trace a route
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the symbols on a map?
\qun
\ex symbol, legend, contour line, longitude line, latitude line, parallel
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the relationship between the size of the map and the size of the real land?
\qun
\ex scale, large scale, small scale, projection
\exn
\qu (8) What other tools are used to find a place?
\qun
\ex compass, sextant
\exn
\gd I390AD7FC-8360-4EAE-8736-3AEDC15AE659

\is 7.2.5
\sd Accompany
\sdn Menemankan
\oldis 7.2.4
\oldsd Accompany
\oldsdn Menemankan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to moving with someone.
\ddn Sila gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak bersama seseorang.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving with someone?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada berjalan/bergerak bersama seseorang?
\ex go with, come with, come along, accompany, escort (v), travel with, journey together
\exn menemani, pergi bersama, datang bersama, berjalan bersama, mengiringi, dengan ditemani, bertemankan
\qu (2) What words refer to someone you travel with?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada orang yang menemani anda?
\ex companion, traveling companion, fellow travelers/passengers, escort (n), tour group
\exn teman seperjalanan, pengiring
\qu (3) What words describe how a person walks with another person?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan cara seseorang berjalan bersama orang lain?
\ex arm in arm, side by side, in step with, out of step with, single file
\exn bergandingan tangan, berjalan seiringan, berjalan bersama-sama, bergerak serentak dengan
\qu (4) What words refer to a group of vehicles or ships moving together?
\qun
\ex convoy
\exn

\is 7.2.5.2
\sd Follow
\sdn Susul
\oldis 7.2.4.2
\oldsd Follow
\oldsdn Susul
\dd Use this domain for words related to following someone.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to following someone?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada menyusuli seseorang?
\ex follow, follow someone around, tag along, follow on, come behind, come after, go last
\exn susul, ikut, ikut dari belakang, datang selepas, jalan paling belakang, ketinggalan
\qu (2) What words refer to following someone closely?
\qun
\ex be on someone's tail, be on someone's heels, tailgate, be right behind
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to following someone at a distance?
\qun
\ex follow at a distance
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to moving at the same speed as the person you are following?
\qun
\ex keep up, keep pace, stay up with
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to moving faster than the person following you?
\qun
\ex pull ahead
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to moving faster than the person you are following?
\qun
\ex gain on
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to moving slower than the person you are following?
\qun
\ex lag behind, fall behind, straggle
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to reaching someone that you are following?
\qun
\ex catch up with, overtake
\exn

\is 7.2.6
\sd Pursue
\sdn
\oldis 7.2.5
\oldsd Flee, pursue
\oldsdn Lari (tak transitif), lari dari (transitif), kejar

\dd Use this domain for words related to pursuing someone--to follow someone in order to catch them.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to pursuing someone?
\qun
\ex run after, chase, in pursuit, pursue, be on someone's heels, chase after, go after, give chase, come after, be after, hunt
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to following someone in order to find out where they go?
\qun
\ex follow, tail, shadow, stalk, track, trail, hound, trace
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the act of pursuing someone?
\qun
\ex chase (n), pursuit
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to someone who is pursuing someone?
\qun
\ex pursuer
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.2.5

\is 7.2.6.1
\sd Catch, capture
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to catching someone who is trying to escape.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to catching someone?
\qun
\ex catch, catch up with, capture, get, corner, hunt down, nab, seize, seizure, trap
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to catching someone and not letting them leave?
\qun
\ex capture, round up, take someone prisoner, recapture
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the police catching a criminal?
\qun
\ex arrest, get, take someone into custody, apprehend, detain
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to catching an animal?
\qun
\ex catch, trap, snare, capture, round up
\exn

\is 7.2.6.2
\sd Prevent from moving
\sdn
\oldis 4.6.5.5
\oldsd Restrain
\oldsdn Menahan

\dd Use this domain for words referring to preventing someone or something from moving.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to preventing someone from moving?
\qun
\ex prevent, immobilize, keep, restrain, control, quarantine, restrict
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by holding them?
\qun
\ex hold, hold down, restrain, pin someone down, seize
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by tying them?
\qun
\ex handcuff, shackle, tie up, bind, binding
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by putting them in an enclosure?
\qun
\ex lock up, cage, confine, contain, corral, shut up, trap
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to preventing someone from moving by getting in their way?
\qun
\ex block, check, hem in, blockade, get in the way
\exn
\qu (6) What things are used to prevent someone from moving?
\qun
\ex handcuffs, shackles, restraint, cage, restraint
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe someone who is being prevented from moving?
\qun
\ex be under restraint, bound, captive, in confinement, held, limited, restricted
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.6.5.5
\oldqu (1) What words refer to restraining someone from doing something?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal menahan seseorang daripada melakukan sesuatu?
\oldex restrain
\oldexn Menahan, menghalang, menegah, mencegah

\is 7.2.6.3
\sd Escape
\sdn Melepaskan diri
\oldis 4.8.2.3
\oldsd Escape
\oldsdn Melepaskan diri
\dd Use this domain for words related to escaping from danger.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to escaping from a dangerous place?
\qun
\ex escape, get out, flee, make your escape, get away, get clear, abandon ship, bail out, evacuate, fly the coop, get free, get loose, run away, scarper, break away, break free, break loose, sneak out
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to escaping from prison?
\qun
\ex break out, make a break for it, bust out
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to escaping from someone who is chasing you?
\qun
\ex get away, give someone the slip, throw someone off the scent, slip through someone's fingers, shake off, make a clean getaway, elude, evade, avoid capture, dodge, sidestep, cover your trail/tracks
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to running away from someone?
\qun
\ex run away, run off, bolt, run for it, make a run for it, take to your heels, scatter, run for your life
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to escaping from a difficult situation?
\qun
\ex extricate yourself, talk your way out of
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to escaping with something you have stolen?
\qun
\ex get away with, make off with
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to helping someone escape?
\qun
\ex get someone out, spring, liberate
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to the act of escaping?
\qun
\ex escape (n), breakout, jailbreak, getaway, prison break, evasion, evacuation
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to someone who has escaped?
\qun
\ex runaway, fugitive, escapee, refugee
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe someone who has escaped?
\qun
\ex escaped, be on the loose, be at large, be on the run, elusive, free
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something related to escaping?
\qun
\ex evasive (maneuvers), getaway (car)
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to being unable to escape?
\qun
\ex can't escape, can't get out, trapped, be stuck, there is no escape, be imprisoned, be a prisoner
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 4.8.2.3
\oldqu (1) What words refer to escaping from danger or captivity?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada perihal melepaskan diri daripada bahaya atau daripada menjadi tawanan?
\oldex avoid capture, break out, break away, make a break, getaway, sneak out, jailbreak, prison break, escapee, to escape, to getaway, free, liberate, runaway, run away, on the loose, fugitive
\oldexn Mengelakkan daripada ditangkap atau ditawan, melarikan diri, melepaskan diri, cuba melepaskan diri, berjaya melarikan diri, curi-curi keluar - keluar tanpa kebenaran, lari dari rumah pasung, lari dari penjara, orang yang berjaya melarikan diri, lepaskan diri daripada, larikan diri dari, bebas, membebaskan diri, orang yang telah melarikan diri, lari daripada, belum dikesan atau ditangkap, orang pelarian
\gd I36E8F1DF-1798-4AE6-904D-600CA6EB4145
