\is 8.1.1.5
\sd Numbered group
\sdn
\oldis 8.1.2.5
\oldsd Numbered collective
\oldsdn Nombor bersama

\dd Use this domain for words related to a group of a particular number of things or people (solo, duo, trio; alone, in threes).
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a group of a particular number?
\qun
\ex single, duo, duet, trio, quartet, quintet, sextet, twins, triplets, quadruplets, quintuplets, sextuplets, twosome, threesome, foursome, fortnight, decade, century, millennium, dozen, score, gross
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that only one person does something?
\qun
\ex alone (adv), solo
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a group of two?
\qun
\ex pair, couple, couplet, brace, dichotomy, deuce, dual, dyad, twain, yoke
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a group of three?
\qun
\ex trilogy, trinity, triple, triumvirate, triune
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that something is done in groups of a certain number?
\qun
\ex singly, one by one, two by two, three by three, by ones, by twos, by threes, in pairs, in threes, one at a time, two at a time, three at a time
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that everyone is to get a certain number of something?
\qun
\ex one apiece, two apiece, three apiece, one each, two each, three each
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.1.2.5
\oldqu (1) What words express how many people are doing something?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menjelaskan berapa banyak orang yang melakukan sesuatu?
\oldex (To do something) alone, solo, singly, in pairs, in threes
\oldexn (Melakukan sesuatu) sendirian, solo, sebatang kara, satu demi satu, sepasang,

\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan digunakan bagi menjelaskan bahawa sesuatu itu sedang dilakukan di dalam kumpulan nombor tertentu?
\oldex One by one, two by two, three by three by ones, by twos, by threes in groups of two, in groups of three
\oldexn Satu demi satu,

\oldex Solo, pair/duo/duet/couple/twins, trio/triplets, quartet, quintet, sextet, century
\oldexn Satu, sepasang, dua rangkai, kembar, abad, kurun

\is 8.1.1.6
\sd Fraction
\sdn Pecahan
\oldis 8.1.2.6
\oldsd Fraction
\oldsdn Pecahan

\dd Use this domain for the numbers that refer to a fraction of something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi nombor-nombor mana merujuk kepada sesuatu pecahan.
\qu (1) What general words refer to a fraction of something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada sesuatu pecahan?
\ex fraction, proportion, percentage, decimal, decimal point
\exn Bahagian, perpuluhan
\qu (2) What words refer to a particular fraction of something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sesuatu pecahan khusus?
\ex half, one half, third, one third, two thirds, quarter, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth
\exn Setengah, separuh, satu pertiga, satu perempat, dua pertiga
\qu (3) What words refer to dividing something into a fraction of the whole?
\qun
\ex halve, quarter (v), bisect, trisect, (divide/cut/fold) in half, in two
\exn

\is 8.1.2
\sd Count
\sdn Membilang
\oldis 8.1.1
\oldsd Count
\oldsdn Membilang
\dd Use this domain for words related to counting--to say the numbers in order, or to use numbers to find an amount.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to saying the numbers in order?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menyatakan angka secara teratur?
\ex count, countdown, say your numbers
\exn Mengira,
\qu (2) What words refer to counting the number of something?
\qun
\ex count, count up, at the last count, keep count, keep track, keep a tally of, enumerate, enumeration
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to determining the amount of something without being exact?
\qun
\ex estimate, assess, reckon
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to determining the quantity of something a second time?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menentukan jumlah sesuatu untuk kali kedua?
\ex recount, renumber
\exn Mengira semula
\qu (5) What words refer to making a mistake when you count?
\qun
\ex miscalculate, miscount, lose count
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the number or amount of something that is counted?
\qun
\ex calculation, sum, estimate, estimation, count (n)
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to assigning a number to each thing in a series?
\qun
\ex number, assign a number, count off
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe an amount that cannot be counted?
\qun (8) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan suatu jumlah yang tidak dapat dikira?
\ex innumerable, unnumbered, uncountable, uncounted, countless
\exn Tidak terkira, tidak terbilang, tak dapat dihitung

\oldexn Kiraan, bilangan, mengira

\oldex Number, assign a number, count off

\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to determining the amount of something?
\qun
\ex calculate, work out, figure out, make, figure, compute, solve
\exn

\qun
\ex is, equals, get
\exn
\xe If you add two and two, you <get> four.
\xen

\qun
\ex answer, solution
\exn
\qu (5) What words are used to talk about mathematics?
\qun
\ex problem, equation, square root, squared, graph, axis
\exn

\qun
\ex mathematician, statistician
\exn
\qu (7) What instruments are used to do mathematics?
\qun
\ex calculator, computer, abacus, slide rule
\exn

\is 8.1.2.2
\sd Add numbers

\oldsdn Campur
\dd Use this domain for words related to adding two numbers together.
\ddn

\qun
\ex add, addition
\exn

\qun
\ex add up, tally (v), total (v)
\exn
\qu (3) What words are used for addition equations?
\qun
\ex plus, and, added to
\exn
\xe Two <added to> two equals four.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate the answer in an equation?
\qun
\ex makes
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the total?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada jumlah?
\ex total (n), total (adj), sum, tally (n), grand total, subtotal, gross, aggregate, amount
\exn Jumlah, kesemuanya,
\qu (6) What words indicate that a particular number is the total?
\qun
\ex altogether, in total, in all, all told
\exn
\qu (7) What words indicate that the number of a group of things reaches a particular total?
\qun
\ex come to, amount to, total (v), reach, add up to, make, bring the number to, bring the total to, number (v)
\exn

\is 8.1.3
\sd Plural
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words and affixes that indicate that there is more than one of something. Some languages, such as Indo-European languages, indicate plural with an affix. Other languages, such as Austronesian languages, use a separate word. Some languages also have words or affixes that indicate that there are two of something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that there is more than one of something?
\qun
\ex -s
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that there are two of something?
\qun
\ex pair of
\exn

\gd I0EBF9FCC-EE38-4F5F-AB5E-C76E199EF7AE

\is 8.1.3.1
\sd Many, much
\sdn
\oldis 8.1.3
\oldsd Many
\oldsdn Banyak
\oldis 8.1.7
\oldsd Much, little
\oldsdn Banyak, sedikit
\dd Use this domain for words indicating that there are many things or people, or that there is much of something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that there is a large amount of something?
\qun
\ex a lot of, lots of, a great deal of, a good deal of, a fair bit of, a fair amount of, much, loads of, tons of, masses of, scads of, piles of, heaps of, stacks of, a mountain of, extensive, widespread, big amount, lots and lots
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that there are a large number of things or people?
\qun
\ex a lot of, lots of, many, many of, a large number of, large numbers of, plenty of, loads of, tons of, masses of, scads of, a bunch of, dozens of, numerous, a host of, quite a few, a wide range of, a raft of, multi-, multiple, a multitude of, considerable, goodly number, plethora, profuse, oodles, scores of
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that there are a very large number of things or people?
\qun
\ex hundreds of, thousands of, millions of, a great many, countless, innumerable, overwhelming, myriad
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that many things are happening?
\qun
\ex flood of, wave of, deluge of, avalanche of, stream, torrent
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that many bad things are happening?
\qun
\ex spate of, epidemic, rash of, wave, be a hotbed of
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that many people are doing something?
\qun
\ex in large numbers, in droves, in force, in strength, thick and fast, be dying like flies, be dropping like flies
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that many people are doing?
\qun
\ex common, popular, widespread, widely
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that someone does something a lot?
\qun
\ex a lot, a good deal, a great deal, quite a bit, plenty, heavy
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe something that contains a lot of a particular substance?
\qun
\ex high in, rich in
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe someone who makes many things?
\qun
\ex productive, prolific
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to using or giving a lot of something?
\qun
\ex generous, liberal
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe a large number or amount?
\qun
\ex large, big, high, sizable, considerable, substantial, significant, generous, handsome, hefty
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe a very large number or amount?
\qun
\ex huge, enormous, vast, massive, colossal, goodly, immense, whopping
\exn

\is 8.1.3.2

\ddn

\exn

\exn

\qun
\ex very few
\exn

\qun
\ex a little, a drop of, pinch, dash, mouthful, in moderation, meager
\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\is 8.1.3.3
\sd Group of things
\sdn Sekumpulan benda
\oldis 8.1.3.2

\oldsdn Sekumpulan benda

\ex group, collection, lot, cluster, clump, assortment, accumulation, aggregate, bits-and-pieces, nuts-and-bolts, odds-and-ends, stockpile, system, volley, wares
\exn Kumpulan, himpunan, golongan
\qu (2) What words refer to a group of things that belong together?
\qun
\ex set, batch, suit
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a group of things that are tied or joined together?
\qun
\ex bundle, bunch, sheaf, pack, package, packet, string of
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a group of things that are put on top of each other?
\qun
\ex pile, stack, heap
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a group of things that are moved together?
\qun
\ex cargo, contents, freight, goods, lading, load
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something is a member of a group?
\qun
\ex member, one of, part of, belong to, go with
\exn

\is 8.1.4
\sd More
\sdn Lebih banyak
\oldis 8.1.4
\oldsd More
\oldsdn Lebih banyak
\dd Use this domain for words related to there being more of something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to more of something in addition to what is already there?
\qun
\ex more, extra, another, added, additional, further, supplementary, spare
\exn
\xe We need more food.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate an amount that is more than an amount already mentioned?
\qun
\ex more than, over and above, as well as, plus, in addition to, on top of
\exn
\xe We need five chickens in addition to the ten we already have.
\xen
\qu (3) What words describe something that is more than another thing in number or amount?
\qun
\ex more, greater, higher, to a greater extent, to a greater degree
\exn
\xe I own more land than you.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate that the actual number is more than a particular number?
\qun
\ex more, over, above, beyond, greater than, in excess of, upwards of, plus, at least
\exn
\xe More than 100 people came to the wedding.
\xen
\qu (5) What words refer to something being more than a particular number or amount?
\qun
\ex be more than, be greater than, exceed, outnumber, be up on, pass, go past, surpass
\exn
\xe My land is more than five acres.
\xen
\qu (6) What words indicate that there are many more of something?
\qun
\ex many more, much more, far more, far beyond, way beyond, a lot more
\exn

\is 8.1.4.2
\sd Increase
\sdn Kenaikan
\oldis 8.1.4.2
\oldsd Increase
\oldsdn Kenaikan
\dd Use this domain for words related to something increasing in number or amount--to be more than before.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to something increasing in number or amount?
\qun
\ex increase, go up, rise, grow, climb, gain, escalate, pick up, improve, widen, augment, expand
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that is increasing in number or amount?
\qun
\ex increasing, rising, growing, mounting, escalating, expanding, more and more, cumulative
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to increasing a lot?
\qun
\ex multiply, double, treble, quadruple, proliferate, snowball
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to increasing very quickly?
\qun
\ex shoot up, soar, rocket, go through the roof, spiral, take off, jump
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to increasing slowly?
\qun
\ex accumulate, build up, pile up, collect, gather, mount up
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to causing something to increase?
\qun
\ex increase (vt), raise, put up, push up, drive up, force up, boost, maximize
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to increasing something by adding to it?
\qun
\ex add to, strengthen, swell, augment, supplement
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to increasing what a machine is doing?
\qun
\ex turn up
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to an increase in number or amount?
\qun
\ex increase (n), growth, rise, raise, build-up, upturn, hike, increment, proliferation, addition, supplement
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to a large increase?
\qun
\ex leap, surge, explosion, boom, jump
\exn
\qu (11) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something more than before?
\qun
\ex increasingly, gain ground, get more and more, become more and more, grow in, gain in
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe something that someone is doing or feeling more than before?
\qun
\ex increased, heightened, greater, higher
\exn

\is 8.1.4.3

\oldsdn Berkurang
\dd Use this domain for words related to something decreasing in number or amount--to be less than before.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to something decreasing in number or amount?
\qun
\ex decrease, fall, go down, come down, slide, diminish, contract, shrink, lessen, reduce, reduction, depreciate, lose, narrow, slow down, abate, peter out, tail off, waste away
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that is decreasing in number or amount?
\qun
\ex decreasing, declining, falling, lowering, shrinking, less and less, fewer and fewer
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to decreasing very quickly?
\qun
\ex drop, plummet, plunge, nosedive, slump, collapse, go through the floor
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to decreasing slowly?
\qun
\ex dwindle, decline, be on the decline, taper off, drop off, die down, ease off
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a decrease in number or amount?
\qun
\ex decrease (n), reduction, drop, fall, decline, downturn, loss, cut, slump, collapse
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a quality becoming less?
\qun
\ex lessen, subside, wane, ebb, recede
\exn
\qu (7) What words indicate that something happens or someone does something less than before?
\qun
\ex decreasingly, lose ground, become less and less, get less and less
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that someone is doing or feeling less than before?
\qun
\ex decreased, lowered, lower
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to causing something to decrease?
\qun
\ex reduce, lower, decrease, cut, slash, roll back, knock down, halve, minimize, abbreviate, abridge, curtail, dilate, drain
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to reducing the amount of something you use or how much you do?
\qun
\ex reduce, cut down on, scale down, scale back, cut back, trim, pare down, downsize, scrimp
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to reducing pain or a bad feeling?
\qun
\ex reduce, lessen, relieve, ease, alleviate, deaden, dull, take the edge off, allay, mitigate
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to decreasing what a machine is doing?
\qun
\ex reduce, lower, turn down
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to something slowly reducing the number or amount of something?
\qun
\ex erode, eat into, deplete, whittle away
\exn

\is 8.1.5.5
\sd Most, least
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words related to the most--the largest number or amount; or the least--the smallest number or amount. Most/least may refer to the largest/smallest number possible or needed. If there are several groups being counted, most/least may refer to the largest/smallest group.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the largest amount of something?
\qun
\ex maximum, most
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the smallest amount of something?
\qun
\ex the least, minimum, the fewest, the lowest
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the largest group?
\qun
\ex the most
\exn
\xe Who has the <most> children?
\xen
\qu (4) What words refer to the smallest group?
\qun
\ex the least
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to an amount being the largest it has ever been?
\qun
\ex an all-time high, record high, high water mark
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to an amount being the smallest it has ever been?
\qun
\ex an all-time low, record low, lowest ebb
\exn
\gd I0AAACFFE-9B6C-49a7-BF68-C0F9FF3E120E

\is 8.1.5.6
\sd Almost
\sdn Hampir
\oldis 8.1.5.4
\oldsd Almost
\oldsdn Hampir

\dd Use this domain for words related to a number or amount that is almost the same as another number.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something is almost a particular number or amount?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan sesuatu itu hampir kepada suatu nombor atau jumlah?
\ex almost, nearly, close to, close on, approaching, nearing, not quite, be pushing, pretty well
\exn Hampir, hampir-hampir, dekat, menjelang
\xe He is almost 100 years old.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate that someone has almost reached a place?
\qun
\ex almost, nearly, just about
\exn
\xe We are <almost> there.
\xen
\qu (3) What words indicate that something has almost reached a particular state?
\qun
\ex almost, nearly, very nearly, just about, practically, virtually, all but, as good as, to all intents and purposes, nearing, approaching, near to, close to, verging on, bordering on, more or less, pretty much, not quite
\exn
\xe The clothes are <almost> dry.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate that something is almost finished?
\qun
\ex almost, nearly, just about, practically, as good as, more or less, not quite
\exn
\xe We are <almost> finished.
\xen
\qu (5) What words indicate that someone almost does something?
\qun
\ex almost, nearly, very nearly, come close to, be on the verge of, come within an inch of
\exn
\xe I <almost> hit you.
\xen
\qu (6) What words indicate that something almost happens?
\qun
\ex almost, be near to, be on the brink of, come within an inch of
\exn
\xe He <almost> died.
\xen
\qu (7) What words indicate that something is almost the best or worst example of some quality?
\qun
\ex almost, nearly, practically, virtually, just about, verging on, bordering on
\exn
\xe He is <almost> the worst student in the school.
\xen
\qu (8) What words indicate that something is so similar to something that it is almost the same thing?
\qun
\ex almost, practically, virtually
\exn
\xe That dog is <almost> human.
\xen
\qu (9) What words indicate that something is almost some quality (such as some color or shape)?
\qun
\ex almost, more or less, practically, virtually, not quite
\exn
\xe The road is <almost> straight.
\xen
\qu (10) What words indicate that something is true of or has happened to almost all of something?
\qun
\ex almost, nearly, practically, virtually, pretty well, more or less, just about
\exn
\xe <Almost> everyone is sick.
\xen

\is 8.1.5.7
\sd Only
\sdn Hanya
\oldis 8.1.5.6
\oldsd Only
\oldsdn Hanya

\dd Use this domain for words referring to only a particular number or amount of people or things--no more than one, or no more than a particular number or amount.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe the only person or thing?
\qun
\ex only, sole, the one, lone, solitary, alone, one and only, single
\exn
\xe I had four brothers, but I am the <only> one who is still alive.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate that there is only a particular number or amount of something?
\qun
\ex only, just, no more than, all
\exn
\xe We <only> have five chairs.
\xen
\qu (3) What words indicate something is true of only one thing or one group of things, and not true of others?
\qun
\ex only, just, exclusively, nothing but, nothing else, be limited to, be restricted to, be confined to, be unique to, be peculiar to, exclusive
\exn
\xe <Only> men can grow beards.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate that something is only what you say it is, and not something more?
\qun
\ex only, just, purely, merely, mere, nothing but
\exn
\xe I don't want anything--I <only> want to help.
\xen

\oldex Only, sole, the one, lone, solitary, alone
\oldexn Hanya, sahaja, yang satu, cuma

\is 8.1.5.8
\sd Exact
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is exact--not more and not less.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe a number or amount that is exact?
\qun
\ex exact, precise
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that a number or amount is exact?
\qun
\ex exactly, precisely
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that something happens at an exact time?
\qun
\ex exactly, precisely, on the dot, sharp
\exn
\xe John begins at <exactly> 6 a.m.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate that something happens at an exact place?
\qun
\ex right, bang, smack, plumb
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that is exactly the same as another thing?
\qun
\ex exact, accurate, faithful, strict, literal, word for word, just
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something is done in exactly the right way?
\qun
\ex exactly, strictly, religiously, to the letter
\exn
\gd I8F4C9266-A025-4b7a-BD67-FE0C043BF6F5

\is 8.1.5.8.1
\sd Approximate
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words that indicate whether a number or amount is approximate.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe a number or amount that is approximate?
\qun
\ex approximate, rough
\exn
\xe We need to know the <approximate> weight of his suitcase.
\xen
\qu (2) What words describe something that is not exact?
\qun
\ex inexact, inaccurate, sort of, kind of
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that a particular number or amount is approximate?
\qun
\ex about, approximately, roughly, give or take, at a guess, somewhere in the region of, an estimated, some, something like, in round numbers, close to
\exn
\xe John walks <approximately> two miles a day.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly more?
\qun
\ex or so, odd, or more, at least, and maybe more, barely, hardly, little more than, scarcely
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate an approximate number when the actual number is possibly less?
\qun
\ex at most, as much as, short of
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to determining the approximate number of amount of something?
\qun
\ex approximate (v), estimate (v), overestimate, underestimate
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to estimating a number to the nearest ten, hundred, thousand, etc?
\qun
\ex rounded to the nearest ten/hundred/thousand, round up, round down
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to a number that is approximate?
\qun
\ex estimate (n), approximation, ballpark figure, round figure
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate time?
\qun
\ex about, around, approximately, round about, or thereabouts, circa, some time
\exn
\qu (10) What words indicate that something happens at an approximate place?
\qun
\ex about, around, in the vicinity of, near, close to
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
\qun
\ex narrowly, rather
\exn
\qu (12) What words indicate that something is done in approximately the right way?
\qun
\ex roughly, more or less, somewhat
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe something that is approximately the same as another thing?
\qun
\ex loose, vague, hazy, impressionistic, broad
\exn
\gd ICA752706-1C9E-43E7-BD17-845C4736CCD8

\is 8.1.5.9
\sd Average
\sdn Purata
\oldis 8.1.4.4
\oldsd Average
\oldsdn Purata

\dd Use this domain for words related to an average number.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to an average number?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada suatu purata angka?
\ex average (n), mean, medium, median
\exn Purata, hitung panjang, pukul rata
\qu (2) What words describe an average number?
\qun
\ex average (adj), mean (adj), medium (adj), medial, on average
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to calculating the average?
\qun
\ex average (v), average out
\exn

\is 8.1.6
\sd Whole, complete
\sdn
\oldis 8.1.6
\oldsd Whole
\oldsdn Semuanya
\dd Use this domain for words describing a whole thing--all of something with no parts missing.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something is whole?
\qun
\ex complete, full, whole, in full, in its entirety, be all there, all of, entire, intact, undivided, united
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to making something complete?
\qun
\ex complete, make up, assemble
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that something is not whole?
\qun
\ex incomplete, partial, missing something
\exn

\is 8.1.6.1
\sd Part
\sdn Bahagian
\oldis 8.1.6.1
\oldsd Part
\oldsdn Bahagian
\dd Many things have parts. Use this domain for words referring to a part of something, and for words that express the idea that something has parts, that something is a part of something, or that link the whole with a part.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a part of something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian sesuatu benda?
\ex part, bit, portion, section, segment, sample, cross-section, member
\exn Sebahagian, sepotong,
\qu (2) What words refer to the parts that something is made from?
\qun
\ex component, element, piece, ingredient, constituent
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the parts of a process?
\qun
\ex stage, phase, round
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the parts of an organization?
\qun
\ex branch, department, division, section, sector, wing, end, subdivision
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the parts of a story?
\qun
\ex episode, installment, chapter, scene, part, extract, excerpt, clip
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the parts of a situation?
\qun
\ex aspect, side, dimension, facet, factor, feature, detail
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to being a part of something?
\qun
\ex be part of, form a part of, inherent
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that something has parts?
\qun
\ex have, of, -'s, consist of, be made of, be made up of, be composed of, comprise, be divided into, include
\exn
\xe the boy<'s> foot
\xen

\is 8.1.6.2

\sdn

\qun
\ex piece, bit
\exn
\xe a <piece> of bread
\xen

\qun
\ex block, cube, slab, bar
\exn

\qun
\ex chunk, hunk, lump, dollop
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a thin piece?
\qun
\ex sheet, slip, pane, slice
\exn

\qun
\ex grain, flake, speck, fleck, crumb, morsel, tidbit, dot, mote
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a small piece that is left after something has been broken?
\qun
\ex fragment, scrap, splinter, chip, shard
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a part of something that has been made by dividing it in some way?
\qun
\ex pinch (of salt), cut (of meat), slice (of bread), bite (of cake)

\is 8.1.7
\sd Enough
\sdn
\oldis 6.8.1.2
\oldsd Have sufficient
\oldsdn Ada kecukupan
\dd Use this domain for words related to being or having enough--to have as much of something or as many of something as you need or want.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that you have enough of?
\qun
\ex enough, sufficient, adequate, satisfactory, enough to go round
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that there is enough of something for what you need?
\qun
\ex be enough, do, suffice, cover, last, meet someone's needs, get by, afford to
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that someone is strong enough or old enough to do something?
\qun
\ex enough, sufficiently
\exn
\xe John <is> strong enough to walk now.
\xen
\qu (4) What words describe a situation in which someone does enough or something happens enough?
\qun
\ex do enough, sufficiently, adequacy, adequately, satisfactorily, sufficiency
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to having enough of something?
\qun
\ex have enough, be OK for, be all right for, be well off for, have sufficient
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to having enough of something to do what you want?
\qun
\ex have the time/money, can afford, can spare, run to
\exn
\xe John <has> the money to buy a bicycle.
\xen
\qu (7) What words refer to having more than enough, but not too much?
\qun
\ex more than enough, plenty, ample
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to not having enough?
\qun
\ex not enough, insufficient, too little, too few, scarce, inadequate, inadequacy, shortage, lack of, be in short supply, be short
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate that there is not enough of something for what you need?
\qun
\ex not be enough, be running short, not last, won't last
\exn
\qu (10) What words indicate that someone is not strong enough or old enough to do something?
\qun
\ex not (strong) enough, not sufficiently
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe a situation in which someone does not do enough or something does not happens enough?
\qun
\ex not...enough, too little
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to not having enough of something?
\qun
\ex not have enough, be short of, be short on, go short, be running short of, deficient, be starved of, be lacking in
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to not having enough of something to do what you want?
\qun
\ex not have enough, can't afford, be strapped for cash
\exn

\is 8.1.7.4
\sd Remain, remainder
\sdn
\oldis 8.1.5.3
\oldsd Remainder
\oldsdn Baki

\dd Use this domain for words related to the remainder of something--the part or amount of something that remains behind after the other parts have been taken away. Something can be left because everything else has been used or eaten, or everything else has been destroyed or burned.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to something remaining?
\qun
\ex left, remain, be left over, survive, be still standing, to spare, to go, in hand
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to the remainder?
\qun
\ex the remains, remnants, leftovers, ruins, what is left of, what remains of, the rest, the remainder, the last of, residue
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to the bad part that remains after the good part has been taken?
\qun
\ex butt, dregs, leavings, offscourings, rags, scraps, sweepings
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a very small part that remains?
\qun
\ex fragment, shadow, trace, vestige
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that remains?
\qun
\ex remaining, last, outstanding, spare, leftover, residual, surplus, surviving
\exn

\is 8.1.8
\sd Full
\sdn Penuh

\oldsd Full
\oldsdn Penuh
\oldis 8.2.4.9
\oldsd Overflowing
\oldsdn Melimpah
\dd Use this domain for words referring to a container being full of something.
\ddn

\qun
\ex full, full up, bulging, be full to the brim, be bursting at the seams, be full to capacity, be chock-a-block, be packed out, be up to the brim, brimful, brimming, bursting, charged, chock-full, chockablock, jam-packed, jammed, loaded, replete, saturated, soaked, stuffed, supercharged
\exn

\qun
\ex be full of, be filled with, be crammed with, be stuffed with, be packed with, be packed full of, be crammed full of
\exn

\qun
\ex crowded, packed, crammed with, be packed out, booked up, fully booked, congested, dense, occupied, throng, thronged, thronging
\exn

\ex fill, fill up
\exn

\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that has been made full?
\qun
\ex filled
\exn

\qun
\ex refill, replenish, top up, top off
\exn

\qun
\ex swarm, teem, be teeming with, be swarming with, be crawling with
\exn

\qun
\ex fuller, fullest
\exn

\qun
\ex fullness
\exn

\qun

\exn

\qun
\ex almost full, not quite full
\exn

\qun
\ex half full
\exn

\ex overflow, overflowing, run over, running over, brimming over, full and running over, overcrowded, overfilled
\exn Melimpah,

\is 8.2
\sd Big
\sdn Besar
\oldis 8.2.4.1
\oldsd Big
\oldsdn Besar
\oldis 8.2.4.3
\oldsd Get larger
\oldsdn Semakin besar
\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is big.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is big?
\qun
\ex big, large, biggish, bulky, fair-sized, be a fair size, good-sized, be a good size, bulky, grand, imposing, sizable, substantial
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that is very big?
\qun
\ex huge, enormous, massive, colossal, great, giant, gigantic, great big, be a whopper, be quite a size, astronomical, elephantine, mammoth, monstrous, monumental, prodigious, stupendous, tremendous, vast
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to something that is big?
\qun
\ex mass, giant
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something becoming big?
\qun
\ex get bigger, expand, grow, swell up, stretch, inflate, increase in size, swell, mushroom
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to part of something becoming big?
\qun
\ex branch, excrescence
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to making something big?
\qun
\ex extend, stretch, enlarge, blow up, magnify, expand, inflate, augment
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the process of becoming big?
\qun
\ex enlargement, expansion, extension, growth, inflation, increase (n), magnification
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that has been made big?
\qun
\ex enlarged, swollen, inflated
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to being bigger than another thing?
\qun
\ex bigger, biggest, larger, largest, greater, greatest
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe something that is much bigger than other things of the same type?
\qun
\ex outsized, giant, extra large
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to how big something is?
\qun
\ex size, dimensions, magnitude
\exn
\qu (12) What words indicate how big something is?
\qun
\ex how big, measure (10 meters), be 10 meters long/wide/high
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to measuring how big something is?
\qun
\ex measure
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to a unit of size?
\qun
\ex cubic (inch/foot/yard)
\exn
\qu (15) What instruments are used to measure the size of something?
\qun
\ex ruler, tape measure
\exn
\qu (16) What words describe a system of measures?
\qun
\ex metric
\exn
\qu (17) What words describe something that is not big or small?
\qun
\ex medium, average, medium-sized, average-sized, in between
\exn
\qu (18) What words refer to something being big on one side or end?
\qun
\ex flare, spread, lopsided, fan out
\exn
\qu (19) What words describe something that is too big?
\qun
\ex gross, outsized, overgrown, oversized, unwieldy
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.2.4.1
\oldqu (1) What words describe something that is large?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang besar?
\oldex Large, big, huge, enormous, mammoth

\is 8.2.2
\sd Long
\sdn Panjang
\oldis 8.2.2
\oldsd Length
\oldsdn Panjang
\oldis 8.2.2.1
\oldsd Long
\oldsdn Panjang
\dd Use this domain for words related to being long. In many languages there is more than one system of measuring length. These systems may be used for different purposes or in different jobs. For instance measuring the length of an object may use different words than measuring the distance a person travels.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is long?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang panjang?
\ex long, lengthy, extensive
\exn Panjang, sangat panjang
\qu (2) What words describe a long distance?
\qun
\ex long, huge, vast
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to something that is long?
\qun
\ex a length of
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something becoming long?
\qun
\ex get longer, lengthen, stretch
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to making something long?
\qun
\ex make something longer, lengthen, extend, stretch
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that has been made long?
\qun
\ex lengthened, elongated, extended, stretched, outstretched
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to being longer than another thing?
\qun
\ex longer, longest
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to how long something is?
\qun
\ex length, distance, how long, span
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate how long something is?
\qun
\ex is, measure (v), long, in length, how long, be (two inches) (too) long
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to measuring how long something is?
\qun
\ex measure, pace off, step off
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to a unit of length?
\qun
\ex inch, foot, yard, mile, light year, millimeter, centimeter, meter, kilometer, day's journey
\exn
\qu (12) What instruments are used to measure the length of something?
\qun
\ex caliper, chain, line, micrometer, rod, rule, ruler, tape measure, measuring tape, tapeline, yardstick
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe a system of lengths?
\qun
\ex metric
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.2.2
\oldqu (1) What words refer to the length of something?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada kepanjangan sesuatu?
\oldex Length, distance
\oldexn Panjang, jarak, jauh
\oldqu (2) What are the units of length?

\oldex Inch, foot, yard, mile, light year, millimeter, centimeter, meter, kilometer

\exn

\qun
\ex huge, immense, vast, enormous
\exn

\qun
\ex spacious, roomy, cavernous, be big inside
\exn

\qun
\ex expanse
\exn

\qun
\ex expand, spread
\exn

\qun
\ex expand
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe an area that has been made big?
\qun
\ex expanded
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to being bigger in area than another thing?
\qun
\ex bigger, biggest, roomier
\exn

\qun
\ex area, acreage, size, square footage, extent
\exn

\qun

\qun
\ex survey
\exn

\qun
\ex rod
\exn

\qun
\ex small, narrow (plot of ground), cramped, poky
\exn
\qu (15) What words refer to how big around an area is?
\qun
\ex circumference, around
\exn

\ddn

\qun
\ex big, large, capacious, voluminous
\exn

\qun
\ex huge, enormous
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a container that is big?
\qun
\ex tank, tub
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a container becoming big?
\qun
\ex expand, inflate
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to making a container big?
\qun
\ex expand, enlarge
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe a container that has been made big?
\qun
\ex expanded
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a container being bigger than another container?
\qun
\ex bigger, biggest
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to how big a container is?
\qun
\ex volume, capacity, size, dimensions
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate how big a container is?
\qun
\ex how big, be (ten liters) in volume, hold, be (ten) cubic inches, be two meters long two meters wide and two meters high, be two by two by two
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to measuring the volume of a something?
\qun
\ex measure, find the volume
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to a unit of volume?
\qun
\ex cubic (inch/foot/yard), milliliter, centiliter, deciliter, liter, decaliter, kiloliter, hectoliter, cup, pint, quart, gallon, fluid ounce, dry ounce, peck, bushel, measure, batch
\exn
\qu (12) What instruments are used to measure volume?
\qun
\ex measuring cup, measuring spoon
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe a system of measures?
\qun
\ex metric, imperial
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to an amount of something that has been measured by a particular container?
\qun
\ex bag, bagful, barrel, boatload, bottle, bowl, box, boxful, bucketful, busload, can, carload, glass, handful, jug, mug, pack, packet, planeload, platter, roomful, sackful, scoop, scoopful, spoon, spoonful, tablespoon, tankful, teaspoon, teaspoonful, trainload, tray, truckload
\exn
\xe All I had to eat was a <handful> of maize.
\xen
\qu (15) What words describe a small container?
\qun
\ex small
\exn

\is 8.2.6
\sd Distance
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words referring to the distance between two things.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the distance between two things?
\qun
\ex distance, how far, span, as the crow flies
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate the distance between two places?
\qun
\ex from, away, off, apart, away from
\exn
\xe Our house is two miles <away>.
\xen
\qu (3) What words refer to the distance something can move?
\qun
\ex range, reach (n), extent
\exn
\xe The gun has a <range> of one mile.
\xen
\qu (4) What words indicate that something (like an area or road) continues for some distance?
\qun
\ex extend, stretch, go on, continue, spread
\exn
\xe The road <stretched> on for miles.
\xen
\qu (5) What question words ask for the distance between two things?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe <What is the distance> from New York to Washington?
\xen
\cf Long

\gd I73D580AC-DC89-474C-8048-3453EBDDA807

\is 8.2.6.1
\sd Far
\sdn Jauh
\oldis 8.5.1.6.4
\oldsd Far
\oldsdn Jauh
\dd Use this domain for words indicating that something is far from something else.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something is far from something else?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang sesuatu adalah jauh dari satu benda yang lain?
\ex far, far away, far off, afar, far afield, far and wide, a far cry from, far apart, far removed, distant, be distant, a long distance, in the distance, some distance, a good distance, a ways, way off, a long way (off), a long ways away, a fair way, quite a ways, nowhere near, miles (away), yonder, wide of, clear off, all over, asunder, at arm's length, on the horizon, the ends of the earth, uttermost parts of the earth
\exn Jauh,
\xe It is far from here to there, about a day's journey.
\xen Ia adalah jauh dari sini ke sana lebih kurang sehari perjalanan
\qu (2) What words describe something that is far?
\qun
\ex distant, remote, faraway, out of the way, long-distance, far-flung
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to how far something is?
\qun
\ex distance, how far
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something is far enough so that you cannot do something?
\qun
\ex too far, out of sight, out of range, beyond reach, out of reach, out of hearing
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to moving away from someone or something?
\qun
\ex go away, recede
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to moving away from a person or vehicle behind you?
\qun
\ex leave behind, leave in the dust
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to staying far from something?
\qun
\ex not go near, not come near, stay away from, keep away from, keep your distance, keep off, stay back, keep back, remain at a distance, stand off, stand aloof, steer clear of, stand clear of
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to a long distance?
\qun
\ex long distance, long haul, long range, a fur piece
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe a place that is far away from where most people go?
\qun
\ex remote, isolated, out of the way, off the beaten track, secluded, miles from anywhere, in the middle of nowhere, way out, backwater, backcountry, boondocks, boonies, hicks, out in the sticks
\exn
\qu (10) What words indicate that something is farther than something else?
\qun
\ex farther, further, beyond, past, on the other side of, farthest, furthest, extreme, in the offing, background
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.5.1.6.4

\exn

\qun

\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\qun
\ex stay close, keep close, hug, cling to
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that something is nearer than something else?
\qun

\exn

\exn

\is 8.2.6.5
\sd Deep, shallow
\sdn Dalam, cetek
\oldis 8.2.2.6
\oldsd Deep, shallow
\oldsdn Dalam, cetek
\dd Use this domain for words related to being deep or shallow--how far something such as a hole extends below the ground or other surface, or how far something is below the surface of the water.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is deep?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang dalam?
\ex deep, deeply, deep-seated, in the depths, deep down
\exn Dalam,
\qu (2) What words describe something that is very deep?
\qun
\ex bottomless
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe how deep something is for a person?
\qun
\ex knee-deep, waist-deep, over your head, out of your depth
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a deep place?
\qun
\ex the depths, channel, trench, gulf, abyss
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something becoming deep?
\qun
\ex deepen, get deeper
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to making something deep?
\qun
\ex deepen, dredge, dig out
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to being deeper than another thing?
\qun
\ex deeper, deepest
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to how deep something is?
\qun
\ex depth
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate how deep something is?
\qun
\ex how deep, be (ten feet) deep, (ten feet) in depth, at a depth of (ten feet), plunge (ten feet)
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to measuring how deep something is?
\qun
\ex take a sounding, plumb
\exn
\qu (11) What instruments are used to measure how deep something is?
\qun
\ex plumb line
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to a unit of depth?
\qun
\ex fathom
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe something that is shallow?
\qun (13) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang cetek?
\ex shallow, not deep, skin-deep, superficial, surface
\exn Cetek, tidak dalam
\qu (14) What words refer to a shallow place?
\qun
\ex shallows, shoal
\exn

\is 8.2.8
\sd Measure
\sdn Ukuran
\oldis 8.2
\oldsd Measure
\oldsdn Ukuran
\dd Use this domain for words related to measuring something--to find out the size, length, weight, or amount of something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to measuring something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada mengukur sesuatu?
\ex measure, take a measurement, assay, assess, balance, calibrate, determine, fathom, gauge, grade, mete, meter, pace, plumb, quantify, rank, reach, read, take a reading, record, rule, sound, span, step off, stretch, stride, survey, tape, test, time
\exn Ukuran, sukatan, timbangan, takaran, menilai, tolok,
\qu (2) What words refer to the size or amount of something?
\qun
\ex capacity, dimension, distance, extent, length, measure, portion, quantity, size, volume
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that can be measured?
\qun
\ex measurable, quantifiable
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the number or amount that you get when you measure something?
\qun
\ex measurement, reading
\exn
\qu (5) What general words refer to a unit of measure?
\qun
\ex unit, measure, standard, scale, benchmark
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something is a particular size or amount?
\qun
\ex is, measure (v), weigh, how big, of
\exn
\xe two kilos <of> sugar
\xen
\qu (7) What instruments are used to measure something?
\qun
\ex abacus, almanac, beam, calendar, caliper, chain, chronometer, clock, compass, dial, gauge, instrument, level, line, micrometer, plumb, protractor, quadrant, rod, rule, ruler, sextant, square, straightedge, tape, tapeline, thermometer, watch, yardstick
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to an amount that cannot be measured?
\qun
\ex immeasurable, measureless, incalculable, unfathomable, unmeasured, untold
\exn

\is 8.2.9
\sd Weigh
\sdn
\oldis 8.2.1
\oldsd Weight
\oldsdn Berat
\dd Use this domain for words related to weighing something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to weighing something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada berat sesuatu?
\ex weigh
\exn Berat
\xe The shopkeeper <weighed> the rice.
\xen
\qu (2) What words refer to the weight of something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada berat sesuatu?
\ex weight, mass
\exn Berat
\xe What is the <weight> of a liter of water?
\xen
\qu (3) What words refer to a unit of weight?
\qun
\ex ounce, pound, ton, milligram, centigram, decigram, gram, dekagram, kilo, kilogram, metric ton, kiloton, megaton, atomic weight, carat, dram, grain, hundredweight, pennyweight, stone, talent, gross weight, net weight
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something is a particular weight?
\qun
\ex is, weigh, how heavy, weigh in at
\exn
\xe The rice <weighs> one kilo.
\xen
\qu (5) What instruments are used to weigh something?
\qun
\ex scale, balance, weight
\exn
\xe I have a <scale> we can use to weigh the rice.
\xen
\qu (6) What words describe a system of weights?
\qun
\ex apothecary, avoirdupois, metric, troy
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to how much weight something can support without breaking or falling?
\qun
\ex support, carry, hold, load, weight, pressure
\exn

\is 8.3.1
\sd Shape
\sdn Bentuk
\oldis 8.3.1
\oldsd Shape
\oldsdn Bentuk
\dd Use this domain for general words referring to the shape of something, and for general words referring to changing the shape of something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan umum merujuk kepada bentuk sesuatu dan bagi perkataan umum merujuk kepada perubahan bentuk sesuatu.
\qu (1) What general words refer to the shape of something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada bentuk sesuatu?
\ex shape, form, figure, silhouette
\exn Bentuk, rupa
\qu (2) What words refer to the outside shape of something?
\qun
\ex outline, lines, profile, contour
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to having a particular shape?
\qun
\ex shaped, in the shape of, in the form of
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to an irregular shape?
\qun
\ex irregular, jagged
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the wrong shape?
\qun
\ex misshapen, deformed, distorted, out of shape, lopsided, lose its shape
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to having no clear shape?
\qun
\ex shapeless, formless, amorphous
\exn
\qu (7) What general words refer to changing the shape of something?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada perubahan bentuk sesuatu?
\ex shape (v), change the shape of, form, mold, transform
\exn Berubah bentuk
\qu (8) What words describe something like a branch or road that divides into two parts?
\qun
\ex forked, bifurcate, bifurcated, fork, branch, a Y in the road
\exn

\is 8.3.1.1
\sd Point, dot
\sdn Titik, bintik
\oldis 8.3.1.1
\oldsd Point, dot
\oldsdn Titik, bintik

\dd Use this domain for words referring to a point--a small mark such as might be made by a pointed object.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan merujuk kepada suatu titik - satu tanda kecil yang terbentuk oleh suatu benda tajam.
\qu (1) What words refer to a point?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada satu titik?
\ex point, dot, polka dot, spot, pinpoint, speck, mote, jot, iota, fleck, period
\exn Titik, bintik, noktah, tompok, titis

\is 8.3.1.3.1
\sd Flat
\sdn Rata
\oldis 8.3.1.3.1
\oldsd Flat
\oldsdn Rata

\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is flat--having a surface that is even. A board or wall is flat when its surface is even and it does not bend.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang mana yang adalah rata - mempunyai permukaan yang sama rata. Suatu papan atau dinding adalah rata apabila permukaannya adalah sama rata dan tidak bengkok.
\qu (1) What words describe something that is flat?
\qun
\ex flat, flat as a pancake, even, flush
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to making something flat?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada membuat sesuatu itu rata?
\ex flatten, even (v), even out, smooth, level, roll something flat, press, squish, squash, smash, mash, spread thin
\exn Meratakan, mendatarkan,
\qu (3) What words refer to something becoming flat?
\qun
\ex flatten, flatten out, level off
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something flat?
\qun
\ex plane, sheet
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that is not flat?
\qun
\ex rough, bumpy, uneven, lumpy, hilly, rolling, mountainous
\exn

\oldexn Rata, datar

\is 8.3.1.4
\sd Horizontal
\sdn Mendatar/Melintang
\oldis 8.3.1.4
\oldsd Horizontal
\oldsdn Mendatar/Melintang
\dd Use this domain for words describing a horizontal orientation in relation to the ground or something that is level--a flat surface that does not rise in any direction. A person is horizontal when he is sleeping. A field is level when it is not on a hill and it has no uneven areas in it.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang mendatar di dalam hubungan dengan kawasan atau sesuatu yang mana adalah datar - pemukaan rata yang mana tidak meninggi dari mana arah pun. Seseorang itu mendatar apabila dia tidur. Suatu padang adalah rata apabila ianya bukan berada di atas bukit atau tidak mempunyai permukaan yang tidak rata.
\qu (1) What words describe something in a horizontal position?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu di dalam keadaan melintang?
\ex horizontal, prone, prostrate, longwise, flat on the ground, on its side, lie, prone, flush, on an even keel, on the level, parallel to the ground
\exn Melintang, mendatar, mengufuk
\qu (2) What words refer to becoming horizontal?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada yang menjadi melintang?
\ex fall on your face, fall prone, prostrate oneself, get horizontal, fall flat, hit the dirt, lay flat
\exn Melintang, mendatar, mengufuk, terlentang, tertiarap, terbaring, telangkup
\qu (3) What words refer to causing something to be horizontal?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menyebabkan sesuatu menlintang?
\ex lay something flat, lay something down, align
\exn Menjajarkan, menyebariskan, membaringkan,
\qu (4) What words describe a surface that is level?
\qun
\ex level (adj), even (adj), flat
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to making something level?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menyama ratakan sesuatu?
\ex make level, level (v)
\exn Meratakan, diratakan,

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.1.4
\oldqu (3) What words describe a surface, which is level?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan suatu permukaan yang rata?
\oldex Level, even, flat
\oldexn Rata, datar,
\cf Lie down

\is 8.3.1.4.1
\sd Vertical
\sdn Tegak/Menegak
\oldis 8.3.1.4.1
\oldsd Vertical
\oldsdn Tegak/Menegak
\dd Use this domain for words describing a vertical orientation in relation to the ground. A person is vertical when he is standing.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang mengambarkan sesuatu yang menegak di dalam hubungan dengan permukaan yang rata. Seseorang itu menegak apabila dia sedang berdiri.
\qu (1) What words describe something in a vertical position?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu dalam keadaan menegak?
\ex vertical, upright, up-and-down, plumb, erect, upraised, perpendicular, at right angles, square, standing, true, straight, straight up, bolt upright
\exn Menegak, tegak, lurus, cacak
\qu (2) What words refer to making something vertical?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada membuat sesuatu itu menegak?
\ex raise, stand something up, stand something on end, erect, set up, rear
\exn Mencacak, meninggikan, mendirikan,
\qu (3) What words describe a surface that is vertical?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan suatu permukaan yang menegak?
\ex sheer, drop (n)
\exn Curam, terjal,
\qu (4) What words describe when the top of something is on the bottom?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan apabila bahagian atas sesuatu itu berada di bahagian bawah?
\ex upside down, inverted, upended
\exn Terbalik, terlentang, songsang
\qu (5) What tools are used to determine if something is vertical?
\qun (5) Apakah peralatan digunakan bagi menentukan sekiranya sesuatu itu adalah menegak?
\ex plumb line, level, square
\exn Tali pengukur, batu ladung, batu bandul, unting-unting

\is 8.3.1.4.2
\sd Leaning, sloping
\sdn Condong, Cerun
\oldis 8.3.1.4.2
\oldsd Leaning, sloping
\oldsdn Condong, Cerun

\dd Use this domain for words describing a leaning orientation in relation to the ground, or a surface that is sloping.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan mengambarkan suatu keadaan yang condong berhubungan dengan suatu kawasan atau permukaan yang cerun.
\qu (1) What words describe something in a leaning position?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu di dalam kedudukan condong?
\ex leaning, at an angle, out of plumb, angled, on a slant, aslant, slanted, inclined, oblique, tilted, crooked, list, askew, out of kilter
\exn Condong, senget, miring, sendeng, bengkok, serong
\qu (2) What words refer to causing something to lean?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menyebabkan sesuatu yang condong?
\ex lean, angle, tilt, slant, incline
\exn Condong, bersudut, lerengan, sengetan
\qu (3) What words refer to leaning something against something else?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada mencondongkan sesuatu menghadap sesuatu yang lain?
\ex lean something against, incline, prop against
\exn Condong menghadap sesuatu, sengetan,
\qu (4) What words describe a surface that is sloping?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan suatu permukaan yang bercerun?
\ex sloping, slope up/down, on an incline, rising, rise up (toward), ascending, upgrade, uphill, falling, fall away, descending, downgrade, downhill, dip
\exn Curam, condong, sendeng
\qu (5) What words refer to a surface that is sloping?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada suatu permukaan yang bercerun?
\ex slope (n), ramp, ascent, rise, bank, incline (n), grade
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to how much something is leaning or sloping?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada berapa banyak kecondongan atau kecerunan sesuatu?
\ex angle, slope (n), inclination, pitch, grade, gradient, steep, precipitous, gradual (rise)
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a surface that is not level?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan satu permukaan yang tidak sama rata?
\ex uneven, rough, hilly, wavy, lumpy, broken (ground), rugged
\exn Tidak rata, tidak sekata, kasar, berlekuk-lekak,

\is 8.3.1.5
\sd Bend
\sdn
\oldis 8.3.1.5
\oldsd Bent
\oldsdn Lengkungan
\dd Use this domain for words referring to bending something and for words that describe something that is bent or curved.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang mana dilengkung atau dilipat.
\qu (1) What words refer to bending something?
\qun
\ex bend, bow, flex, curve, put a kink in
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to something bending?
\qun
\ex bend, buckle, curl, sag, warp
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that is bent?
\qun
\ex bent, arched, bowed, crinkled, curved, curving, curled, devious, gnarled, gnarly, hooked, indirect, jagged, kinked, knotted, knotty, knurled, knurly, turning, twirled, twisted
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe something that should be straight but is bent?
\qun
\ex akimbo, askew, awry, bandy, catawampus, contorted, crooked, deviating, distorted, skewed, tortuous, warped
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a bend in something?
\qun
\ex bend, bow, curve, kink, loop, angle, joint
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to making many bends in something?
\qun
\ex corrugate
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that has many bends?
\qun
\ex circuitous, coiled, convoluted, corrugated, curly, curvy, kinky, meandering, pretzel, serpentine, serrated, sinuous, snaky, spiral, tortuous, twisting, undulating, waved, waving, wavy, wind, winding, zigzag
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to a line or road that is bent?
\qun
\ex bend, curve, twist
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe something that can be bent?
\qun
\ex bendable, flexible, flexibility, jointed, pliable, plastic, supple
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe something that cannot be bent?
\qun
\ex unbending, inflexible, inflexibility, rigid, rigidity
\exn

\is 8.3.2.5
\sd Furrow
\sdn Alur
\oldis 8.3.2.7
\oldsd Furrow
\oldsdn Alur

\dd Use this domain for words related to a furrow--a long mark cut into the surface of something, such as the furrow made by a plow, or a long cut made by a knife.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a furrow?
\qun
\ex furrow, groove, rut, scratch, crack, score, incision, slit, chamfer, channel, gutter, trench, ditch, moat, trough, seam, line, fold, wrinkle
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to making a furrow?
\qun
\ex furrow, plow, incise, score, cut, seam, cut a channel, engrave, etch, bite in
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something with many furrows?
\qun
\ex furrowed, ribbed, striated, fluted, corduroy, corrugated, rippled, washboard, wrinkled
\exn

\exn Cahaya, sinar, pancaran cahaya, mentari,
\qu (2) What words refer to making light shine in a place?
\qun
\ex light (v), light up, illuminate
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that has light shining on it?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuaatu yang mempunyai sinaran cahaya?
\ex be light, illuminated, sunlit, moonlit, starlit, lighted, luminous
\exn Menerangi,
\qu (4) What words refer to a ray of light?
\qun
\ex ray, beam, shaft, sunbeam, moonbeam
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to different kinds of light?
\qun
\ex daylight, sunlight, moonlight, starlight, firelight, candlelight, electric light, electromagnetic radiation, fluorescence, fluorescent light, incandescent light, infrared, lamplight, luminescence, luminescent, phosphorescence, phosphorescent, photoelectric, ultraviolet
\exn
\qu (6) What words are used to describe light?
\qun
\ex candlepower, frequency, lumen, radiant, radiation, refract, short-wave, spectrum
\exn

\exn

\exn

\exn

\qun

\exn

\qun
\ex leave the lights on
\exn

\is 8.3.3.2.1
\sd Shadow
\sdn Bayang-bayang
\oldis 8.3.3.2.1
\oldsd Shadow
\oldsdn Bayang-bayang
\dd Use this domain for words related to a shadow--the area on the ground where the light does not shine because something is in the way. For instance if the sun (or another light) is shining on an object, the area behind the object is in shadow (dark).
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan berkaitan kepada suatu bayang-bayang - kawasan di atas kawasan di mana cahaya tidak bercahaya kerana sesuatu menutupinya. Contohnya sekiranya matahari (ataupun cahaya lain) menyinar di atas satu objek, kawasan di bahagian belakang objek itu dibayangi (gelap)
\qu (1) What words refer to a shadow?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bayang-bayang?
\ex shadow
\exn Bayang-bayang, bayangan, kelibat,
\xe The sun was hot, so we got under the shadow of a tree.
\xen Matahari sedang panas terik oleh itu kami pun berteduh di bawah bayangan pokok.
\qu (2) What words refer to something blocking the light from shining on something?
\qun
\ex shade, cast a shadow, block the light, eclipse, overshadowing
\exn
\xe You are in my light.
\xen
\qu (3) What words describe something in the shadow of something else?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang berada di dalam bayang-bayang sesuatu?
\ex in the shade, shaded, shady, shadowy
\exn Di dalam tempat teduh, tempat redup,

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.3.2.1
\oldqu (2) What words refer to something blocking the light from shining on something? Shade, cast a shadow, block the light, eclipse
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sesuatu yang menghalang cahaya daripada menerangi sesuatu?
\oldex
\oldexn Tempat teduh, redup, gerhana
\oldxe You are in my light.
\oldxen Kamu berada di dalam cahaya saya.
\gd ICBA6876C-5B48-42F4-AE0A-7FBE9BB971EF

\is 8.3.3.3
\sd Color
\sdn Warna
\oldis 8.3.3.3
\oldsd Color
\oldsdn Warna
\oldis 8.3.3.3.8
\oldsd Colorless
\oldsdn Tidak berwarna
\dd Use this domain for words related to color.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to color?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada warna?
\ex color, shade, tint, hue, coloring, pigment, tincture, cast, palette, coloration, complexion, chroma, chromatic, tone
\exn Warna, pigmen, tinta, cat, corak
\qu (2) What words indicate that something is a particular color?
\qun
\ex be red/green, be a red/reddish color, colored, tinted
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that is a dark color?
\qun
\ex dark, deep, rich
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe something that is a light color?
\qun
\ex light (adj), pale, pastel, faint, livid, lurid, pallid, pallor, pale-faced, neutral tint
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that is a bright color?
\qun
\ex bright, brightly colored, brilliant, pure, gaudy, garish, vivid, flashy, fresh, intense, strong, hot
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that is a dull color?
\qun
\ex dull, faded, washed out, drab, dingy, flushed, clouded, grayish, somber
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something, such as a photograph, that has been made with color?
\qun
\ex color (photograph), in color
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that has no color or is black and white?
\qun
\ex colorless, black and white, uncolored, monochrome, achromatic, ghostly, glassy, lackluster, undyed
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to the intensity of a color?
\qun
\ex value, intensity, saturation
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to pure or mixed colors?
\qun
\ex pure, mixed, tinge, primary color, secondary color, tertiary color
\exn
\qu (11) What words describe colors that look good together?
\qun
\ex go together, go with, suit you, color scheme, complimentary
\exn
\qu (12) What words describe colors that do not look good together?
\qun
\ex clash
\exn
\qu (13) What words describe someone who cannot see color?
\qun
\ex color-blind
\exn
\qu (14) What words refer to a color or pattern of colors used by a group of people to identify themselves?
\qun
\ex livery, tartan, team colors
\exn

\is 8.3.3.3.4
\sd Colors of the spectrum
\sdn Warna-warna spektrum
\oldis 8.3.3.3.4
\oldsd Colors of the spectrum
\oldsdn Warna-warna spektrum
\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is colored.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to all the colors arranged in the spectrum of the rainbow?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada semua warna-warna spektrum di dalam pelangi?
\ex spectrum, rainbow, prism, spectral
\exn Spektrum, pelangi, prisma
\qu (2) What words describe a kind of color?
\qun
\ex primary color, secondary color, earth color, warm color, cool color, infrared
\exn
\qu (3) What are the shades of red?
\qun (3) Apakah warna-warna merah?
\ex red, beet-red, blood-red, blush, brick-red, cardinal, carmine, carnelian, cherry, Chinese red, claret, coral, crimson, fiery, fire-red, flame-colored, incarnadine, lobster, lobster-colored, madder, pink, puce, roan, rose, rose-colored, roseate, rosy, rouge, ruby-red, ruddy, scarlet, vermilion, wine
\exn Merah jambu, merah muda, merah samar, merah marah, merah menyala, warna lembayung, kemerah-merahan, merah darah, merah manggis, merah hati, merah tua, merah merona, merah delima,

\qun (4) Apakah warna-warna perang/oren?
\ex orange, apricot, cadmium, carrottop, carroty, ocher, peach, salmon, tangerine
\exn Warna aprikot, warna jinga, oren, kuning tanah,
\qu (5) What are the shades of yellow?
\qun (5) Apakah warna-warna kuning?
\ex yellow, amber, banana, blond, blonde, canary, chartreuse, chrome yellow, citron, cream, flaxen, gold, golden, goldilocks, jaundice, lemon, saffron, sallow, straw-colored, sulfur, tawny, terra cotta, yellow ocher, xanthous
\exn
\qu (6) What are the shades of green?
\qun (6) Apakah warna-warna hijau?
\ex green, greenish, apple-green, bottle-green, chlorine, emerald, grass, grass-green, khaki, leaf-green, leek-green, lime-green, olive, pea, pea-green, peacock, sap green, sea-green, topaz, verdant, viridian
\exn Hijau daun, hijau zamrud, hijau buah zaitun, hijau kebiru-biruan, hijau pucuk pisang, hijau botol,
\qu (7) What are the shades of blue?
\qun (7) Apakah warna-warna biru?
\ex blue, azure, baby-blue, beryl-blue, carbuncle, cerulean, cobalt, cyan, cyanic, indigo, lapis lazuli, navy blue, Prussian blue, royal blue, sapphire, sky blue, teal, turquoise, ultramarine
\exn Biru laut, biru muda, kebiru-biruan, biru nilam, nila kandi, biru tua
\qu (8) What are the shades of purple?
\qun (8) Apakah warna-warna ungu?
\ex purple, violet, amethyst, crocus, hyacinth, lavender, lilac, liver-colored, magenta, maroon, mauve, mulberry, plum, plum-colored, royal purple
\exn Ungu, ungu lembut, permata ungu, lembayung ungu
\qu (9) What are the shades of brown?
\qun
\ex brown, tan, beige, flesh colored, auburn, brunette, buff, chestnut, chocolate, cinnamon, cocoa, coffee, dun, fawn, foxy, hazel, khaki, mahogany, ocher, russet, rust, sepia, sienna, sorrel, umber, walnut
\exn
\qu (10) What words describe something that looks like metal?
\qun
\ex metallic, copper, brass, bronze, bronzed, gilded, gilt, gold, golden, platinum, silver, silvery, steely
\exn

\exn
\qu (2) What words are used of something changing color?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan bagi sesuatu yang bertukar warna?
\ex change color, lose its color, blush, turn pale, pale, blanch
\exn naik merah, menjadi merah, merah muka, merah padam

\qun
\ex wash out, run
\exn

\ex fade, bleach
\exn

\qun
\ex colored, discolored, bleached, dyed, faded, mantled, painted, shaded, stained, tinged, tinted
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to things used to change the color of something?
\qun
\ex paint (n), dye (n), bleach (n), food coloring, stain (n)
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a color that does not change?
\qun
\ex fast
\exn

\is 8.3.4
\sd Hot
\sdn Panas
\oldis 8.3.4
\oldsd Temperature
\oldsdn Suhu
\oldis 8.3.4.1
\oldsd Hot
\oldsdn Panas
\oldis 8.3.4.2
\oldsd Warm
\oldsdn Hangat
\oldis 8.3.4.4
\oldsd Change temperature
\oldsdn Perubahan suhu
\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is hot.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is hot?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan yang mengambarkan sesuatu yang panas?
\ex hot, heat, red hot, boiling, burning hot, molten, ardent, baking, blazing, brisk, broiling, burning, calorific, fervent, fervid, fevered, fiery, glowing, heat, hot, igneous, incandescent, reeking, scorching, sizzling, smoking, torrid, white-hot
\exn Panas, haba, panas membara, sangat panas, panas terik,
\qu (2) What words describe food that is hot?
\qun
\ex hot, piping hot, scalding
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that is warm?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan yang mengambarkan sesuatu yang hangat?
\ex be warm, lukewarm, tepid
\exn Hangat, suam, suam-suam kuku, panas-panas suam
\qu (4) What words describe a time or place that is hot?
\qun
\ex hot, boiling, be a scorcher, sultry, sunny, sweltering, sweltry, tropical, heat wave
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe a time or place that is warm?
\qun
\ex warm, the warmth, balmy, mild, temperate
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe a time or place that is so hot that you are uncomfortable?
\qun
\ex stifling, muggy, humid, oppressive
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to feeling hot?
\qun
\ex hot, warm, boiling
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to feeling hot because you are sick?
\qun
\ex have a temperature, feverish
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to how hot something is?
\qun
\ex temperature, heat, degree, Celsius, Centigrade, Fahrenheit, level of heat, warmth
\exn
\qu (10) What things do people use to measure how hot something is?
\qun
\ex thermometer
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to something becoming hot?
\qun
\ex warm up, get hot, thaw, melt, temperature is rising
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to making something hot?
\qun
\ex heat something, warm something, thaw something, melt something, take the chill off, heat up, reheat, warm up
\exn
\qu (13) What happens to things and people when they get hot?
\qun
\ex boil, melt, burn, warp, sweat
\exn
\qu (14) What words describe clothes that make you feel warm?
\qun
\ex warm, thermal
\exn
\qu (15) What things do people use to stay warm when it is cold?
\qun
\ex fire, heater, furnace, central heating, radiator, hot-water bottle, electric blanket
\exn
\qu (16) What words describe something that is neither hot nor cold?
\qun
\ex room temperature, ambient temperature
\exn

\is 8.3.4.1
\sd Cold
\sdn Dingin
\oldis 8.3.4.3
\oldsd Cold
\oldsdn Dingin
\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is cold.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is cold?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan yang mengambarkan sesuatu yang adalah dingin?
\ex cold, frozen, icy, glacial, hibernal, hiemal, hyperborean, marmoreal, unthawed
\exn Dingin, sejuk, beku
\qu (2) What words describe food that is cold?
\qun
\ex cold, cool, chilled, ice-cold, stone-cold
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that is cool?
\qun
\ex cool, crisp, refresh, unfrozen
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe a time or place that is cold?
\qun
\ex cold, the cold, frosty, wintry, cold spell, cold snap, frigid, bleak
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe a time or place that is cool?
\qun
\ex cool, chilly, drafty, nippy, fresh, crisp, bracing, chill
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe a time or place that is very cold?
\qun
\ex freezing, bitterly cold, arctic, subzero temperatures
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a wind that is cold?
\qun
\ex freezing, bitter, biting, cutting, raw
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to feeling cold?
\qun
\ex be cold, feel cold, look cold, freezing, frozen, feel the cold
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to feeling cold because you are sick?
\qun
\ex get the chills, ague
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to how cold something is?
\qun
\ex temperature, coldness, coolness
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to something becoming cold?
\qun
\ex get cold, turn cold, drop, fall, cool down, cool, cool off, freeze, lose heat
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to making something cold?
\qun
\ex cool something, chill, refrigerate, freeze something
\exn
\qu (13) What happens to things when they get cold?
\qun
\ex freeze, harden, brittle, frost-bound
\exn
\qu (14) What happens to people when they get cold?
\qun
\ex shiver, be blue with cold, goose pimples, goosebumps, gooseflesh, someone's teeth are chattering, frostbite, frostbitten, freeze to death, die of cold
\exn
\qu (15) What words describe clothes that make you feel cool?
\qun
\ex cool
\exn
\qu (16) What things do people use to stay cool when it is hot?
\qun
\ex fan, cooler, air-conditioning, air-conditioner, air-conditioned, refrigeration
\exn

\is 8.3.5
\sd Type, kind
\sdn
\oldis 8.3.6
\oldsd Class
\oldsdn Golongan

\dd Use this domain for words related to something being a type of thing, or that something belongs to a class of things.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something belongs to a class of things?
\qun
\ex be, be a kind of, be a type of, be a member of, include
\exn
\xe The animal <class> <includes> dogs, cats, and horses.
\xen
\qu (2) What words refer to the class to which something belongs?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada suatu golongan yang mana dianggotainya?
\ex type, kind, class, group, variety
\exn Golongan, kumpulan
\qu (3) What words refer to a member of a class?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada ahli kepada suatu golongan?
\ex kind (of), type (of), member (of), example (of), sort (of), such
\exn Jenis, contoh, model, ahli, anggota,
\qu (4) What words refer to assigning something to a class?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menentukan sesuatu kepada suatu golongan?
\ex classify (with/as), classification, class, assign to a class, categorize, grade, group, sort
\exn Mengelaskan, menggolongkan, klasifikasi, pengelasan, penggolongan
\xe I would not <classify> this fossil <as> a dinosaur.
\xen Saya tidak akan <menggolongkan> fosil in <sebagai> dinosaur.

\is 8.3.5.2.1
\sd Same
\sdn Sama
\oldis 8.3.6.2.1
\oldsd Same
\oldsdn Sama
\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is the same thing as you just mentioned, or describing two things that are exactly the same.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the same person or thing, not a different one?
\qun
\ex the same, the very same, the self-same, one and the same, common
\exn
\xe This isn't <the same> man, it's another man.
\xen
\qu (2) What words describe two things that are the same?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan dua benda yang sama?
\ex same, identical, indistinguishable, can't tell the difference, can't tell them apart, be no different from, match, be a carbon copy, word for word, be synonymous with, be no better than, be nothing more than
\exn Sama, serupa, seiras, mirip,
\xe The twins are <the same> in every way.
\xen
\qu (3) What words indicate that two numbers or amounts are the same?
\qun
\ex the same, equal, equivalent, even, level
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe someone or something that is the same as before?
\qun
\ex be the same, unchanged, hasn't changed a bit, hasn't changed at all, unaffected
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe someone or something that never changes?
\qun
\ex the same, consistent, unchanging, constant
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that is the same in all its parts?
\qun
\ex uniform, homogeneous
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to making all the things in a group the same?
\qun
\ex standardize, bring something into line
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that two things that people said are the same?
\qun
\ex correspond, be consistent with, agree, tally, coincide, match up
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate that something in one group is the same in some way as something in another group?
\qun
\ex corresponding, equivalent, counterpart, opposite number
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to thinking the same as someone else?
\qun
\ex like-minded, be on the same wavelength, be in tune with, be in harmony
\exn
\qu (11) What words indicate that a part of one thing is the same as part of something else?
\qun
\ex overlap
\exn
\qu (12) What words indicate that two things are the same in some way?
\qun
\ex equally, of equal, equal in, just as, as...as, every bit as, even, evenly
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to saying that two things are the same in some way?
\qun
\ex equate
\exn

\is 8.3.5.2.2
\sd Like, similar
\sdn Macam, serupa
\oldis 8.3.6.2.2
\oldsd Like, similar
\oldsdn Macam, serupa
\dd Use this domain for words describing two things or people that are similar, but not the same.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe two things that are similar?
\qun
\ex like, similar, alike, much the same, comparable, parallel
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to something being like another thing?
\qun
\ex resemble, bear a resemblance to, akin to, have an affinity with, the same sort of
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe two things that are very similar?
\qun
\ex be two of a kind, have a lot in common, tantamount
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe two things that are a little similar?
\qun
\ex kind of like, vaguely resemble
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done in a similar way?
\qun
\ex similarly, like, such as, as
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to something being like another thing in some way?
\qun
\ex have something in common, share something, correspond
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to something looking like another thing?
\qun
\ex look like, resemble, the image of
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to something looking very much like another thing?
\qun
\ex be just like, look just like, be the image of, be the spitting image of, be the living image of, could pass for, could be mistaken for, be a dead ringer for, be the picture of
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to someone who looks like another person?
\qun
\ex look-alike, double
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to being like your mother or father?
\qun
\ex be like, take after, be a chip off the old block
\exn
\qu (11) What words indicate that someone or something makes you think of another person or thing because they are similar?
\qun
\ex remind someone of, be reminiscent of, echo
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to the quality of being similar?
\qun
\ex similarity, likeness, resemblance
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to the way in which two things are similar?
\qun
\ex similarity, parallel
\exn

\is 8.3.5.2.4
\sd Other
\sdn Yang lain
\oldis 8.1.5.2
\oldsd Other
\oldsdn Yang lain
\dd Use this domain for words related to other, as in 'the other person', 'another thing'--a thing that is not the same as something that has been mentioned.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to another thing?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada benda yang lain?
\ex other, another, different, else, other than

\is 8.3.6
\sd Made of, material
\sdn
\oldis 8.3.7
\oldsd Material composition
\oldsdn Kandungan bahan

\dd Use this domain for words that mark the material out of which something has been made.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to something being made of some material?
\qun
\ex be made of, consist of, be made up of, be composed of, made out of, made with, made from
\exn
\xe John's house is made of bricks.
\xen
\qu (2) What words refer to something having some material in it?
\qun
\ex have something in it, contain
\exn
\xe The coffee contains milk.
\xen
\qu (3) What words refer to the material something is made of?
\qun
\ex material, composition, stuff, substance
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate the material that something is made of?
\qun
\ex out of, with, from, of
\exn
\xe This picture was done <with> oil paints.
\xen
