\is 8.3.7.7
\sd Right, proper
\sdn
\oldis 8.3.8.7
\oldsd Suitable
\oldsdn Sesuai

\dd Use this domain for words describing something, such as a tool or way of doing something, that is proper for a particular time, place, purpose, or job. The words in this domain involve a comparison between two things, an item and a setting. An evaluation is made as to how good the item is in the setting. The words may be used only of certain types of items, certain types of settings, or certain types of usefulness.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang mengambarkan dua perkara yang baik bersama-sama ataupun sesuatu yang sesuai di dalam satu keadaan.
\qu (1) What words describe something that is proper?
\qun
\ex right, proper, applicable, apposite, apropos, becoming, befitting, correspond, correspondent, corresponding, decent, due, expected, felicitous, germane, meet, opportune, pertinent, pleasing, principled, properly, right-minded, rightful, smart, suitable, suited, timely, well, well-timed
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that is right for a particular job?
\qun
\ex right, proper, accepted, approved, appropriate, correct
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to something being right for a particular job?
\qun
\ex suit, lends itself to, be suited to, be cut out for, be made for, fit the bill, fit in, be right for, be the right person for, make a good/ideal
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something someone does that is right for a particular situation?
\qun
\ex right, proper, acceptable, appropriate, apt, correct, fitting, suitable, be the done thing, be the way it's done, in keeping with
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to doing something in the right way?
\qun
\ex right, properly, correctly, by the book
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the quality of being proper?
\qun
\ex suitability, suitableness, fit (n)
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.8.7
\oldqu (1) What words describe something that is suitable?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang sesuai?
\oldex Suitable, proper, fitting, presentable
\oldexn Sesuai, cocok, wajar, patut, betul
\oldqu (2) What words describe something that is not suitable?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang tidak sesuai?
\oldex Unsuitable, improper, wrong, unfitting, unpreventable
\oldexn Tidak sesuai,
\gd IF29DCCAE-1654-4EB7-8AAE-04F7DF4FE90C

\is 8.3.7.7.1
\sd Wrong, unsuitable
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words describing something, such as a tool or way of doing something, that is unsuitable for a particular time, place, purpose, or job.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is unsuitable?
\qun
\ex improper, ill-suited, ill-timed, inadmissible, inapt, incongruous, incorrect, indecent, indelicate, malapropos, presumptuous, unacceptable, unapt, unbecoming, unbefitting, undue, unfit, unfitting, unsuited to, untimely, untoward
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to something being unsuitable for a particular purpose or situation?
\qun
\ex wrong, unsuitable, not suitable, unsuited to, not suited to, inappropriate, not appropriate, hardly the time/place/person
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to someone being unsuitable for a job?
\qun
\ex unsuitable, not suitable, not be cut out for, wrong, ill-suited to, not suited to
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something being unsuitable because it isn't good enough?
\qun
\ex unfit, not fit
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something being unsuitable for a particular place?
\qun
\ex be out of place, be out of keeping, not be in keeping, incongruous
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to someone being unsuitable for a particular place?
\qun
\ex be out of place, misfit
\exn
\gd I21F21658-A69A-491C-A37B-156A8F4AD3FB

\is 8.3.7.7.2
\sd Convenient
\sdn Mudah
\oldis 3.3.4.6
\oldsd Convenient
\oldsdn Mudah

\dd Use this domain for words describing something that is convenient--a good time to do something.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini untuk perkataan-perkataan yang berdasarkan soalan berikut.
\qu (1) What words describe something that is convenient?
\qun (1) Bagaimanakah dijelaskan sesuatu yang mudah?
\ex convenient, handy, suit, fit in with, be good for, a good time, no trouble, no problem
\exn Mudah (senang), sesuatu yang berguna (untuk memudahkan kerja contohnya), sesuainya (sesuatu kelengkapan atau kemudahan) dengan suatu keperluan
\qu (2) What words describe something that is not convenient?
\qun
\ex inconvenient, not convenient, be bad for, a bad time
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 3.3.4.6
\gd IC7DBD50E-0FF5-42AF-A7A9-9EAF03671C49

\is 8.3.7.7.3
\sd Compatible
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to being compatible--words that describe two things or people that can be together or work together without problems or conflict.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe things that are compatible?
\qun
\ex compatible, congruent, congruous, consistent, consonant, suitable, proper, fitting, presentable
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to things being compatible?
\qun
\ex accord, agree, clash, cohere, complement, comport, dovetail, go together, go with, harmonize, jibe, rhyme, square
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe people that are compatible?
\qun
\ex compatible
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to people being compatible?
\qun
\ex work well together, be well-suited, be well-matched, be made for each other, be a perfect match, be a perfect pair, be ideally suited, be right for
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the quality of being compatible?
\qun
\ex compatibility, harmony
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe things or people that are incompatible?
\qun
\ex incompatible, ill-matched
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to people being incompatible?
\qun
\ex not be suited, be wrong for, not be right for, not be someone's type
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to the quality of being incompatible?
\qun
\ex incompatibility
\exn
\gd I2B2BEDD5-3F9C-4C18-A256-AA65EE19F15C

\is 8.3.7.8
\sd Decay
\sdn
\oldis 8.3.5
\oldsd Decay, rot
\oldsdn Rosak, reput
\dd Use this domain for words related to something decaying--when a living thing dies and becomes bad, or when a part of a living thing becomes bad.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to something decaying?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sesuatu yang mereput?
\ex decay, rot, decompose, perish, fester, mildew, molder, putrefy
\exn Rosak, reput, menjadi buruk
\qu (2) What words describe something that is decaying?
\qun
\ex rotten, decayed, moldy, mildewed, putrid, rotted, carious
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to food decaying?
\qun
\ex go bad, go off, go stale, go sour, spoil, taint
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe food that is decaying?
\qun
\ex rotten, bad, stale, moldy, sour, rancid, off, tainted
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to making something decay?
\qun
\ex rot
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the process of decay?
\qun
\ex decay (n), corruption, decomposition, putrefaction
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a place on something where it is decaying?
\qun
\ex decay (n), rot (n), canker, caries, carrion, dry rot
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to something being eaten by insects?
\qun
\ex eaten by insects, infested with termites, moth-eaten
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.5
\gd I76A06E45-99F7-446F-A2E8-E23EDF6064BD

\is 8.3.7.8.1
\sd Rust
\sdn
\oldis 8.3.5.1
\oldsd Eaten by rust, insects
\oldsdn Dimakan oleh karat, serangga
\dd Use this domain for words related to metal rusting--when metal becomes bad.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to metal rusting?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada logam berkarat?
\ex rust, corrode, oxidize, tarnish, rust away
\exn Dimakan oleh karat, berkarat, telah berkarat
\qu (2) What words describe metal that has rusted?
\qun
\ex rusty, corroded, tarnished, rusted, eaten away, eaten through
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to making metal rust?
\qun
\ex corrode, eat away, eat through
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the process of rusting?
\qun
\ex corrosion, oxidation
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to rust?
\qun
\ex rust, tarnish
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that makes metal rust?
\qun
\ex corrosive
\exn

\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sesuatu yang telah dimakan oleh serangga?
\oldex Eaten by insects, infested with termites, moth-eaten
\oldexn Dimakan oleh serangga, beranai, diserang oleh anai-anai, penuh dengan anai-anai,

\is 8.3.7.8.2
\sd Blemish
\sdn Kecacatan
\oldis 8.3.8.8
\oldsd Blemish
\oldsdn Kecacatan

\dd Use this domain for words related to a blemish--something small and bad on the skin of a person or the surface of something, but not something serious, especially something wrong that does not affect how something works.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a blemish in something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada suatu kecacatan di dalam sesuatu?
\ex blemish, blot, dapple, excrescence, freckle, mole, pimple, speck, speckle, small fault
\exn Kecacatan, cacat rupa,
\qu (2) What words describe something that has a blemish on it?
\qun
\ex blemished, defaced, marred
\exn

\is 8.3.7.8.3
\sd Garbage
\sdn Sampah
\oldis 8.3.5.3
\oldsd Garbage
\oldsdn Sampah
\dd Use this domain for words related to garbage--something that is no longer wanted.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to garbage?
\qun
\ex garbage, rubbish, trash, litter, refuse, junk, waste, wastepaper, scrap
\exn
\qu (2) What do people do to garbage?
\qun
\ex take out, throw away, discard, burn, chuck, dispose of, disposal, haul away, bury, dump, litter, pile up, collect
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a container where people put garbage?
\qun
\ex garbage can, trashcan, waste-basket, wastepaper basket, bin, dustbin, wastebin, garbage bag
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to a place where people put garbage?
\qun
\ex garbage pit, rubbish heap, garbage dump, rubbish tip, compost pile, incinerator
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to a person who removes garbage?
\qun
\ex garbage man, dustman
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a vehicle used to remove garbage?
\qun
\ex garbage truck, dustcart
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a person who leaves garbage in a public place?
\qun
\ex litterbug
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something made to be used once and then thrown away?
\qun
\ex disposable
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to bad things that people allow to go into water or air?
\qun
\ex pollution, pollute, pollutant, smog, acid rain
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.5.3
\oldqu (1) What words are used of things that are no longer wanted?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan digunakan bagi benda-benda yang tidak lagi diperlukan?
\oldex Trash, garbage, rubbish, refuse, waste, waste paper
\oldexn Sampah, benda yang tidak berguna, bahan buangan
\oldqu (2) What do people do to trash?
\oldqun (2) Apakah orang perbuat kepada sampah-sarap?
\oldex Take out, throw away, discard, burn, haul away, bury, dump, pile up, collect
\oldexn Dibuang, dibakar, ditanam, dikumpulkan
\oldqu (3) Where do people put trash?
\oldqun (3) Di manakah orang membuang sampah-sarap?
\oldex Trash can, garbage can, waste paper basket, garbage pit, rubbish heap, compost pile, garbage dump, incinerator
\oldexn Tong sampah, bakul sampah, pembakaran sampah,

\is 8.3.7.8.4
\sd Preserve
\sdn Mengawet
\oldis 8.3.5.4
\oldsd Preserve
\oldsdn Mengawet

\dd Use this domain for words related to preserving the condition of something from decay.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to preserving something from decay?
\qun
\ex preserve, put up, treat, conserve, maintain, keep up, sustain, take care of
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a method of preserving something?
\qun
\ex bottle, can, cure, dry, embalm, freeze, mummify, pickle, refrigerate, salt, smoke, tan
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that has been preserved?
\qun
\ex preserved, well-preserved, unspoiled
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something continuing to be in a good condition?
\qun
\ex stay fresh, keep well, retain its flavor/appearance
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something used to preserve something?
\qun
\ex preservative, salt, formaldehyde, embalming fluid, canning jar
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the process of preserving something?
\qun
\ex preservation, embalming, mummification
\exn

\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada mengekalkan keadaan sesuatu daripada menjadi reput/rosak?
\oldex Preserve
\oldexn Mengawet

\is 8.3.7.9
\sd Value
\sdn Nilai
\oldis 8.3.8.9
\oldsd Value
\oldsdn Nilai

\dd Use this domain for words related to the value of something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the value of something?
\qun
\ex value, price, worth
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to evaluating the value of something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada nilai sesuatu?
\ex evaluate, evaluation, value (v)
\exn Penilaian, menilai, nilai
\qu (3) What words describe something that is valued as good?
\qun
\ex good, valuable, worthy, advantageous, important, useful, dear
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe something that is valued as bad?
\qun
\ex bad, worthless, unworthy, unimportant, useless
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to increasing the value of something?
\qun
\ex increase in value, inflate, inflation, appreciate
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to decreasing the value of something?
\qun
\ex decrease in value, debase, degrade, deflate, deflation, depreciate
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.8.9
\oldqu (2) What words describe something, which is valued as good?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang mana dinilai sebagai baik?
\oldex Good, valuable, worthy, advantageous, important, useful, acceptable, dear
\oldexn Baik, berharga, bernilai, penting, mahal, berguna,
\oldqu (3) What words describe something, which is valued as bad?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang mana dinilai sebagai sesuatu yang tidak baik?
\oldex Bad, worthless, unworthy, unimportant, useless
\oldexn Buruk, tidak berharga, tidak berguna, tidak penting
\cf Evaluate, test

\is 8.3.8.2
\sd Glory
\sdn Kemuliaan
\oldis 8.3.9.2
\oldsd Glory
\oldsdn Kemuliaan

\dd Use this domain for words describing the appearance of something that has pleasing aspects or inspires awe and wonder in the viewer. For instance, the palace of a king, the home of a rich man, or a temple may be elaborately decorated and be described as glorious or magnificent. Or something in nature such as a sunset or flower may inspire awe and wonder.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan mengambarkan kemunculan sesuatu yang mempunyai aspek mengembirakan atau menimbulkan rasa kagum dan ketakjuban kepada pemerhati. Contohnya, istana raja, rumah seorang yang kaya atau rumah ibadat yang dihiasi dengan indahnya dan digambarkan sesuatu yang hebat dan mengagumkan. Ataupun sesuatu di dalam alam seperti matahari terbit atau bunga yang menakjubkan dan mengagumkan.
\qu (1) What words describe something that is pleasing and awe inspiring in appearance?
\qun
\ex glory, glorious, magnificent, splendor, resplendent, awe inspiring, wonderful, grand, great
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.3.9.2
\oldqu (1) What words describe something, which is pleasing, and awe inspiring in appearance?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu, yang mana mengembirakan dan mengilhamkan kekaguman di dalam kemunculan sesuatu?
\oldex Glory, glorious, magnificent, splendor, resplendent, awe inspiring, wonderful
\oldexn Mulia, kemuliaan, mengagumkan, indah, megah, hebat, gemilang,
\gd I312CE7A7-8C7C-416D-BF93-73376F1F16D8

\is 8.4
\sd Time
\sdn Waktu
\oldis 8.4
\oldsd Time
\oldsdn Waktu
\dd Use this domain for general words related to time, and for words indicating the temporal location of an event.
\ddn
\qu (1) What general words refer to time?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada waktu?
\ex time, temporal
\exn Waktu, masa, batas waktu,
\qu (2) What words indicate that something is happening at some time?
\qun
\ex when, upon, thereupon, then, at, be at, be on, -'s, time
\exn
\xe <The time of> the meeting <will be> four o'clock.
\xen

\oldsdn Jangka waktu

\ddn

\qun
\ex period, span, while, length of time
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a period of time?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada suatu jangka waktu?
\ex instant, second, minute, hour, hourly, day, week, fortnight, month, season, year, decade, century, turn of the century, lifetime, millennium
\exn Saat, minit, jam, hari, minggu, bulan, musim, tahun, abad, seumur hidup
\qu (3) What words refer to a point in time?
\qun
\ex point, moment

\exn Haribulan, jadual harian,

\qun (2) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan merujuk kepada suatu hari tertentu?
\ex date, January 1, 2000, 1-1-00, the first of January 2000
\exn Tarikh, 1hb Januari 2000, hari pertama bulan Januari 2000
\qu (3) What words are used of the system of numbering the years?

\ex calendar, Gregorian calendar, Julian calendar, BC (before Christ), AD (ad Domino), Christian era

\is 8.4.1.2
\sd Day
\sdn Hari
\oldis 8.4.1.2
\oldsd Day
\oldsdn Hari
\dd Use this domain for words referring to a day.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a day?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada suatu hari?
\ex day, whole day, day and night, a day and a night, 24 hour day, 'morning, noon and night'
\exn Hari, sepanjang hari, siang dan malam, satu hari dan satu malam, 24 jam, pagi, tengah hari dan malam
\qu (2) What words are used to indicate that something happens every day?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan bagi menunjukkan sesuatu terjadi setiap hari?
\ex daily, every day, each day
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to an indefinite day?
\qun
\ex someday, one day, a certain day, the other day, some day in the future, one day long ago
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something happens during the whole day?
\qun
\ex all day long, the whole day long, the whole day through
\exn
\qu (5) What words are used for the period of time when the sun is shining?
\qun
\ex day (as opposed to night), during the day, daytime, daylight, daylight hours
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.1.2.1
\gd I3A0DC521-F028-4C17-945C-B121E2D3DC0B

\is 8.4.1.2.3
\sd Time of the day
\sdn Waktu dalam hari
\oldis 8.4.2
\oldsd Time of the day
\oldsdn Waktu dalam hari
\oldis 8.4.2.1
\oldsd Just before dawn
\oldsdn Sebelum subuh
\oldis 8.4.2.2
\oldsd Dawn
\oldsdn Subuh
\oldis 8.4.2.3
\oldsd Morning
\oldsdn Pagi
\oldis 8.4.2.4
\oldsd Noon
\oldsdn Tengahari
\oldis 8.4.2.5
\oldsd Afternoon
\oldsdn Petang
\oldis 8.4.2.6
\oldsd Sunset
\oldsdn Matahari terbenam
\oldis 8.4.2.7
\oldsd Evening
\oldsdn Malam
\oldis 8.4.2.9
\oldsd Midnight
\oldsdn Tengah Malam
\dd Use this domain for words referring to a time of the day.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a time of the day?
\qun
\ex time, hour, watch
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to dawn?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada subuh?
\ex dawn, sunrise, daybreak, aurora, cockcrow, dawning, sunup
\exn Subuh, fajar, matahari terbit, dinihari, menjelang pagi
\qu (3) What words refer to the time between dawn and noon?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada waktu di antara subuh dan tengah hari?
\ex morning, midmorning, am, antemeridian, ante meridiem, forenoon, matins, morn, early morning
\exn Pagi,
\qu (4) What words refer to noon?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada tenga hari?
\ex noon, midday, meridian, midpoint, noonday, noontide, noontime
\exn Tengah hari, waktu tengah hari,
\qu (5) What words refer to the time between noon and sunset?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada waktu diantara tenga hari dan matahari terbenam?
\ex afternoon, mid afternoon, pm, postmeridian, post meridiem
\exn Petang,
\qu (6) What words refer to sunset?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada matahari terbenam?
\ex sunset, sundown, twilight, dusk, nightfall, it gets dark, gloaming
\exn Matahari terbenam, senja, senjakala,
\qu (7) What words refer to the time between sunset and when you go to sleep?
\qun
\ex evening, early evening, late in the evening, tonight, eventide, vesper, late night
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to the time when you go to sleep?
\qun
\ex bedtime, time to go to sleep
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to midnight?
\qun (9) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada tengah malam?
\ex midnight, the middle of the night, pumpkin hour
\exn Tengah malam
\qu (10) What words refer to the time between midnight and dawn?
\qun
\ex late at night, the early hours of the morning (2-4), the small hours, the wee hours of the morning, the first watch, the second watch
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to the time just before dawn?
\qun (11) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada waktu sebelum subuh?
\ex just before dawn, hours before dawn, predawn hours, it gets light, foredawn
\exn Sebelum fajar menyingsing, sebelum dinihari,
\qu (12) What words refer to the time when you wake up?
\qun
\ex time to get up
\exn

\exn Isnin, Selasa, Rabu, Khamis, Jumaat, Sabtu, Ahad

\exn Musim, musim hujan, tengkuju, kemarau,
\qu (5) What words refer to a season related to a time of cultivation?

\ex planting season, growing season, harvest season, hunger season
\exn Musim menanam, musim menuai,

\exn Abadi, kekal, tidak berkesudahan, selama-lamanya, berterusan, berlanjutan,
\qu (3) What words are used to indicate that something will continue forever?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan bagi menunjukkan yang sesuatu akan berterusan selama-lamanya?
\ex be forever, last forever, go on forever, always be there, never fail/end/die/stop
\exn
\qu (4) What words are used to refer to all time or a time that will never end?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan bagi merujuk kepada seluruh masa atau suatu masa yang tidak akan pernah berakhir?
\ex eternity, infinity, all times
\exn Keabadian, kekekalan, ketakterhinggaan,

\is 8.4.5
\sd Relative time
\sdn Penghubung masa
\oldis 8.4.5
\oldsd Relative time
\oldsdn Penghubung masa
\dd Use the domains in this section for words that relate one time to another. Use this domain for words that indicate a temporal relation between situations.
\ddn Gunakan domain-domain di dalam bahagian ini bagi perkataan yang mana mempunyai hubungan masa satu sama lain. Gunakan domain bagi perkataan yang mana menunjukkan satu hubungan yang sementara di antara situasi.
\qu (1) What general words refer to one time in relation to another time?
\qun
\ex relative to, in relation to, before or after
\exn
\xe When did it happen <relative to> his death?
\xen

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5
\oldqu (1) What general words refer to one time in relation to another?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada satu masa di dalam hubungan kepada yang lain?
\oldex Relative to, in relation to, before or after
\oldexn Berhubungan kepada, di dalam hubungan dengan, sebelum atau sesudah
\oldxe When did it happen <in relation to> his death?
\oldxen Bilakah hal itu terjadi <di dalam hubungan kepada> kematiannya?
\gd I1F4EFAE7-1029-4B66-80EE-802459A7BAF5

\is 8.4.5.1
\sd Order, sequence
\sdn Tertib, berurut-urutan
\oldis 7.4.9
\oldsd Order, sequence
\oldsdn Tertib, berurut-urutan
\oldis 8.1.2.7
\oldsd Sequence
\oldsdn Urutan
\oldis 8.4.5.2
\oldsd Temporal order
\oldsdn
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis 8.4.5.1
\oldsd Temporal sequence
\oldsdn Rangkaian/Urutan semasa
\dd Use this domain for words referring to temporal order or sequence--the order in which a group of events happen. Things and people may also be in order based on the order in which something happened or should happen to them.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the order or sequence of a group of events?
\qun
\ex order, sequence, cycle, pattern, rota, order of events
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to a group of events that happen in order?
\qun
\ex sequence, series, succession, chain, course, progression
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a group of things in a series?
\qun
\ex series, lineup, queue
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe a group of things that have been put in order?
\qun
\ex be in order, ordered, in sequence, be the right way round, in chronological order, chronological, consecutive, consecutively, successive, in succession, one after another, one after the other, (three years) running, sequential
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to doing things in order?
\qun
\ex in order, take turns
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the particular order in which something comes?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada urutan khusus di mana sesuatu itu muncul?
\ex place, position, where something comes
\exn Pertama, kemudian, selepas, terakhir, tamat, kesimpulan, penutup
\qu (7) What words describe a group of things that have not been put in order?
\qun
\ex unordered, out of sequence
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe a group of things in the wrong order?
\qun
\ex be out of order, be in the wrong order, be the wrong way round, backwards
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to something missing from a group of things in order?
\qun
\ex gap
\exn
\qu (10) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a noun phrase with no overt marker.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe the last person (out the door)
\xen
\qu (11) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a 'be' clause with the 'Item' in the subject position.
\qun
\ex be
\exn
\xe This child <was> first.
\xen
\qu (12) In English 'Order' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the 'Item' marked by 'of'.
\qun
\ex of
\exn
\xe the second <of> the winners
\xen

\nt Old questions for \oldis 7.4.9
\oldqu (1) What words describe a group of things which have been put in order?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan sehimpunan benda yang telah disusun berurut-urutan?
\oldex ordered, in sequence
\oldexn Tersusun, dalam urutan atau susunan
\oldqu (2) What words describe a group of things which have not been put in order?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang menghuraikan sekelompok benda yang tidak tersusun?
\oldex unordered, out of sequence
\oldexn Tidak teratur atau tersusun, tidak berurutan, di luar daripada urutan atau susunan
\oldqu (3) What words refer to the order or sequence that a group of things are in or should be in?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan-perkataan yang merujuk kepada susunan atau urutan yang mana sepatutnya hal atau benda itu berada?
\oldex
\oldexn  Susunan, urutan, aturan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.1.2.7
\oldqu (1) What general words refer to the sequence or order of a group of things, events, or ideas?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada urutan and susunan kumpulan bagi sesuatu benda, peristiwa atau pendapat?
\oldex Sequence, order
\oldexn Urutan, rangkaian, siri, babak, deret
\oldqu (3) What words refer to doing something a second time?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada melakukan sesuatu kali kedua?
\oldex Again, repeat, repetition
\oldexn Semula, lagi, pengulangan

\oldex (Be/do/happen) in order
\oldexn Berlaku dalam urutan/susunan

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.1
\oldqu (1) What words indicate that one event happened after another?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang satu kejadian terjadi selepas yang satu?
\oldex And, and then, having...-en, before, after, (be/do/happen) in sequence

\cf Arrange; Organize; Series; Ordinal numbers
\gd I00269021-E1C4-474D-9DBA-341D296BDAC7

\is 8.4.5.1.1
\sd Series
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to a series--several things that happen one after another.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to a series of things, events, numbers or people?
\qun
\ex series, sequence, string of, succession of, stream, train of events, course of
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe things in a series?
\qun
\ex successive, consecutive, alternating, serial
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that someone does things in a series?
\qun
\ex in succession, one after the other, one after another, straight, in a row, running, alternate
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the place that something has in a series?
\qun
\ex place, order, rank, slot, grade
\exn
\cf Order, sequence
\gd I00041516-72D1-4E56-9ED8-FE235A9B1A68

\is 8.4.5.1.2
\sd First
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.5.2.1
\oldsd Happen first
\oldsdn Terjadi terdahulu
\dd Use this domain for words referring to something happening first--to be before all other things in order or time.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is first in order or time?
\qun
\ex first, original, initial, earliest, inaugural, prime
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate an event or action that is first?
\qun
\ex first (adv), first of all, beginning with, starting with
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that something happened when you first saw something?
\qun
\ex at first sight, at first glance
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something is the first in a list of things that you will talk about?
\qun
\ex firstly, first of all, to start with, to begin with, in the first place
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that something happens or is done for the first time?
\qun
\ex first, the first time
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to the first time someone does something?
\qun
\ex debut, premiere, maiden (voyage)
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe something that has never happened before?
\qun
\ex unprecedented, a first
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to doing something that has never been done before?
\qun
\ex be the first to do something, show the way, lead the way, pioneer, break new ground
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to being the first person to do something in a situation instead of waiting for someone else?
\qun
\ex make the first move, take the initiative
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to the person who did something first?
\qun
\ex pioneer, the first
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to something that is the first of its kind?
\qun
\ex prototype, original (n)
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.2.1
\oldqu (1) What words indicate that one event happened first?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan bahawa satu peristiwa terjadi terlebih dahulu?
\oldex (Be/do/happen) first
\oldexn (Ada/Membuat/Berlaku) pertama
\gd IF352A437-58F2-4920-AEC3-EDA8041F7447

\is 8.4.5.1.3
\sd Next
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.5.2.2
\oldsd Happen next
\oldsdn Terjadi kemudian
\dd Use this domain for words referring to something happening next.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that an event happens next?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang suatu peristiwa itu terjadi kemudian?
\ex next, right afterwards, the day after, then
\exn (Ada/membuat/berlaku) kemudian
\qu (2) What words describe something that happens next?
\qun
\ex next, following, ensuing
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to an event happening next after another event?
\qun
\ex follow, come next, be after, be next, succeed, come after, go after, go next, ensue
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.2.2

\is 8.4.5.1.4
\sd Last
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.5.2.3
\oldsd Happen last
\oldsdn Terjadi terakhir
\dd Use this domain for words referring to something happening last--to happen after all other things in a sequence, or to be the last person or thing in a sequence.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that an event happens last?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang suatu peristiwa itu terjadi akhir?
\ex last (adv), at the end
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that happens last?
\qun
\ex last (adj), final, closing, concluding
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to an event happening last?
\qun
\ex come last, end with, finish with
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that a person or thing is the last in a list or line or group?
\qun
\ex be last, come last, finish last, bring up the rear, straggler, be the last straw
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that something is next to the last?
\qun
\ex next to the last, the last but one, penultimate
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something is the last before now?
\qun
\ex last (week), latest
\exn
\qu (7) What words do people use to indicate the last thing in a list of things they are talking about?
\qun
\ex lastly, finally, last but not least
\exn
\qu (8) What words refer to the last thing?
\qun
\ex the last, the latter
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to the last part of something?
\qun
\ex end, ending, finish
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.2.3
\gd I49AA89F2-2022-4213-845E-DBBB4B53476C

\is 8.4.5.1.5
\sd Regular
\sdn Biasa/Lazim
\oldis 8.4.5.1.4
\oldsd Regular
\oldsdn Biasa/Lazim

\dd Use this domain for words referring to something that happens regularly.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happens regularly?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan sesuatu yang terjadi secara biasa?
\ex regular, regularly, at regular intervals, every day, daily, be punctuated by, with great regularity, routine, like clockwork
\exn Biasa, lazim, rutin
\qu (2) What words indicate that something happens sometimes but not regularly?
\qun
\ex intermittently, intermittent, on and off, off and on, in fits and starts, sporadic
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that something does not happen regularly?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan sesuatu yang tidak terjadi secara biasa?
\ex irregular, without warning
\exn Tidak tetap,

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.1.4

\is 8.4.5.1.6
\sd Alternate
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to alternating--when several things happen one after another in a repeated pattern.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to things alternating?
\qun
\ex alternate, repeat, cycle, rotate
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe things that alternate?
\qun
\ex alternating, repeated, cyclical, rotating
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that two things alternate?
\qun
\ex alternate (actions/events)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to two or more people doing something in alternate turns?
\qun
\ex alternate, take turns, take it in turns, share, spell each other, go back and forth
\exn
\gd I95A8D932-9554-439F-AFB5-AB158F2EED96

\is 8.4.5.2
\sd Before
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.5.1.1
\oldsd Happen before
\oldsdn Terjadi sebelumnya
\dd Use this domain for words referring to one event happening before another.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happens before a particular event?
\qun
\ex before (conj), prior to, on the eve of, pre-
\exn
\xe John took a bath <before> eating dinner.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate that something happens before now or before a particular time?
\qun
\ex before (adv), earlier, formerly, previously, ago, already
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that someone does something before a particular event?
\qun
\ex beforehand, in advance, advance, prior
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something must be done before a particular time?
\qun
\ex before, by, not later than, at the latest
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something that happened before?
\qun
\ex antecedent, precedent, precedence, the one before
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that happened before?
\qun
\ex previous, old, last (adj), earlier, former, prior, preceding, recent, preliminary
\exn
\qu (7) What words describe a time that comes before another one?
\qun
\ex previous (day), last (night), the (week) before, the preceding (year)
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that something comes before another in a series?
\qun
\ex before, in front of, ahead of
\exn
\qu (9) What words describe something that comes before another in a series?
\qun
\ex previous, preceding, earlier, the one before
\exn
\qu (10) What words refer to something happening before something else?
\qun
\ex come before, precede, predate, lead up to, come first, be before, be a prelude to, anticipate, antedate
\exn
\qu (11) What words refer to coming before something else in a series?
\qun
\ex come before, precede
\exn
\qu (12) What words refer to doing something before someone else does it?
\qun
\ex do something first, be first, beat someone to it, ahead of, be ahead of your time
\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to a person or thing that existed before another?
\qun
\ex predecessor, forerunner, precursor, ex-(wife/president)
\exn
\qu (14) What words describe something that has been mentioned before?
\qun
\ex above, aforementioned, foregoing
\exn

\oldexn Sebelum, baru-baru, sebelumnya,

\is 8.4.5.2.1
\sd After
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.5.1.3
\oldsd Happen after
\oldsdn Terjadi sesudah
\dd Use this domain for words referring to one event happening after another.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happens after a particular time or event?
\qun
\ex after, afterward, afterwards, later, later on, subsequently, after that, beyond that, hence
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that something happens after a certain period of time?
\qun
\ex after, within, in, from now
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that comes after something else?
\qun
\ex next, following, later, subsequent, succeeding, ensuing, after, future, consequent, latter
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something happening after something else?
\qun
\ex follow, come after, ensue, follow-up, be after
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to the events that happen after an event?
\qun
\ex sequel, aftermath, what follows
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a person who takes a job or position after someone else?
\qun
\ex successor, next in line, succeed
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to a book or film that comes after another one?
\qun
\ex sequel
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that something comes after another in a series?
\qun
\ex after, next, later, further on
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate that something will not be done now, but later?
\qun
\ex later, it can wait, it will wait
\exn
\qu (10) What words are used to link events when telling a story?
\qun
\ex and, and then, then, having...-en, after, thereafter, thereon, thereupon, whereupon, upon
\exn
\xe <After> taking a bath, John ate a big dinner.
\xen

\is 8.4.5.2.2
\sd At the same time
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.5.1.2
\oldsd Happen at same time
\oldsdn Terjadi pada masa yang sama
\dd Use this domain for words referring to two things happening at the same time.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that two things happen at the same time?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan bahawa dua perkara terjadi pada masa yang sama?
\ex at the same time, together, at one time, at once, simultaneously, at the same instant, in concert, in unison
\exn Sementara, pada waktu yang sama, semasa, bersinkronisasi, sezaman, masa kini, mutakhir, kebetulan, serentak,
\qu (2) What words indicate that something happens at the same time as something else?
\qun
\ex at the same time as, meanwhile, while, as, -ing, simultaneity, concurrently, coincident
\exn
\xe Mary bought food, <while> John got gas for the car.
\xen
\qu (3) What words refer to two things happening at the same time?
\qun
\ex coincide, clash
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to arranging two events so that they happen at the same time?
\qun
\ex synchronize, tie something in with
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe things that happen at the same time?
\qun
\ex simultaneous, synchronized, parallel, synchronous, contemporaneous, concurrent
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to two people that lived at the same time?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada dua orang yang tinggal pada masa yang sama?
\ex contemporary, be a contemporary of someone, be contemporaries
\exn

\is 8.4.5.2.3
\sd During
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words indicating that something happened during some time period, or that something happened while something else was happening.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happened during some time period?
\qun
\ex during, in, in the course of, during the course of, through, throughout, over, by day, by night, during the middle of, in the interim, within
\exn
\xe It rained <during> the night.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate that something happened during the time when something else was happening?
\qun
\ex while, meanwhile, in the meantime
\exn
\xe I decided to eat something <while> I waited for the rain to stop.
\xen
\gd I69D039E6-F669-4D54-8B67-89B19FF0A19C

\is 8.4.5.3
\sd Right time
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words referring to the right time to do something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the right time to do something?
\qun
\ex the right time, a good time, be the time
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something happening at the right time?
\qun
\ex timely, opportune, well-timed, come at the right time
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to a person's ability to choose the right time to do something?
\qun
\ex timing, sense of timing
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the wrong time to do something?
\qun
\ex the wrong time, a bad time, not a good time, be no time, not be the time
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something happening at the wrong time?
\qun
\ex badly-timed, ill-timed, come at the wrong time, at a bad time, inopportune
\exn
\gd I6BF8CE57-1970-4EFB-A7D7-B0BF8BE6FB6B

\is 8.4.5.3.1
\sd Early
\sdn Awal/Dini/Dulu
\oldis 8.4.5.3.1
\oldsd Early
\oldsdn Awal/Dini/Dulu
\dd Use this domain for words that indicate that something happens early--before the expected time, before the usual time, or before the time that was agreed on. Some words may include the idea that it is good that the event happened early. Other words may include the idea that it is bad that the event happened early.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang mana mengambarkan sesuatu kejadian sebelum masa yang dijangkakan. Beberapa perkataan termasuklah buah fikiran yang baik tentang peristiwa yang terjadi lebih awal. Perkataan lain termasuklah buah fikiran bahawa betapa buruknya kejadian yang terjadi lebih awal.
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happens early?
\qun
\ex early (adv), ahead of time, ahead of schedule, in good time
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that happens early?
\qun
\ex early (adj)
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to something happening early?
\qun
\ex be early
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something happens too early?
\qun
\ex too early, too soon, untimely, premature, prematurely, jump the gun
\exn
\qu (5) What words indicate that something happens early in the morning?
\qun
\ex early, first thing, at the crack of dawn, bright and early
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something will happen no earlier than a particular time?
\qun
\ex at the earliest, no earlier than
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.3.1
\oldqu (1) What words indicate that something happened before the expected time?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan bahawa sesuatu telah terjadi sebelum masa yang dijangkakan?
\oldex Early, ahead of time, ahead of schedule, in good time, untimely, premature, too soon
\oldexn Awal, dini, terlebih awal, pramatang, belum tiba waktunya,
\gd IEB662979-604C-455E-A2C6-A84B03A2EE3A

\is 8.4.5.3.2
\sd On time
\sdn Tepat waktu
\oldis 8.4.5.3
\oldsd Punctuality
\oldsdn Ketepatan
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis

\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran

\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis

\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis

\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran

\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis
\oldsd
\oldsdn Bahasa Dan Pemikiran
\oldis 8.4.5.3.2
\oldsd On time
\oldsdn Tepat waktu
\dd Use this domain for words describing something happening on time--at the expected time, at the usual time, or at the time that was agreed on.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happens on time?
\qun
\ex on time, right on time, punctually, promptly, on cue, on the dot, at the right time, at the designated time, at the appointed time, when expected, right when it was supposed to happen, at the exact moment
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that happens on time?
\qun
\ex timely
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who does things on time?
\qun
\ex punctual, prompt
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something happens before it is too late?
\qun
\ex in time, just in time, in the nick of time, not a moment too soon, at the last minute, at the eleventh hour, catch, cut it fine, cut it too close, made it in by a whisker, just under the wire
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to finishing something within the time that is allowed?
\qun
\ex meet a deadline, on schedule
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.5.3
\oldqu (1) What words indicate that an event happens at the correct time?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang kejadian itu terjadi pada waktu yang betul?
\oldex Punctuality
\oldexn Ketepatan

\oldex Be on time, punctual, timely, right on time, at the right time, at the designated time, at the appointed time, when expected, just in time, in the nick of time, not a moment too soon, made it in by a whisker, just under the wire, right when it was supposed to happen, at the exact moment

\is 8.4.5.3.3
\sd Late
\sdn Lambat
\oldis 8.4.5.3.3
\oldsd Late
\oldsdn Lambat
\dd Use this domain for words describing something happening late--after the expected time, after the usual time, or after the time that was agreed on.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something happens late?
\qun
\ex late (adv), not on time, lateness (of the hour), late in life
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that happens late?
\qun
\ex late (adj), overdue, belated
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe someone who is late?
\qun
\ex tardy, latecomer
\exn
\qu (4) What do people say to someone who is late?
\qun
\ex about time too, what time do you call this? where have you been? better late than never
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to being late to pay back a loan?
\qun
\ex be behind with, overdue, be in arrears
\exn
\qu (6) What words indicate that something happens late at night?
\qun
\ex last thing at night, in the middle of the night, the early hours, till all hours
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to not finishing something within the time that is allowed?
\qun
\ex be behind, be behind schedule, be running late, overrun
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that something is too late?
\qun
\ex too late, it's a little late in the day, leave it a bit late, miss
\exn
\qu (9) What words indicate that something will happen no later than a particular time?
\qun
\ex no later than, at the latest
\exn

\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan sesuatu telah terjadi sesudah waktu yang dijangkakan?
\oldex Be late, tardy, lateness (of the hour)
\oldexn Lambat, lewat, perlahan,
\gd I6FB1D03C-B0FE-49B7-A473-168F12A54A36

\is 8.4.5.3.4
\sd Delay
\sdn Melambatkan
\oldis 8.4.5.3.4
\oldsd Delay
\oldsdn Melambatkan
\dd Use this domain for words referring to something delaying someone or something--to cause something to happen at a later time, cause someone to do something at a later time, or cause someone or something to be late.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada sesuatu yang melambatkan sesuatu peristiwa - menyebabkan sesuatu terjadi pada waktu kemudian, menyebabkan seseorang melakukan sesuatu pada waktu lain atau menyebabkan seseorang atau sesuatu terlambat
\qu (1) What words refer to something delaying someone?
\qun
\ex delay, make someone late, hold someone up, keep, detain
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to something delaying an event?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sesuatu yang melambatkan sesuatu peristiwa?
\ex delay, hold something up, set back, put back, get bogged down
\exn Tunda, lambat, membuat seseorang terlambat, menahan sesuatu/seseorang,
\qu (3) What words refer to an instance of delaying something?
\qun
\ex delay (n), hold-up
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to deliberately delaying someone in order to accomplish something?
\qun
\ex stall, play for time, delaying tactics
\exn

\qun
\ex put off, procrastinate
\exn
\qu (3) What do people say when they postpone doing something?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe I'll do it later.

\is 8.4.6.1
\sd Start something
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.6.1
\oldsd Begin
\oldsdn Mula

\dd Use this domain for words referring to starting something, or for something beginning to happen.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to starting something?
\qun
\ex start, launch, open, initiate, set in motion, get things moving, start the ball rolling, begin
\exn
\qu (2) What words refer to officially starting something such as a new law or way of doing something?
\qun
\ex introduce, bring in, phase in
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to starting an organization?
\qun
\ex start, start up, open, set up, establish, found, inception
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to something starting a natural process?
\qun
\ex start, activate, set off
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to starting something again after it has stopped?
\qun
\ex restart, bring back, reintroduce, revive, restore, resurrect
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.6.1
\oldqu (1) What words are used to indicate that something has begun?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan digunakan
\oldex
\oldexn bagi menunjukkan bahawa sesuatu itu telah bermula? Mula, bermula, memulakan, permulaan,
\oldqu (2) What do people say when they want someone else to start?
\oldqun (2) Apakah yang dikatakan oleh seseorang apabila mereka mahu seseorang memulakan sesuatu?
\oldex Go, dig in, have at it, let's go, let's do it, move it, let's get going, "on your marks, get set, go", "ready, set, go"
\oldexn Mulakanlah, bersedia,
\oldqu (3) What is a person called who starts something?
\oldqun (3) Apakah seseorang itu dipanggil yang memulakan sesuatu?
\oldex Initiator, founder, originator, starter
\oldexn Pemula, penubuh, pengasas, pengasal, penghidup, pelepas

\gd I3F37BB6F-CD32-4430-AA35-700ACABBEE15

\is 8.4.6.1.2
\sd Stop something
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.6.1.1
\oldsd Stop, end
\oldsdn Perhentian, Penamat
\dd Use this domain for words related to the end of an action or situation.
\ddn Gunakan domain in bagi perkataan yang berkaitan dengan akhiran sesuatu tindakan atau keadaan.
\qu (1) What words (intransitive verbs) indicate that something has ended?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan (kata kerja intransitif) menunjukkan sesuatu itu telah berakhir?
\ex stop, come to rest, halt, come to a screeching halt
\exn Akhir, berhenti, tamat, penghabisan,
\qu (2) What words (transitive verbs) indicate that someone is stopping something?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan (kata kerja transitif) menunjukkan bahawa seseorang sedang menghentikan sesuatu?
\ex end (something), stop (something), stanch (flow of blood), obstruct (justice), arrest (progress), halt (traffic), impede (progress), inhibit (flow), delay (someone/event), hold up (traffic), detain (someone), discontinue (product), suspend (action), terminate (someone's life), conclude (story), cease (hostilities), desist from (doing something), bring closure to (something), curtail
\exn Kesudahan (sesuatu), berhenti, menahan, membebat (darah mengalir), menghalang, menyekat (keadilan), menahan (kemajuan), menghentikan (lalu lintas), menyekat (perkembangan), merencat (aliran), melambatkan (seseorang/peristiwa), kelewatan (lalu lintas), menangkap/menahan (seseorang), menghentikan (hasil pengeluaran), menunda (tindakan), menamatkan (hidup seseorang), menyimpulkan (cerita), berhenti (permusnahan), menghalang daripada (melakukan sesuatu), penutupan (sesuatu)
\qu (3) What words refer to the event of stopping?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada peristiwa yang berhenti?
\ex halt, standstill, pause, discontinuance, stoppage, stay, closure
\exn Berhenti, buntu, berhenti sejenak, penghentian, penamatan, pemberhentian,
\qu (4) Where do things typically stop?
\qun (4) Di manakah biasanya sesuatu itu berhenti?
\ex stopping place, station
\exn
\qu (5) What things are used to stop things?
\qun (5) Apakah perkara yang digunakan untuk menghentikan sesuatu?
\ex brake, catch, skid
\exn
\qu (6) What do people say when they want someone to stop?
\qun (6) Apakah dikatakan oleh orang ramai apabila mereka menginginkan seseorang itu berhenti?
\ex Halt! Stay! Cease and desist! Belay that order! Avast!
\exn Berhenti! Hentikan!
\qu (7) What words describe something that you can't stop doing?
\qun
\ex compulsive
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that some state has ended?
\qun
\ex cease, finish, stop
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to something stopping gradually?
\qun
\ex fade away, wear off, go away, die away
\exn

\sd End
\sdn
\dd Use this domain for words referring to the end of an action or situation.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the end of something?
\qun
\ex end, finish, conclusion, consummation, culmination, denouement, expiration, finale, homestretch, last, outcome, termination, terminus, terminal, conclusion, time is up, that is all
\exn

\is 8.4.6.1.4
\sd Until
\sdn Sehingga
\oldis 8.4.6.4.4
\oldsd Until
\oldsdn Sehingga

\dd Use this domain for words that indicate that something will continue to happen until a particular time or until something else happens, and then it will stop. In written English a hyphen is used to indicate that something happens from one time until another time, as in "8:00-5:00" or "Monday-Friday".
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something will happen until something else happens?
\qun
\ex until, till, up until, up to, to, through, last (v), heretofore, hitherto, (hyphen)
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that something will not happen until something else happens?
\qun
\ex until, wait until
\exn

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.6.4.4
\oldqu (1) What words indicate that something happened until some time?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang sesuatu perkara terjadi sehingga ke suatu waktu?
\oldex Until, till, up to, through
\oldexn Sehingga, sampai, sampai kehadnya, dari mula hingga ke akhir
\gd I590570C5-3267-4966-B0DB-2AF7A5105C83

\is 8.4.6.1.5
\sd Since, from
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words that indicate that something will start to happen at some time and continue for some time.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something starts to happen after a particular time and then continues?
\qun
\ex starting, from, as from, after that
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that something started in the past and continued until now?
\qun
\ex since, ever since, for, from, starting from, from that time on, thereafter
\exn
\qu (3) What words indicate that something starts to happen now and will continue?
\qun
\ex from now on, from this time forward, starting now, starting from now, effective immediately, henceforth
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that something will start in the future and continue?
\qun
\ex from then on, starting then
\exn
\gd I3EDB307F-BE46-40B6-A6A4-AE075B40258C

\is 8.4.6.2
\sd Past
\sdn Masa lampau
\oldis 8.4.6.2
\oldsd Past
\oldsdn Masa lampau
\dd Use this domain for words referring to the past or to a time in the past.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words refer to the past?
\qun
\ex past, before, in the past, in years gone by, in the times of our fathers, in our father's/grandparent's/ancestor's time, was (being/doing/happening), lately
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that existed or happened in the past?
\qun
\ex earlier, foregoing
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that existed or happened long ago?
\qun
\ex the distant past, long ago
\exn

\is 8.4.6.2.1
\sd Recently
\sdn
\oldis 8.4.6.2.1
\oldsd A moment ago
\oldsdn Sebentar tadi

\dd Use this domain for words indicating that something happened recently--a short time before now.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that an event happened a short time ago?
\qun
\ex recently, not long ago, a short time ago, newly, freshly, a little while back, a short while ago, a little while ago
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that an event happened a very short time ago?
\qun
\ex just, only just, a moment ago, a minute ago, just this minute, barely, scarcely, hardly
\exn
\xe It <just> happened.
\xen
\qu (3) What words indicate that something has been happening up until now?
\qun
\ex recently, lately, in recent weeks/months, in the last/past few weeks/months, for the last/past few weeks/months
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe an event that has happened recently?
\qun
\ex recent, latest
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe news of something that happened recently?
\qun
\ex latest, up-to-date, up-to-the-minute
\exn

\ex not yet, not now, still need to wait, it will be awhile (still), it will take some time, not quite here, almost
\exn Belum lagi, masih perlu menunggu, ia akan mengambil masa,

\oldsdn Segera

\exn

\qun

\exn

\qun
\ex immediate, instant, instantaneous
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that someone does something immediately without thinking about it?
\qun
\ex then and there
\exn

\exn

\exn
\qu (13) What words refer to something that is new?
\qun
\ex novelty, innovation, latest, original

\is 8.4.6.5.6
\sd Old fashioned
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words describing something old fashioned--something that was done or used in the past, but not done or used now.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words describe something that is old fashioned?
\qun
\ex old-fashioned, unfashionable, antiquated, archaic, outdated, out of date, outmoded, outworn
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe something that is old fashioned and no longer used?
\qun
\ex antiquated, dated, fusty, early type/form of, obsolete, primitive
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe an old fashioned idea or way of doing something?
\qun
\ex old, customary, inveterate, passé, traditional, tried and true, well-trodden
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe something that is so old fashioned that people think it is stupid?
\qun
\ex medieval, out of the ark, dinosaur, anachronism, archaic
\exn
\qu (5) What words describe something that is old fashioned but people still like it?
\qun
\ex quaint, old-time, of the old school, olde worlde
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to something becoming old fashioned?
\qun
\ex be on the way out, fall into disuse
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to making something old fashioned by doing the same thing a new way?
\qun
\ex antiquate, render obsolete
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe someone who is old fashioned in the way they think or act?
\qun
\ex old fashioned, be behind the times, be living in the past, reactionary, straitlaced
\exn
\qu (9) What words refer to someone who is old fashioned?
\qun
\ex fuddy-duddy, old fogy, old guard, traditionalist
\exn

\dd Use this domain for words referring to something happening again or doing something again.
\ddn

\exn Lagi, semula, balik,

\qun
\ex do something again, repeat, redo, over, all over again
\exn
\xe (Mary washed the dress, but it wasn't clean so) she washed it <again>.
\xen

\qun

\exn

\qun

\exn

\qun
\ex again, once more
\exn

\qun
\ex retake, resit
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to something you do again?
\qun
\ex repetition
\exn
\qu (8) What words indicate that something is done many times?
\qun
\ex repeated, repeatedly, recurrent, recurring, repetitive, again and again, over and over again, always, never stop
\exn
\xe Mary washed the dress <over and over again>.
\xen

\is 8.4.7.1

\exn
\qu (2) What words are used to describe something that is not interrupted?
\qun
\ex incessant, uninterrupted
\exn

\exn Meneruskan, semula,

\is 8.4.8

\dd Use this domain for words referring to the speed at which a person acts or the speed at which something happens.

\qu (1) What words refer to the speed at which a person acts?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada di mana seseorang mengambil tindakan?
\ex speed, velocity, pace
\exn Kepantasan, kelajuan, kederasan, halaju,
\qu (2) What words are used to indicate the speed of something?
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe miles <per> hour
\xen

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.8
\gd IDF149819-608F-46CD-BA0F-55F1D9D2E8EC

\is 8.4.8.1
\sd Quick
\sdn Serta-merta/Pantas
\oldis 8.4.8.1
\oldsd Quick
\oldsdn Serta-merta/Pantas
\dd Use this domain for words referring to doing something at a quick speed or something happening quickly.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada melakukan sesuatu pada kelajuan yang serta-merta atau sesuatu yang berlaku dengan cepat.
\qu (1) What words describe an action that is done quickly?
\qun
\ex fast, quick, quickly, quickness, speedy, speeding, speedily, speed, hasty, hastily, haste, rapid, rapidly, rapidity, hurry, hurried, hurriedly, in a hurry, swift, swiftly, swiftness, rush, rush into, rush through, in a rush, express
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe an action that is done extremely quickly?
\qun
\ex at light speed, faster than a speeding bullet, just a blur
\exn
\qu (3) What words describe something that happens quickly?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang terjadi dengan cepat?
\ex happen so fast, in the twinkling of an eye, came and went so quickly, it was all over in a minute
\exn Dengan sekelip mata,
\qu (4) What words refer to doing something quickly?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada melakukan sesuatu dengan pantas?
\ex to speed, move fast, hurry, hasten, be brief
\exn Bergerak pantas
\qu (5) What words refer to causing someone to do something quickly?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada membuat seseorang itu melakukan sesuatu dengan pantas?
\ex hurry (someone), rush (someone)
\exn
\qu (6) What do you say to someone when you want him to hurry?
\qun (6) Apa yang kamu katakan kepada seseorang apabila kamu ingin supaya dia cepat?
\ex Hurry up! Move it! Let's go, let's go! Quick! Faster! Speed it up! Get a move on! Giddy up! (horse)
\exn Cepatlah! Lekaslah! Cepat-cepat!

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.4.8.1
\oldqu (1) What words describe an action, which is done quickly?
\oldqun (1) Apakah perkata mengambarkan suatu perbuatan yang dilakukan dengan cepat-cepat?
\oldex Fast, quick, quickly, quickness, speedy, speeding, speedily, speed, hasty, hastily, haste, rapid, rapidly, rapidity, hurry, hurried, hurriedly, in a hurry, swift, swiftly, swiftness, rush, rush into, rush through, in a rush, express
\oldexn Laju, cepat, terburu-buru, tergesa-gesa, bergegas
\oldqu (2) What words describe an action, which is done extremely quickly?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan suatu perbuatan yang mana dilakukan dengan sangat cepat sekali?
\oldex At light speed, faster than a speeding bullet, just a blur
\oldexn

\is 8.4.8.2
\sd Slow
\sdn Perlahan
\oldis 8.4.8.2
\oldsd Slow
\oldsdn Perlahan
\dd Use this domain for words referring to doing something at a slow speed.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada melakukan sesuatu pada had laju yang perlahan.
\qu (1) What words describe an action that is done slowly?
\qun
\ex slow, slowly, leisurely
\exn
\qu (2) What words describe an action that is done extremely slowly?
\qun
\ex excruciatingly slow, move at a snail's pace, gradual, gradually, little by little, bit-by-bit, glacial
\exn
\qu (3) What words refer to doing something slowly?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada melakukan sesuatu dengan perlahan-lahan?
\ex go slow, slowness, take your time (over)
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to causing someone to do something slowly?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menyebabkan seseorang melakukan sesuatu dengan perlahan-lahan?
\ex slow (someone) down, hold back, restrain, delay, hold up
\exn
\qu (5) What do you say to someone when you want him to do something slowly?
\qun
\ex Slow down! Take it easy! Take your time! Whoa! (horse)
\exn

\is 8.4.8.3
\sd Sudden
\sdn Tiba-tiba
\oldis 8.4.7.6
\oldsd Sudden
\oldsdn Tiba-tiba
\dd Use this domain for words referring to a sudden event--something happens that I don't expect.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada suatu peristiwa yang tiba-tiba - sesuatu yang tidak yang tidak saya jangkakan.
\qu (1) What words refer to moving suddenly?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada bergerak dengan tiba-tiba?
\ex move suddenly, sudden movement
\exn
\qu (2) What words are used to indicate that an event is sudden?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan bagi merujuk peristiwa yang tiba-tiba?
\ex sudden (warning), all of a sudden, abrupt
\exn Tiba-tiba (amaran), dengan tiba-tiba, mendadak, mengejut
\qu (3) What words are used to indicate that something happened suddenly?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan yang digunakan bagi merujuk kepada sesuatu yang terjadi secara tiba-tiba?
\ex suddenly, abruptly, without warning, without notice
\exn Tiba-tiba, mengejut, tanpa amaran, tanpa notis
\qu (4) What words refer to the suddenness of something?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sesuatu yang serta merta?
\ex suddenness
\exn

\is 8.5.1
\sd Here, there
\sdn
\oldis 8.5.1
\oldsd Here
\oldsdn Di sini

\dd Use this domain for words that refer to a place in relation to the speaker or listener.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada satu tempat yang berhubungan dengan orang yang berucap atau yang mendengar.
\qu (1) What words refer to a place near the speaker?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada tempat dengan dengan orang yang berucap?
\ex here, hereabouts, hither, in this place, on this very spot, around here
\exn Di sini
\qu (2) What words refer to a place near the listener?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada tempat berdekatan dengan pendengar?
\ex there, thereabouts, thither
\exn Di sana
\qu (3) What words refer to a place that is not near the speaker or the listener?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada satu tempat yang tidak dekat kepada pembicara atau pendengar?
\ex over there, elsewhere, yon, yonder
\exn

\exn

\is 8.5.1.6
\sd Across
\sdn Seberang
\oldis 8.5.1.7
\oldsd Across
\oldsdn Seberang

\dd Use this domain for words that refer to a place on another side of something from the reference point. 'Across' involves three things--the object, the reference point, and something else in between the two.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada satu tempat
\qu (1) What words indicate that something is across from something else?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang sesuatu berada di seberang dari satu benda lain?
\ex across, across from, on the other side of, on the opposite side of, beyond, offshore from
\exn
\xe The village was on the other side of the river from us.
\xen Kampung itu berada di sebelah sungai daripada kami.

\is 8.5.2
\sd Direction
\sdn Haluan/arah
\oldis 8.5.2
\oldsd Direction
\oldsdn Haluan/arah

\dd Use this domain for general words referring to a direction.
\ddn Gunakan domain in bagi perkataan umum yang merujuk kepada satu haluan/arah.
\qu (1) What words refer to a direction?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada satu arah?
\ex direction, orientation, course, way, bearing
\exn Arah, hala, haluan,
\xe Turn to a <bearing> of 270 degrees.
\xen Dia telah menghala ke <arah> itu.
\qu (2) What words refer to facing in some direction?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada menghadap ke suatu arah?
\ex face (v), point, orient
\exn (Ke arah) muka, titik pertemuan, timur
\xe The captain <pointed> the ship into the wind.
\xen Kaptain <mengarahkan> kapal laut ke arah angin.
\qu (3) What words refer to a person's ability to know what direction he is going in?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada kemampuan seseorang mengetahui apakah arah dia akan pergi?
\ex sense of direction
\exn
\qu (4) What words indicate that two things are going in the same direction?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang dua perkara akan pergi ke arah yang sama?
\ex with
\exn Dengan
\xe We were carried down the river <with> the current.
\xen Kami dibawa oleh arus sungai.
\qu (5) What words indicate that two things are going in different directions?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang dua perkara ke arah yang berlainan?
\ex against
\exn Bertentangan
\xe The ship was sailing <against> the wind.
\xen Kapal laut itu belayar <menentang> again.

\oldsd Right, left
\oldsdn Kanan, kiri

\dd Use this domain for words referring to right and left.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada kanan dan kiri.
\qu (1) What words refer to the right side?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sebelah kanan?
\ex right
\exn Kanan
\qu (2) What words refer to the left side?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada sebelah kiri?
\ex left
\exn Kiri
\qu (3) What words describe a person who usually uses his right hand?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan seorang yang biasanya menggunakan tangan kanannya?
\ex right-handed
\exn
\qu (4) What words describe a person who usually uses his left hand?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan seorang yang biasanya menggunakan tangan kirinya?
\ex left-handed
\exn Kidal

\is 8.5.2.8
\sd North, south, east, west
\sdn Utara, selatan, timur, barat
\oldis 8.5.2.3
\oldsd North, south, east, west
\oldsdn Utara, selatan, timur, barat

\dd Use this domain for words referring to the directions of the compass.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada arah kompas
\qu (1) What general words refer to a direction of the compass?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada satu arah compas?
\ex direction, heading, point of the compass, degree, bearing, cardinal points
\exn Haluan, darjah,
\qu (2) What words refer to a direction of the compass?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada satu arah kompas?
\ex north, south, east, west, northeast, northwest, southeast, southwest, northward, southward, eastward, westward, northerly, southerly, westerly, easterly, up north, down south, sunrise, sunset
\exn Utara, selatan, barat, timur laut, barat laut, tenggara, barat daya, ke arah utara, ke arah timur, ke arah barat, ke barat, di timur, di utara, matahari terbit, matahari terbenam
\qu (3) What words describe something that is toward one of the directions of the compass?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang adalah menghala ke satu arah kompas?
\ex northern, southern, eastern, western, boreal, austral, oriental, occidental, Midwestern, Fareast
\exn Di sebelah utara, di sebelah selatan, timur, barat, Timur Jauh,
\qu (4) What words describe something going in one of the directions?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan sesuatu yang pergi ke satu hala?
\ex northbound, southbound, eastbound, westbound
\exn Ke utara, ke selatan, ke timur, ke barat
\qu (5) What words describe a person who is from a part of the country that is north, south, east, or west?
\qun (5) Apakah perkataan mengambarkan seorang yang adalah daripada bahagian negeri yang adalah utara, selatan, timur atau barat?
\ex northerner, southerner, easterner, westerner
\exn Orang utara, orang selatan, orang timur, orang barat
\qu (6) What words refer to a compass?
\qun (6) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada satu kompas?
\ex compass, needle
\exn Kompas, jarum

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.5.2.3
\gd I6B1EEEBD-2433-4F39-9E67-7AC4DD0FE20A

\is 8.5.3
\sd Be at a place
\sdn Berada di satu tempat
\oldis 8.5.3
\oldsd Be at a place
\oldsdn Berada di satu tempat
\dd Use this domain for words related to being at a place.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something or someone is in a particular place?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan yang sesuatu atau seseorang adalah berada di tempat yang biasa?
\ex be at a place/location, be in a place/location, be located, be situated, be localized, attendance, be present, presence, sit, lie, laid, occupy, be resting
\exn
\qu (2) What words indicate that something or someone is in the correct or expected place?
\qun (2) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan sesuatu atau seseorang di tempat atau kawasan yang betul?
\ex in place, in the proper place, in your place, out of place
\exn

\qun (1) Apakah perkataan menunjukkan sesuatu atau seseorang tidak berada di suatu tempat?

\exn Tidak hadir, hilang

\ex absentee, truant, missing person, no-show
\exn

\is 8.5.5
\sd Spatial relations
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words that indicate a spatial relation between situations.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that a situation happened at the same place as another situation?
\qun
\ex where, in the same place as, at the same place as
\exn
\xe He is sitting <where> I was sitting.
\xen
\qu (2) What words indicate that a situation happened at a different place as another situation?
\qun
\ex somewhere else, elsewhere
\exn
\gd I3785D9F3-0922-4D79-A0FA-B97C4A26FE17

\is 8.5.6
\sd Contain
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words that express the idea that something contains something.
\ddn
\qu (1) What words indicate that something contains something?
\qun
\ex have, of, -'s, contain, hold
\exn
\qu (2) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a clause using the verb 'contain' with the 'Container' in the subject position and the 'Content' in the object position.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe The cup <contained> milk.
\xen
\qu (3) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a clause using the verb with the 'Container' in the subject position, the 'Content' in the object position, and the 'Container' in a preposition phrase marked by 'in'.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe The cup <has> milk <in it>.
\xen
\qu (4) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the 'Container' as the head and the 'Content' marked by 'of'.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe a cup <of> milk
\xen
\qu (5) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the word 'container' as the head and the 'Content' marked by 'of'.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe the <container> <of> milk
\xen
\qu (6) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a noun phrase with the word 'contents' as the head and the 'Container' marked by 'of'.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe the <contents> <of> the cup
\xen
\qu (7) In English 'Containership' can be expressed by a possession phrase with the 'Container' in the first position and the word 'contents' in the second position.
\qun
\ex
\exn
\xe the cup<'s> <contents>
\xen
\cf Container


\gd I8FBED974-7D25-44C3-80CB-7D02E4069007

\is 8.6
\sd Parts of things
\sdn Bahagian benda
\oldis 8.6
\oldsd Parts of things
\oldsdn Bahagian benda
\dd Use this domain for words that refer to a part of something. These words are often based on the parts of a person's body.
\ddn Gunakan domain ini bagi perkataan yang merujuk kepada bahagian sesuatu. Perkataan ini seringkali berdasarkan bahagian tubuh seseorang.
\qu (1) What general words refer to a part of something?
\qun (1) Apakah perkataan umum merujuk kepada bahagian sesuatu?
\ex part, piece, section, component, portion, bit
\exn Bahagian, sekeping,
\qu (2) If something has two sides, what words refer to the other side?
\qun (2) Sekiranya sesuatu mempunyai dua permukaan, apakah perkataan yang merujuk kepada permukaan yang disebelah?
\ex the back, the reverse, the other side, the flip side
\exn Muka sebelah,
\qu (3) What words refer to the part of something used to hold it?
\qun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian sesuatu yang digunakan untuk dipegang?
\ex handle, grip
\exn Pemegang, telinga, tangkai, gagang, hulu
\qu (4) What words refer to the main part of something?
\qun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian utama sesuatu?
\ex body, chassis
\exn Badan, rangka, bagan
\qu (5) What words refer to something added to the main part?
\qun
\ex appendage, appurtenance, adjunct, accessory, addition, attachment
\exn
\qu (6) What words refer to a layer of something?
\qun
\ex layer, level, stratum, stratified, story, floor, sandwich
\exn
\qu (7) What other words refer to a part of something?
\qun (7) Apakah perkataan lain merujuk kepada bahagian sesuatu?
\ex flap, detail, bar, blade, hook, lid, neck, nose, shelf, wheel, longitudinal, projection
\exn Lapisan,

\nt Old questions for \oldis 8.6
\oldqu (2) What words refer to the front part of something?
\oldqun (2) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian depan sesuatu?
\oldex Front, face, facade
\oldexn Depan, muka
\oldqu (3) What words refer to the back part of something?
\oldqun (3) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian belakang sesuatu?
\oldex Back, rear
\oldexn Belakang, pungung, buntut
\oldqu (4) What words refer to the top part of something?
\oldqun (4) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian atas sesuatu?
\oldex Top, topside, summit, peak, pinnacle, cap
\oldexn Atas, puncak,
\oldqu (5) What words refer to the bottom part of something?
\oldqun (5) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian dasar sesuatu?
\oldex Bottom, underside, base, foot
\oldexn Dasar, punggung, buntut, kaki
\oldqu (6) What words refer to the side part of something?
\oldqun (6) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian sisi sesuatu?
\oldex Side, right side, left side
\oldexn Sisi, tepi,sebelah, samping, sebelah kiri/kanan, pinggir
\oldqu (7) What words refer to the inside part of something?
\oldqun (7) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian dalam sesuatu?
\oldex Inside, interior, innards, lining
\oldexn Di dalam, dalaman, bahagian dalam
\oldqu (8) What words refer to the outside part of something?
\oldqun (8) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian luar sesuatu?
\oldex Outside, exterior, surface, cover, covering, skin
\oldexn Di luar, luaran, permukaan, kulit luar,
\oldqu (9) What words refer to the middle of something?
\oldqun (9) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian tengah-tengah sesuatu?
\oldex Middle, center
\oldexn Tengah, bahagian tengah, pusat
\oldqu (10) What words refer to the edge of something?
\oldqun (10) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada bahagian tepi sesuatu?
\oldex Edge, rim, border
\oldexn Tepi, pinggir, bibir, tepi,
\oldqu (11) What words refer to the corner of something?
\oldqun (11) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada penjuru sesuatu?
\oldex Corner
\oldexn Penjuru, sudut, bucu
\oldqu (12) What words refer to the tip of something?
\oldqun (12) Apakah perkataan merujuk kepada hujung sesuatu?
\oldex Tip, point, end
\oldexn Hujung, mata, tanjung,

\qu (3) What words refer to the edge of a cup or plate?
\qun
\ex rim, lip, brim
\exn
\qu (4) What words refer to the edge of a piece of clothing?
\qun
\ex hem, fringe
\exn
\qu (5) What words refer to something put along the edge of something?
\qun
\ex frame, edging, skirting
\exn
\qu (6) What words describe something that is on the edge?
\qun
\ex edge (adj), peripheral, marginal, border (adj), bordering
\exn
\qu (7) What words refer to the corner of something?
\qun
\ex corner (n)
\exn
\qu (8) What words describe something that is on the corner?
\qun
\ex corner (adj)
\exn
\gd IFC170F70-520E-4f3e-B8B8-98E4B898FD24

\is 8.6.7
\sd End, point
\sdn

\dd Use this domain for words related to the end of something.
\ddn
\gd IE1E0B800-85AD-4886-ABE5-9F67C022A5ED
